title: Coordinated Cellular Neighborhoods Orchestrate Antitumoral Immunity at the Colorectal Cancer Invasive Front.
main_goals: To re-engineer CODEX for FFPE tissue microarrays and apply it to characterize the spatial organization of the immune tumor microenvironment in colorectal cancer. The study aimed to identify distinct cellular neighborhoods, analyze their spatial relationships, and correlate these spatial features with patient survival outcomes.

title: Transition to invasive breast cancer is associated with progressive changes in the structure and composition of tumor stroma.
main_goals: To understand the changes in the tumor microenvironment (TME) accompanying the transition from DCIS to IBC using MIBI-TOF and machine learning. The study aimed to delineate TME states, identify features associated with progression, and investigate factors influencing IBC relapse.

title: Muscle Spatial Transcriptomic Reveals Heterogeneous Profiles in Juvenile Dermatomyositis and Persistence of Abnormal Signature After Remission.
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the spatial heterogeneity of molecular signature in the muscle of juvenile dermatomyositis (JDM) patients before and after treatment. It identified spatially distributed pathological signatures related to myofibrillar stress, muscle remodeling, and interferon signaling. The study also found persistence of these pathological signatures after two years of remission, paving the way for understanding pathophysiology and biomarker identification.

title: Rapid elemental imaging of copper-bearing critical ores using laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy coupled with PCA and PLS-DA.
main_goals: Apply Laser-Induced Breakdown Spectroscopy (LIBS) coupled with PCA and PLS-DA for rapid elemental imaging, pattern recognition, classification, and spatial analysis of copper-bearing critical ores. Visualize element spatial distribution using 2D mapping.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis Reveals Increased Adipogenesis and Triggering of the Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease Pathway in Pig-to-NHP Islet Recipients' livers During the Early Post-xenotransplant Period.
biological_context: Liver pathology and microenvironment changes following pig-to-NHP islet xenotransplantation, focusing on adipogenesis and NAFLD pathways
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Pathway Analysis']
main_goals: To analyze the hepatic pathology in pig-to-NHP islet recipients using spatial transcriptomics. To identify transcriptional changes in the liver, particularly near the islet implantation site. To reveal increased adipogenesis and NAFLD pathways in the liver post-transplantation.

title: Spatial metabolomics informs the use of clinical imaging for improved detection of cribriform prostate cancer.
main_goals: Identify metabolic markers for cribriform prostate cancer using spatial metabolomics. Evaluate whether clinical imaging techniques based on these markers can differentiate cribriform from noncribriform prostate cancers.

title: Single cell sequencing and spatial multiomics of diabetic kidney segmentation insights zonation-specific therapeutic metabolic pathways.
main_goals: To understand the spatial metabolic heterogeneity and compartmentalized pathway dysregulation in diabetic nephropathy using spatial multi-omics and single-cell transcriptomics. The study aims to identify zonation-specific metabolic pathways, region-enriched proteins, and contributing cell types, and evaluate a therapeutic intervention's effect on spatial metabolic perturbations.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal a stress-induced EMT-like epithelial subset driving immune activation in silica-injured lung.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate epithelial dynamics in silica-induced lung injury using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. The study identifies a stress-induced EMT-like epithelial subset (C0) that drives immune activation and tissue remodeling through specific cell-cell interactions.

title: Interferon-responsive HEVs drive tumor tertiary lymphoid structure formation and predict immunotherapy response in nasopharyngeal carcinoma.
main_goals: The paper aims to reveal characteristics of tumor tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs) in nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell data. It identifies interferon-responsive high endothelial venules (IFN-HEVs) linked to CXCL9 and CXCR3+CD4+ T cell recruitment within TLSs. The study correlates these IFN-HEV related phenotypes with patient survival and immunotherapy response and develops a predictive scoring system (CTRscore) for ICB outcomes.

title: Integrated spatial omics of metabolic reprogramming and the tumor microenvironment in pancreatic cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To analyze metabolic reprogramming and the tumor microenvironment in pancreatic cancer by integrating single-cell transcriptomics, spatial transcriptomics, and spatial metabolomics. The study aimed to visualize spatial co-localization, uncover metabolic heterogeneity, identify metabolic shifts during progression, delineate metabolic differences between regions, and characterize aberrant cell communication.

title: Multi-omics reveals the polyethylene terephthalate carcinogenicity: Cancer progression and immune microenvironment.
main_goals: This study integrates multi-omics (network toxicology, machine learning, molecular docking, single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics) and experimental validation to systematically investigate the mechanistic underpinnings of PET carcinogenicity. It aims to identify PET-associated oncogenic targets, analyze their prognostic value in pan-cancer, and delineate the pathways involved in PET-driven tumorigenesis and immune microenvironment changes.

title: Identification of core genes in acute kidney injury: evidence from multi-omics human transcriptomic data and in vivo models.
biological_context: Acute kidney injury in human and mouse kidney
main_goals: Identify core genes in acute kidney injury (AKI) by integrating multi-omics human transcriptomic data and validating findings in mouse models. Explore the mechanisms of these genes, focusing on SUGCT's role in proximal tubules using snRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. Provide potential diagnostic and therapeutic targets for AKI.

title: Identification of an immunomodulatory lncRNA signature associated with immune cell reprogramming in high-grade glioma.
main_goals: Identify immunomodulatory lncRNA signatures associated with the tumor immune microenvironment (TME) in high-grade gliomas. Use transcriptomics, scRNA-seq, and spatial transcriptomics to find context-dependent lncRNA expression in immune cells and their spatial distribution within the TME. Correlate specific lncRNAs with immunosuppression and immune evasion mechanisms.

title: Analysis of Hyperexpanded T Cell Clones in SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine-Associated Liver Injury by Spatial Proteomics and Transcriptomics.
biological_context: SARS-CoV-2 vaccine-associated liver injury in human liver
data_modalities_used: ['T cell receptor sequencing', 'multiplex immunofluorescence (mIF)', 'RNA in situ hybridisation (RISH)', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'Xenium', 'spatial proteomics']
main_goals: This paper aims to characterize the immune infiltrate in a liver explant from a patient with severe SARS-CoV-2 vaccine-associated liver injury (SVALI). Using spatial multi-omics techniques, the study identifies and localizes hyperexpanded cytotoxic and tissue-resident CD8+ T cell clones throughout the liver, suggesting their role in SVALI pathogenesis.

title: Single-cell multi-omics reveals that FABP1 + renal cell carcinoma drive tumor angiogenesis through the PLG-PLAT axis under fatty acid reprogramming.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Pathway Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Visualization']
main_goals: To investigate fatty acid metabolism reprogramming in renal cell carcinoma using multi-omics. The study identifies FABP1+ tumors driving angiogenesis via the PLG-PLAT axis and suggests this axis as a potential therapeutic target.

title: PRRX1 is a key regulator in the phenotypic transition between human normal dermal and keloid fibroblasts.
biological_context: Human skin (foetal, postnatal, keloid), wound healing, scarring
main_goals: To investigate the cellular and molecular characteristics underlying scarless healing by comparing human foetal skin, postnatal skin, and keloid tissue using spatial transcriptomics and histology. The study identified key differences, focusing on fibroblast heterogeneity and the role of PRRX1 in the phenotypic transition between normal and keloid fibroblasts, with the aim of finding factors for promoting scarless wound healing.

title: Resolving spatial subclonal genomic heterogeneity of loss of heterozygosity and extrachromosomal DNA in gliomas.
main_goals: To map the spatial organization of DNA-level somatic copy number changes and extrachromosomal DNA in gliomas using an integrated framework of spatial transcriptomics and sequencing. To identify shared and distinct spatial subclonal heterogeneity characteristics and understand the role of ecDNA in tumor adaptability.

title: A spatial transcriptomic atlas of acute neonatal lung injury across development and disease severity.
biological_context: Human infant lung development and injury (neonatal, preterm birth)
main_goals: Create a spatial transcriptomic atlas of human infant lungs across development and injury using imaging-based spatial transcriptomics. Apply computational clustering to identify spatial patterns related to development and disease severity (gestational age/life span). Provide an open resource for the lung research community.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptomic analysis during cold ischemic injury to the murine kidney reveals compartment-specific changes.
biological_context: Murine kidney cold ischemic injury during transplantation
main_goals: To characterize cold ischemia injury in murine kidneys using spatial transcriptomics across different time points. The study aims to identify spatiotemporal and compartment-specific molecular changes, understand potential metabolic reprogramming, and compare findings with warm ischemia-reperfusion injury.

title: Spatiotemporal Single-Cell Analysis Reveals T Cell Clonal Dynamics and Phenotypic Plasticity in Human Graft-versus-Host Disease.
biological_context: Human Graft-versus-Host Disease (GVHD) after allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation (alloHCT), in blood and gut
data_modalities_used: ['mixed lymphocyte reaction-based clonal "fingerprinting"', 'TCR clonotyping', 'single-cell RNA/TCR sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To dissect T-cell-mediated pathology in human GVHD using integrated spatiotemporal single-cell analysis. To uncover clonal dynamics and phenotypic plasticity linked to GVHD severity. To identify spatial localization patterns of T cells in the gut.

title: Spatial organization, chromatin accessibility and gene-regulatory programs defining mouse sensory neurons.
main_goals: Present an integrated atlas of mouse sensory neurons using scRNA-seq, spatial transcriptomics (MERSCOPE), and chromatin accessibility data. Confirm cell types and spatial organization. Elucidate gene regulatory programs defining sensory neuron diversity.

title: Identification and Mapping of Human Lymph Node Stromal Cell Subsets by Combining Single-Cell RNA Sequencing with Spatial Transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To identify and characterize human lymph node stromal cell (LNSC) subtypes using scRNA-seq, validate these subtypes across multiple donors, and map their spatial locations within the lymph node using spatial transcriptomics integration to understand their potential interactions with lymphocytes.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Unveils the Blueprint of Mammalian Lung Development.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: To create a comprehensive spatial transcriptomic atlas of mouse lung development, uncover spatial TF regulation and cell-cell communication networks by integrating spatial epigenome, and delineate alveolar cell trajectories to understand the cellular and molecular orchestration of lung development.

title: Tumor microenvironment heterogeneity and progression mechanisms in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma: A study based on single-cell and spatial transcriptomic sequencing.
main_goals: To investigate tumor microenvironment heterogeneity and progression mechanisms in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify markers and mechanisms related to ICC invasion and lymphatic metastasis, and explore potential therapeutic targets.

title: Integrative Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveal Functional and Spatial Heterogeneity of Atrial and Ventricular Cardiomyocytes in the Heart.
biological_context: Atrial and Ventricular Cardiomyocytes in the Heart
covered_analysis_steps: ['Normalization', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study integrates scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics to elucidate the spatial distribution and intercellular communication of atrial and ventricular cardiomyocyte subtypes in the heart. It aims to reveal their distinct roles in energy metabolism, pump function, and regulatory functions within their anatomical context. The ultimate goal is to enhance the understanding of cardiac function complexity and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: Single-cell transcriptome sequencing reveals new epithelial-stromal associated mesenchymal-like subsets in recurrent gliomas.
main_goals: To explore transcriptional and regulatory mechanisms driving glioma recurrence, focusing on mesenchymal-like subpopulations using single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify novel MES-like subpopulations, characterize their association with prognosis and invasiveness, and identify key regulators like EGR1 and SERPINE1.

title: Spatial and genomic profiling of residual breast cancer after neoadjuvant chemotherapy unveil divergent fates for each breast cancer subtype.
main_goals: Investigate mechanisms underlying divergent fates of breast cancers with high residual cancer burden across subtypes after neoadjuvant chemotherapy using single-cell spatial transcriptomics and genomic profiling. The study aims to unveil distinct genomic and microenvironmental strategies governing BC subtype-specific outcomes.

title: Ectopic expression of GDF15 in cancer-associated fibroblasts enhances melanoma immunosuppression via the GFRAL/RET cascade.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'western blotting', 'quantitative real-time PCR', 'ELISA', 'co-immunoprecipitation', 'chromatin immunoprecipitation', 'luciferase gene reporter assays', 'lentiviral transfection', 'cell co-culture experiments', 'recombinant protein rescue experiments', 'flow cytometry', 'knockout mice', 'Cre-loxP system mice']
main_goals: This study characterizes the role of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in the melanoma immune microenvironment. It identifies a unique group of CAFs expressing high GDF15, which enhances melanoma immunosuppression via the GFRAL/RET cascade, leading to increased tumor cell stemness and immunosuppressive macrophage polarization. The findings offer new targets for melanoma immunotherapy.

title: Deciphering the Regulatory Networks of the Migrasome-Associated Cell Subpopulation in Heterotopic Ossification via Multi-Omics Analysis.
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate key biomolecular networks involved in heterotopic ossification (HO) through a comprehensive multi-omics analysis. It identified mesenchymal lineage cells (MLin) as a key migrasome-associated subtype and peptidylprolyl isomerase B (Ppib) and transgelin (Tagln) as key molecules, constructing their regulatory network and spatial distribution. The findings aim to facilitate the discovery of novel biomarkers for HO.

title: Integrated transcriptomics and machine learning reveal REN as a dual regulator of tumor stemness and NK cell evasion in Wilms tumor progression.
main_goals: This study integrates transcriptomics and machine learning to identify REN as a key regulator in Wilms tumor. It investigates REN's dual role in promoting tumor stemness and facilitating NK cell evasion, aiming to uncover therapeutic strategies for high-risk WT cases.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome analyses reveal MAZ(+) NPC-like clusters as key role contributing to glioma recurrence and drug resistance.
main_goals: This study investigates the heterogeneity of gliomas associated with Temozolomide (TMZ) resistance using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies MAZ(+) NPC-like clusters as key contributors to glioma recurrence and drug resistance by enhancing stemness and DNA repair capacity, and proposes a combination therapy strategy.

title: Development of a circadian-related prognostic signature highlights RBM17 as a stemness regulator in liver cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate the molecular underpinnings of how circadian dysregulation influences liver cancer progression. It develops a prognostic signature (Circadian Prognosis Scores - CPS) based on dysregulated liver circadian genes (LCGs) and identifies RBM17 as a key regulator promoting cancer stem cell phenotype and cisplatin resistance. The findings propose novel therapeutic targets for liver cancer.

title: Prehabilitation during neoadjuvant chemotherapy results in an enhanced immune response in esophageal adenocarcinoma tumors: A randomized controlled trial.
data_modalities_used: ['formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tumors', 'multispectral immunohistochemistry', 'NanoString spatial transcriptomics', 'peak oxygen uptake (V̇O₂peak)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To determine whether prehabilitation exercise training during neoadjuvant chemotherapy (NAC) increases tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes (TILs) in patients with locally advanced esophageal cancer. The study aimed to assess the impact of prehabilitation on tumor-immune responses and correlate changes in fitness with these immune markers.

title: Distinct molecular patterns in R6/2 HD mouse brain: Insights from spatiotemporal transcriptomics.
main_goals: To investigate distinct molecular patterns in the R6/2 HD mouse brain using spatiotemporal transcriptomics, integrating Visium and snRNA-seq. The study aimed to identify regional, temporal, and cell-type-specific regulatory pathways that contribute to Huntington's disease progression, observing synaptic dysfunction, early Tcf4 dysregulation, mitochondrial deficits, and neuropeptide Y signaling changes.

title: Neurodegeneration Promotes Tumorigenesis in Colorectal Cancer: Insights From Single-Cell and Spatial Multiomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-cell communication analysis', 'Trajectory analysis', 'Spatial dependencies analysis', 'Cell neighborhood network analysis', 'Prognostic modeling']
main_goals: To investigate the role of neurodegeneration in colorectal cancer (CRC) progression. The study aims to understand the mechanisms by which neurodegeneration disrupts ENS function and facilitates tumor growth using multiomics data. The findings highlight the potential of targeting neurodegeneration in CRC treatment.

title: Widespread and cell-type-specific transcriptomic reorganization following mild traumatic brain injury.
biological_context: Mild traumatic brain injury in mice
main_goals: This study aims to understand how mild traumatic brain injury (TBI) alters the brain by employing spatial transcriptomics in a murine closed-head impact model. It identifies generalizable TBI signatures and specific regional and cell-type dysregulations, highlighting the complexity of TBI at a molecular level.

title: A Multimodal Spatial and Epigenomic Atlas of Human Adult Lung Topography.
main_goals: To present an integrated multimodal single-nucleus human lung atlas (snHLA) profiling 746,047 nuclei from 49 mapped lung blocks. The atlas aims to resolve molecularly distinct populations and capture accessible chromatin regions to nominate new transcriptional regulators. It serves as a foundational resource for interrogating lung pathophysiology origins.

title: Spatial transcriptomics from pancreas and local draining lymph node tissue reveals a lymphotoxin-β signature in human type 1 diabetes.
biological_context: Human type 1 diabetes (T1D) pathogenesis, specifically in pancreatic tissue and associated lymph nodes.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study used spatial transcriptomics to explore the inflammatory response in human type 1 diabetes (T1D) pancreata and draining lymph nodes. It aimed to identify transcriptional alterations across tissues and cellular scales, highlighting specific gene signatures like lymphotoxin-beta in the lymph node and inflammation-associated genes in the pancreas. The findings aim to inform future therapeutic interventions for T1D.

title: Oncogenic drivers shape the tumor microenvironment in human gliomas.
data_modalities_used: ['whole-genome sequencing', 'chromatin conformation capture (Hi-C)', 'RNA-seq', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics (Xenium)', 'histology images']
main_goals: To investigate how genomic alterations in gliomas influence the tumor microenvironment. The study aims to understand the impact of IDH mutations and EGFR amplification (ecDNA vs. linear gains) on tumor architecture and cellular composition, revealing subtype-specific cellular ecosystems.

title: Site-Specific Immune and Stromal Architecture Drive Resistance to Trastuzumab Deruxtecan in HER2+ Metastatic Breast Cancer.
main_goals: To investigate mechanisms of resistance to Trastuzumab deruxtecan (T-DXd) in HER2+ metastatic breast cancer by analyzing spatial proteomic profiles of metastatic lesions. The study aimed to identify differences in immune and stromal architecture between responders and non-responders, linking spatial immune exclusion and immune suppression to resistance.

title: Multi-omics analyses reveal interactions between GREM1+ fibroblasts and SPP1+ macrophages in gastric cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry staining']
main_goals: This study integrates multi-omics data (bulk RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, spatial transcriptomics) to analyze the gastric cancer microenvironment. It identifies GREM1+ fibroblasts and SPP1+ macrophages as key interacting cell types involved in immunosuppression and tumor progression, suggesting them as potential therapeutic targets.

title: Multi-omic spatial profiling reveals the unique SARS-CoV-2 lung microenvironment and collagen VI as a predictive biomarker in severe COVID-19.
data_modalities_used: ['Quantseq Bulk RNA sequencing', 'Nanostring GeoMX spatial transcriptomics', 'RNAscope', 'multiplex immunofluorescence', 'immunohistochemistry', 'ELISA']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To understand the pathogenic role of microenvironmental interactions and the extracellular matrix in post-mortem COVID-19 lung using an integrative multi-omic approach. The study identified an immunosuppressive virus microenvironment and highlighted collagen VI as a potential predictive biomarker for severe COVID-19.

title: Multi-omics exploration of CAV1<sup>+</sup> tumor epithelial subcelltype in oral squamous cell carcinoma and its impact on the immune microenvironment.
biological_context: Oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC-GB) originating from gingiva and buccal mucosa
main_goals: To reveal the characteristics of tumor epithelial cell subcelltypes and their roles in tumor progression in OSCC. The study focused on identifying specific transcription factors and analyzing their effects on cell status and function, as well as investigating interactions between a high malignancy subcelltype and immune cells.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomic Profiling of Penile Squamous Cell Carcinoma Reveals Dynamics of Tumor Differentiation and Immune Microenvironment.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the development trajectories and tumor microenvironment of penile squamous cell carcinoma (PSCC). It reveals PSCC cell differentiation dynamics, identifies a spatial subtype with stemness and invasiveness features, and characterizes the immune landscape, particularly in HPV-positive tumors. The findings suggest therapeutic targets like laminin-integrin interaction and immunotherapy for PSCC.

title: Multi-omics characterization of oncosis in spinal cord injury.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'transmission electron microscopy', 'qRT-PCR', 'immunofluorescence']
main_goals: To provide the first spatiotemporal mapping of oncotic gene regulation following spinal cord injury (SCI) and identify potential therapeutic targets. The study characterizes the expression dynamics and cellular localization of oncosis-related genes in an SCI model.

title: Cell-specific protein expression in Alzheimer's disease prefrontal cortex.
main_goals: To analyze cell-specific protein expression in the prefrontal cortex of Alzheimer's disease (AD) and non-AD brains using the GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler (DSP) platform. The study aimed to identify proteins differentially expressed in specific cell types (neurons, astrocytes, microglia) and provide insights into AD pathophysiology.

title: Analyzing the potential targets and mechanism of per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) on breast cancer by integrating network toxicology, single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and molecular simulation.
main_goals: To investigate the molecular mechanisms through which PFAS contribute to breast cancer development. The study integrated network toxicology, single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and molecular simulation to identify core genes involved in PFAS-induced breast cancer. The findings provide insights into how PFAS may promote breast cancer progression.

title: Local inflammation at the salmon louse (Lepeophtheirus salmonis) attachment site contributes to copepodid rejection in coho salmon (Oncorhynchus kisutch).
biological_context: Salmon louse attachment and host immune response in coho salmon and Atlantic salmon.
main_goals: This study investigates the susceptibility of different salmon species to salmon lice and characterizes the cellular response at the louse attachment site. It compares the morphology of scaly skin and the cellular response in coho salmon versus Atlantic salmon using histological, proteomic, and spatial transcriptomic analyses. The findings suggest that coho salmon mount a rapid inflammatory response against salmon lice.

title: PML1-Mediated Feedforward Loop Through PI3K and MAPK Axes Drives Endocrine Resistance.
biological_context: Estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) breast cancer endocrine resistance
main_goals: This study identifies PML1 as a key therapeutic target to overcome endocrine resistance in ER+ breast cancer. It reveals a PML1-mediated feedforward loop involving PI3K and MAPK signaling that drives resistance. The study also demonstrates that arsenic trioxide can disrupt this loop, offering a potential treatment strategy.

title: Molecular pathology of acute spinal cord injury in middle-aged mice.
main_goals: This study investigates the molecular pathology of acute spinal cord injury in middle-aged mice by comparing them to young mice. It aims to identify age-related differences in behavioral, histopathological, and transcriptional outcomes. The findings suggest that while gross recovery and histopathology are similar, age-related changes in cell subpopulations may impact repair mechanisms.

title: High-Resolution Spatial Profiling of Microglia Reveals Proximity Associated Immunometabolic Reprogramming in Alzheimer's Disease.
main_goals: To elucidate disease-associated microglial subtypes and their metabolic signatures in relation to amyloid plaques in Alzheimer's disease using high-resolution spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify conserved proximity-dependent metabolic shifts and explore potential cell-type specific vulnerabilities near microglia.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Shows a Distinctive Tumour Microenvironment in the Invasive Versus Premalignant Portion of Early Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
biological_context: Early cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) progression from actinic keratosis (AK)
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the distinct gene expression patterns within the tumor microenvironment during the progression of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) from premalignant actinic keratosis (AK). Using spatial transcriptomics, the researchers compared gene expression in tumor cells, immune cells, and fibroblasts between invasive and premalignant portions of early-stage SCC samples, identifying differentially expressed genes and altered pathways.

title: Spatiotemporal and single-cell atlases to dissect regional specific cell types of the developing ovary.
main_goals: This study builds a spatiotemporal developmental atlas of ovaries using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. It characterizes regional heterogeneity of granulosa cell subtypes, analyzes molecular distinctions between healthy and atretic follicles, and identifies specific luteal cell populations. The research aims to provide a comprehensive delineation of ovary development and regional specificity of ovarian cell types.

title: CCR2<sup>+</sup> monocytes promote memory CD8<sup>+</sup> T-cell differentiation via membrane-bound TGF-β.
biological_context: CD8+ T-cell differentiation during acute infection
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This study reveals a novel spatial mechanism for CD8+ T-cell fate decisions, highlighting the role of CCR2+ monocytes in promoting memory CD8+ T-cell differentiation via membrane-bound TGF-β. It integrates scRNA-seq and spatially resolved transcriptomics to understand the spatial determinants of T-cell fate during acute infection.

title: Mechanism of Quanduzhong Capsules in treating knee osteoarthritis from perspective of spatial heterogeneity.
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize the targeted effects of Quanduzhong Capsules on cartilage lesions in knee osteoarthritis by integrating spatial transcriptomics data mining and animal experiments. It sought to elucidate the molecular mechanisms by constructing an interaction network between drug candidate targets and spatially specific genes in cartilage lesions. The goal was to clarify the spatially specific targeted effects and protective mechanisms of the capsules.

title: Multi-omics unveils BCAA metabolism markers L-leucine and HMGCS1 as prognostic marker for immunotherapy efficacy in non-small cell lung cancer.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL)
main_goals: This study identifies branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) plasma metabolites and gene signatures, specifically L-leucine and HMGCS1, as prognostic markers for immunotherapy efficacy in NSCLC. It also investigates the prognostic value of HMGCS1 in DLBCL.

title: The integration of single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveals the tumor microenvironment and spatial organization of testicular diffuse large B-cell lymphomas.
biological_context: Primary testicular diffuse large B-cell lymphomas (PT-DLBCL)
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'chromatin immunoprecipitation sequencing', 'xenograft models']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Organization']
main_goals: This study aims to characterize the tumor microenvironment and spatial organization of primary testicular diffuse large B-cell lymphomas (PT-DLBCL) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies key cell populations, analyzes genetic heterogeneity, and proposes therapeutic targets by investigating the roles of E2F and CREB.

title: Temporally resolved single-cell RNA sequencing reveals protective and pathological responses during herpes simplex virus CNS infection.
biological_context: Herpes Simplex Virus 1 (HSV-1) CNS infection in mice
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Communication Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Differential Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to reveal temporally resolved cell-specific transcriptomic changes and cell-cell communication during HSV-1 CNS infection. It identifies protective and pathological immune responses, including a unique population of virus-activated microglia and the role of monocytes in driving pathology.

title: High-Resolution Spatial Map of the Human Facial Sebaceous Gland Reveals Marker Genes and Decodes Sebocyte Differentiation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study provides a comprehensive molecular analysis of the human sebaceous gland, focusing on cellular interactions and sebocyte differentiation. It identifies distinct stages of sebocyte differentiation characterized by unique gene signatures, enhancing understanding of sebaceous gland biology.

title: Unravelling heart failure cellular signalling heterogeneity with spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To unravel heart failure cellular signalling heterogeneity using spatial transcriptomics.

title: TSPAN4<sup>+</sup> fibroblasts coordinate metastatic niche assembly through migrasome-driven metabolic reprogramming and stromal-immune crosstalk in pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Gene enrichment', 'prognostic analyses']
main_goals: This study explored migrasome-associated fibroblasts, especially TSPAN4 and ITGA5, as key regulators of pancreatic cancer metastasis. It identified TSPAN4+ fibroblasts as crucial for metastatic niche assembly through migrasome-driven metabolic reprogramming and stromal-immune crosstalk. Targeting these fibroblasts is proposed as a promising therapeutic strategy.

title: Precision targeting of β-catenin induces tumor reprogramming and immunity in hepatocellular cancers.
main_goals: This paper investigates the efficacy of a novel siRNA encapsulated in lipid nanoparticles targeting CTNNB1 (LNP-CTNNB1) in CTNNB1-mutated hepatocellular carcinoma models. It demonstrates that LNP-CTNNB1 induces tumor reprogramming and immunity, and enhances responses to immune checkpoint inhibitors by preventing T cell exhaustion and forming lymphoid aggregates.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome analyses reveal tumor heterogeneity and immune remodeling involved in pituitary neuroendocrine tumor progression.
biological_context: Pituitary neuroendocrine tumors (PitNETs) progression and invasion
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate tumor heterogeneity and immune remodeling during pituitary neuroendocrine tumor (PitNET) progression using integrated single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify aggressive tumor populations and characterize the tumor microenvironment, particularly focusing on the role of SPP1+ tumor-associated macrophages in invasion.

title: Intercellular communication between FAP+ fibroblasts and SPP1+ macrophages in prostate cancer via multi-omics.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunohistochemical staining', 'immunofluorescence staining']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study investigates the intercellular communication between FAP+ fibroblasts and SPP1+ macrophages in prostate cancer using multi-omics approaches. It identifies key signaling pathways like CSF1/CSF1R and CXCL/ACKR1 that contribute to an immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment and highlights potential therapeutic targets.

title: Deciphering the cellular and molecular landscape of cervical cancer progression through single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study aims to comprehensively characterize the tumor microenvironment in cervical cancer progression using integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies distinct cellular populations, particularly SPP1+ macrophages, and their interactions, highlighting the SPP1-CD44 axis as a potential therapeutic target and prognostic biomarker.

title: Multihormone-producing capabilities of normal pancreatic islet cells-spatial transcriptomics analysis using Xenium.
main_goals: This study investigates whether adult pancreatic islet cells maintain the plasticity to produce multiple pancreatic hormones simultaneously. Using spatial transcriptomics with Xenium, the researchers analyzed gene transcripts of glucagon, insulin, somatostatin, and pancreatic polypeptide in pancreatic islet cells. The findings suggest that adult islet cells can express multiple hormone gene transcripts, implying a potential for co-production.

title: PROS1-MERTK Axis Drives Tumor Microenvironment Crosstalk and Progression in Papillary Thyroid Microcarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vivo experiments', 'in vitro experiments']
main_goals: This study identified the PROS1-MERTK signaling interaction as pivotal in PTMC progression by analyzing intercellular communication networks using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The findings, confirmed through in vitro and in vivo models, highlight this axis as a critical component of the tumor microenvironment driving PTMC progression.

title: Characterization of cancer-associated fibroblasts and their spatial architecture reveals heterogeneity and survival associations in classic Hodgkin lymphoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study characterizes cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and their spatial architecture in classic Hodgkin lymphoma (cHL). It investigates the association of CAFs and specific immune cell subsets with patient outcomes using multiplexed immunofluorescence imaging and spatial analysis. The findings highlight the heterogeneity of CAFs and the importance of their spatial relationships with tumor cells for survival in cHL.

title: Investigating the molecular mechanisms associated with ulcerative colitis through the application of single-cell combined spatial transcriptome sequencing.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: This research investigated the molecular mechanisms of ulcerative colitis (UC) by applying single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analyses. It identified specific monocyte subtypes and two key genes, GNG5 and TIMP1, involved in UC pathogenesis, offering insights for clinical diagnosis and treatment.

title: Arhgap29 Deficiency Directly Leads to Systemic and Craniofacial Skeletal Abnormalities.
biological_context: Skeletal abnormalities, syndromic cleft lip and palate (SCL/P)
data_modalities_used: ['micro-CT imaging', 'histological analysis', 'transcriptomic methods', 'Immunohistochemical analysis', 'in vitro studies']
main_goals: To investigate the role of Arhgap29 in skeletal development and its association with syndromic cleft lip and palate. The study characterized skeletal abnormalities in Arhgap29-deficient mice and explored the underlying molecular mechanisms.

title: Epithelial cell dynamics: Key drivers of type 2 inflammation in eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis.
main_goals: This paper analyzes epithelial cell dynamics and their role in type 2 inflammation in eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis (ECRS). It highlights the key drivers of ECRS pathogenesis, including epithelial cells releasing cytokines and the impact of eosinophilic mucins. The study emphasizes the need for stratified medicine approaches to develop targeted interventions by restoring epithelial integrity and immune balance.

title: Integrating AI/ML and multi-omics approaches to investigate the role of TNFRSF10A/TRAILR1 and its potential targets in pancreatic cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk genomics', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'proteomics', 'ceRNA network analysis', 'QSAR modeling']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the role of TNFRSF10A/TRAILR1 and its potential targets in pancreatic cancer by integrating multi-omics data with AI/ML approaches. The research identified TNFRSF10A as a potential therapeutic target and used advanced deep learning and QSAR analysis to find existing drugs with potential modulatory effects.

title: Decellularised Amniotic Membrane for the Neurogenic Expression of Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Cell Adhesion', 'Cell Migration']
main_goals: The study aims to investigate the potential of decellularized amniotic membrane (DAM) to induce neurogenic differentiation in human mesenchymal stem cells (hMSCs) for neural regeneration in peripheral neuropathy. The research utilizes spatial transcriptomics and immunofluorescence staining to analyze gene expression and cellular responses. The findings suggest that DAM promotes stem cell adhesion, migration, and neural marker expression, indicating its utility for neural repair.

title: Chaperonin containing TCP1 subunit 5 as a novel pan-cancer prognostic biomarker for tumor stemness and immunotherapy response: insights from multi-omics data, integrated machine learning, and experimental validation.
biological_context: Pan-cancer analysis of CCT5, tumor stemness, and immunotherapy response
main_goals: This study investigates the pan-cancer roles of CCT5 in tumorigenesis, stemness maintenance, and immunotherapy response using multi-omics data. It developed a novel CCT5-based signature (CCT5.Sig) to predict immunotherapy response with high accuracy. The findings highlight CCT5 as a potential pan-cancer biomarker.

title: Identification of Prognostic Biomarkers of Ovarian High-Grade Serous Carcinoma: A Preliminary Study Using Spatial Transcriptome Analysis and Multispectral Imaging.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'multispectral immune cell immunofluorescence (IF)', 'gene expression profiling']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify prognostic biomarkers for ovarian high-grade serous carcinoma (HGSC) recurrence following first-line treatment. It employed spatial transcriptomics and multispectral imaging to link spatial expression patterns of genes and immune cell interactions to patient outcomes, revealing potential biomarkers for predicting non-recurrence.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal correlation between RNA methylation-related miRNA risk model and immune infiltration in hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['miRNA sequencing data', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'sequencing']
main_goals: The study aimed to correlate RNA methylation-related miRNA (RMRM) risk with immune infiltration in HCC. It developed a risk model based on four RMRMs and investigated its association with prognosis and immune cell infiltration using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The research identified miR-4739's role in promoting HCC cell proliferation and migration via SPP1+ macrophages.

title: Spatially resolved transcriptomic profiling for glomerular and tubulointerstitial gene expression in C3 glomerulopathy.
main_goals: To investigate the substructure-specific gene expression profile of C3 glomerulopathy (C3G) using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify differentially expressed genes in glomeruli and tubulointerstitial regions of C3G and validate findings in vitro. It seeks to provide insights into the pathophysiology of C3G.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis Reveals HDAC Inhibition Modulates Microglial Dynamics to Protect Against Ischemic Stroke in Mice.
main_goals: To characterize the transcriptomic profiles and spatial distribution of microglia in the stroke brain following HDAC inhibitor administration. The study aims to understand how HDAC inhibition modulates microglial activation and phenotype to promote neuronal repair in the ischemic penumbra.

title: Etiology-based Molecular Characterization of Hepatocellular Carcinoma Reveals SQLE's Contribution to Immunosuppressive Microenvironment.
data_modalities_used: ['RNA-seq', 'genetic alteration', 'copy number alteration', 'immune-related features', 'single-cell transcriptomic data', 'spatial transcriptomic data', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'single-cell transcriptomic data', 'spatial transcriptomic data']
main_goals: To explore etiology-specific features of HCC and improve understanding of tumorigenesis, revealing potential therapeutic targets. The study found that HCC with different etiologies shows distinct clinical features, genetic alterations, copy number alterations, and tumor microenvironments. Specifically, SQLE was found to be overexpressed in viral hepatitis-related HCC and associated with a poor prognosis and an immunosuppressive microenvironment.

title: Dissecting PTPN7-driven aggressiveness in IDH-wildtype astrocytomas: multi-omics, clinical validation, and spatial transcriptomics for prognostic insights.
data_modalities_used: ['TCGA', 'CGGA', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', '10x Genomics Visium', 'immunohistochemistry', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Single-cell RNA sequencing analysis', 'Prognostic analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the role of PTPN7 in IDH-wildtype astrocytomas. It examines PTPN7's prognostic significance, spatial distribution, and immune-related functions using multi-omics and spatial transcriptomics. The goal is to elucidate PTPN7 as a potential prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target to improve patient survival.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveal high T cell and monocyte status as predictive and prognostic markers in pancreatic cancer.
main_goals: This study aimed to discover predictive or prognostic factors for pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). It investigated differences between PDAC cases treated with upfront surgery versus neoadjuvant chemotherapy, and those with good versus poor responses to chemotherapy, using digital spatial profiling and immunohistochemistry. The findings identified specific cell types and molecular markers that could serve as predictive and prognostic indicators for PDAC.

title: Association of DNA damage response signals and oxidative stress status with nivolumab efficacy in patients with Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
biological_context: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: To investigate the association of DNA damage response (DDR) signals and oxidative stress status with nivolumab efficacy in HNSCC patients. The study aims to identify potential non-invasive biomarkers for predicting treatment response by analyzing peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) and spatial transcriptomics data from tumor biopsies.

title: Oligodendrocyte-astrocyte crosstalk in Parkinson's disease mediates neuronal ferroptosis via the FGF signaling pathway.
main_goals: This study investigates the crosstalk between oligodendrocytes and astrocytes in Parkinson's disease and how it mediates neuronal ferroptosis via the FGF signaling pathway. The research characterizes the intercellular communication network using single-nucleus sequencing and spatial transcriptomics, identifies key signaling molecules, and validates findings in PD mice. The study elucidates the role of glial cell dysregulation in driving DA neuron ferroptosis and inflammation in the midbrain SN region.

title: Spatial multiomics decipher fibroblast-macrophage dynamics in systemic sclerosis.
main_goals: To explore tissue organization and cell coordination in SSc skin, providing spatiotemporal insights into disease mechanisms and bridging the gap between omics discovery and precision medicine by analyzing fibroblast-macrophage dynamics.

title: Dissecting key contributions of Th2 and Th17 cytokines to atopic dermatitis pathophysiology.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This paper investigates which T helper (Th)2 and Th17 cytokines drive specific epidermal hallmarks in atopic dermatitis (AD). It utilizes human epidermal equivalents stimulated with these cytokines and analyzes their effects using morphological, functional, and transcriptomic methods. The study aims to uncover the role of IL-22 in Th2-driven AD and evaluate the potential of combinatory therapies.

title: Comprehensive single-cell RNA atlas of human laryngeal normal, preneoplastic and tumorigenic states.
biological_context: Laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma (LSCC) progression from vocal cord leukoplakia (VCL)
main_goals: To characterize the cellular microenvironmental differences between vocal cord leukoplakia (VCL) and laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma (LSCC) at single-cell resolution. The study aims to identify epithelial subclusters in VCL with malignant potential and shared immunosuppressive features with LSCC, providing insights into disease progression and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Microglia activation orchestrates CXCL10-mediated CD8<sup>+</sup> T cell recruitment to promote aging-related white matter degeneration.
biological_context: Aging-related white matter degeneration in mice
main_goals: To investigate microglial functions related to aging-associated changes in myelinated axons of mice using pharmacological and genetic approaches. The study reveals that maladaptive microglia activation promotes the accumulation of harmful CD8+ T cells, leading to white matter degeneration. It also identifies the CXCL10-CXCR3 axis as crucial for CD8+ T cell recruitment.

title: HMG Box-containing Protein 1 (HBP1) Protects Against Pancreatic Injury in Acute Pancreatitis but Promotes Neoplastic Progression.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of HMG Box-containing Protein 1 (HBP1) in acute pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer progression. The findings indicate that HBP1 protects against pancreatic injury but promotes neoplastic progression in the presence of oncogenic KRAS. HBP1 is identified as a potential therapeutic target for intervening pancreatitis and PanIN progression.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Identified Fatty Acid-Binding Proteins Controlling Endothelial Glycolytic and Arterial Programming in Pulmonary Hypertension.
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'immunostaining', 'Bulk RNA sequencing (RNA-seq)', 'single-cell RNA sequencing analysis', 'spatial transcriptomic analysis', 'plasma proteome analysis']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'single-cell RNA sequencing analysis', 'Bulk RNA sequencing (RNA-seq)']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of endothelial fatty acid-binding proteins (FABP4/5) in the pathogenesis of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH). It used single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, along with other experimental techniques, to identify FABP4/5 as key regulators of endothelial glycolysis and arterial programming in PAH, demonstrating their therapeutic potential.

title: Insights into early acne pathogenesis: Exploring intercellular dynamics and key dysregulated genes.
main_goals: The paper aims to explore comprehensive changes and shared dysregulated signaling pathways in early-stage acne by analyzing cell communication using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies dysregulated genes related to inflammation and hyperkeratinization, proposes new markers across various skin cell types, and discusses potential FDA-approved treatments targeting key pathways.

title: A single-cell spatial chart of the airway wall reveals proinflammatory cellular ecosystems and their interactions in health and asthma.
biological_context: Airway wall in health and asthma
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To apply single-cell spatial transcriptomics to reveal the airway wall landscape in health and during asthma, identifying proinflammatory cellular ecosystems and their interactions. The study aims to provide insights into the mechanisms driving asthma and identify targets for therapeutic intervention by revealing distinct cellular ecosystems within spatial niches.

title: Gain-of-function PPM1D mutations attenuate ischemic stroke.
main_goals: This study identifies gain-of-function PPM1D mutations in ischemic stroke patients, revealing a protective role of PPM1D against ischemic brain injury. It elucidates the mechanism involving PPARα-mediated fatty acid metabolism and introduces a pharmacological stabilizer, T2755, as a potential therapy.

title: Targeting mitochondrial complex I of CD177<sup>+</sup> neutrophils alleviates lung ischemia-reperfusion injury.
biological_context: Lung ischemia-reperfusion injury and primary graft dysfunction following lung transplantation
main_goals: This study identifies CD177+ neutrophils as a key contributor to lung ischemia-reperfusion injury (IRI) and primary graft dysfunction. It demonstrates that targeting mitochondrial complex I in these neutrophils alleviates lung injury in experimental models.

title: Integrative single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis reveals MDK-NCL pathway's role in shaping the immunosuppressive environment of lung adenocarcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular composition of the tumor microenvironment in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and assesses the role of the MDK-NCL signaling pathway. The findings reveal that LUAD cells utilize the MDK-NCL pathway to shape an immunosuppressive microenvironment, promoting malignancy and immune evasion, thus highlighting it as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Pyroptosis drives tumor progression and immune evasion in Hepatocellular Carcinoma: a single-cell and spatial transcriptomic study.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)', 'spatial transcriptomic data', 'bulk RNA-seq data']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates pyroptosis-related gene expression in HCC, identifying CHMP4B as a key gene influencing prognosis and the tumor microenvironment. It aims to elucidate CHMP4B's role in tumor progression and immune evasion, suggesting its potential as a biomarker and therapeutic target.

title: Multimodal spatial proteomic profiling in acute myeloid leukemia.
main_goals: The study optimized a high-throughput pipeline for spatial immunofluorescence and mass cytometry imaging to profile immune, tumor, and structural components in AML. It identified tertiary lymphoid-like aggregates in bone marrow and found signatures predictive of outcomes in AML. The work opens possibilities for discovering novel structures and interactions underpinning leukemic immune response.

title: Decoding the impact of MMP1+ malignant subsets on tumor-immune interactions: insights from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To investigate MMP1 expression, its cellular localization, and its impact on tumor progression and immune modulation using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to understand MMP1's role in the tumor-immune microenvironment and explore its potential as a therapeutic target.

title: Phenotypic heterogeneity and plasticity in colorectal cancer metastasis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates phenotypic heterogeneity and plasticity in colorectal cancer metastasis. Using single-cell multiomics and spatial transcriptomics, it identifies cancer cell states resembling metastasis-initiating cells and their regulators (AP-1, NF-κB) in an immunosuppressive niche. The findings aim to reveal targets to impair metastasis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics advances the use of canine patients in cancer research: analysis of osteosarcoma-bearing pet dogs enrolled in a clinical trial.
main_goals: This study presents the first application of the GeoMx Canine Cancer Atlas to outcome-linked samples from canine osteosarcoma patients. It analyzes gene and pathway enrichment associated with disease-free interval in these patients, aiming to validate the utility of the canine model for human cancer research.

title: High-Sensitivity PD-L1 Staining Using Clone 73-10 Antibody and Spatial Transcriptomics for Precise Expression Analysis in Non-Tumorous, Intraepithelial Neoplasia, and Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck.
biological_context: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: To evaluate PD-L1 (CD274) expression using a highly sensitive clone (73-10) and spatial transcriptomics in HNSCC, intraepithelial neoplasia, and normal mucosa. The study aimed to understand the role of PD-L1 in HNSCC and potentially expand patient eligibility for immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveal PI3K-AKT and metabolic alterations in aggressive, treatment-resistant lactotroph pituitary neuroendocrine tumors.
biological_context: Aggressive, treatment-resistant lactotroph pituitary neuroendocrine tumors (PitNET)
data_modalities_used: ['Visium Spatial Transcriptomics', 'whole transcriptome sequencing', 'whole exome sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Deconvolution']
main_goals: To unravel the molecular heterogeneity of lactotroph PitNET and identify biomarkers of aggressiveness and resistance to pharmacological treatment using spatial transcriptomics and other sequencing methods. The study aimed to identify molecular targets for therapeutic strategies.

title: Spatiotemporal single-cell analysis elucidates the cellular and molecular dynamics of human cornea aging.
main_goals: This study elucidates the spatiotemporal cellular and molecular dynamics of human cornea aging using single-cell RNA sequencing and scStereo-seq. It identifies novel cell subpopulations, maps the spatial positioning of limbal stem cells, and delineates intercellular interactions. The findings reveal an age-related centripetal migration pattern of basal cells and differential regional characteristics of the corneal endothelium, providing a resource for understanding corneal homeostasis and advancing related research.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome analysis revealed cellular heterogeneity of glycosyltransferases in cervical cancer, and identified GALNT3-negative epithelial cells as a protective factor: a retrospective cohort study based on public database.
main_goals: This study explored the role of glycosyltransferases (GTs) in cervical cancer using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identified GALNT3-negative epithelial cells as a protective factor, correlating with reduced tumor-associated macrophages and myeloid-derived suppressor cells, and demonstrated the impact of GALNT3 expression on cancer cell behavior in vitro.

title: Integrating Spatial and Single-Nucleus Transcriptomic Data to Assess the Effects of Intrauterine Hyperglycemia on Fetal Pancreatic Development.
biological_context: Fetal pancreatic development under maternal pregestational diabetes mellitus
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To investigate the specific impacts of maternal pregestational diabetes mellitus (PGDM) on cellular functions and intercellular communication within the fetal pancreas. The study aims to reveal cellular responses, spatial changes, and molecular mechanisms underlying fetal pancreatic response to maternal PGDM.

title: Precision Medicine in Pediatric Autoimmunity: Leniolisib Treatment of Childhood-Onset Lupus Nephritis Due to Activated PI3K-Delta Syndrome (APDS).
biological_context: Childhood-onset Lupus Nephritis (LN) in Activated PI3K-delta Syndrome type 1 (APDS1)
data_modalities_used: ['MIBI-TOF (Multiplexed Ion Beam Imaging Time-of-Flight Spectrometry)', 'flow cytometry', 'clinical parameters']
main_goals: To investigate the mechanistic underpinnings and treatment response of lupus nephritis (LN) in activated PI3K-delta syndrome type 1 (APDS1) using pathway-specific therapy and advanced spatial proteomics. The study aimed to characterize the kidney tissue immune architecture in APDS1-LN and compare it to typical childhood-onset LN and healthy controls. It also evaluated the therapeutic response to leniolisib, a selective PI3Kδ inhibitor.

title: Region- and cell type-specific changes in gene expression in the cerebellum after classical fear conditioning.
main_goals: Investigate transcriptional changes in the cerebellum associated with auditory fear conditioning using spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA sequencing. Highlight region- and cell-type-specific molecular adaptations in the cerebellum contributing to non-motor learning.

title: Paired mutation calling and spatial transcriptomics identify cellular neighbourhoods dictating the neoplastic outcome of colitis.
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vivo lineage tracing', 'mutational profiling']
main_goals: This study investigates how the cellular environment impacts the progression from inflammatory bowel disease to cancer by combining lineage tracing, computational modeling, mutational profiling, and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to identify epithelial- and immune-enriched neighborhoods that facilitate tumor initiation by promoting the selection and expansion of pro-oncogenic clones.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Explore Purine Metabolism-Related Prognostic Risk Model and Tumor Immune Microenvironment Modulation in Ovarian Cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Pseudotime analysis', 'Gene expression analysis', 'Prognostic modeling', 'Tumor microenvironment analysis', 'Immunotherapy association analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to explore purine metabolism-related prognostic risk models and their impact on the tumor immune microenvironment in ovarian cancer. It uses single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify key genes and cellular behaviors associated with prognosis and immunotherapy response.

title: Metabolism-associated marker gene-based predictive model for prognosis, targeted therapy, and immune landscape in ovarian cancer: an integrative analysis of single-cell and bulk RNA sequencing with spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study aims to identify metabolism-associated marker genes (MRGs) to develop a prognostic model for ovarian cancer (OC). The model is used to explore targeted therapies, predict immune landscape, and understand the biological functions linked to metabolism in OC. The study also validates the prognostic ability of a specific MRG, TREM1, and identifies potential therapeutic drugs.

title: Spatiotemporal dynamic changes of meningeal microenvironment influence meningeal lymphatic function following subarachnoid hemorrhage: from inflammatory response to tissue remodeling.
main_goals: To investigate the meningeal transcriptional response post-SAH and elucidate the dynamic influence of the meningeal microenvironment on meningeal lymphatic function. The study aimed to characterize spatiotemporal dynamic changes in the early meningeal microenvironment post-SAH and validate findings in a mouse model.

title: Macrophage sensitivity to bexmarilimab-induced reprogramming is shaped by the tumor microenvironment.
data_modalities_used: ['patient-derived explant culture', 'RNA sequencing', 'multiplex cytokine profiling', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study explored the responsiveness of tumor microenvironments to bexmarilimab, a macrophage reprogramming therapy, using patient-derived explant cultures. It characterized responses via RNA sequencing and multiplex cytokine profiling, and investigated effects of Clever-1+ macrophages and TME features using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The findings revealed that the inflammatory state of the TME is the primary determinant of response and emphasized the need for patient selection.

title: Deciphering the Immunomodulatory Function of GSN<sup>+</sup> Inflammatory Cancer-Associated Fibroblasts in Renal Cell Carcinoma Immunotherapy: Insights From Pan-Cancer Single-Cell Landscape and Spatial Transcriptomics Analysis.
biological_context: Renal cell carcinoma (specifically clear cell renal cell carcinoma) and pan-cancer immunotherapy
data_modalities_used: ['pan-cancer single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics sequencing', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'in vivo experiments', 'in vitro experiments', 'real-world immunotherapy data']
covered_analysis_steps: ['machine learning', 'spatial gene expression analysis', 'cell-cell interaction analysis']
main_goals: The study aims to decipher the immunomodulatory function of GSN+ inflammatory cancer-associated fibroblasts (iCAFs) in renal cell carcinoma immunotherapy. It introduces the Caf.Sig model, a machine learning-based tool for predicting immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) response using CAF gene signatures. The research also investigates the mechanisms by which GSN+ iCAFs influence ICI efficacy and suggests therapeutic strategies for upregulating GSN.

title: Single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal FAS+ T cell and autophagy-related signatures predicting chemoimmunotherapy response in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma patients.
main_goals: The study aimed to investigate the prognostic effect of autophagy-related genes (ARGs) in DLBCL. It identified prognostic ARGs and constructed an autophagy-related model to divide patients into risk groups. The research also identified FAS+ T cells as a biomarker for favorable prognosis.

title: Deciphering the role of acetylation-related gene NAT10 in colon cancer progression and immune evasion: implications for overcoming drug resistance.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Survival Analysis', 'Mendelian randomization']
main_goals: This study aimed to decipher the role of acetylation-related gene NAT10 in colon cancer progression and immune evasion, investigating its implications for overcoming drug resistance. The research utilized multi-omics analyses to identify NAT10 as a factor associated with tumor progression, metastasis, and immune escape characteristics in colon cancer, suggesting it as a potential biomarker and therapeutic target.

title: Targeting mesenchymal monocyte-derived macrophages to enhance the sensitivity of glioblastoma to temozolomide by inhibiting TNF/CELSR2/p65/Kla-HDAC1/EPAS1 axis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'patient-derived GBM organoids', 'intracranial orthotopic GBM model', 'histology images']
main_goals: To identify a subtype of monocyte-derived macrophages (MDM) that contribute to temozolomide (TMZ) resistance in glioblastoma (GBM) and to elucidate the mechanisms involved. The study aims to demonstrate that targeting these mesenchymal MDMs enhances GBM sensitivity to TMZ and to provide a potential therapeutic strategy for MES-subtype GBM.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals human cortical layer and area specification.
main_goals: This study uses MERFISH and deep learning to spatially map human fetal cortical development. It reveals the early establishment of cortical layers and identifies distinct modes of areal specification, including an abrupt boundary between V1 and V2 visual cortices. The findings highlight the role of spatial relationships in cortical development.

title: Sequence Diversity and Encoded Enzymatic Differences of Monocistronic L1 ORF2 mRNA Variants in the Aged Normal and Alzheimer's Disease Brain.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'PacBio HiFi long-read sequencing', 'enzymatic functional assays']
main_goals: This study assessed endogenous RT activities and L1 mRNA diversity from cerebral cortex samples of Alzheimer's disease (AD) and nondiseased (ND) brains. It identified monocistronic ORF2 transcripts and investigated their functional differences and impact on genomic mosaicism in the aged brain.

title: Genomic evolution reshapes cell-type diversification in the amniote brain.
biological_context: Amniote brain evolution and cell-type diversification
main_goals: The study created a single-cell atlas of over 1.3 million cells from the telencephalon and cerebellum of various amniotes using spatial transcriptomics. It identifies species-specific variations in cell types and highlights differences between birds and mammals in telencephalon excitatory neurons and cerebellar cell types. The research also identified a bird-specific Purkinje cell subtype and implicates the LSD1/KDM1A pathway in learning and circadian rhythms.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals an anti-tumor neutrophil subgroup in microwave thermochemotherapy-treated lip cancer.
biological_context: Lip squamous cell carcinoma (LSCC) treated with microwave thermochemotherapy (MTC)
main_goals: This study uses single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the role of tumor-associated neutrophils (TANs) in lip cancer treated with microwave thermochemotherapy. It identifies an anti-tumor neutrophil subgroup (N1-phenotype) characterized by specific markers and functions, and describes their interaction with fibroblasts to form a defense wall against LSCC. The study also proposes a marker (MX2) for predicting prognosis and uses deep learning to predict its expression from H&E images.

title: Multi-omics Analysis Reveals the Propagation Mechanism of Ferroptosis in Acute Kidney Injury.
data_modalities_used: ['snRNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'mouse model of bilateral renal ischemia-reperfusion injury']
main_goals: This study analyzes snRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics data to elucidate the propagation mechanism of ferroptosis in acute kidney injury. It identifies key genes (GPX4, FTH1, FTL) and transcription factors (KLF6) involved in ferroptosis and reveals a subpopulation of proximal tubule cells associated with this process.

title: INHBA<sup>+</sup> macrophages and Pro-inflammatory CAFs are associated with distinctive immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment in submucous Fibrosis-Derived oral squamous cell carcinoma.
biological_context: Oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) derived from oral submucosal fibrosis (OSF)
main_goals: This paper investigates the distinctive tumor immunosuppressive microenvironment (TISME) in oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) derived from oral submucosal fibrosis (ODSCC) compared to OSCC without OSF history (NODSCC). It identifies INHBA+ macrophages and pro-inflammatory cancer-associated fibroblasts (iCAFs) as key components contributing to a more severe TISME in ODSCC, potentially impacting immunotherapy sensitivity.

title: Development of a machine learning-based predictive risk model combining fatty acid metabolism and ferroptosis for immunotherapy response and prognosis in prostate cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study developed a machine learning-based prognostic model for prostate cancer by integrating fatty acid metabolism and ferroptosis. The model stratifies patients into risk groups, predicts immunotherapy response, and identifies potential therapeutic targets, validated using multi-omics data and spatial transcriptomics.

title: High-resolution spatial transcriptomics and cell lineage analysis reveal spatiotemporal cell fate determination during craniofacial development.
main_goals: The paper reports a high-resolution spatiotemporal transcriptomic and cell-type atlas of cranial neural crest cell-derived mesenchymal lineage diversification during mouse palatogenesis. It reveals mesenchymal lineage establishment at or prior to palatogenesis initiation and identifies a heterogeneous Sox9+ mesenchymal progenitor population. The study demonstrates that distinct mesenchymal populations are established early, preceding palatal development.

title: What single-cell RNA sequencing taught us about MGMT expression in glioblastoma.
main_goals: This study evaluated MGMT expression at the single-cell level in glioblastoma using publicly available single-cell sequencing data. It aimed to understand the relationship between MGMT expression and MGMT promoter methylation status in tumor cells, contrasting with previous bulk methods.

title: Hypoxia-induced RHCG as a key regulator in psoriasis and its modulation by secukinumab.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'bulk data analysis', 'ex vivo experiments', 'clinical specimens']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of RHCG in psoriasis pathogenesis, particularly its induction by hypoxia and its modulation by secukinumab. The authors used bioinformatics and experimental approaches to show that RHCG upregulation in psoriatic skin enhances keratinocyte proliferation markers and activates dendritic cells. Secukinumab treatment effectively reduced RHCG expression, suggesting RHCG as a target for psoriasis therapy.

title: Characterization of protective effects of Jianpi Tongluo Formula on cartilage in knee osteoarthritis from a single cell-spatial heterogeneity perspective
data_modalities_used: ['single cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction', 'Western blot', 'immunohistochemical staining']
main_goals: To systematically characterize the protective effects of Jianpi Tongluo Formula (JTF) on cartilage in knee osteoarthritis (KOA) and elucidate the underlying molecular mechanisms. The study integrates single cell and spatial transcriptomics with animal experiments to identify key pathogenic factors and assess JTF's intervention effects.

title: Major Facilitator Superfamily transporters balance sugar metabolism in peach.
main_goals: To investigate the role of Major Facilitator Superfamily (MFS) transporters in balancing sugar metabolism during peach fruit development and ripening using a multi-omics approach. The study aims to identify key transporters and genetic loci influencing sugar accumulation and quality.

title: Spatial transcriptomics highlights B cells as key contributors to a complete and durable response to chemo-immunotherapy in a patient with resectable NSCLC.
biological_context: Resectable non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with a solitary synchronous brain metastasis treated with neoadjuvant chemo-immunotherapy
main_goals: This study reports a case of a patient with resectable NSCLC who achieved a complete pathologic response to neoadjuvant chemo-immunotherapy. Using spatial transcriptomics and other molecular profiling techniques, the paper highlights the role of B cells in mediating tumor eradication and the formation of tertiary lymphoid structures, suggesting mechanisms for a durable immune response. The findings aim to guide biomarker discovery and clinical decision-making.

title: Landscape of spatial disruption of homeostasis in the middle temporal gyrus of epileptic patients.
biological_context: Epilepsy in the middle temporal gyrus of humans
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: This study investigates the middle temporal gyrus (MTG) in epileptic patients using single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) and spatial transcriptomics (ST) to elucidate cellular and spatial disruptions associated with epilepsy. They identified cellular and layer-specific gene expression alterations, and spatial mapping revealed significant changes in key marker genes like NPY and GFAP. The study aimed to enhance understanding of the molecular and cellular underpinnings of epilepsy and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: Gas Bubbles from Biodegradable Magnesium Implants Convey Mechanical Cues and Promote Immune Cell Stimulation.
biological_context: Biodegradable magnesium implants and their effect on surrounding tissue and immune cells in rats.
main_goals: This study investigates how gas bubbles from biodegradable magnesium implants influence adjacent tissue and cell behavior in rats, focusing on their biological implications, cellular responses, and the role of mechanical cues and inflammation. The findings suggest a need for controlled gas release and monitoring of bubble evolution in such implants.

title: Mapping the molecular signature of ABA-regulated gene expression in germinating barley embryos.
