main_goals: To map ABA-regulated gene expression in germinating barley embryos using spatial transcriptomics, transcriptomics, and metabolomics. The study aimed to understand the molecular signature of ABA's role in seed germination and phytohormonal crosstalk.

title: Differential Localization of β-Catenin Protein in CTNNB1 Mutant Endometrial Cancers Results in Distinct Transcriptional Profiles.
biological_context: Endometrioid endometrial cancers (EECs) with CTNNB1 exon 3 mutations
main_goals: This study aimed to determine downstream gene expression based on the localization of mutant β-catenin protein (nuclear vs. non-nuclear) in CTNNB1 mutant endometrial cancers. It utilized spatial transcriptomics to identify distinct transcriptional profiles associated with these localizations, revealing pathway enrichments and a novel therapeutic target (TROP2). The findings emphasize the heterogeneity of intratumor transcriptional profiles dependent on β-catenin localization.

title: Single-cell MultiOmics and spatial transcriptomics demonstrate neuroblastoma developmental plasticity.
main_goals: This study dissects the transcriptional and epigenetic landscapes governing developmental states in neuroblastoma using single-cell MultiOmics and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies developmental intermediate states and epigenetic priming critical for malignant transitions in high-risk neuroblastomas. The research also maps enhancer gene regulatory networks and microenvironments sustaining aggressive states, suggesting therapeutic targets.

title: Decoding the Resistin-CAP1 Pathway in Intermediate Monocytes Mediating Liver Allograft Rejection.
main_goals: This study identifies intermediate monocytes and the Resistin-CAP1 pathway as crucial mediators of liver allograft rejection. It demonstrates the therapeutic potential of targeting this pathway using nanogold-siRNA technology to mitigate rejection and improve graft survival.

title: 3D reconstruction of a human Carnegie stage 9 embryo provides a snapshot of early body plan formation.
biological_context: Human embryo development at Carnegie stage 9
main_goals: This study provides a 3D reconstruction of a human Carnegie stage 9 embryo using spatial transcriptomics. It identifies diverse cell types and provides insights into early body plan formation, including hindbrain development, the isthmic organizer, neuromesodermal progenitor cells, aorta formation, and primordial germ cells.

title: Spatial multi-omics reveals the potential involvement of SPP1<sup>+</sup> fibroblasts in determining metabolic heterogeneity and promoting metastatic growth of colorectal cancer liver metastasis.
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial regions and molecular/metabolic basis of colorectal cancer liver metastasis (CRLM). It identifies SPP1+ fibroblasts as key players in determining metabolic heterogeneity and promoting metastatic growth through interactions with tumor cells.

title: DDX24 spatiotemporally orchestrates VEGF and Wnt signaling during developmental angiogenesis.
main_goals: To investigate the role of DDX24 in the spatiotemporal regulation of developmental angiogenesis by analyzing its effects on VEGF and Wnt signaling pathways in zebrafish. The study aims to understand how DDX24 deficiency impacts vascular development and to explore potential therapeutic interventions.

title: Spatial visualization provides insight into immune modulation by an L-DBF vaccine formulation against Shigella.
biological_context: Immune modulation by L-DBF vaccine formulation against Shigella
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study investigates how a two-dose regimen of L-DBF, formulated in an oil-in-water emulsion, modulates immune responses in the lung using spatial transcriptomics. The findings highlight significant changes in the lung immune landscape, including altered expression of immune cell markers and reprogramming of fibroblasts and cardiomyocytes, demonstrating the vaccine's potential to reshape lung immune architecture.

title: PAQR5 drives the malignant progression and shapes the immunosuppressive microenvironment of hepatocellular carcinoma by activating the NF-κB signaling.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Single cell-RNA seq', 'Spatial transcriptomic']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the molecular mechanisms by which PAQR5 facilitates HCC progression and contributes to the immunosuppressive microenvironment. It found that PAQR5 activates the NF-κB signaling pathway, driving proliferation, invasion, EMT, and immune escape in HCC.

title: Oncogene aberrations drive medulloblastoma progression, not initiation.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of oncogene aberrations and copy number variations in the progression of group 3/4 medulloblastoma using single-cell technologies. It demonstrates that large-scale chromosomal aberrations are early initiating events, while single-gene oncogenic events arise later and can drive tumor progression and therapy resistance. The findings also provide insights into the cellular origin and early developmental stages of medulloblastoma.

title: Heterogeneous pericoerulear neurons tune arousal and exploratory behaviours.
biological_context: Locus coeruleus (LC) regulation of arousal and exploratory behaviors
data_modalities_used: ['viral tracing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'neural circuit approaches']
main_goals: This paper identifies diverse GABAergic neurons in the peri-LC region that modulate LC firing modes to control global arousal levels and related behaviors. It defines peri-LC anatomy and molecularly characterizes LC and peri-LC cell types using viral tracing, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics. The findings highlight the heterogeneity of LC and peri-LC neuronal populations in modulating arousal and avoidance states.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals tumor microenvironment heterogeneity in EBV positive diffuse large B cell lymphoma.
biological_context: Epstein-Barr Virus-positive Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma (EBV+DLBCL)
main_goals: This study integrated spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing to map tumor microenvironment heterogeneity in EBV+DLBCL. It identified PD-1/PD-L1 signaling as a hallmark of the immunosuppressive TME and provided preclinical evidence for PD-1/PD-L1 blockade as a therapeutic strategy.

title: Mature tertiary lymphoid structures evoke intra-tumoral T and B cell responses via progenitor exhausted CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells in head and neck cancer.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'antigen receptor sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanisms by which mature tertiary lymphoid structures (mTLS) in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) promote intra-tumoral T and B cell responses. It highlights the role of progenitor exhausted CD4+ T cells in activating B cells and supporting CD8+ T cell activation within mTLS. The findings suggest that mTLS are associated with improved patient survival and response to immune checkpoint blockade.

title: Spatial transcriptional landscape of human heart failure.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'GeoMx Whole Human Transcriptome Atlas', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry', 'sc/snRNA-seq data', 'histology images']
main_goals: To explore cell-type- and histology-specific gene expression profiles in cardiomyopathies using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to characterize the cellular composition of ventricular myocardium, identify differentially expressed genes in failing hearts, and link them to specific histological features and cell types.

title: ABCC3 Is a Differential Marker of CYP11B2-Negative Zona Glomerulosa Cells in Human Adrenal Cortex.
biological_context: Primary aldosteronism and human adrenal cortex
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of ABCC3 in the human adrenal cortex, particularly in the context of primary aldosteronism. It identifies ABCC3 as a novel marker for CYP11B2-negative zona glomerulosa cells, providing a histopathological tool to differentiate normal adrenal zonation from aldosterone-producing lesions.

title: Novel Link Between Myeloid-Specific Adenosine Deaminase 2 and CXCL10-CXCR3 Axis in Infectious ARDS.
biological_context: COVID-19 induced Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)
main_goals: This study investigates the association between the monocyte-derived enzyme adenosine deaminase 2 (ADA2) and SARS-CoV-2 induced ARDS. It reveals a link between ADA2, the chemokine CXCL10, and its receptor CXCR3, particularly highlighting ADA2's expression in inflammatory monocytes within affected lungs.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal unique subpopulations of infiltrating macrophages and dendritic cells following AKI.
covered_analysis_steps: ['scRNA-seq analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics analysis', 'CITE-seq analysis', 'Gene Ontology analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the temporal, spatial, and transcriptional characteristics of unique subpopulations of kidney infiltrating macrophages (KIMs) and kidney dendritic cells (KDCs) following ischemia-induced acute kidney injury (AKI) in mice. It utilized single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and CITE-sequencing to identify distinct cellular subpopulations and their unique microenvironments. The findings aim to inform the development of macrophage-specific therapeutics for kidney diseases.

title: Integrating spatial transcriptomics and snRNA-seq data enhances differential gene expression analysis results of AD-related phenotypes.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper integrates spatial transcriptomics (ST) and single-nucleus RNA sequencing (snRNA-seq) data to enhance differential gene expression (DGE) analysis for Alzheimer's disease (AD) related phenotypes. By leveraging the spatial information from ST and larger sample sizes from snRNA-seq, the study aims to identify spatially informed cell-type-specific DGE genes that are crucial for understanding AD pathogenesis and potential therapeutic targets. The integration resulted in the identification of significant genes that were not detectable by traditional cell-type-specific analyses alone.

title: Immune-epithelial-stromal networks define the cellular ecosystem of the small intestine in celiac disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization', 'Single-Cell Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the immune-epithelial-stromal interactions in celiac disease by performing single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It reveals shifts in epithelial cell states, altered T cell populations, and persistent immune-epithelial changes even after treatment. The research also identifies CD-specific lymphoid aggregates and altered signaling networks with potential therapeutic targets.

title: Oligodendroglia vulnerability in the human dorsal striatum in Parkinson's disease.
biological_context: Parkinson's disease in the human dorsal striatum
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate the diversity of oligodendroglia and their alterations in Parkinson's disease by performing sn-RNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics on human dorsal striatum samples. It identifies disease-associated oligodendroglia populations with specific molecular signatures and investigates their spatial distribution and impact on myelin integrity.

title: Decoding per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) in hepatocellular carcinoma: a multi-omics and computational toxicology approach.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differential Gene Expression Analysis', 'Protein-Protein Interaction (PPI) network construction', 'Survival risk model development', 'Molecular docking simulations']
main_goals: This study aims to uncover the molecular mechanisms by which PFAS exposure drives hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) using a multi-omics approach. It identifies key molecular targets and pathways involved in PFAS-induced liver carcinogenesis and proposes a survival risk model (PFASRHSig) for HCC. The findings offer potential therapeutic targets for mitigating health risks associated with PFAS exposure.

title: FMO2<sup>+</sup> cancer-associated fibroblasts sensitize anti-PD-1 therapy in patients with hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'transcriptome profiling', 'cytometry by time-of-flight analysis']
main_goals: This study identifies a specific FMO2+ cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) subset that is associated with a favorable response to anti-PD-1 therapy in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). These CAFs promote anti-PD-1 efficacy by enhancing tertiary lymphoid structure formation and immune cell infiltration via the CCL19-CCR7 axis. The study proposes FMO2+ CAFs as a predictive biomarker and CCL19 in combination with anti-PD-1 as a potential therapeutic strategy for HCC.

title: Dissecting the immune landscape in pediatric high-grade glioma reveals cell state changes under therapeutic pressure.
main_goals: The study provides a comprehensive transcriptomic analysis of the pediatric high-grade glioma (pHGG) immune landscape using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It examines immune microenvironment distinctions after various therapeutic treatments and by age, identifying differences in myeloid subpopulations compared to adults and observing shifts towards immune-suppressive environments post-therapy. The findings aim to offer insights into immunotherapy targets and serve as a resource for understanding immune microenvironmental variations.

title: Induced B cell receptor diversity predicts PD-1 blockade immunotherapy response.
biological_context: Advanced and metastatic basal cell carcinoma, glioblastoma, melanoma, and head and neck squamous cell carcinoma
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'high-definition spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial immunoreceptor profiling', 'RNA sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study identifies that induced B cell receptor (BCR) clonal diversity predicts response to PD-1 blockade immunotherapy across multiple cancer types. The findings suggest that BCR diversity is a dynamic factor in immunotherapy, acting as a prognostic marker and a potential therapeutic target.

title: Calbindin 2 as a Novel Biomarker and Therapeutic Target for Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm: Integrative Analysis of Human Proteomes and Genetics.
data_modalities_used: ['proteome', 'genetics', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell/single-nucleus RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'preclinical mouse models']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify novel biomarkers and therapeutic targets for abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) by integrating human proteome and genetic data, and performing multiomics and experimental validation. The study identified calbindin 2 (CALB2) as a potential causal factor and therapeutic target, with lenalidomide and genistein showing promise as treatments.

title: A Spatial Multi-Omic Framework Identifies Gliomas Permissive to TIL Expansion.
data_modalities_used: ['spectral flow cytometry', 'TCR sequencing', 'single-cell RNA-seq', 'Xenium in situ transcriptomics', 'CODEX spatial proteomics']
main_goals: This study aims to identify genomic and spatial determinants of Tumor-Infiltrating Lymphocyte (TIL) expandability in high-grade gliomas. It leverages multimodal profiling to define molecular and spatial correlates of TIL manufacturing success, establishing a genomics-enabled selection platform for adoptive T cell therapy.

title: Charting the Single-Cell and Spatial Landscape of IDH-Wildtype Glioblastoma with GBmap.
main_goals: This study aimed to create a comprehensive single-cell and spatial atlas of Glioblastoma (GB) to unravel its cellular heterogeneity, spatial architecture, and clinical relevance. They constructed GBmap, a harmonized single-cell atlas, and used spatial transcriptomics to map tumor organization, developing the Tumor Structure Score (TSS). The resource reveals cellular heterogeneity and identifies hypoxia-dependent niches associated with poor prognosis.

title: Meningeal-derived retinoic acid regulates neurogenesis via suppression of Notch and Sox2.
biological_context: Mouse brain development, specifically neocortical neurogenesis
main_goals: This paper investigates how meningeal-derived retinoic acid (RA) regulates neurogenesis by suppressing Notch and Sox2. It identifies that RARα binds to the Sox2ot promoter and that meningeal RA promotes neurogenesis by suppressing Notch signaling in Foxc1-mutant embryos. The findings elucidate a mechanism for how meningeal RA coordinates neocortical development and sheds light on neurodevelopmental disorders associated with meningeal defects.

title: Neurogenesis drives hippocampal formation-wide spatial transcription alterations in health and Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: To investigate the spatial transcription profile of neurons and glia in the hippocampal formation in health and Alzheimer's disease using in situ sequencing. The study aims to understand how neurogenesis modulates cellular profiles and whether enhancing neurogenesis can restore neuronal profiles in Alzheimer's disease. It also provides a platform for examining cellular dynamics in the hippocampal formation.

title: The suppressive role of GLS in radiosensitivity and irradiation-induced immune response in LUAD: integrating bioinformatics and experimental insights.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'in vitro experiments', 'in vivo experiments', 'co-culture assays', 'flow cytometry', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'CD8+ T cell activation and cytotoxicity']
main_goals: This study investigates the suppressive role of Glutaminase (GLS) in radiosensitivity and irradiation-induced immune responses in Lung Adenocarcinoma (LUAD). It explores GLS's impact on DSB repair, ferroptosis, and CD8+ T cell activation and cytotoxicity. The research also developed a GLS-DSBr prognostic model for LUAD patients.

title: Impaired parvalbumin interneurons in the retrosplenial cortex as the cause of sex-dependent vulnerability in Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: This study investigates the cause of sex-dependent vulnerability in Alzheimer's disease by focusing on parvalbumin interneurons in the retrosplenial cortex. It identifies early, sex-dependent alterations in these neurons, linking their impairment to cognitive deficits and dysregulated brain connectivity, and suggests stimulating these neurons as a therapeutic strategy.

title: Investigation into the Spatial Heterogeneity of Lung Composite Large-Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Combined Large-Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Differential Gene Expression Analysis', 'Functional Enrichment']
main_goals: This study aimed to explore spatial transcriptomic expression patterns in Lung combined large-cell neuroendocrine carcinoma (CoLCNEC) and identify crucial genes. It investigates the spatial heterogeneity of CoLCNEC and validates the role of SMC1A in cell migration, invasion, cell cycle, and apoptosis.

title: Heterogenous cancer-associated fibroblasts related tumor microenvironment marked by CD10/KLF4/TIAM1 were identified in pancreatic adenocarcinoma by integrated transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study explored the composition and proportions of CAF subtypes within the PDAC tumor microenvironment. It identified distinct CAF-related TME subtypes and characterized their gene expression profiles, prognostic correlations, and spatial distributions. The findings provide insights into the role of CAF heterogeneity in PDAC progression and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal an immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment related to metastatic dissemination during pancreatic cancer liver metastasis.
data_modalities_used: ['snRNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed immunofluorescence staining', 'immunohistochemistry', 'transwell assay', 'scratch wound healing assay']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Deconvolution', 'Intercellular signalling', 'Pseudotime analysis', 'Immune infiltration profiling', 'Spatial gene expression analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular heterogeneity and immune microenvironment in pancreatic cancer liver metastasis using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to elucidate the role of T_reg cells and the SPP1 pathway in fostering an immunosuppressive microenvironment and to identify CITED4 as a biomarker for liver metastasis and poor prognosis.

title: Cross-Species Multi-Omics Analysis Reveals Myeloid-Driven Endothelial Oxidative Stress in Ischemic Stroke.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-sequencing', 'single-cell RNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'flow cytometry', 'in vitro oxygen-glucose deprivation/reperfusion']
main_goals: This study integrates multi-omics data to reveal a peripheral-central immune axis in ischemic stroke, highlighting myeloid-driven endothelial oxidative stress. It investigates the interplay between peripheral and central immune responses and the impact of myeloid cell infiltration on the blood-brain barrier. The findings suggest targeting endothelial oxidative injury and myeloid-endothelial crosstalk as a potential therapeutic strategy.

title: Broad rim lesions are a new pathological and imaging biomarker for rapid disease progression in multiple sclerosis.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify new pathological and imaging biomarkers for rapid disease progression in Multiple Sclerosis (MS). Researchers analyzed an MS autopsy cohort using histology and spatial transcriptomics to uncover a distinct lesion type associated with rapid progression. This finding was then validated using PET imaging, identifying 'broad rim lesions' as a potential biomarker to guide future therapeutic trials.

title: Disruption of DNA methylation underpins the neuroinflammation induced by targeted CNS radiotherapy.
biological_context: Neuroinflammation induced by targeted CNS radiotherapy
main_goals: This study investigates the underlying cellular and molecular mechanisms of neuroinflammation induced by targeted radiotherapy. It characterizes DNA methylation patterns in irradiated brain tissue and integrates them with gene expression analysis to identify inflammatory micro-environmental niches and regulatory neuropeptides. The findings suggest that epigenetic dysregulation, particularly DNA methylation alterations, plays a role in neurotoxicity and could be a target for reducing radiotherapy side-effects.

title: In situ mass spectrometry imaging reveals metabolite alterations in gray and white matter after spinal cord injury.
main_goals: This study uses ambient air flow-assisted desorption electrospray ionization mass spectrometry imaging to identify the localization of metabolites in different regions of the spinal cord after transection surgery. It reveals specific metabolite increases and decreases in gray and white matter, and ventral and dorsal horns, providing insights into metabolic alterations post-injury. The findings support the development of precise treatment strategies.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptomics of tertiary lymphoid organ-like structures in human atherosclerotic plaques.
main_goals: This study presents a spatially resolved single-cell transcriptome atlas of human atherosclerotic plaques, identifying cell types and plaque tertiary lymphoid organs (PTLOs). It explores the association of PTLO development with specific gene expressions and the immune involvement of B cells. The findings suggest that PTLO-like structures correlate with cerebrovascular events and propose a mechanism mediated by PTLO-derived IgG antibodies.

title: Combined spatial metabolomics and 4D-DIA quantitative proteomics approaches to explore the relationship between lung cancer and the heart.
biological_context: Lung cancer and its impact on the heart in mice
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', '4D-DIA quantitative proteomics', 'spatial mass spectrometry imaging']
main_goals: This study investigates the interplay between lung cancer and cardiovascular disease by examining changes in cardiac metabolites and protein expression using spatial metabolomics and 4D-DIA quantitative proteomics in nude mice with A549 lung cancer cells. The aim is to identify altered metabolites and proteins in the heart that are crucial for cardiovascular injury in this context.

title: Integrated spatial and single cell transcriptomics identifies PRKDC as a dual prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target in hepatocellular carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study integrates spatial and single-cell transcriptomics to identify PRKDC as a prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It reveals PRKDC's role in malignant cell subpopulations, its association with the tumor immune microenvironment, and its impact on immune cell infiltration. The research aims to provide new strategies for HCC treatment by targeting PRKDC.

title: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing reveals a preclinical model for the most common subtype of glioblastoma.
main_goals: This paper characterizes the tumor and TME in an immunocompetent mouse model of glioblastoma using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and Visium spatial transcriptomics. The study identifies key targets related to neural integration, immunoevasion, and immunosuppression, and compares the model to human GBM subtypes, particularly TME^Med GBM. The goal is to establish a preclinical model for a common GBM subtype.

title: Investigative needle core biopsies support multimodal deep-data generation in glioblastoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'metabolomics', 'proteomics', 'phosphoproteomics', 'T-cell clonotype analysis', 'MHC Class I immunopeptidomics', 'stereotactic needle core biopsies']
main_goals: This paper investigates the feasibility and utility of investigative needle core biopsies for monitoring treatment response in glioblastoma. It demonstrates the depth of data generation possible from routine biopsies through multi-omics analyses and examines spatial and genomic heterogeneity. The study also explores the use of biopsies for generating patient-derived xenograft models.

title: L-DOPA Induces Spatially Discrete Changes in Gene Expression in the Forebrain of Mice with a Progressive Loss of Dopaminergic Neurons.
biological_context: Parkinson's disease model with progressive loss of dopaminergic neurons
main_goals: To analyze the spatial profile of L-DOPA-induced gene expression in the forebrain of mice with a progressive loss of dopaminergic neurons. The study aimed to identify ubiquitous and region-specific effects of L-DOPA on gene expression, particularly in areas relevant to both motor and nonmotor symptoms of Parkinson's disease.

title: Deciphering of intra-tumoural heterogeneity and the interplay between metastasis-associated meta-program and myofibroblasts in gastric cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'patient-derived organoid models', 'clinical sample analyses']
main_goals: To decipher intra-tumoural heterogeneity in gastric cancer, understand the interplay between metastasis-associated meta-programs and myofibroblasts, and identify potential therapeutic targets. The study identified seven meta-programs (MP1-MP7) and elucidated the reciprocal interaction loop between MP7 GC cells and myofibroblasts (myCAFs), suggesting Taselisib and Lapatinib as potential inhibitors for MP7 GC cells.

title: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal the mechanism by which Xiaozhiling injection treats internal hemorrhoids.
main_goals: To investigate the molecular mechanism underlying the therapeutic effect of Xiaozhiling injection in treating internal hemorrhoids. The study uses single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to reveal changes in gene expression and subcellular structures in fibroblasts, identifying the activation of the Sphk1/S1P pathway as a key mechanism.

title: Tff2 marks gastric corpus progenitors that give rise to pyloric metaplasia/SPEM following injury.
biological_context: Gastric metaplasia and cancer, specifically focusing on pyloric metaplasia (SPEM) and its origins in the gastric corpus.
main_goals: To identify the progenitor cells responsible for pyloric metaplasia (SPEM) in the gastric corpus following injury and to investigate their role in gastric cancer development. The study identifies Tff2+ corpus isthmus cells as these progenitors and demonstrates their direct progression to dysplasia upon Kras mutation, bypassing metaplasia.

title: Candida albicans and colorectal cancer: A paradoxical role revealed through metabolite profiling and prognostic modeling.
data_modalities_used: ['liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry', 'in vitro cell culture', 'gene expression analysis']
main_goals: This study investigated the paradoxical role of Candida albicans in colorectal cancer (CRC) by examining its metabolic profile and developing a prognostic model. The researchers aimed to determine whether C. albicans promotes or suppresses tumor development and to understand the mechanistic basis of its interaction with CRC cells.

title: Integrating multi-omics and experimental techniques to decode ubiquitinated protein modifications in hepatocellular carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aims to systematically explore the role of ubiquitination in shaping the tumor microenvironment (TME) of HCC, focusing on its impact on cancer progression and immune modulation. It integrates multi-omics data and experimental techniques to investigate ubiquitinated protein modifications and identify potential biomarkers like UBE2C. The findings highlight ubiquitination's multifaceted roles in HCC, supporting tumor progression and influencing immune and stromal cell activity.

title: Transcriptomic characterization of transitioning cell types in the skin of Atlantic salmon.
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize the transcriptomic profiles of mesenchymal stromal cells in healthy Atlantic salmon skin and during wound healing. It investigated the transcriptional activity and potential differentiation pathways of these cells using single-nucleus sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The findings chart the transcriptomic activity of subclusters of differentiating stromal cells and reveal their spatial niches.

title: Spatial single-cell analysis identifies placental villi structuraland immune remodeling across gestation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses imaging mass cytometry to create a spatial map of placental villi and unravel cellular dynamics across gestation. It identifies structural and immune remodeling, comparing mid-gestation to term placentas. The findings offer insights into cellular composition changes and potential immune states relevant to pregnancy complications.

title: Neuroprotectin D1 and GPR37 protect against chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy and the transition from acute to chronic pain.
data_modalities_used: ['mouse dorsal root ganglia (DRG)', 'primary DRG cultures', 'hind paw skins', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'human DRG']
main_goals: This study investigates the roles of Neuroprotectin D1 (NPD1) and its receptor GPR37 in protecting against chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) and the transition from acute to chronic pain. The findings indicate that GPR37 deficiency drives pain chronicity in CIPN and suggest NPD1's potential in safeguarding sensory neurons through GPR37.

title: Spatial gene regulatory networks driving cell state transitions during human liver disease.
main_goals: To uncover the spatial transcriptional landscape driving human liver fibrosis using multi-modal spatial omics data. The study aims to define molecular signatures and cellular trajectories associated with disease progression in liver cirrhosis. The ultimate goal is to identify potential targets for therapeutics or early diagnostic markers.

title: The dynamic immune behavior of primary and metastatic ovarian carcinoma.
main_goals: This study used single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to identify molecular mechanisms leading to immunosuppression in high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma (HGSC). It found primary tumors had a more active immune microenvironment than omental tumors and identified dysfunctional T cells correlated with interferon pathway changes in epithelial cells, suggesting cross-communication is key to immune suppression in HGSC.

title: Adipose-derived leptin and complement factor D mediate osteoarthritis severity and pain.
main_goals: To investigate the role of fat-secreted factors, specifically leptin and complement factor D, in the development and severity of osteoarthritis. The study aims to elucidate the fat-cartilage cross-talk and its contribution to OA pathogenesis and pain using mouse models and spatial transcriptomics.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analysis reveals that an immune cell-related signature could predict clinical outcomes for microsatellite-stable colorectal cancer patients receiving immunotherapy.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer (CRC) with microsatellite stability (MSS) receiving immunotherapy
main_goals: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of combining anti-PD-1 antibody with VEGFRi compared to VEGFRi alone in MSS CRC patients. It also sought to identify immune cell-related biomarkers predicting clinical outcomes by analyzing the tumor microenvironment using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, leading to the development of the MCICRS signature.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal the pathogenesis of chronic granulomatous disease in a natural model.
main_goals: This study establishes a natural CGD model in Ncf2-/- mice, elucidates the mechanisms of granuloma formation involving specific neutrophil and macrophage populations, and identifies potential therapeutic interventions by testing pharmacological inhibition of MIF, Morrbid deletion, and Il1r1 knockout, all of which suppressed granuloma formation.

title: Long-chain sulfatide enrichment is an actionable metabolic vulnerability in intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm (IPMN)-associated pancreatic cancers.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMN)-associated pancreatic cancers (PDAC)
data_modalities_used: ['MALDI-MS', 'Visium spatial transcriptomics', 'CRISPR/cas9 technology', 'small interfering RNAs', 'pharmacological inhibition']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Metabolomic analysis', 'Functional studies', 'In vivo tumor growth suppression']
main_goals: This study aimed to uncover biochemical and molecular drivers underlying the malignant progression of IPMNs to PDAC. It identified long-chain sulfatide enrichment as an early metabolic alteration in precancerous pancreatic lesions that persists through invasive neoplasia, posing a potential actionable vulnerability in IPMN-derived PDAC.

title: Glial changes and gene expression in Alzheimer's disease from snRNA-Seq and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study quantifies cellular changes in the prefrontal cortex and temporal gyrus of Alzheimer's disease patients using integrated snRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics data. It assesses cellular proportions and gene expression, focusing on the roles of glial cells (astrocytes and microglia) in disease progression. The findings highlight astrocytic reactivity and microglial immune surveillance as key components of AD pathology.

title: Multi-omics analysis constructs a novel neuroendocrine prostate cancer classifier and classification system.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify a robust NEPC classifier and provide new perspectives for resolving intra-tumoral heterogeneity. They constructed a novel NEPC classifier and classification system using multi-omics analysis and machine learning. The NEP100 model and its derived classification system offer improved diagnostic and prognostic prediction for NEPC, enabling subtype-specific therapeutic strategies.

title: Resolving the spatial organization of fetal liver hematopoiesis by SeekSpace.
main_goals: This study utilizes the SeekSpace platform to map the spatial distribution of hematopoietic progenitor populations within the fetal liver. It provides a detailed spatial transcriptomic atlas and reveals that HSC/MPPs expansion is spatially associated with macrophages and endothelial cells, supported by specific signaling pathways.

title: Integrated multi-omics analysis reveals the functional and prognostic significance of lactylation-related gene PRDX1 in breast cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['Genome-Wide Association Study (GWAS) summary statistics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-cell Communication Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Prognostic Model Construction', 'Cox regression', 'LASSO regression']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the regulatory mechanisms and prognostic significance of the lactylation-related gene PRDX1 in breast cancer. It integrated multi-omics data to analyze PRDX1's expression, its role in cell-cell communication and spatial heterogeneity, and developed a prognostic model based on PRDX1-positive monocytes. The findings highlight PRDX1's involvement in tumor microenvironment regulation and immune escape.

title: Reversible downregulation of HLA class I in adenoid cystic carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['multiplex immunofluorescence', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'RNA in-situ hybridization', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: This paper investigates the immune landscape of Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma (ACC) using various omics techniques. It identifies low beta-2-microglobulin (B2M) and HLA class I expression as a key feature of ACC tumors, potentially explaining their 'cold' immune phenotype and poor response to immunotherapies. The study demonstrates that immune activators like interferon-gamma and STING agonists can restore HLA/B2M expression, suggesting a promising therapeutic avenue.

title: An organ-wide spatiotemporal transcriptomic and cellular atlas of the regenerating zebrafish heart.
main_goals: This paper generates a spatially-resolved molecular and cellular atlas of the regenerating zebrafish heart across eight stages using integrated Stereo-seq and scRNA-seq. It characterizes cardiomyocyte cell states, explores the role of tpm4a, and uncovers the activation of ifrd1 and atp6ap2 genes. The study reconstructs a 4D virtual regenerating heart as a resource for the scientific community.

title: Spatial transcriptomics study of Castleman disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The study utilized spatial transcriptomics to explore Castleman Disease (CD) pathogenesis. It aimed to identify lesion cells and understand the role of mesenchymal cells and cellular communication in disease progression across different histologic types.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals regionally altered gene expression that drives retinal degeneration.
biological_context: Retinal degeneration in mice induced by photo-oxidative stress
main_goals: To investigate spatio-temporal gene expression changes in the adult mouse retina in response to photo-oxidative stress, identify regionally distinct transcriptomes and key drivers of molecular changes, and provide evidence of angiogenic changes.

title: Spatial Analysis Identifies CD147 as a Novel Marker of High-Grade Childhood Posterior Fossa Ependymoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper investigates the spatial differences in the tumor microenvironment of childhood posterior fossa ependymoma (PFA-EPN) between World Health Organization grade 2 (G2) and grade 3 (G3). It identifies CD147 as a potential novel marker associated with higher tumor grade and explores its relationship with immune cells and tumor-proliferating cells, suggesting CD147+ microglia may play a role in promoting CD8+ T cell exclusion in aggressive PFA-EPN.

title: Identification of Specific Biomarkers for Anaplastic Thyroid Carcinoma Through Spatial Transcriptomic and Immunohistochemical Profiling.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify and validate key mRNA and protein markers associated with ATC progression and dedifferentiation. The study performed spatial transcriptomic analysis on an ATC case and validated findings using immunohistochemistry in a larger cohort. The goal was to identify molecular markers that can distinguish ATC from other thyroid tumors for improved diagnosis and treatment.

title: Identification of a cancer stem cell-like subpopulation that promotes HCC metastasis.
main_goals: The study identifies a metastasis-promoting cancer stem cell (CSC)-like subpopulation in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) that enhances invasiveness and suppresses anti-tumor immunity via the ICAM1 signaling pathway. It aims to provide a potential perspective for CSC-targeted therapies in HCC by modulating cellular interactions between CSC-like cells and immune cells.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Landscape of Brain Metastases from Triple-Negative Breast Cancer: Comparison of Primary Tumor and Brain Metastases Using Spatial Analysis.
biological_context: Brain metastases from triple-negative breast cancer
main_goals: This study uses spatial RNA sequencing to analyze primary triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) tumors and paired brain metastases (BM) to understand the tumor microenvironment. It aims to identify mechanisms underlying BM and potential therapeutic targets by comparing gene expression and immune cell infiltration across different spatial zones in primary tumors and BM.

title: Desmosome mutations impact the tumor microenvironment to promote melanoma proliferation.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of desmosome mutations in melanoma by analyzing their impact on the tumor microenvironment. It found that desmosome mutations in keratinocytes lead to reduced desmosome gene expression, which in turn promotes melanoma cell proliferation.

title: Integrating bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics to identify and functionally validate novel targets to enhance immunotherapy in NSCLC.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro experiments', 'syngeneic cancer mouse models']
main_goals: To identify and functionally validate novel targets to enhance immunotherapy in NSCLC by integrating bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics. The study developed a multigene signature (CCDI) based on programmed cell deaths (PCDs) and identified necroptosis genes (PTGES3, MYO6, CCT6A, and CTSH) as potential therapeutic targets.

title: Phase 2 trial of perioperative chemo-immunotherapy for gastro-esophageal adenocarcinoma: The role of M2 macrophage landscape in predicting response.
main_goals: This paper presents the clinical results of a phase 2 trial combining neoadjuvant chemotherapy and immunotherapy for locally advanced gastro-esophageal adenocarcinoma. It also investigates the role of M2 macrophage landscape in predicting treatment response by analyzing immune cell populations using multiplex immunohistochemistry and longitudinal single-cell transcriptomic profiling. The study aims to describe the treatment's effectiveness and reveal inflammatory milieu features associated with response to personalize future treatments.

title: Unveiling purine metabolism dysregulation orchestrated immunosuppression in advanced pancreatic cancer and concentrating on the central role of NT5E.
main_goals: This study investigates purine metabolism dysregulation in pancreatic cancer, focusing on its role in orchestrating immunosuppression. It utilizes single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to analyze purine metabolism features, identify key genes like NT5E, and assess their impact on immune phenotypes and immunotherapy response. The findings suggest that targeting purine metabolism or NT5E could be a therapeutic strategy for advanced pancreatic cancer.

title: Airway Spatial Transcriptomics in Smoking.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To create a framework for predicting altered cell-cell communication in smoker lungs using single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data. The study identified specific pathways, including the collagen pathway, altered in current smokers compared to never-smokers. The findings aim to provide molecular context for future research and therapeutic interventions.

title: The tectum transversum(TTR) maintains patency of the developing coronal suture.
main_goals: To investigate the developmental process of the tectum transversum (TTR) in a mouse model and characterize its role in maintaining coronal suture patency. The study used genetic ablation and spatial transcriptomics to demonstrate TTR's essential function and suggest its interaction with BMP signaling.

title: The essential role of connective-tissue cells during axolotl limb regeneration.
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the role of connective tissue (CT) cells in axolotl limb regeneration. It used spatial transcriptomics to reveal that CT cells constitute a significant portion of the blastema and that their ablation delays regeneration. The paper also provides a molecular profile of CT cells via an interactive web platform.

title: A Spatial Multi-Omic Framework Identifies Gliomas Permissive to TIL Expansion.
data_modalities_used: ['spectral flow cytometry', 'TCR sequencing', 'single-cell RNA-seq', 'Xenium in situ transcriptomics', 'CODEX spatial proteomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study identifies genomic and spatial determinants of TIL expandability in high-grade gliomas. It reveals associations between IL7R expression, perivascular immune clustering, and metabolic programs like ACSS3 with successful TIL expansion. The findings establish a genomics-enabled selection platform for adoptive T cell therapy, with prospective implementation in the GIANT clinical trial.

title: Mapping the spatial architecture of glioblastoma from core to edge delineates niche-specific tumor cell states and intercellular interactions.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To map the spatial architecture of the GBM ecosystem using spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify niche-specific tumor cell states, multicellular niches, and intercellular interactions, particularly focusing on immune evasion mechanisms.

title: Transmembrane Serine Protease TMPRSS11B promotes an acidified tumor microenvironment and immune suppression in lung squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: To determine the impact of TMPRSS11B activity on the host immune system and the tumor microenvironment in LUSC. The study evaluated the effect of Tmprss11b depletion in a mouse model and found that TMPRSS11B promotes an acidified and immunosuppressive TME, identifying it as a therapeutic target.

title: Spatial multi-omics profiling of breast cancer oligo-recurrent lung metastasis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aims to explore the spatial topology of lung-specific metastases from breast cancer and the underlying biological mechanisms using a comprehensive strategy with imaging mass cytometry, spatial proteomics, snRNA-seq, and multiplex immunofluorescence. It identifies distinct cellular compositions and spatial differences in the tumor microenvironment between primary breast cancer and lung metastases, with a focus on potential therapeutic targets like anti-angiogenic therapy and immunotherapy.

title: Spatially resolved multi-omics reveals the renal cortex-metabolic reprogramming of Shenhua Tablet for intervention on IgA nephropathy.
main_goals: To explore the molecular mechanism of Shenhua Tablet (SHT) intervention in IgA nephropathy (IgAN) using spatial multi-omics strategies. The study aimed to understand how SHT affects metabolites and gene expression in the renal cortex and identify its active components.

title: The role of transketolase in the immunotherapy and prognosis of hepatocellular carcinoma: a multi-omics approach.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq analysis', 'methylation profiling', 'single-cell analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'RT-qPCR', 'siRNA transfection', 'luciferase reporter assay', 'chromatin immunoprecipitation']
main_goals: This study aims to explore the role of transketolase (TKT) in the immunotherapy and prognosis of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) using a multi-omics approach. It investigates TKT expression, its association with tumor immunity, prognostic value, and regulation by STAT3.

title: Multidimensional transcriptomics based to illuminate the mechanisms of taurine metabolism in immune resistance of pancreatic cancer.
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the potential therapeutic relationship between taurine metabolism disorders and pancreatic cancer immunotherapy. The researchers identified novel tumor cell subsets and analyzed cell-cell communication to gain insights into immunotherapy strategies. They also identified LY6D as a potential therapeutic target by examining its role in regulating taurine metabolism within the immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment.

title: BDNF-GABA signaling in astrocytes: enhancing neural repair after SCI through MSC therapies.
biological_context: Spinal cord injury (SCI) recovery facilitated by Mesenchymal Stem Cells (MSCs) and induced pluripotent stem cell-derived MSCs (iPSC-MSCs)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Normalization', 'Denoising', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study aims to map the astrocyte landscape, explore signaling pathways, and uncover molecular mechanisms supporting SCI recovery using MSC therapies. It highlights the role of BDNF-regulated GABA signaling in astrocytes for neuronal regeneration and the potential of hUC-MSCs and iPS-derived MSCs in activating these pathways.

title: FOS-driven inflammatory CAFs promote colorectal cancer liver metastasis via the SFRP1-FGFR2-HIF1 axis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro models', 'in vivo models', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study identifies an inflammatory CAF subtype (CFD+ iCAFs) associated with poor clinical outcomes in colorectal cancer liver metastasis (CRLM). It reveals that FOS-mediated differentiation drives SFRP1 overexpression in these CAFs, which then promotes tumor stemness and epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) via the SFRP1-FGFR2-HIF1 axis, enhancing CRLM progression. SFRP1 is highlighted as a potential therapeutic target.

title: A spatial transcriptomics study of MES-like and mono/macro cells in gliomas.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Gene Expression Profiling', 'Survival Analysis', 'Cell Communication Mapping', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Drug Sensitivity Analysis', 'Immune Therapy Responsiveness Assessment']
main_goals: This study aimed to conduct a comprehensive multi-omics analysis of gliomas to identify potential therapeutic targets and prognostic markers. It investigated the roles of MES-like malignant and monocyte/macrophage cell subsets in tumor progression and immune modulation using spatial transcriptomics and other bioinformatics approaches. The research also explored drug sensitivity and immune therapy responsiveness in relation to these cell types.

title: THBS2-producing matrix CAFs promote colorectal cancer progression and link to poor prognosis via the CD47-MAPK axis.
main_goals: This study identifies matrix CAFs (mCAFs) as a critical subset in colorectal cancer (CRC) that secretes THBS2. It elucidates that THBS2 promotes CRC progression by binding to CD47 on tumor cells, activating the MAPK/ERK5 pathway. The findings highlight the THBS2-CD47 axis and CREB3L1 as potential therapeutic targets.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals the key role of MCAM<sup>+</sup> tip-like endothelial cells in osteosarcoma metastasis.
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the role of tip-like endothelial cells (ECs) in osteosarcoma metastasis. It used single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify MCAM+ tip-like ECs and confirmed their association with angiogenesis and metastasis in osteosarcoma.

title: Withaferin A maintained microbiome and metabolome features in A53T transgenic mice via multi-omics integrated analysis.
data_modalities_used: ['16S rRNA sequencing', 'fecal metabolomics', 'brain spatial metabolomics', 'immunohistochemistry', 'Western blot', 'ELISA', 'behavioral tests']
main_goals: This study investigated the neuroprotective mechanisms of Withaferin A (WFA) in a Parkinson's disease mouse model. It aimed to elucidate WFA's regulation of gut microbiota composition, metabolic pathways, and correlations with brain spatial metabolomics to understand its impact on the microbiota-gut-brain axis.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptomics reveals key gene regulation for grain yield and quality in wheat.
main_goals: This study performs a spatial transcriptomics study of wheat grain development to understand gene regulation impacting grain yield and quality. It classifies grain cell types, identifies marker genes, and reveals co-expression patterns that influence development. The research identifies specific genes, including TaABI3-B1, potentially regulating wheat grain development.

title: Identification of the disulfidptosis-related key gene CD2AP as a potential biomarker and new therapeutic target for LUAD patients by comprehensive multi-omics analysis.
main_goals: This study aimed to explore CD2AP's function in LUAD and its potential as a biomarker and therapeutic target through multi-omics analysis. The research identified CD2AP as a key gene related to disulfidptosis, overexpressed in LUAD, and linked to poorer prognosis. It also investigated CD2AP's association with the immune microenvironment, drug sensitivity, and spatial expression patterns.

title: A distinct subgroup with Schwann-like differentiation presents immune resistance and poor prognosis in plantar melanoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry (mIHC)', 'bulk RNA sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Single-Cell Analysis', 'Transcriptome', 'Gene Expression Regulation, Neoplastic']
main_goals: This study aimed to reveal the evolutionary characteristics and communication patterns of tumor subgroups in plantar melanoma using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and multiplex immunohistochemistry. It identified a distinct subgroup with Schwann-like differentiation, regulated by HMGA2, which is associated with immune resistance and poor prognosis. The study also elucidated the functional impact of HMGA2 inhibition on melanoma fate.

title: Unveiling the crucial role of CD8<sup>+</sup> T cell and endothelial cell interaction in rheumatoid arthritis through the integrated analysis of spatial transcriptomics and bulk/single-cell RNA-seq.
main_goals: This study aimed to unveil the crucial role of CD8+ T cell and endothelial cell interaction in rheumatoid arthritis. By integrating bulk RNA-seq, single-cell RNA-seq, and spatial transcriptomics, the researchers identified CD8+ T cell-endothelial cell interactions via chemokine signaling as critical drivers of RA progression. This interaction is proposed to promote leukocyte transendothelial migration and synovial immune infiltration.

title: The glycolytic characteristics of hepatocellular carcinoma and its interaction with the microenvironment: a comprehensive omics study.
main_goals: To identify glycolysis-related prognostic markers and immunological abnormalities in patients with Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) by integrating multi-omics data. The study aimed to find potential biomarkers and therapeutic targets for HCC diagnosis and treatment.

title: Spatial multi-omics analysis of metabolic heterogeneity in zebrafish exposed to microcystin-LR and its disinfection byproducts.
biological_context: Zebrafish exposed to microcystin-LR and its disinfection byproducts
main_goals: This study introduces spatial multi-omics to investigate the disruptions caused by ingestion of MC-LR and MCLR-DBPs in zebrafish. It characterizes overall metabolic changes and provides insight into the spatial distribution of metabolites and genes in targeted organs. The approach enhances understanding of the biological effects of these pollutants.

title: Spatial multi-omics analysis of tumor-stroma boundary cell features for predicting breast cancer progression and therapy response.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial transcriptional characteristics of the tumor boundary in breast cancer and its association with progression and therapy response. It identifies key cell-cell interactions, particularly between CAFs and M2-like TAMs, which are linked to immune exclusion and drug resistance. A novel malignant body signature (MBS) is developed for prognostic prediction and assessment of treatment response.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analyses revealing tumor microenvironment remodeling after neoadjuvant chemoimmunotherapy in non-small cell lung cancer.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) tumor microenvironment remodeling after neoadjuvant chemoimmunotherapy
main_goals: To examine the impact of chemoimmunotherapy in NSCLC patients by identifying key molecules, cell subpopulations, communication patterns, and spatial distributions that correlate with therapeutic sensitivity. The study aims to uncover dynamic spatial and transcriptional changes in the tumor microenvironment in response to combined therapy.

title: Multimodal sequencing of neoadjuvant nivolumab treatment in hepatocellular carcinoma reveals cellular and molecular immune landscape for drug response.
biological_context: Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) with neoadjuvant nivolumab treatment
data_modalities_used: ['spatially-resolved transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'bulk transcriptomics', 'TCR clonotype analyses', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'TCR clonotype analyses', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular and molecular immune landscape of hepatocellular carcinoma patients treated with neoadjuvant nivolumab. It aims to identify mechanistic determinants of therapeutic response and differentiate responders from non-responders by integrating multimodal sequencing data and exploring spatiotemporal dynamics.

title: Illustrating the distribution and metabolic regulatory effects of nuciferine by mass spectrometry imaging and spatial metabolomics.
biological_context: Nervous system disorders and effects of nuciferine
main_goals: To map the distribution of nuciferine and its key metabolites in mouse brain microregions and peripheral organs using AFADESI-MSI. The study aimed to investigate the neuropharmacological effects of nuciferine by identifying metabolic alterations, specifically in purine metabolism, and their correlation with enzyme localization.

title: Single-Cell Profiling and Proteomics-Based Insights Into mTORC1-Mediated Angio+TAMs Polarization in Recurrent IDH-Mutant Gliomas.
main_goals: This study investigates the roles of the mTORC1 pathway and tumor-associated macrophages in the recurrence and progression of IDH-mutant gliomas. It utilizes proteomic, phosphoproteomic, and multi-dimensional transcriptomic approaches, including single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The findings suggest that mTORC1 activation and Angio-TAMs are key contributors to glioma recurrence and progression.

title: Single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal the evolution of glucose metabolism in hepatocellular carcinoma and identify G6PD as a potential therapeutic target.
main_goals: This study aims to explore the temporal-spatial evolution of glucose metabolism in HCC using single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies G6PD as a potential therapeutic target by examining its role in HCC cell proliferation, migration, and invasion, and its association with glutathione metabolism and ROS production.

title: Spatial transcriptomics delineates potential differences in intestinal phenotypes of cardiac and classical necrotizing enterocolitis.
biological_context: Necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC) in neonatal infants, comparing cardiac and classical subtypes.
main_goals: To compare ileal spatial transcriptomes of patients with cardiac and classical necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC). The study aimed to identify differences in cell types, metabolism, and immune cell activation between NEC subtypes, differentiating their underlying pathological mechanisms.

title: Single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics identify brain landscape of gene regulatory networks associated with behavioral maturation in honeybees.
biological_context: Behavioral maturation in honeybees (nursing to foraging)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To identify the gene regulatory networks (GRNs) associated with behavioral maturation in honeybees using single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to uncover cell-type and spatial heterogeneity in GRN organization and understand the role of specific GRNs in coordinating brain cell activity during behavioral transitions.

title: Integrated single-cell and spatial analysis identifies context-dependent myeloid-T cell interactions in head and neck cancer immune checkpoint blockade response.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) response
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Ligand-Receptor Interactions']
main_goals: To systematically evaluate cell interactions between immune cell types within the tumor microenvironment of HNSCC patients responding to ICB. The study integrated single-cell and spatial omics data to identify context-dependent myeloid-T cell interactions and potential biomarkers for ICB response. It aims to provide a rich data resource of cell-cell ligand-receptor interactions for the research community.

title: Comparative spatial transcriptomics reveals root dryland adaptation mechanism in rice and HMGB1 as a key regulator.
biological_context: Rice root adaptation to dryland conditions
main_goals: This study investigates the molecular and developmental mechanisms underlying root adaptation to dryland conditions in upland rice compared to irrigated rice. It utilizes spatial transcriptomics to identify key genes and developmental phenotypes, highlighting HMGB1 as a crucial regulator for root elongation and thickening, thereby enhancing drought resistance.

title: From Invaginating Site to Deep Lesion: Spatial Transcriptomics Unravels Ectopic Endometrial Penetration Features in Adenomyosis.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'histological techniques']
main_goals: This study maps the spatial transcriptional landscape of adenomyosis from the endometrial invaginating site to ectopic lesions. It investigates molecular mechanisms of endometrial invasion and fibrosis, identifying key cell types and their roles. The work aims to provide a deeper understanding of adenomyosis pathogenesis and introduces a novel transcriptomics web resource.

title: Conformation-sensitive targeting of CD18 depletes M2-like tumor-associated macrophages resulting in inhibition of solid tumor progression.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer (CRC), non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC)
data_modalities_used: ['LC-MS/MS', 'surface plasmon resonance', 'peptide-protein interaction 3D modeling', 'Quantibrite PE beads in PBMCs', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: To elucidate the anticancer efficacy of TB511 by identifying new target proteins that preferentially bind to M2-TAMs and clarifying the apoptosis-inducing mechanism in these cells. The study investigates activated CD18 as a target protein for cancer therapy and TB511 as a potential therapeutic agent.

title: Multi-omics analysis identifies DLX4 as a novel biomarker for diagnosis, prognosis, and immune infiltration: from pan-cancer to renal cancer.
biological_context: Pan-cancer, specifically Kidney Renal Clear Cell Carcinoma (KIRC)
main_goals: To investigate the molecular mechanisms of DLX4 in pan-cancer, with a focus on its role in renal cancer (KIRC). The study aims to identify DLX4 as a novel biomarker for diagnosis, prognosis, and immune infiltration, and explores its potential as a therapeutic target.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of the aging mouse brain reveals origins of inflammation in the white matter.
main_goals: To systematically understand age-induced molecular changes in the mouse brain using spatial transcriptomics, identifying inflammation origins in white matter fiber tracts, with pronounced effects in females. The study confirmed findings with immunofluorescence and MRI, linking previous disjointed observations.

title: RIPK2 promotes colorectal cancer metastasis by protecting YAP degradation from ITCH-mediated ubiquitination.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of Receptor-Interacting Protein Kinase 2 (RIPK2) in promoting colorectal cancer (CRC) metastasis. It identifies RIPK2 as a risk factor that enhances tumor cell migration and invasion by protecting YAP from degradation. The findings suggest RIPK2 is a promising therapeutic target for CRC.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals tryptophan metabolism restricting maturation of intratumoral tertiary lymphoid structures.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to investigate the factors restricting the maturation of intratumoral tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs) in hepatocellular carcinoma. It identifies a tryptophan-enriched metabolic microenvironment shaped by malignant cells as a key factor. The findings suggest that inhibiting tryptophan metabolism can promote TLS maturation and enhance anti-tumor responses.

title: Spatial proteomics of ER tubules reveals CLMN, an ER-actin tether at focal adhesions that promotes cell migration.
biological_context: Human cells, Endoplasmic Reticulum, Focal Adhesions, Cell Migration
main_goals: The study maps the proteomic landscape of the human ER network using proximity labeling and CRISPR technologies. It identifies CLMN as an ER-actin tether at focal adhesions, demonstrating its role in cell migration by affecting adhesion disassembly and actin dynamics. The research also suggests CLMN influences calcium signaling at ER-actin interfaces.

title: Integrated Metabolomics and Spatial Transcriptomics of Cystic Pancreatic Cancer Precursors Reveals Dysregulated Polyamine Metabolism as a Biomarker of Progression.
biological_context: Cystic pancreatic cancer precursors (Intraductal Papillary Mucinous Neoplasms - IPMNs)
data_modalities_used: ['cystic fluid metabolomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'tissue metabolomics', 'cell line metabolomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Metabolomics analysis', 'Spatial transcriptomics analysis', 'Single-cell transcriptomics analysis', 'Biomarker discovery', 'Statistical analysis of omics data', 'Correlation analysis between omics and clinical data']
main_goals: To identify oncometabolites in cystic pancreatic cancer precursors (IPMNs) using integrated metabolomics and spatial transcriptomics, aiming to find biomarkers that indicate the risk of malignancy. The study specifically investigates the role of polyamine metabolism and its potential as a clinical management aid for IPMNs.

title: Comprehensive sequencing of the lung neuroimmune landscape in response to asthmatic induction.
data_modalities_used: ['Standard RNA sequencing', 'single nucleus-RNA sequencing', 'spatial RNA sequencing', 'snRNA-seq']
main_goals: To investigate how asthmatic induction alters the pulmonary neuroimmune transcriptome in vagal ganglia and lungs. The study aimed to identify gene expression changes, their clustering in specific neuron types, and their spatial distribution.

title: Unraveling the spatial and signaling dynamics and splicing kinetics of immune infiltration in osteoarthritis synovium.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF)', 'Computational drug prediction']
main_goals: This study aims to unravel the spatial and signaling dynamics and splicing kinetics of immune infiltration in osteoarthritis (OA) synovium. It provides a comprehensive spatial and transcriptional atlas of OA synovium, identifying key genes and signaling networks driving immune cell infiltration and proposing potential therapeutic targets.

title: Morphogenic, molecular and cellular adaptations for unidirectional airflow in the chicken lung.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Cell Type Identification']
main_goals: The study delineates the morphogenic, molecular, and cellular features of the chicken lung that facilitate unidirectional airflow. It identifies a chicken-specific alveolar cell type (luminal cells) and describes the spatial organization of cell types and vascularization. The research aims to explore avian lung evolution and provide a foundation for functional genetic analysis.

title: Correlative analysis of metallomic gene expression and metal ion content within the mouse hippocampus.
biological_context: Mouse hippocampus metallomics and gene expression
main_goals: This study aimed to reveal a molecular basis for metallomic heterogeneity across key subregions of the hippocampus by integrating elemental mapping with spatial transcriptomics. The results demonstrate associations between metal enrichment and regional expression of transcripts related to metal transport, storage, and regulation. It also provides a template for integrating transcriptomics into multimodal workflows for neurometallome investigations.

title: Spatial genomics reveals cholesterol metabolism as a key factor in colorectal cancer immunotherapy resistance.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify early treatment features associated with immunotherapy (ICI) outcome in colorectal cancer by leveraging the MC38 syngeneic tumor model. Using spatial transcriptomics, the researchers identified specific tumor and stroma cell subsets and revealed that increased tumor cell cholesterol regulation, synthesis, and transport were associated with a lack of ICI response, while inflammation and T cell infiltration correlated with response.

title: Spatial analysis of IPMNs defines a paradoxical KRT17-positive, low-grade epithelial population harboring malignant features.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMNs) and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'Nanostring GeoMx', 'single cell RNA sequencing', 'immunofluorescence', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates transcriptional changes during IPMN progression using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. It identifies a subpopulation of low-grade IPMN epithelial cells expressing malignant features, marked by KRT17, and validates this finding using immunofluorescence. The goal is to identify a high-risk gene signature for better clinical management of IPMNs.

title: A tissue-scale strategy for sensing threats in barrier organs.
main_goals: Discovered a tiered threat-sensing strategy at the tissue scale in the lung during influenza infection. This strategy involves spatially graded PRR expression, leading to cell-type-specific threat-sensing probabilities. The findings suggest a mechanism to tolerate threats within epithelia while enabling potent immune responses as threats invade deeper.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Identifies Immune-Stromal Niches Associated with Cancer in Adult Dermatomyositis.
biological_context: Adult-onset dermatomyositis and cutaneous lupus erythematosus
main_goals: This study provides the first comprehensive spatial mapping of immune and stromal cells in adult-onset dermatomyositis. It reveals unique immune and stromal niches associated with DM subtypes, differentiating cancer-associated from non-cancer-associated DM skin lesions. The findings highlight specific cellular infiltrates, cytokine profiles (IL1B, CXCL10, IFN-β), and stromal remodeling patterns in DM.

title: Peripartum dapagliflozin improves late-life maternal cardiovascular outcomes in a murine model of superimposed preeclampsia.
biological_context: Superimposed preeclampsia in a murine model
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'circulating plasma protein markers', 'urine studies', 'ultrasounds', 'tissue histopathology', 'serial echocardiography']
main_goals: To test the short- and long-term obstetrical and cardiovascular effects of dapagliflozin, an SGLT2 inhibitor, in a murine model of superimposed preeclampsia. The study also aimed to identify molecular effects of SGLT2 inhibition in cardiovascular tissues during and after pregnancy. The findings suggest dapagliflozin treatment improved physiological cardiovascular parameters during gestation and cardiac function later in life.

title: Spatial proteomics of Onchocerca volvulus with pleomorphic neoplasms shows local and systemic dysregulation of protein expression.
biological_context: Onchocerca volvulus, a parasitic nematode causing river blindness, with a focus on pleomorphic neoplasms (PN) in female worms, particularly after ivermectin treatment.
main_goals: To analyze the spatial proteome of Onchocerca volvulus female worms with pleomorphic neoplasms (PN) and identify proteins associated with PN development. The study aimed to understand how PN affects protein expression in different tissues and to investigate potential links between protein dysregulation and worm mortality following ivermectin treatment.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of progression gene signature and tumor microenvironment leading to progression in mycosis fungoides.
biological_context: Mycosis fungoides (MF) progression from patch to plaque and tumor stages
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'immunohistochemistry', 'CD3 morphology markers', 'CD4 morphology markers', 'CD30 morphology markers']
main_goals: This study investigated transcriptomic changes and the tumor microenvironment associated with Mycosis Fungoides (MF) progression. It identified genes linked to progression and found that M2 macrophages and cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in the tumor microenvironment may contribute to progression in early-stage MF.

title: Multi-omic landscape of human gliomas from diagnosis to treatment and recurrence.
biological_context: Human gliomas from diagnosis to treatment and recurrence
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study applies spatial proteomics, transcriptomics, and glycomics to human gliomas to uncover therapeutic escape mechanisms and tumor microenvironment evolution. It identifies targetable antigens, characterizes recurrence drivers in IDH-mutant gliomas, and utilizes multi-omic integration for grade classification and survival prediction.

title: Inonotus obliquus (chaga) ameliorates folic acid-induced renal fibrosis in mice: the crosstalk analysis among PT cells, macrophages and T cells based on single-cell sequencing.
biological_context: Folic acid-induced renal fibrosis in mice
data_modalities_used: ['UPLC-MS', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'H&E staining', 'Masson trichrome staining']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Differential Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the therapeutic effects of Inonotus obliquus (Chaga) on folic acid-induced renal fibrosis in mice. It uses single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to analyze cellular responses and identify potential mechanisms of action. The findings suggest Chaga may be a promising candidate for renal fibrosis treatment.

title: SERPINA3 predicts long-term neurological outcomes and mortality in patients with intracerebral hemorrhage.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify reliable biomarkers for predicting long-term neurological outcomes and mortality in patients with intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH). It utilized spatial transcriptomics on autopsy brain tissues and plasma analysis to identify SERPINA3 as a potential prognostic biomarker.

title: A spatially resolved transcriptome landscape during thyroid cancer progression.
