main_goals: This study aimed to map the tumor microenvironment (TME) architecture across different stages of thyroid cancer progression using integrated spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. It identified distinct thyrocyte subpopulations and stage-specific cell-cell interactions, providing insights into cancer progression and potential diagnostic/therapeutic targets.

title: DNA methylation memory of pancreatic acinar-ductal metaplasia transition state altering Kras-downstream PI3K and Rho GTPase signaling in the absence of Kras mutation.
biological_context: Pancreatic acinar-to-ductal metaplasia (ADM) transition state and pancreatic cancer
data_modalities_used: ['DNA methylome profiling', 'transcriptome profiling', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study investigates the epigenetic memory of the pancreatic acinar-to-ductal metaplasia (ADM) transition state, even in the absence of oncogenic mutations. It identifies differential DNA methylation at Kras-downstream PI3K and Rho GTPase pathway genes during ADM, which persists after gene expression normalization. The findings link epigenetic memory to cancer-related cell plasticity in the pancreas.

title: eIF3f promotes tumour malignancy by remodelling fatty acid biosynthesis in hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['organoid models', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'Metabolomics', 'proteomics', 'metabolic flux analysis', 'transmission electron microscopy', 'multi-species models', 'time-of-flight mass cytometry', 'multiplexed immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of eIF3f in promoting tumor malignancy in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) by remodeling fatty acid biosynthesis. The research identified eIF3f as a key regulator that stabilizes ACSL4, thereby increasing fatty acid biosynthesis and promoting HCC malignancy. Targeting the eIF3f-ACSL4-fatty acid biosynthesis axis, potentially in combination with anti-PD-1 therapy, showed promise for decelerating HCC progression.

title: Conserved spatial subtypes and cellular neighborhoods of cancer-associated fibroblasts revealed by single-cell spatial multi-omics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study discovers and characterizes four distinct spatial CAF subtypes conserved across cancer types and independent of spatial omics platforms. These subtypes exhibit unique spatial organization, neighboring cell compositions, interaction networks, and transcriptomic profiles, influencing tumor microenvironment characteristics and patient survival.

title: Spatial metabolomics to profile metabolic reprogramming of liver in Schistosoma japonicum-infected mice.
main_goals: This study aims to profile the metabolic reprogramming of the liver in mice infected with Schistosoma japonicum using spatial metabolomics. The research intends to provide insights into the spatial distribution of metabolites and their relationship with the disease progression.

title: Multi-Omics Analysis of the Anoikis Gene CASP8 in Prostate Cancer and Biochemical Recurrence (BCR).
main_goals: This paper explores the role of the Anoikis gene CASP8 in prostate cancer and biochemical recurrence (BCR). It utilizes single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to analyze gene expression patterns and identifies CASP8 as a potential biomarker for prostate cancer, developing a predictive model for BCR.

title: Spatial relationships and interactions of immune cell niches are linked to the pathologic response of muscle-invasive bladder cancer to neoadjuvant therapy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Tertiary Lymphoid Structure analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to characterize the spatial features of distinct cell-type niches within the tumor microenvironment (TME) of patients with varying responses to neoadjuvant therapy. It identifies CCL19/CCL21 as key drivers of tertiary lymphoid structure (TLS) formation in MIBC and highlights the role of TLS and tumor heterogeneity in therapeutic response.

title: The transcription factor LHX2 mediates and enhances oncogenic BMP signaling in medulloblastoma.
biological_context: Medulloblastoma, a common childhood brain malignancy, with a focus on cerebellar development.
data_modalities_used: ['mouse xenografts', 'immunohistochemical analysis', 'cell-based assays', 'orthotopic xenografts', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'transcriptomic analysis', 'in-mouse orthotopic transplantation']
main_goals: This paper explores the mechanisms of Bone Morphogenetic Protein (BMP) signaling in medulloblastoma. It identifies the transcription factor LHX2 as being transcriptionally induced by BMP signaling and, in turn, enhancing BMP signaling by upregulating the BMP type I receptor (ACVR1). The study demonstrates that LHX2 gain-of-function enriches stemness and chemoresistance in medulloblastoma cells and contributes to tumor propagation and metastasis.

title: Ginsenoside Rb1 and berberine synergistically protect against type 2 diabetes mellitus via GDF15/HAMP pathway throughout the liver lobules: Insights from spatial transcriptomics analysis.
biological_context: Type 2 diabetes mellitus in a mouse model
main_goals: This study investigates the synergistic protective effects of Ginsenoside Rb1 (Rb1) and berberine (BBR) against type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) using a mouse model. It aims to elucidate the underlying mechanisms, particularly focusing on liver metabolism modulation and the GDF15/HAMP pathway, using spatial transcriptomics to understand zone-specific effects.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analysis reveals tumor cell heterogeneity and underlying molecular program in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: This study characterizes tumor cell heterogeneity in colorectal cancer (CRC) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analysis. It identifies malignant cell expression programs (MCEPs), constructs crosstalk networks with immune/stromal cells, and develops a prognostic model for personalized risk prediction. The research also identifies potential therapeutic targets, such as TIMP1.

title: Precision Oncology Program (POP), an observational study using real-world data and imaging mass cytometry to explore decision support for the Molecular Tumor Board: study protocol.
main_goals: To evaluate the feasibility and utility of integrating real-world data (RWD) and imaging mass cytometry (IMC) to inform personalised treatment recommendations for cancer patients. The study assesses whether clinicogenomic data from a matched cohort can guide treatment decisions and explores the impact of spatial proteomics on these decisions. The ultimate goal is to support profiling-driven decision-making for Molecular Tumor Boards.

title: Identification and characterization of human retinal stem cells capable of retinal regeneration.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell multiomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'human retinal organoids', 'rd10 mouse model of retinitis pigmentosa']
main_goals: This paper identifies and characterizes human neural retinal stem-like cells (hNRSCs) from human fetal retinas and retinal organoids. It demonstrates their self-renewal and differentiation potential and their ability to regenerate all retinal cell types. Furthermore, transplanted hNRSCs showed promise in alleviating retinal degeneration and improving visual function in a mouse model.

title: Spatiotemporal profiling of adhesion G protein-coupled receptors in developing mouse and human pancreas reveals a role for GPR56 in islet development.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Expression Regulation, Developmental', 'Clustering']
main_goals: To systematically characterize the expression of adhesion G protein-coupled receptors (aGPCRs) and their ligands in developing mouse and human pancreas. The study investigates the role of GPR56 in islet development by analyzing Gpr56 null mice.

title: Multi-Omics Profiling Reveals Glycerolipid Metabolism-Associated Molecular Subtypes and Identifies ALDH2 as a Prognostic Biomarker in Pancreatic Cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['lipidomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomic analysis', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'PCR', 'immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: This study characterizes glycerolipid metabolism (GLM) in pancreatic cancer (PC) using multi-omics technologies. It identifies GLM-associated molecular subtypes with distinct prognostic, biofunctional, immune microenvironmental, and drug sensitivity profiles. ALDH2 is identified as a novel prognostic biomarker for PC.

title: SOX2 commands LIM homeobox transcription factors in choroid plexus development and tumorigenesis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This work examined the role of the transcription factor SOX2 in choroid plexus (CP) development and tumorigenesis. It investigated SOX2's function in the molecular signature of tumor cells using multi-omics approaches and identified SOX2-LMX1 signaling as critical for maintaining progenitor identity in CP development and tumor formation.

title: Spatial lipidomics reveals sphingolipid metabolism as anti-fibrotic target in the liver.
biological_context: Steatotic liver disease (SLD) and liver fibrosis
data_modalities_used: ['bulk lipidomics', 'spatial lipidomics', 'transcriptomics', 'imaging mass cytometry', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)']
main_goals: This study uses a spatial multi-omics approach to investigate the mechanisms of liver fibrosis in steatotic liver disease. It identifies sphingolipid metabolism as a key dysregulated pathway and suggests its potential as an anti-fibrotic therapeutic target.

title: Single-cell and spatial analyses reveal the effect of VSIG4<sup>+</sup>S100A10<sup>+</sup>TAMs on the immunosuppression of glioblastoma and anti-PD-1 immunotherapy.
biological_context: Glioblastoma (GBM) tumor immune microenvironment (TIME) and response to anti-PD-1 immunotherapy.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-seq', 'single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'flow cytometry', 'multiplex immunofluorescence (mIF)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aims to explore the heterogeneity of tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) in glioblastoma (GBM) and their impact on tumor immunity and anti-PD-1 immunotherapy response. It identifies VSIG4+S100A10+TAMs as key players in immunosuppression and a prognostic indicator for GBM patients.

title: The Novel Dual GIP and GLP-1 Receptor Agonist Tirzepatide Attenuates Colon Cancer Development by Regulating Glucose Metabolism.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', 'in vitro cell proliferation assays', 'in vivo tumor regression models', 'patient-derived xenograft (PDX) mouse model']
main_goals: To investigate the role of tirzepatide (TZP), a GIP and GLP-1 receptor agonist, in attenuating colon cancer development by regulating glucose metabolism. The study demonstrates TZP's ability to inhibit cancer cell proliferation, promote apoptosis, and induce tumor regression in mice by downregulating glycolysis and the TCA cycle, mediated by HIF-1α and PFKFB3 inhibition.

title: TM4SF1 overexpression in tumor-associated endothelial cells promotes microvascular invasion in hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of tumor-associated endothelial cells (TECs) in microvascular invasion (MVI) in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It identifies TEC subpopulations and key genes, such as TM4SF1, associated with MVI by analyzing single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data. The findings suggest that TM4SF1 overexpression in TECs promotes MVI via epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT).

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals a Stereoscopic Response of Rice Leaf Cells to Magnaporthe oryzae Infection.
biological_context: Rice leaf response to Magnaporthe oryzae infection
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to reveal a stereoscopic immune response of rice leaf cells to Magnaporthe oryzae infection. It constructs a rice leaf atlas, identifies immune receptor expression in vascular tissues, and shows diterpene phytoalexin biosynthesis in procambium cells. The research highlights cell-specific and multi-dimensional immune responses, including longitudinal immunity towards the leaf tip.

title: Proximity proteomics reveals unique and shared pathological features between multiple system atrophy and Parkinson's disease.
biological_context: Synucleinopathies (Parkinson's disease, multiple system atrophy, dementia with Lewy bodies)
main_goals: To use in-situ proximity labeling to compare aggregated and total alpha-synuclein interactomes between Multiple System Atrophy (MSA) and Parkinson's Disease/Dementia with Lewy Bodies (PD/DLB). The study aims to reveal unique and shared pathological features and understand divergent and convergent alpha-synuclein-aggregate interactions.

title: Integrated multi-omics profiling characterizes the crucial role of human dental epithelium during tooth development.
main_goals: This paper aims to characterize human fetal tooth development by integrating single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and secretome analysis. It seeks to identify uncharacterized epithelial subpopulations, map spatiotemporal changes, and elucidate epithelial-mesenchymal interactions. The ultimate goal is to highlight the crucial role of dental epithelium in orchestrating tooth morphogenesis.

title: B cells and energy metabolism in HER2-positive DCIS: insights into breast cancer progression from spatial-omics analyses.
biological_context: HER2-positive DCIS and invasive breast tumors
main_goals: This study investigates the associations between gene expression profiles in cancer cells and the immune microenvironment of HER2-positive DCIS and invasive breast tumors using spatial transcriptomics. It aims to understand the role of B cells and energy metabolism in breast cancer progression from DCIS to invasive cancer.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptome atlas of developing mouse lung.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To generate a spatiotemporal transcriptome atlas of developing mouse lung, from branching morphogenesis to alveologenesis. The study identifies spatial domains, maps lineage trajectories, explores transcription factor regulatory networks, and characterizes alveolar niche heterogeneity. The goal is to provide a comprehensive molecular atlas to advance understanding of human lung development and regeneration.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analyses reveal transcriptional cell lineage heterogeneity in extracranial arteriovenous malformation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To generate an overview of the molecular information within eAVMs at the single-cell level by performing single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified different cell states, uncovered specific cell populations (MAFB+ nidus ECs), characterized mesenchymal activation in ECs, and identified transcriptional variation within perivascular cells. It also cataloged dysregulated cell-to-cell interactions associated with eAVMs.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Differential Inflammatory Pathways in Discoid Lupus Erythematosus and Lichen Planus.
biological_context: Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus and Lichen Planus
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to investigate differential inflammatory pathways in discoid lupus erythematosus and lichen planus. The research aims to provide insights into the molecular mechanisms underlying these skin conditions by analyzing the spatial distribution of gene expression.

title: Toward molecular phenotyping of temporal lobe epilepsy by spatial omics.
biological_context: temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) patient subtypes (PET+ vs PET-)
data_modalities_used: ['18F-fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography (PET)', 'mass spectrometry imaging (MSI)', 'proteomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: To identify differential molecular mechanisms in temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) patient subtypes (PET+ vs PET-) using a spatial omics approach. The study aimed to elucidate the molecular basis for metabolic differences observed in TLE patients by analyzing lipid and protein profiles in neocortical and hippocampal biopsies.

title: Metabolic stress and age drive inflammation and cognitive decline in mice and humans.
biological_context: Metabolic stress, inflammation, and cognitive decline, including Alzheimer's disease
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'high-fat diet model', 'post mortem tissue', 'hippocampal spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study investigates the link between metabolic stressors, inflammation, and cognitive decline in mice and humans. It uses a high-fat diet model in mice and examines post-mortem human brain tissue to identify gene expression changes and the role of microglia, particularly focusing on secreted phosphoprotein 1 (SPP1), in metabolically driven cognitive impairment.

title: Heterozygous GAA knockout is nonconsequential on metabolism and the spatial liver transcriptome in high-fat diet-induced obese and prediabetic mice.
biological_context: High-fat diet-induced obesity and prediabetes in mice
main_goals: This study investigated the impact of heterozygous GAA knockout on liver metabolism and metabolic health in mice fed a high-fat diet. It also explored alterations in the liver transcriptome of these mice using spatial transcriptomics. The findings indicate that heterozygous GAA knockout is nonconsequential on metabolism and metabolic health in this model.

title: Spatial immune remodeling of the liver metastases: discovering the path to antimetastatic therapy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper aims to analyze liver metastases from a spatial immune perspective. It highlights the potential of spatial omics technologies to understand immune escape mechanisms and the molecular basis of immune remodeling. The goal is to identify specific spatial immune characteristics for accurate clinical predictions and to develop strategies targeting spatial immune remodeling for antimetastatic therapy.

title: Immune-featured stromal niches associate with response to neoadjuvant immunotherapy in oral squamous cell carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of tumor stromal cells in the tumor microenvironment of oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) and their association with response to neoadjuvant immunotherapy. It identifies specific stromal cell populations and their spatial distribution that correlate with treatment outcomes in patients receiving anti-PD-1 monotherapy or combination immunochemotherapy.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal a tumor-associated macrophage subpopulation that mediates prostate cancer progression and metastasis.
main_goals: This study aimed to reveal the dynamics of tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) in prostate cancer using integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identified a specific SPP1+/TREM2+ TAM subpopulation enriched in metastatic tumors and associated with poor survival, suggesting SPP1+ TAMs as a therapeutic target to enhance immune checkpoint inhibition.

title: Multi-omics approach reveals the impact of prognosis model-related genes on the tumor microenvironment in medulloblastoma.
data_modalities_used: ['RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-cell ATAC sequencing', 'spatial RNA analyses']
main_goals: To develop a TME-associated risk score (TMErisk) model using RNA sequencing data to predict patient outcomes and elucidate biological mechanisms in medulloblastoma. The study validated findings using single-cell and spatial analyses, identifying key genes and their expression dynamics across cell types and tumor regions.

title: CD147 Mediates the Metabolic Reprogramming of Cancer Associated Fibroblasts Induced by EVs Released by Differentiating Cancer Stem Cells.
main_goals: This study demonstrates that CD147 packaged in extracellular vesicles (sEVs-CD147) activates cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in colorectal cancer. It shows that this activation reprograms CAF metabolism, leading to increased aerobic glycolysis, lactate release, and pro-tumorigenic cytokine and VEGF production. The findings indicate that sEV-packaged CD147 promotes tumor progression by modifying stroma metabolism.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal the heterogeneity and intercellular communication of cancer-associated fibroblasts in gastric cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study characterizes CAF subtypes and explores intercellular communication between CAFs and malignant epithelial cells in gastric cancer using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies CAF subpopulations and their interactions, potentially revealing therapeutic targets.

title: Downregulated STAT3 and STAT5B are prognostic biomarkers for colorectal cancer and are associated with immune infiltration.
data_modalities_used: ['TCGA data', 'GTEx database', 'clinical samples', 'single cell RNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Immune infiltration analysis']
main_goals: This study assesses the expression, prognostic value, and immune function of the STAT family in colorectal cancer. It found that downregulated STAT3 and STAT5B are significantly associated with better patient outcomes and immune infiltration. The study proposes STAT3 and STAT5B as potential prognostic biomarkers and immunotherapy targets for colorectal cancer.

title: Reactivation of CTLA4-expressing T cells accelerates resolution of lung fibrosis in a humanized mouse model.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of CTLA4-expressing T cells in resolving lung fibrosis. It demonstrates that targeting CTLA4 with ipilimumab accelerates lung regeneration and reduces fibrosis in a mouse model. The findings suggest that immune-mediated clearance of senescent cells by T cells is crucial for tissue repair.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in the adult Drosophila brain and body.
main_goals: This paper applies spatial transcriptomics using a selected gene panel to map unknown cell clusters from the Fly Cell Atlas to their spatial locations in the adult Drosophila brain. It also investigates principles of mRNA localization and transcriptional diversity in muscle cells and presents computational tools for integrating spatial transcriptomics and single-cell datasets.

title: Determinants of Response to Sequential Pembrolizumab with Trastuzumab plus Platinum/5-FU in HER2-Positive Gastric Cancer: A Phase II Chemoimmunotherapy Trial.
data_modalities_used: ['whole-exome sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'T-cell receptor sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'whole-exome sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'T-cell receptor sequencing']
main_goals: This study assessed the contributions of components in sequential pembrolizumab with trastuzumab plus platinum/5-FU in HER2-positive gastric cancer. It aimed to understand the biology of intratumoral heterogeneity and the impact of tumor and immune cell features on clinical outcomes by analyzing various omics data from patient biopsies.

title: The Role of PLIN3 in Prognosis and Tumor-Associated Macrophage Infiltration: A Pan-Cancer Analysis.
data_modalities_used: ['mRNA expression', 'protein expression', 'bulk transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multicolor fluorescence staining']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of PLIN3 in cancer prognosis and tumor-associated macrophage infiltration across multiple cancer types. It analyzes PLIN3 expression, its correlation with M2 macrophages, and its functional impact in LUAD cells, aiming to identify PLIN3 as a prognostic biomarker and potential immunotherapeutic target.

title: Integration of single-nuclei and spatial transcriptomics to decipher tumor phenotype predictive of relapse-free survival in Wilms tumor.
data_modalities_used: ['single-nuclei RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'mutation/copy number data', 'Immunohistochemistry']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study integrated single-nuclei and spatial transcriptomics to identify a tumor phenotype predictive of relapse-free survival in Wilms tumor. It identified a relapse-associated tumor subtype resembling nephron progenitor cells, residing in immune-desert niches through interactions with CAFs, and proposed a prognostic model. The findings suggest targeting these cells with EGFR inhibitors as a potential therapeutic strategy for high-risk patients.

title: Multi-omics analysis of the dynamic role of STAR+ cells in regulating platinum-based chemotherapy responses and tumor microenvironment in serous ovarian carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study identifies STAR+ cells as a novel cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) subtype that enhances chemotherapy sensitivity in serous ovarian carcinoma. STAR+ cells potentially modulate key metabolic pathways and suppress WNT signaling, contributing to improved treatment responses. The findings position STAR+ cells as a potential biomarker for predicting chemotherapy efficacy.

title: An atlas of early human mandibular endochondral and osteogenic paracrine signaling regions of Meckel's cartilage.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'in vivo lineage tracing mouse model']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Differentiation']
main_goals: This study establishes a spatiotemporal atlas of Meckel's cartilage in human fetuses using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It reveals distinct mechanisms of mandibular ossification mediated by anterior and intermediate Meckel's cartilage populations, highlighting the role of paracrine signaling.

title: Dynamic responses to rejection in the transplanted human heart revealed through spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to characterize transcriptional heterogeneity in human cardiac biopsies during and after allograft rejection. It identifies differences in cell abundance across rejection classes and uncovers distinct transcriptomic profiles associated with rejection resolution and persistent rejection, highlighting genes involved in inflammation and immune signaling. The findings aim to improve the stratification of immune-cardiac interactions for therapeutic strategies post-transplant.

title: SPP1 + macrophages in colorectal cancer: Markers of malignancy and promising therapeutic targets.
main_goals: This study investigated the roles and mechanisms of SPP1+ macrophages in colorectal cancer (CRC) using integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics with bulk sequencing. The findings highlight SPP1+ macrophages as key players in CRC progression, metastasis, and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Genetic insights into idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: a multi-omics approach to identify potential therapeutic targets.
data_modalities_used: ['genomic data', 'transcriptomic data', 'plasma expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) data', 'Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) summary statistics', 'RNA-seq (bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics)', 'UK Biobank data']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Genome-Wide Association Study', 'Transcriptome-wide association study', 'Mendelian randomization', 'RNA-seq co-expression analysis', 'Molecular docking', 'Phenome-wide MR']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify potential therapeutic targets and evaluate safety profiles for Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF) using a multi-omics approach. They integrated genomic and transcriptomic data to identify key genes, explored causal relationships using Mendelian randomization, and assessed druggability and potential side effects through molecular docking and phenome-wide MR. The research identified six key genes as potential drug targets for IPF.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis reveals that Pros1<sup>+</sup> oligodendrocytes are involved in endogenous neuroprotection after brainstem stroke.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of oligodendrocytes in endogenous neuroprotection after brainstem stroke. It identifies a novel subcluster of Pros1+ oligodendrocytes (OLG8 cells) that increase after stroke and protect interneurons, with Myo1e facilitating their differentiation and alleviating ischemic injury.

title: Cancer-associated fibroblast heterogeneity in chordoma<sup>†</sup>.
main_goals: This paper analyzes the cellular landscape of chordoma using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies an inflammatory CAF subtype (iCAF) associated with poor prognosis and tumor invasion, proposing its role in driving an invasive phenotype. The study highlights the need to integrate findings from different chordoma studies to establish a consensus on cellular heterogeneity and compare CAF populations with other tumor types.

title: A single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomic atlas of the COVID-19 liver reveals topological, functional, and regenerative organ disruption in patients.
main_goals: This study performs single-nucleus RNA-seq and spatial transcriptomic profiling of livers from COVID-19 decedents to understand liver dysfunction. It identifies SARS-CoV-2 RNA positive hepatocytes, a pro-fibrotic signaling network, and changes in cellular composition, revealing insights into hepatocellular injury, ductular reaction, vascular expansion, and fibrogenesis in COVID-19 cholangiopathy.

title: Metabolomics based analysis reveals the therapeutic effects of Incarvillea arguta (Royle) Royle aqueous extract against alcohol-induced liver injury.
main_goals: To investigate the chemical composition of Incarvillea arguta (Liangtoumao) aqueous extract, evaluate its therapeutic intervention effect on alcohol-induced liver injury (ALI) in rat models, and explore its mechanisms using metabolomics. The study aimed to confirm the efficacy and elucidate the mechanisms behind its use in traditional Chinese medicine for ALI.

title: Transcriptional signatures of hippocampal tau pathology in primary age-related tauopathy and Alzheimer's disease.
biological_context: Alzheimer's disease and primary age-related tauopathy
main_goals: This paper investigates the transcriptional signatures of hippocampal neurons with and without tau pathology in primary age-related tauopathy (PART) and Alzheimer's disease (AD). It aims to identify shared transcriptional changes associated with intraneuronal tau and their functional enrichment, providing insights into common pathogenic pathways.

title: Blocking ITGA5 potentiates the efficacy of anti-PD-1 therapy on glioblastoma by remodeling tumor-associated macrophages.
biological_context: Glioblastoma (GBM) tumor microenvironment and response to anti-PD-1 therapy
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro assays', 'in vivo assays', 'co-immunoprecipitation', 'RNA immunoprecipitation', 'pull-down assays']
main_goals: This study aimed to dissect the molecular mechanisms of specific immunosuppressive subpopulations that drive anti-PD-1 resistance in Glioblastoma. It identified a novel circular RNA (circSDHAF2) that facilitates a tumor microenvironment promoting anti-PD-1 resistance by stabilizing ITGA5, leading to the formation of SPP1+ MDMs. The findings demonstrate that ITGA5 blockade can enhance anti-PD-1 therapy efficacy in GBM.

title: Spatial Metabolomics and Transcriptomics Reveal Metabolic Reprogramming and Cellular Interactions in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma with High PD-1 Expression and Therapeutic Response.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images', 'in vitro functional analyses']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Metabolic Reprogramming Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Prognostic Biomarker Identification', 'Functional Validation']
main_goals: This study utilized spatial metabolomics and transcriptomics to investigate metabolic reprogramming and cellular interactions in nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) patients with varying therapeutic responses and PD-1 expression. The research identified key metabolic pathways and gene signatures associated with therapeutic sensitivity and poor prognosis, validating them with public datasets and in vitro experiments.

title: Contact Cooling-Induced ELOVL4 Enhances Skin Wound Healing by Promoting the Inflammation-to-Proliferation Phase Transition.
biological_context: Skin wound healing and the role of temperature regulation
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-sequencing', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'skin organoids', 'in vivo functional perturbations']
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanism by which adequate temperature enhances skin wound healing, identifying ELOVL4 as a key mediator. It reveals that contact cooling at 20°C upregulates ELOVL4, which promotes the transition from the inflammation to proliferation phase of wound healing by producing DHA and EPA that dampen pro-inflammatory cytokines.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptomics unravels cell states and ecosystems associated with clinical response to immunotherapy.
biological_context: Vulvar high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions (vHSIL) treated with immunotherapeutic peptide vaccine
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'public single-cell transcriptomic data sets']
main_goals: This study leveraged single-cell spatial transcriptomics to analyze the tumor microenvironment in response to immunotherapy in patients with vulvar high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions. It aimed to identify cellular heterogeneity and spatial interactions associated with different clinical responses (complete, partial, and non-responders). The findings highlight the importance of both cellular composition and spatial organization in predicting immunotherapy efficacy.

title: Spatial transcriptomics identifies novel Pseudomonas aeruginosa virulence factors.
biological_context: Murine model of ocular infection with Pseudomonas aeruginosa
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Visualization', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This study leveraged dual spatial transcriptomics to examine host-pathogen interactions during Pseudomonas aeruginosa ocular infection. It identified differential gene expression patterns, developed a predictive model for bacterial burden, and discovered a novel virulence factor, PA2590.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Surgical Resection Specimens of Primary Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma Treated with Afatinib in a Window-of-Opportunity Study (EORTC90111-24111).
biological_context: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
main_goals: This study evaluated afatinib-induced tumor and microenvironment modifications in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma using spatial transcriptomics and RNA-sequencing. The research explored tumor evolution and composition under anti-HER therapy, identifying key genes implicated in EMT, MET, and PDGF pathways that may serve as targets to prevent tumor evolution after anti-HER therapy.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Novel Mechanisms Involved in Perineural Invasion in Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinomas.
main_goals: This study used Nanostring GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler to analyze the whole transcriptome of cancer and nerve cells in PDAC. It aimed to identify mechanisms involved in perineural invasion (PNI) and its association with cancer pain and prognosis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of the epipharynx in long COVID identifies SARS-CoV-2 signalling pathways and the therapeutic potential of epipharyngeal abrasive therapy.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of the epipharynx in long COVID by analyzing spatial gene expression. It identifies SARS-CoV-2 signaling pathways and suggests epipharyngeal abrasive therapy (EAT) as a potential treatment by reducing viral RNA, inflammation, and improving epithelial dysfunction.

title: Cellular and molecular determinants mediating the dysregulated germinal center immune dynamics in systemic lupus erythematosus.
main_goals: This paper investigates the follicular immune landscaping and in situ transcriptomic profile in lymph nodes from SLE individuals using spatial transcriptomics and multiplex imaging. The study aims to highlight altered immunological landscapes and identify druggable targets by analyzing spatial molecular and cellular signatures of SLE follicular B and T follicular helper cell dynamics.

title: Alterations in PD-L1 succinylation shape anti-tumor immune responses in melanoma.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk transcriptomics', 'proteomics', 'in vitro assays', 'in vivo models']
main_goals: This study reveals a link between the metabolite succinyl-CoA and anti-tumor immunity in melanoma. It demonstrates that succinylation of PD-L1 at lysine 129 leads to its degradation, enhancing T cell-mediated tumor elimination. The study also identifies CPT1A as a succinyltransferase for PD-L1 and suggests CPT1A and PD-L1 levels as potential biomarkers for anti-PD-1 therapy response.

title: Glycogen drives tumour initiation and progression in lung adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of glycogen in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) progression. It utilizes spatial screens to identify glycogen accumulation as a driver of tumor grade and poor survival. The study also establishes a link between glycogen levels and central carbon metabolites essential for tumor growth, proposing a framework for integrating spatial metabolomics with translational models.

title: Single-cell multi-stage spatial evolutional map of esophageal carcinogenesis.
main_goals: This study presents a spatial transcriptomic map at single-cell resolution to chart the evolutionary trajectories of human esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC). It reveals that ESCC progression is driven by a proliferative epithelial cell subpopulation and identifies a key interaction involving JAG1-NOTCH1 signaling that leads to the formation of a 'CAF-Epi' niche, shielding the tumor from immune surveillance. This niche formation is a significant indicator of progression and patient outcomes in ESCC.

title: Expression of co-signaling molecules TIM-3/Galectin-9 at the maternal-fetal interface.
main_goals: To examine the expression and localization of Galectin-9 and TIM-3 at the maternal-fetal interface and to investigate their potential roles in maintaining immune tolerance and pregnancy maintenance. The study aimed to provide insights into recurrent pregnancy loss.

title: Spatial and single-cell transcriptomic analysis reveals fibroblasts dependent immune environment in colorectal cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Quality control', 'Dimensionality reduction', 'Visualization', 'Differential gene expression analysis', 'Immune infiltration assessment', 'Prognostic gene identification', 'Clustering', 'Survival analysis', 'Metabolic pathway analysis', 'Cell proliferation assay', 'Cell migration assay', 'Invasion assay']
main_goals: This study aimed to dissect fibroblast heterogeneity in colorectal cancer using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identified key fibroblast-associated genes with prognostic relevance and characterized distinct molecular subtypes based on these biomarkers. The research also explored the immune microenvironment and identified potential immunotherapeutic targets.

title: Identification of conserved gene expression changes across common glomerular diseases by spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To identify conserved gene expression changes across common glomerular diseases using spatial transcriptomics, providing insights into underlying molecular mechanisms and potential therapeutic strategies.

title: PLOD3 as a novel oncogene in prognostic and immune infiltration risk model based on multi-machine learning in cervical cancer.
main_goals: To improve prognostic accuracy and therapeutic strategies for cervical cancer by developing a multi-machine learning prognostic model based on metabolic-associated genes. The study identifies PLOD3 as a novel oncogene and analyzes immune infiltration patterns related to risk categories.

title: A novel signature predicts prognosis in pancreatic cancer based on tumor membrane-associated genes.
main_goals: The study aimed to identify a novel signature predicting prognosis in pancreatic cancer by analyzing tumor membrane-associated genes. It developed a prognostic model (MaGPS) based on six specific genes and validated its predictive power, also exploring potential therapeutic targets associated with the signature.

title: Extraction of a stromal metastatic gene signature in breast cancer via spatial profiling.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'transcriptomic reference human breast cancer (BC) datasets', 'histology images']
main_goals: To identify a stromal metastatic (Met) signature in breast cancer using spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to validate this signature and discuss its potential as a prognostic tool for pinpointing metastatic breast cancer and understanding tumor-extrinsic molecular hallmarks.

title: Tumor Prognostic Risk Model Related to Monocytes/Macrophages in Hepatocellular Carcinoma Based on Machine Learning and Multi-Omics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify monocyte/macrophage-associated genes in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and construct a prognostic model based on these genes. The model was validated and its relationship with drug resistance and immune therapy responses was investigated. The identified single-gene prognostic model, based on UQCRH, can predict HCC patient survival and treatment outcomes.

title: Cell type and region-specific transcriptional changes in the endometrium of women with RIF identify potential treatment targets.
biological_context: Recurrent implantation failure (RIF) in human endometrium
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling', 'Differential Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study employed spatial transcriptomics to identify region- and cell-type-specific transcriptional differences in the endometrium of women with recurrent implantation failure (RIF) compared to fertile controls. The findings pinpoint dysregulated pathways and potential treatment targets, emphasizing the importance of analyzing endometrial regions and cell types as distinct entities.

title: Novel Cell-to-Cell Communications Between Macrophages and Fibroblasts Regulate Obesity-Induced Adipose Tissue Fibrosis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates novel cell-to-cell communications between macrophages and fibroblasts in obesity-induced adipose tissue fibrosis using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It elucidates the role of the Mincle-Oncostatin M axis in this process, identifying Mincle-expressing macrophages in crown-like structures and demonstrating Oncostatin M's suppressive effect on fibroblast collagen production.

title: Recurrent ERBB2 alterations are associated with esophageal adenocarcinoma brain metastases.
data_modalities_used: ['whole-genome sequencing', 'single-cell spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell whole-genome sequencing', 'multi-region sequencing', 'histology images']
main_goals: This paper investigates the molecular mechanisms underlying brain metastases in esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC) by performing multi-omics analysis. It identifies recurrent ERBB2 alterations as a key driver in EAC brain metastases and explores their association with disease progression and treatment response.

title: PLXNB1 and other signaling drives a pathologic astrocyte state contributing to cognitive decline in Alzheimer's Disease.
biological_context: Alzheimer's disease and aging-related cognitive decline
main_goals: This study identifies a specific astrocyte subset (Ast10) associated with Alzheimer's disease and cognitive decline. It investigates the signaling pathways driving its emergence and confirms the regulatory role of PLXNB1. The findings suggest Ast10 as a potential therapeutic target for preserving cognitive function.

title: 3D spatial transcriptomics reveals the molecular structure of input and output pathways in the mouse olfactory bulb.
biological_context: Mouse olfactory bulb organization and gene expression
main_goals: This study reconstructs the anatomical and molecular organization of the mouse olfactory bulb using 3D spatial transcriptomics. It reveals symmetric organization of glomeruli and the relationship between olfactory epithelium gene expression and glomerular position. The findings suggest a reorganization from sensory input to cortical output pathways.

title: Altered inflammatory mucosal signatures within their spatial and cellular context during active ileal Crohn's disease.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'frozen CD surgical tissue sections', 'ileal CD mucosa']
main_goals: This study aims to deepen the understanding of distinct inflammatory signatures in Crohn's disease by combining spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. It investigates overlapping pathways, identifies changes in early epithelial cells, and maps their spatial location, particularly antigen presentation in crypt bases. The research also proposes early epithelial cells as mediators of the MHC class II pathway during inflammation, potentially promoting macrophage infiltration.

title: NAD+ prevents chronic kidney disease by activating renal tubular metabolism.
biological_context: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) associated with impaired renal tubular metabolism and fatty acid oxidation (FAO).
main_goals: This paper investigates the mechanism by which NAD+ supplementation protects against chronic kidney disease (CKD) by activating renal tubular metabolism. It demonstrates that NAD+ precursor nicotinamide riboside (NR) restores fatty acid oxidation (FAO) in proximal tubule cells in a mouse model of Alport syndrome, thereby preventing CKD. The study also identifies sex differences at the transcriptional level in this model.

title: Multimodal mass spectrometry imaging reveals spatial metabolic reprogramming in diabetic liver disease.
biological_context: Diabetic liver injury (DLI) in a rat model, with investigation into the therapeutic effects of ferulic acid.
data_modalities_used: ['air-flow-assisted desorption electrospray ionization mass spectrometry imaging (AFADESI-MSI)', 'matrix-assisted laser desorption ionization mass spectrometry imaging (MALDI-MSI)', 'metabolomics']
main_goals: To comprehensively analyze spatial metabolic changes in diabetic liver injury (DLI) using multimodal mass spectrometry imaging and to evaluate the therapeutic potential of ferulic acid. The study aimed to identify metabolic reprogramming in DLI and assess ferulic acid's ability to restore metabolic homeostasis.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics and Proteomics Profiling After Ischemic Stroke Reperfusion: Insights Into Vascular Alterations.
biological_context: Ischemic stroke reperfusion in mouse brain
main_goals: To investigate cerebrovascular changes following ischemic stroke reperfusion using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. The study aims to understand the molecular basis of futile reperfusion by analyzing early changes in the peri-infarct cortex.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome profiling reveal CTHRC1+ fibroblasts promote EMT through WNT5A signaling in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: This study identifies CTHRC1+ fibroblasts and their role in promoting EMT via WNT5A signaling in colorectal cancer. It demonstrates how CTHRC1+ CAFs upregulate MSLN in malignant epithelial cells, contributing to tumor invasion and metastasis.

title: Microglial mechanisms drive amyloid-β clearance in immunized patients with Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to explore the mechanisms of amyloid-beta clearance in Alzheimer's disease patients after immunization. It identifies distinct microglial states and transcriptional pathways involved in Aβ removal, highlighting the roles of TREM2, APOE, and complement signaling. The findings aim to provide molecular targets for enhancing AD immunotherapies.

title: Bystander neuronal progenitors in forebrain organoids promote protective antiviral responses.
biological_context: Forebrain organoids and neuronal antiviral responses
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of intercellular crosstalk in mediating intrinsic neuronal immunity and its contribution to limiting viral infection. The study utilizes forebrain organoids to demonstrate that bystander neural progenitors, via type I interferon signaling, promote protective antiviral responses. Spatial transcriptomics reveals distinct antiviral gene expression patterns among neuronal subtypes, highlighting the importance of interneuronal communication in brain antiviral immunity.

title: PERK+ Macrophages Drive Immunotherapy Resistance in Lymph Node Metastases of Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
biological_context: Oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) lymph node metastases
main_goals: This study evaluates the pathologic response of lymph node metastases in OSCC patients treated with neoadjuvant anti-PD-1 immunotherapy. It identifies PERK+ macrophages in LN metastases as a key driver of immunotherapy resistance by promoting an ECM-enriched microenvironment that hinders T cell cytotoxicity. Pharmacologic inhibition of the PERK pathway showed potential to improve therapeutic outcomes.

title: Study on the Material Basis and Mechanisms of Achyrocline satureioides in the Treatment of Nonsmall Cell Lung Cancer Based on Network Pharmacology and Spatial Metabolomics.
data_modalities_used: ['high-resolution ultrahigh-performance liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry (HR-UHPLC-MS/MS)', 'matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization mass spectrometry imaging (MALDI-MSI)']
main_goals: To comprehensively investigate the active components and action mechanism of Achyrocline satureioides in the treatment of nonsmall cell lung cancer (NSCLC) by combining network pharmacology and spatial metabolomics. The study aimed to identify active compounds, their targets, and elucidate metabolic mechanisms.

title: Deciphering ovarian cancer heterogeneity through spatial transcriptomics, single-cell profiling, and copy number variations.
covered_analysis_steps: ['copy number variation analysis', 'single-cell profiling', 'gene expression analysis', 'cell-cell communication analysis', 'tumor clone identification', 'evolutionary trajectories']
main_goals: To elucidate the intricate mechanisms underlying HGSOC heterogeneity by conducting a comprehensive analysis of single-cell transcriptomes, spatial transcriptomes, and copy number variations. The study aims to identify distinct tumor clones, their evolutionary trajectories, and spatial relationships, as well as uncover functional profiles of tumor cells and key communication networks.

title: EPAS1 induction drives myocardial degeneration in desmoplakin-cardiomyopathy.
main_goals: This study investigated the molecular mechanisms driving myocardial degeneration in desmoplakin-cardiomyopathy (DSP-cardiomyopathy). Using spatial transcriptomics on patient explanted hearts, they identified EPAS1 as a key regulator associated with mitochondrial dysfunction and apoptosis in stressed cardiomyocytes, suggesting EPAS1 as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Single Cell Spatial Transcriptomics of the Murine Embryonic Palate Links Pax9 to Patterning and Organization of Extracellular Matrix Components.
biological_context: Murine embryonic palate development and cleft palate formation
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'Visium HD', 'Xenium In Situ mRNA spatial profiling', 'RNAscope Multiplex assays', 'sequencing']
main_goals: To explore the genomic basis of palatal clefts using single-cell spatial RNA-sequencing in a Pax9-/- murine model. The study aims to identify perturbations in the signaling microenvironment and extracellular matrix components contributing to cleft palate defects, providing a framework for identifying therapeutic targets.

title: Complement activation in tumor microenvironment after neoadjuvant therapy and its impact on pancreatic cancer outcomes.
biological_context: Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) after neoadjuvant therapy (NAT)
main_goals: This study investigates how neoadjuvant therapy differentially impacts pancreatic cancer cells and the tumor microenvironment. It identifies that higher complement expression in the tumor microenvironment following NAT is associated with improved patient outcomes, suggesting complement dynamics as a potential biomarker.

title: Blood TCTP as a potential biomarker associated with immunosuppressive features and poor clinical outcomes in metastatic gastric cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the prognostic and immunological relevance of plasma translationally controlled tumor protein (TCTP) in patients with advanced gastric cancer. It investigates TCTP as a potential biomarker associated with immunosuppressive features and poor clinical outcomes. The findings suggest plasma TCTP reflects clinically relevant immunosuppressive myeloid signals.

title: Single-cell eQTL mapping reveals cell subtype-specific genetic control and mechanism in malignant transformation of colorectal cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['sc-eQTL mapping', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This paper aims to understand the mechanisms underlying colorectal cancer (CRC) development at single-cell resolution by profiling transcriptomes, spatial transcriptomics, and snMultiomes. It presents a CRC sc-eQTL map, identifies cell subtype-specific genetic control, and reveals how specific genetic variants and gene expression changes (e.g., LGALS9) contribute to CRC progression and immune evasion. The study also demonstrates the therapeutic potential of targeting the LGALS9-TIM3 axis.

title: Uncovering the Signatures of Cellular Senescence in the Human Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex.
biological_context: Human dorsolateral prefrontal cortex aging and senescence
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aimed to build a transcriptomic atlas of aging and senescence in the human dorsolateral prefrontal cortex using Visium spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA sequencing. The researchers identified markers of aging in cortical layers and cell types, observed changes in astrocyte and inhibitory neuron populations, and characterized the heterogeneous senescence profile influenced by cell type and cortical layer. The findings highlight gene expression modules enriched with age and senescence-related genes, particularly in microglia, endothelial cells, and regional astrocytes.

title: Single-cell multiome and spatial profiling reveals pancreas cell type-specific gene regulatory programs driving type 1 diabetes progression.
biological_context: Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) progression in the pancreas
main_goals: This study aims to understand cell type-specific regulatory programs driving Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) in the pancreas. It reveals alterations in pancreatic cell types and niches during T1D progression, identifies epigenomic drivers and causal pathways of T1D risk, and highlights changes in cell-cell signaling affecting beta cell regulation. The findings provide a basis for therapeutic targets for disease prevention.

title: Cross-tissue multi-omics analyses reveal the gut microbiota's absence impacts organ morphology, immune homeostasis, bile acid and lipid metabolism.
biological_context: Gut microbiota's absence in mice and its impact on organ morphology, immune homeostasis, and metabolism
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'targeted bile acid metabolomics', 'sequencing', 'histology images']
main_goals: To systematically assess how the absence of the gut microbiota affects organ morphology, immune homeostasis, bile acid, and lipid metabolism in mice using integrated multi-omics analyses. The study investigates aberrations in immune cells, altered mucosal zonation, and shifts in bile acid and lipid metabolism, highlighting key host pathways involved in lipid homeostasis in germ-free mice.

title: Multiomic spatial atlas shows deleted in malignant brain tumors 1 (DMBT1) glycoprotein is lost in colonic dysplasia.
biological_context: Colonic dysplasia and colorectal cancer development in mice and humans
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunofluorescence', 'scRNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomic analysis', 'mouse organoids', 'human organoids']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differential gene expression analysis', 'Ligand-receptor mapping', 'Gene expression regulation']
main_goals: This study aimed to define the molecular spatial organization of colonic dysplasia in a mouse model, investigate host-microbe interactions during colonic tumorigenesis, and identify molecular changes, specifically focusing on the DMBT1 glycoprotein. It utilized multiomic spatial approaches to show DMBT1 is lost in colonic dysplasia and implicated WNT signaling in its downregulation.

title: A progranulin variant causing childhood interstitial lung disease responsive to anti-TNF-α biologic therapy.
data_modalities_used: ['whole-exome sequencing', 'digital spatial mRNA profiling', 'lung biopsies', 'ELISA', 'alveolar macrophage transcriptomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper describes the identification of a pathogenic progranulin (GRN) variant causing childhood interstitial lung disease. It demonstrates the utility of convergent multiomics in evaluating aberrant TNF-α pathway activation and guiding precision therapeutics with anti-TNF-α biologic therapy, leading to dramatic patient improvement.

title: Use of metabolic imaging to monitor heterogeneity of tumour response following therapeutic mTORC1/2 pathway inhibition.
biological_context: PTEN-null renal cancer model treated with mTORC1/2 inhibitor AZD2014
main_goals: The paper developed an integrated multi-modal imaging workflow to assess the heterogeneity of AZD2014 (mTORC1/2 inhibitor) response in a PTEN-null renal cancer model. It used mass spectrometry imaging and imaging mass cytometry to analyze spatial responses of metabolite and protein biomarkers, demonstrating that MSI-based workflows provide novel insights into pharmacodynamic effects of mTORC1/2 inhibition that classical biomarkers do not resolve. The study also showed PI3K-dependent resistance mechanisms.

title: Single-cell and spatial analysis reveals the interaction between ITLN1<sup>+</sup> foam cells and SPP1<sup>+</sup> macrophages in atherosclerosis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This study investigates the interaction between ITLN1+ foam cells and SPP1+ macrophages in atherosclerosis using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to elucidate their regulatory functions and intercellular communication networks, identifying the MIF-(CD74 + CD44) and SPP1-CD44 ligand-receptor axes as key mediators.

title: Single-cell and spatial genomic landscape of non-small cell lung cancer brain metastases.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) brain metastases
data_modalities_used: ['single-nucleus RNA sequencing', 'T cell receptor sequencing', 'single-cell spatial sequencing', 'whole-genome sequencing', 'multiplexed immunofluorescence']
main_goals: This study investigates the genomic and microenvironmental landscape of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) brain metastases. It characterizes chromosomal instability and identifies neural-like transcriptional programs in cancer cells from brain metastases, which pre-exist in primary tumors but are enriched in metastases. The findings provide insights into NSCLC brain metastasis biology.

title: Comprehensive analysis of the structural phenotypes and functional characteristics of B cells in oral lichen planus and oral lichenoid lesions through single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Oral lichen planus and oral lichenoid lesions
covered_analysis_steps: ['Preprocessing', 'Normalization', 'Denoising', 'Batch Correction', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Deconvolution', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Visualization', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To comprehensively characterize B-cell phenotypes and spatial distribution in oral lichen planus (OLP) and related oral lichenoid lesions (OLL) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to uncover epigenetic mechanisms underlying B cell-mediated immune regulation in the oral mucosal microenvironment and observed extensive B-cell infiltration and tertiary lymphoid structure formation.

title: Decoding functional hematopoietic progenitor cells in the adult human lung.
main_goals: This study investigates the presence and characteristics of functional hematopoietic progenitor cells (HPCs) in the adult human lung. It demonstrates that these pulmonary HPCs reside in extravascular spaces, exhibit proliferation and engraftment capabilities in mice, and possess a distinct gene signature enriched for immune, megakaryocyte/platelet, and erythroid pathways. The research also spatially maps these blood progenitors to an alveolar interstitium niche and identifies HPCs with a lung signature within mobilized stem cell pools for transplantation.

title: Programs, origins and immunomodulatory functions of myeloid cells in glioma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'chromatin accessibility', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'organoid explant systems']
main_goals: This study systematically investigates the immunomodulatory phenotypes of myeloid cells in glioma by integrating multiple omics technologies. It discovered four distinct immunomodulatory programs driven by microenvironmental cues, which can predict immunotherapy response and survival. The research aims to provide a framework for understanding myeloid cell immunomodulation in glioma and to guide the development of improved immunotherapies.

title: Multiomics analysis unveils the cellular ecosystem with clinical relevance in aldosterone-producing adenomas with KCNJ5 mutations.
main_goals: This multiomics study aimed to analyze the cellular ecosystem of aldosterone-producing adenomas (APA) with KCNJ5 mutations, revealing cellular heterogeneity and spatial segregation. It investigated the role of lipid-associated macrophages and found correlations between intratumor cortisol synthesis, blood cortisol levels, and osteoporosis. The study provides insights into APA biology and potential clinical implications.

title: Integrative single-cell and spatial transcriptome analysis reveals heterogeneity of human liver progenitor cells.
biological_context: Human liver progenitor cell heterogeneity in different conditions (fetal, healthy, cirrhotic, and HCC-affected livers)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Gene Co-expression Network Analysis']
main_goals: To analyze human liver progenitor cell heterogeneity using integrative single-cell and spatial transcriptome analysis. The study aimed to characterize LPC subpopulations, their spatial colocalization, and distinct cellular states across various liver conditions.

title: From Local to Systemic: The Journey of Tick Bite Biomarkers in Australian Patients.
biological_context: Tick bites and tick-related illnesses in Australian patients
data_modalities_used: ['skin biopsies', 'peripheral blood', 'cellular transcriptomics', 'cell-free transcriptomics', 'proteomics', 'metabolomics', 'DNA methylation', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: To investigate if molecular signals from tick-bite locations in the skin can be detected systemically in peripheral blood. The study aimed to provide proof-of-concept that blood samples can capture biomarkers reflecting local tissue processes following a tick bite.

title: Spatial single-cell proteomics landscape decodes the tumor microenvironmental ecosystem of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['imaging mass cytometry', 'spatial proteomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplex immunofluorescence', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'bulk proteomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to generate a comprehensive spatial atlas of iCCA to understand the tumor microenvironment (TME) ecosystem. It identifies spatial features associated with prognosis and immunotherapy response, revealing that spatial topology correlates with patient outcomes and proposing potential therapeutic options for identified subtypes.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals prognostically LYZ<sup>+</sup> fibroblasts and colocalization with FN1<sup>+</sup> macrophages in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
main_goals: This study identified prognostically relevant LYZ+ fibroblasts and FN1+ macrophages in DLBCL. The hub genes associated with these subtypes represent potential biomarkers, providing insights into improving patient outcomes in DLBCL.

title: Astrocyte heterogeneity reveals region-specific astrogenesis in the white matter.
biological_context: White matter and gray matter astrocyte comparison and astrogenesis in murine forebrain and cerebellum
main_goals: This paper compares astrocytes from cortical gray matter (GM) and white matter (WM)/corpus callosum (WM/CC) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics in mice. It reveals distinct molecular properties between WM and GM astrocytes, with specific hallmarks for WM astrocytes. The study also investigates region-specific astrogenesis by comparing WM astrocytes in the cortex and cerebellum, finding evidence for continued astrogenesis in the WM/CC.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of Glomerulo-centric antibody mediated rejection in renal transplants.
biological_context: Glomerulo-centric antibody mediated rejection in renal transplants
main_goals: This case study used Digital Spatial Profiling to analyze spatial transcriptomics in renal transplant biopsies during antibody-mediated rejection. It identified molecular signatures of immune cells and HLA class II antigens within glomeruli and observed decreased podocyte gene expression. The findings highlight podocyte vulnerability and suggest potential gene markers for future diagnostic use.

title: Resolving the spatial and cellular architecture of intra-tumor heterogeneity by multi-region dissection of lung adenocarcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper aims to delineate the spatial heterogeneity and driving factors of cell colocalization in Lung Adenocarcinoma (LUAD) by analyzing multi-regional biopsies. It investigates the distinct spatial distributions and immune cell colocalizations of two cancer cell sub-clusters, providing insights into their roles in LUAD progression and immune evasion.

title: Human placental extract improves liver cirrhosis in mice with regulation of macrophages and senescent cells.
main_goals: This study investigated the therapeutic potential of human placental extract (HPE) for liver cirrhosis. It demonstrated that HPE administration improved liver function and reduced senescent cells in a mouse model. The study also elucidated the anti-inflammatory mechanisms involving macrophage polarization and senescent cell-derived inflammation pathways.

title: Deciphering key roles of B cells in prognostication and tailored therapeutic strategies for lung adenocarcinoma: a multi-omics and machine learning approach towards predictive, preventive, and personalized treatment strategies.
main_goals: This study aims to decipher the roles of B cells in the prognostication and tailored therapeutic strategies for lung adenocarcinoma using a multi-omics and machine learning approach. It developed a B cell-associated gene signature (SRBS) to predict prognosis and guide personalized treatment, including immunotherapy and chemotherapy.

title: Clonal Heterogeneity in Human Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma and Its Impact on Tumor Progression.
main_goals: To understand the contribution of intratumoral heterogeneity to PDAC biology by analyzing single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data from primary human PDAC samples. The study revealed significant clonal heterogeneity, diverse transcriptional states, and unique interactions with the tumor microenvironment, challenging traditional PDAC classifications and highlighting the role of clonal evolution in disease progression and metastasis.

title: Spatially distinct cellular and molecular landscapes define prognosis in triple negative breast cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differential gene expression analysis', 'Cell-type deconvolution', 'Spatial entropy', 'Functional enrichment', 'TF-target / ligand-receptor analysis', 'Convolutional neural networks']
main_goals: To delineate the spatial and molecular heterogeneity underlying differential prognosis in triple-negative breast cancer using spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify distinct epithelial gene signatures that can classify samples and inform therapy, potentially transforming the clinical landscape for this aggressive subtype.

title: A Complete Spatial Map of Mouse Retinal Ganglion Cells Reveals Density and Gene Expression Specializations.
biological_context: Mouse retina spatial gene expression and cell distribution
main_goals: To map the spatial distribution and gene expression of all retinal ganglion cell (RGC) subtypes in mice using spatial transcriptomics and machine learning. The study investigates non-uniform distributions and gene expression variations, comparing mouse central vision specialization to primates.

title: Spatial metabolomics revealed multi-organ toxicity and visualize metabolite changes induced by borneol in zebrafish.
biological_context: Borneol toxicity in zebrafish, affecting heart, liver, kidney, and nervous system.
main_goals: This study systematically evaluated the effects of borneol (BO) on zebrafish using MALDI-MSI to understand its multi-organ toxicity and visualize metabolite changes. It aimed to provide insights into the toxicity of BO and its impact on metabolic dysregulation in aquatic organisms and potentially human health.

title: Spatiotemporal Transcriptomic Profiling Reveals the Dynamic Immunological Landscape of Alveolar Echinococcosis.
main_goals: This study aims to reveal the host immune response mechanism against E. multilocularis by integrating bulk RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, and spatial transcriptomics. It provides a high-resolution spatial atlas of infection foci and elucidates the roles of neutrophils, Spp1+ macrophages, and fibroblasts during disease progression. The findings suggest a transition in parasite control strategy by the host.

title: Identifying gene expression and cellular pathways involved in glomerular AL-amyloidosis and correlation with experimental data: seeking novel therapeutic interventions.
main_goals: To identify gene expression and cellular pathways involved in glomerular AL-amyloidosis using spatial transcriptomics in human kidney biopsies. The study aimed to correlate these findings with experimental data and discover novel therapeutic targets.

title: Analysis of thyroid carcinoma composition and spatial architecture in the progression of dedifferentiation, lymphatic metastasis, and gastric metastasis.
biological_context: Thyroid carcinoma progression, including dedifferentiation, lymphatic metastasis, and gastric metastasis
main_goals: To explore the spatial distribution characteristics of thyroid carcinomas and associated gastrointestinal metastatic cells using spatial transcriptomics and immunofluorescence. The study aimed to identify cell composition changes related to tumor dedifferentiation and metastasis, and to find potential markers for gastric metastasis.

title: Defining the molecular identity and morphology of glia limitans superficialis astrocytes in vertebrates.
biological_context: Vertebrate CNS glia limitans superficialis astrocytes
main_goals: This paper defines the molecular identity and morphology of astrocytes forming the glia limitans superficialis. It identifies myocilin (Myoc) as a specific marker for these astrocytes and demonstrates their evolutionary conservation across vertebrates. The research aims to advance understanding of CNS homeostasis and potential therapeutic targeting.

title: A novel HVEM-Fc recombinant protein for lung cancer immunotherapy.
data_modalities_used: ['organoid', 'T cell co-culture systems', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'flow cytometry', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'flow cytometry']
main_goals: This paper evaluates the anti-tumor efficacy and underlying mechanisms of a novel recombinant fusion protein, HVEM-Fc, for lung cancer immunotherapy. It demonstrates that HVEM-Fc inhibits tumor growth and metastasis in mouse models and enhances T-cell activity in both murine and human organoid systems. The study also highlights that combining HVEM-Fc with PD-1 inhibitors yields the most potent anti-tumor outcomes.

title: Spatial profiling of ANO7 in prostate tissue: links to AR-signalling-associated lipid metabolism and inflammation.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of ANO7 in benign prostatic epithelium using spatial transcriptomics. It examines differences between ANO7-expressing and non-expressing regions and their corresponding stromal compartments. The findings highlight ANO7's potential role in regulating lipid metabolism associated with androgen signaling in benign luminal cells and low-grade cancer.

title: Isotope Encoded Spatial Biology Identifies Amyloid Plaque-Age-Dependent Structural Maturation, Synaptic Loss, and Increased Toxicity.
data_modalities_used: ['mass spectrometry imaging', 'stable isotope labeling', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'hyperspectral confocal microscopy']
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate the processes involved in Aβ plaque formation and maturation using a knock-in Aβ mouse model. It employed mass spectrometry imaging and stable isotope labeling to timestamp Aβ plaques and track their aging spatially. The study correlated single-plaque spatial transcriptomics with time since seeding to identify gene-expression changes associated with plaque age, revealing relationships between plaque age, structural maturity, synapse loss, and toxicity.

title: Single Cell Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Immunotherapy-Driven Bone Marrow Niche Remodeling in AML.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation']
main_goals: This study investigates the spatiotemporal interactions in the bone marrow niche of AML patients treated with pembrolizumab and decitabine. It aims to reveal how immunotherapies remodel the bone marrow niche by analyzing cell-cell distances and ligand-receptor signaling, linking these changes to clinical responses.

title: Somatic mutations distinguish melanocyte subpopulations in human skin.
biological_context: Human skin melanocyte subpopulations and their response to sun damage
main_goals: This study investigates the homeostatic mechanisms of human skin melanocytes by phenotyping clonal expansions and analyzing mutational landscapes, gene expression, and morphology. It reveals a subpopulation of melanocytes with low mutation burden, found preferentially in hair follicles, suggesting a protected niche. The findings illustrate the utility of incorporating mutational data into cell atlases.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis of HIV and tuberculosis coinfection in a humanized mouse model reveals specific transcription patterns, immune responses and early morphological alteration signaling.
biological_context: HIV and tuberculosis coinfection in a humanized mouse model
main_goals: This study aimed to understand the early phenotypical and functional changes in immune cell infiltration in the affected organ of a humanized mouse model coinfected with HIV and Mtb. Spatial transcriptomics revealed specific transcription patterns, immune responses, and morphological alteration signaling at the early stage of infection.

title: Histopathologic Evaluation and Single-Cell Spatial Transcriptomics of the Colon Reveal Cellular and Molecular Abnormalities Linked to J-Pouch Failure in Patients with Inflammatory Bowel Disease.
biological_context: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) and J-Pouch failure after Total Abdominal Colectomy (TAC) with Ileal Pouch-Anal Anastomosis (IPAA)
main_goals: This study aimed to identify histopathological features in the total abdominal colectomy specimen associated with J-pouch failure in patients with inflammatory bowel disease. It also investigated the molecular mechanisms underlying this susceptibility using single-cell spatial transcriptomics to map gene expression and immune cell interactions in relation to pouch failure risk.
