title: Primed Mesenchymal Stem Cells by IFN-γ and IL-1β Ameliorate Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome through Enhancing Homing Effect and Immunomodulation.
main_goals: This study investigated the therapeutic potential of mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) primed with IFN-γ and IL-1β for treating Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS). The research aimed to understand how these primed MSCs enhance homing, modulate immune responses, and improve lung function in an ARDS mouse model, with a focus on identifying underlying molecular mechanisms through RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics of Intraductal Papillary Mucinous Neoplasms Reveals Divergent Indolent and Malignant States.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMN) and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC)
main_goals: This study used Digital Spatial RNA profiling (DSP-RNA) to define and associate transcriptomic states with cancer risk in IPMN. It uncovered three distinct epithelial transcriptomic states that correlated with pathological grade and PDAC molecular subtypes, providing potential for improved risk stratification of IPMN.

title: Integration of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals fibroblast subtypes in hepatocellular carcinoma: spatial distribution, differentiation trajectories, and therapeutic potential.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This paper integrates single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify and characterize fibroblast subtypes in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It reveals their distinct spatial distributions, differentiation trajectories, and their role in promoting tumor progression through angiogenesis. Furthermore, it demonstrates the potential of a machine learning model based on these subtypes for predicting HCC patient prognosis and sorafenib response.

title: Analysis of fatty acid metabolism in prostate cancer and discovery of a new programmed cell death-associated luminal cell subpopulation.
main_goals: This study analyzes fatty acid metabolism in prostate cancer using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies a new programmed cell death-associated luminal cell subpopulation and proposes new therapeutic targets.

title: Exploring the cellular and molecular basis of murine cardiac development through spatiotemporal transcriptome sequencing.
main_goals: This study utilizes spatial transcriptome sequencing to construct a spatiotemporal cell atlas of early murine cardiac development. The researchers elucidated the spatial organization of cardiac cellular lineages and their interactions, identified key genes associated with the loss of myocardial regeneration ability, and found marker genes for left and right atria.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal a potential role of ATF3 in brain metastasis of lung adenocarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)', 'spatial transcriptomics (ST)', 'Western blotting', 'quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: To dissect cellular components and their spatial distribution in human brain metastasis tumors of lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and identify potential therapeutic targets. The study identified ATF3 as a potential regulator of the mesenchymal-epithelial transition (MET) program in LUAD brain metastasis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals regional characteristics of lupus nephritis in murine kidneys and immune response to prednisolone or Gancao Nourishing-Yin decoction therapies.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to characterize regional differences in lupus nephritis in mouse kidneys. It also investigates the immune response to prednisolone or Gancao Nourishing-Yin decoction therapies.

title: Matrix mechano-sensing at the invasive front induces a cytoskeletal and transcriptional memory supporting metastasis.
data_modalities_used: ['HE-stained images', 'histology images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'Ex vivo culture', 'patient samples', 'murine models']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: The study characterizes extracellular matrix (ECM) organization at the invasive front of tumors and its impact on metastasis. It identifies distinct ECM features correlated with invasive behavior and demonstrates that metastases recapitulate these features. The research also highlights a spatial cytoskeletal and transcriptional memory in cancer cells responding to the ECM, uncovering a mechano-inflammatory program linked to prognosis.

title: Comprehensive analysis of cytokine and chemokine gene expression in IgG4-related disease by spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper aims to comprehensively analyze cytokine and chemokine gene expression in IgG4-related disease using spatial transcriptomics to understand the underlying mechanisms of the disease.

title: Clonal lineage tracing and transcriptomics of cortical progenitor populations reveal maintenance of differentiation potential.
main_goals: This study uses a lineage tracing tool (pbacBarcode) and transcriptomics to investigate the contributions of individual cortical radial glial progenitors (RGPs) to the postnatal cortex. It reveals that some RGPs remain multipotent and maintain differentiation potential into different cell types as late as postnatal day 4, suggesting a population decline model for postnatal neocortical development. The study also identifies a potential pool of intermediary progenitor cells.

title: Triterpenoid saponins in tea plants: A spatial and metabolic analysis using UPLC-QTOFMS, molecular networking, and DESI-MSI.
main_goals: This study profiles triterpenoid saponins in tea plants using mass spectrometry and imaging. It characterizes their structural diversity and tissue-specific distribution, revealing cultivar-specific variations and compartmentalized root localization. The findings aim to advance understanding for bioactive compound extraction and breeding strategies.

title: Single-Nucleus RNA Sequencing and Spatial Transcriptomics for Squamous Cell Carcinoma Arising From Ovarian Mature Teratoma.
biological_context: Squamous cell carcinoma arising from ovarian mature teratoma (SCC-MT)
main_goals: This study performed single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics on clinical SCC-MT samples to identify novel therapeutic candidates. The researchers identified unique gene expression profiles and determined a role for KLF5 in SCC-MT development, suggesting KLF5-related factors as potential therapeutic targets.

title: A single approach, multiple insights: Harnessing spatial transcriptomics and proteomics to identify novel therapeutic targets of alcohol-associated hepatitis.
main_goals: This study aims to identify novel therapeutic targets for alcohol-associated hepatitis by applying spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. The research leverages these technologies to gain multiple insights into the disease's mechanisms.

title: Unveiling the crucial role of glycosylation modification in lung adenocarcinoma metastasis through artificial neural network-based spatial multi-omics single-cell analysis and Mendelian randomization.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Single-Cell Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling', 'Multiomics']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of glycosylation modification in lung adenocarcinoma metastasis using multi-omics approaches. It employs artificial neural networks for predictive modeling and Mendelian randomization to identify causal genes, aiming to pinpoint viable therapeutic targets.

title: Spatial profiling of the interplay between cell type- and vision-dependent transcriptomic programs in the visual cortex.
biological_context: Visual cortex (V1) development and organization in mice during critical periods of postnatal life, focusing on the effects of visual experience on neuronal cell types.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper aims to characterize the spatial organization of L2/3 cell types in the primary visual cortex (V1) with and without visual experience. It investigates how visual deprivation influences transcriptomic programs in a cell type- and vision-dependent manner, linking spatial zonation to gene expression continuity and identifying distinct gene programs affected by visual experience.

title: Evolutionary convergence of sensory circuits in the pallium of amniotes.
biological_context: Evolutionary convergence of sensory circuits in the pallium of amniotes
main_goals: The paper compares the development and evolution of pallial sensory circuits across birds, lizards, and mammals using birthdating, single-cell RNA, and spatial transcriptomics. It reveals developmental distinctions and functional similarities, suggesting evolutionary convergence of high-order sensory processing.

title: Quinolinic acid potentially links kidney injury to brain toxicity.
biological_context: Mouse model of rapid kidney failure induced by Mdm2 conditional deletion in kidney tubules, as well as mouse models of ischemia-induced acute kidney injury and adenine-induced chronic kidney disease. Also includes analysis of patients with advanced chronic kidney disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Metabolomics Analysis', 'Pathway Enrichment Analysis', 'Data Integration']
main_goals: This study investigates the link between kidney dysfunction and neurological impairment using metabolomics. It identifies the kynurenine pathway, specifically quinolinic acid, as a potential mediator of this connection, observed in mouse models and human patients with chronic kidney disease. The findings suggest the kynurenine pathway as a target for treating neurological issues in kidney disease.

title: New dimension in viral hepatitis research.
biological_context: Hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection and coinfection with Hepatitis Delta Virus (HDV) and Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)
main_goals: This paper demonstrates the feasibility of spatial transcriptomics in analyzing HBV infections using GeoMx DSP technology. It revealed spatially distinct transcriptomic signatures related to immune features and viral burden in liver tissues of HBV-monoinfected, HBV/HDV coinfected, and HBV/HIV coinfected patients. The study identified underinvestigated immune cells and highlights future directions for improving understanding and treatment of HBV.

title: Spatial interaction mapping of PD-1/PD-L1 in head and neck cancer reveals the role of macrophage-tumour barriers associated with immunotherapy response.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'in situ proximity ligation assay (isPLA)', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study aims to bridge the gap in understanding the tumor microenvironment by identifying distinct spatial patterns of PD-1/PD-L1 interactions and their association with immunotherapy responses in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC). It highlights the utility of isPLA in detecting distinct tumor-immune interactions within the TME, offering new cellular interaction metrics for stratifying and optimizing immunotherapy strategies.

title: Mapping Human Uterine Disorders Through Single-Cell Transcriptomics.
biological_context: Human uterine disorders including endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial cancer, and fibroids
main_goals: This paper reviews the application of single-cell transcriptomics and spatial transcriptomics in mapping human uterine disorders. It highlights how these technologies reveal cellular heterogeneity and molecular mechanisms underlying diseases like endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial cancer, and fibroids, identifying cell types, signaling pathways, and cellular dysfunctions. The review also discusses the potential of these approaches for biomarker discovery and personalized medicine in gynecological disorders.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis identifies epithelium-macrophage crosstalk in endometriotic lesions.
main_goals: To identify cell type-specific gene expression changes in endometriotic lesions and elucidate crosstalk among stroma, epithelium, and macrophages compared to eutopic endometrium. The study highlights increased signaling between lesion epithelium and macrophages, suggesting the epithelium drives lesion inflammation and promotes a pro-repair phenotype in macrophages.

title: The trabecular and compact myocardium of adult vertebrate ventricles are transcriptionally similar despite morphological differences.
main_goals: The study investigates whether the compact and trabecular layers of adult vertebrate ventricles have intrinsically different transcriptional states despite morphological differences. Using spatial transcriptomics and analyzing existing single-cell transcriptomes, the research compares embryonic and adult hearts across species. The findings suggest that the transcriptional states of developing trabecular and compact myocardium do not persist into adulthood.

title: Single-cell and spatial-resolved profiling reveals cancer-associated fibroblast heterogeneity in colorectal cancer metabolic subtypes.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Immune Infiltration Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) heterogeneity within colorectal cancer (CRC) metabolic subtypes using single-cell and spatial profiling. It identified SFRP2+ CAFs as protumorigenic and linked their presence to chemoresistance, proposing AGMAT as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Quantifying multilabeled brain cells in the whole prefrontal cortex reveals reduced inhibitory and a subtype of excitatory neuronal marker expression in serotonin transporter knockout rats.
biological_context: Serotonin transporter knockout rats, prefrontal cortex function, anxiety
main_goals: The paper aims to quantify multilabeled brain cells in the whole prefrontal cortex of serotonin transporter knockout rats and investigate changes in neuronal marker expression. It also presents a novel method for automated cell counts using deep learning (StarDist) and open-source tools for analyzing a wide range of prefrontal cortex subregions.

title: Polyamine metabolism dysregulation contributes to muscle fiber vulnerability in ALS.
biological_context: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) in SOD1²ⁱ⁰ˢ mouse model
main_goals: To understand how altered innervation interferes with muscle homeostasis during ALS progression by generating a spatial transcriptomics dataset of skeletal muscle in the SOD1²ⁱ⁰ˢ mouse model. The study identified polyamine metabolism as a key altered pathway, correlating its dysregulation with muscle fiber vulnerability and demonstrating that restoring polyamine homeostasis can rescue the ALS muscle phenotype.

title: CDK16<sup>+</sup> Luminal Progenitor Cell-Like Tumor Cells Interacted with POSTN<sup>+</sup> Cancer-Associated Fibroblasts Associate with Chemo-Resistance In Breast Cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Single-Cell Analysis']
main_goals: This paper characterizes dynamic changes in tumor states and cellular composition in breast cancer patients undergoing neoadjuvant chemotherapy. It identifies CDK16+ luminal progenitor cell-like tumor cells interacting with POSTN+ cancer-associated fibroblasts as a driver of chemo-resistance. The study proposes targeting CDK16 to enhance chemotherapy efficacy.

title: Multi-modal refinement of the human heart atlas during the first gestational trimester.
biological_context: Human heart development during the first gestational trimester
main_goals: To study first-trimester human hearts to lay groundwork for studies of congenital heart defects. The study aimed to characterize cell types and their spatial organization, identifying new cardiomyocyte populations and autonomic/lymphatic endothelial transcriptomes, and a cardiomyofibroblast progenitor. It also aimed to translate molecular identity into specialized cardiac functions through anatomical-positional features.

title: Comprehensive single-cell pan-cancer atlas unveils IFI30+ macrophages as key modulators of intra-tumoral immune dynamics.
main_goals: This study elucidates IFI30's role in enhancing MHC-II antigen processing and its function within the macrophage-mediated tumor microenvironment across various cancers. It positions IFI30 as a promising immunotherapeutic target, particularly in its interaction with M2-macrophages, suggesting it as a potential intervention point in cancer immunotherapy.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal pre-metastatic subsets and therapeutic targets in penile carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'cell assays']
main_goals: This study aimed to understand tumor heterogeneity in penile carcinoma and identify pre-metastatic subsets and therapeutic targets. Using various transcriptomic and cell assay techniques, the researchers discovered an MMP3+SPP1+ pre-metastatic subset and identified CK2α as a potential therapeutic target, showing anti-tumor effects with Silmitasertib.

title: Role of TGF-β/SMAD/YAP/TAZ signaling in skeletal muscle fibrosis.
biological_context: Skeletal muscle fibrosis, specifically in the context of muscular dystrophies and acute muscle injury
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of the YAP/TAZ signaling pathway in skeletal muscle fibrosis, which is associated with the differentiation of fibro/adipogenic progenitors (FAPs) into myofibroblasts. The study found that TGF-β activates YAP/TAZ via SMAD3, promoting FAP differentiation and fibrosis. Inhibiting YAP/TAZ or mechanotransduction reduced fibrosis in vitro and in vivo, suggesting YAP/TAZ as a therapeutic target.

title: Metabolic heterogeneity in tumor cells impacts immunology in lung squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of metabolic heterogeneity on immunological functions in lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC). It analyzes spatial metabolic profiles and tumor-infiltrating T lymphocytes (TILs) to identify metabolic tumor subpopulations and their correlation with immune cell infiltration and patient survival. The findings highlight the interplay between metabolic heterogeneity and the tumor immune microenvironment, suggesting potential for tailored therapeutic strategies.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptomics elucidates the pathogenesis of fulminant viral myocarditis.
biological_context: Fulminant viral myocarditis induced by Coxsackievirus B3 in mice
main_goals: To elucidate the pathogenesis of fulminant viral myocarditis (FM) using spatiotemporal transcriptomics. The study identified key cell types and molecular pathways involved in FM, including mesothelial cells, macrophages, CD8+ effector T cells, and the IFN-gamma/Spi1 axis. It also demonstrated the therapeutic potential of targeting this axis.

title: Spatial proteomics identifies a CRTC-dependent viral signaling pathway that stimulates production of interleukin-11.
biological_context: Viral infection, specifically in relation to immune response and potential fibrotic complications.
main_goals: To identify signaling factors involved in viral infection response by analyzing protein relocalization on a global scale. The study identified CRTC2/3 translocation as a key pathway stimulated by viral infection, leading to IL-11 production, with potential clinical implications for fibrotic viral infections like SARS-CoV-2.

title: Multiomics identify the gene expression signature of the spinal cord during aging process.
main_goals: This paper investigates the transcriptional characteristics of aging spinal cords using multiomics. It identifies key gene expression signatures related to senescence, neuroinflammation, ferroptosis, and necroptosis, highlighting the role of Spi1 and Fth1 in mediating ferroptosis resistance in senescent glial cells.

title: Cell and transcriptomic diversity of infrapatellar fat pad during knee osteoarthritis.
biological_context: Infrapatellar fat pad during knee osteoarthritis
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: This study uses a multiomic approach to identify cell types and transcriptomic profiles within the infrapatellar fat pad (IFP) and to determine differences related to knee osteoarthritis (KOA), sex, and obesity. It maps cell subclusters, resolves cell distributions and communication networks using spatial transcriptomics, and defines metabolic differences in fibroblasts.

title: ITGA5<sup>+</sup> synovial fibroblasts orchestrate proinflammatory niche formation by remodelling the local immune microenvironment in rheumatoid arthritis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial gene expressions', 'Immunohistology', 'multiplex immunofluorescence', 'flow cytometry', 'bulk RNA sequencing']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the phenotypic heterogeneity of tissue-resident synovial fibroblasts and their role in inflammatory response in rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The researchers identified a novel ITGA5+ synovial fibroblast population that remodels the local immune microenvironment and exacerbates RA development by inducing TPH differentiation. Therapeutic modulation of this subpopulation is proposed as a potential treatment strategy for RA.

title: Neural stem cell quiescence and activation dynamics are regulated by feedback input from their progeny under homeostatic and regenerative conditions.
biological_context: Mouse adult subventricular neural stem cell (NSC) niche
main_goals: This study investigates the feedback mechanisms regulating neural stem cell (NSC) quiescence and activation dynamics in the mouse adult subventricular zone. It reveals that transient amplifying cells (TAPs), the progeny of NSCs, repress NSC proliferative states through ephrin signaling and calcium dynamics. The findings suggest a feedback loop that maintains stem cell pools throughout life.

title: Deciphering the cell type-specific and zonal distribution of drug-metabolizing enzymes, transporters, and transcription factors in livers of mice using single-cell transcriptomics.
biological_context: Mouse liver cell types and zonal distribution of drug-processing genes
main_goals: To characterize the distribution of drug-processing genes (DPGs) in mouse liver using published single-cell and nuclei transcriptomic datasets, subjected to zonal deconvolution. The study aimed to identify DPG enrichment in different liver cell types and zones, providing insights into xenobiotic biotransformation.

title: Spatial transcriptomics defines the cell-specific RNA landscape of equine dorsal root ganglia.
biological_context: Equine dorsal root ganglia (DRG) in healthy adult horses, with potential application to spinal neurodegenerative conditions in horses.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images', 'immunohistochemistry (implied by cell markers and regions of interest)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation (implied by regions of interest based on markers)', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To define the spatial transcriptomic landscape of equine dorsal root ganglia (DRG) in healthy adult horses using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify cell-specific gene expression differences in distinct DRG regions and validate the approach for future application to disease states.

title: Autosomal dominant SLURP1 variants cause palmoplantar keratoderma and progressive symmetric erythrokeratoderma.
biological_context: Epidermal differentiation disorders (ichthyosis and palmoplantar keratoderma (PPK)) and progressive symmetric erythrokeratoderma (PSEK) phenotypes.
data_modalities_used: ['whole-exome sequencing', 'patient keratinocytes', 'high-resolution spatial transcriptomics', 'quantitative cytokine profiling', 'mass spectrometry']
main_goals: To identify novel genetic variants that cause palmoplantar keratoderma (PPK) and progressive symmetric erythrokeratoderma (PSEK) phenotypes. The study investigated variant consequences using in silico predictions, patient keratinocyte assays, high-resolution spatial transcriptomics, and quantitative cytokine profiling. The findings expand the phenotypic spectrum of epidermal differentiation disorders due to SLURP1 variants and suggest a novel mechanism of action for dominant SLURP1 pathogenic variants.

title: A comprehensive spatio-cellular map of the human hypothalamus.
main_goals: The paper presents a comprehensive spatio-cellular transcriptional map of the human hypothalamus, named 'HYPOMAP', by combining single-nucleus sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies conserved and divergent cell types between humans and mice, and finds neuronal clusters enriched for body mass index (BMI) genome-wide association study genes, highlighting potential therapeutic targets for metabolic and other disorders.

title: Spatially resolved transcriptomics reveal the determinants of primary resistance to immunotherapy in NSCLC with mature tertiary lymphoid structures.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with mature tertiary lymphoid structures (mTLSs)
main_goals: To investigate the determinants of primary resistance to immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICIs) in NSCLC patients with mature tertiary lymphoid structures (mTLSs). The study uses spatial transcriptomics and multiplex immunofluorescence to identify specific cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) subsets that contribute to immune exclusion and T cell exhaustion, leading to resistance.

title: MALDI MSI-based spatial amine metabolomics revealing the protective effect of combination therapy against cerebral ischemia/reperfusion-induced brain injury in rats.
main_goals: This paper investigates the protective effects of Edaravone (Eda) and Ginaton injection (Gin) combination therapy against cerebral ischemia/reperfusion (I/R) injury in a rat model. It uses MALDI MSI-based spatial amine metabolomics to reveal the metabolic alterations and the regulatory effect of the combination treatment on these disorders in the cerebral cortex and striatum.

title: Targeting fibroblast-endothelial cell interactions in LAM pathogenesis using 3D spheroid models and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The study aimed to investigate fibroblast-endothelial cell interactions in LAM pathogenesis using 3D spheroid models and spatial transcriptomics. They identified elevated PDGFR and FGFR in LAMFs and demonstrated that sorafenib, a multikinase inhibitor, significantly reduced invasion in LAMF-LEC spheroids. The findings suggest VEGF-A and basic FGF as potential therapeutic targets and multikinase inhibition as a promising strategy for LAM.

title: Effects of maternal edible THC consumption on offspring lung growth and function in a rhesus macaque model.
biological_context: Offspring lung growth and function following prenatal exposure to THC
data_modalities_used: ['magnetic resonance imaging', 'pulmonary function testing', 'bulk RNAseq', 'whole genome bisulfite sequencing', 'spatial RNAseq', 'bronchial alveolar lavage']
main_goals: This study aimed to determine if in utero exposure to delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) negatively impacts offspring lung development and function in a rhesus macaque model. The researchers used MRI, pulmonary function testing, and molecular analyses to investigate these effects. Findings suggest that prenatal THC exposure may alter epigenetic regulation and adversely affect lung development and function.

title: New Anti-Fibrotic Strategies for Keloids: Insights From Single-Cell Multi-Omics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Communication Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation']
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular heterogeneity and molecular mechanisms of keloids using single-cell multi-omics. It identified key fibroblast subpopulations with opposing roles in fibrosis and explored endothelial cell involvement in abnormal angiogenesis and EMT. The findings provide theoretical foundations for new anti-fibrotic treatment strategies targeting specific fibroblast subpopulations.

title: Immune microenvironment spatial landscapes of tertiary lymphoid structures in gastric cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates the prognostic impact and immune microenvironment characteristics of tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) in gastric cancer (GC). It used multispectral imaging and single-cell/spatial transcriptomics to analyze immune cell infiltration and interactions within TLS. The findings highlight the positive prognostic value of TLS and the intricate cell-cell communications they facilitate.

title: Spatial transcriptomics identifies molecular niche dysregulation associated with distal lung remodeling in pulmonary fibrosis.
main_goals: To use image-based spatial transcriptomics to analyze gene expression in the distal lung of patients with pulmonary fibrosis, characterizing spatial niches and identifying molecular changes associated with disease progression. The study aims to provide a spatially resolved view of pulmonary fibrosis and establish methods applicable to other spatial transcriptomic studies.

title: Multiomic analysis uncovers a continuous spectrum of differentiation and Wnt-MDK-driven immune evasion in hepatoblastoma.
main_goals: To provide a comprehensive analysis of the tumor microenvironment of hepatoblastoma, unveiling its spatial architecture and key signaling mechanisms. The study identified tumor transcriptional programs, characterized the immune environment, and discovered a Wnt-MDK-driven mechanism for immune evasion. Findings suggest midkine as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Succinate supplementation alleviates liver cancer by inhibiting the FN1/SQLE axis-mediated cholesterol biosynthesis.
main_goals: This study investigated the role of exogenous succinate in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It reports that succinate supplementation exhibits an anti-tumorigenic effect by inhibiting cell proliferation and tumor formation. The mechanism involves FN1-activated SQLE-related cholesterol biosynthesis, suggesting succinate's potential as a therapeutic agent for HCC.

title: CD8 + T cells mediate vaccination-induced lymphatic containment of latent Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection following immunosuppression, while B cells are dispensable.
biological_context: Latent Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection in lymphatics
main_goals: This study investigated the immunological mechanisms underlying the containment and reactivation of latent lymphatic Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection following immunosuppression. It revealed that CD8+ T cells, but not B cells, are critical for preventing reactivation induced by vaccination, despite CD4+ T cell deficiency.

title: Multi-omics analysis of core E3 ubiquitin ligase identifies prognostic biomarkers associated with immune infiltration and drug sensitivity in lung adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify key E3 ubiquitin ligases involved in LUAD progression, investigate their prognostic value, immune infiltration associations, and drug sensitivity potential. The researchers systematically analyzed their expression, localization, and functional enrichment pathways. The findings suggest these ligases could serve as molecular biomarkers for LUAD patient outcomes.

title: A single-cell and spatial wheat root atlas with cross-species annotations delineates conserved tissue-specific marker genes and regulators.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Molecular Sequence Annotation', 'Gene Expression Regulation', 'Gene Regulatory Networks']
main_goals: This paper generated a single-cell and spatial transcriptomics atlas of soil-grown wheat roots. It annotated cell clusters by transferring annotations from related species and validated predictions using spatial transcriptomics. The study identified conserved tissue-specific marker genes and generated cell type-specific gene regulatory networks for wheat and other species.

title: MSC-EVs and UCB-EVs promote skin wound healing and spatial transcriptome analysis.
biological_context: skin wound healing and scar formation
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'electron microscopy', 'nanoparticle tracking analysis', 'western blot']
main_goals: This study investigated the effects of MSC-EVs and UCB-EVs on skin wound healing and scar formation reduction in mice. It utilized spatial transcriptomics to analyze cellular heterogeneity and molecular pathways involved in the healing process. The findings suggest these EVs are promising agents for promoting skin wound healing.

title: Cellular Crosstalk Promotes Hepatic Progenitor Cell Proliferation and Stellate Cell Activation in 3D Co-culture.
biological_context: Liver damage, ductular reaction, and liver fibrosis
data_modalities_used: ['fluorescently labeled progenitor cells', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'human liver explants']
main_goals: This paper reports on an in vitro co-culture system to examine the functional interaction between hepatic progenitor cells and activated hepatic stellate cells (HSCs). The study demonstrates that close contact between these cells enhances progenitor cell proliferation and HSC activation, recapitulating events observed in liver damage. The developed 3D co-culture model provides evidence for direct interactions sufficient to drive responses similar to ductular reaction and fibrosis, paving the way for further research into liver pathology.

title: Lactational high weight loss impairs follicular development by causing mitochondrial dysfunction of ovarian cells in sows and mitigated by butyrate supplement.
biological_context: Ovarian follicular development in sows and its impairment during lactational high weight loss, with mitigation by butyrate.
data_modalities_used: ['Spatial transcriptomics', 'Immunofluorescent staining', 'Transmission electron microscopy', 'Hormone detection', 'Western blot']
main_goals: To explore the mechanism by which high weight loss during lactation in sows damages follicular development and to investigate the mitigating effect of butyrate treatment. The research aims to elucidate how lactational high weight loss impacts mitochondrial function and steroidogenesis in ovarian cells, leading to impaired follicular development, and to demonstrate that butyrate can alleviate these effects.

title: TRα1 mutant suppresses KLF9 to cause endometrial metaplasia with ectopic IL-33 expression leading to uterine fibrosis and infertility.
biological_context: Uterine metaplasia and infertility in mice
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize the molecular events leading to infertility in a mouse model with a mutated TRα1 receptor. It identified endometrial metaplasia, suppressed KLF9, ectopic IL-33 expression, and uterine fibrosis as key contributors to infertility. The findings provide insights into uterine epithelial morphogenesis and the impact of thyroid dysfunction on female fertility.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Cancer and Stromal Cell Heterogeneity Between Center and Invasive Front of Pancreatic Cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study utilized digital spatial profiling to compare the transcriptional profiles of cancer cells and cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) between the tumor center and invasive front of human PDAC. It identified significant inter-regional heterogeneity in pathways related to cellular stress, proliferation, glycolysis, and epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT), confirmed by immunohistochemistry.

title: A high-resolution view of the immune and stromal cell response to Haemophilus ducreyi infection in human volunteers.
biological_context: Human skin infection with Haemophilus ducreyi
main_goals: To provide a high-resolution view of the immune and stromal cell response to Haemophilus ducreyi infection in human skin. The study characterizes multiple cell types within infected human skin using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics, determining the cellular origin of differentially expressed transcripts. It identifies enriched immune cell types in pustules and highlights type I interferon stimulation in macrophages near abscesses, suggesting mechanisms for the failure of immune clearance.

title: Spatial metabolic analysis of the regulatory effects of DL-3-n-butylphthalide in a cerebral ischemia-reperfusion mouse model.
main_goals: This study aimed to profile the metabolic alterations induced by DL-3-n-butylphthalide (NBP) during cerebral ischemia-reperfusion using spatial metabolomics. It investigated NBP's therapeutic role in improving energy supply, decreasing autophagy, and enhancing unsaturated fatty acid biosynthesis. The findings shed light on novel mechanisms of NBP efficacy in treating cerebral ischemia/reperfusion injury.

title: Mouse gut blueprint: regionality and resilience.
main_goals: To create a comprehensive blueprint of the mouse gut using spatial transcriptomics, exploring its regionality and resilience under perturbed conditions. The work highlights the adaptive capabilities of the murine gut's regionalized structure and how it functions and responds to external challenges.

title: The key role of the NUDT3 gene in lung adenocarcinoma progression and its association with the manganese ion metabolism family.
main_goals: This study aimed to systematically analyze the expression characteristics of the NUDT3 gene in lung adenocarcinoma and its association with tumor progression, integrating single-cell transcriptomic analysis and experimental validation using cell lines. The findings highlight the critical role of NUDT3 in lung adenocarcinoma progression and its potential as a therapeutic target.

title: Spatial multi-omics characterizes GPR35-relevant lipid metabolism signatures across liver zonation in MASLD.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify spatially distributed genes and metabolites regulated by GPR35 in different liver zones during MASLD progression using lipid metabolomics, spatial transcriptomics, and spatial metabolomics. The findings highlight GPR35's role in influencing lipid accumulation, inflammation, and hepatocyte damage repair in a zonal manner, thereby impacting MASLD progression.

title: Multiomics characterization of breast angiosarcoma from an Asian cohort reveals enrichment for angiogenesis signaling pathway and tumor-infiltrating macrophages.
biological_context: Breast angiosarcoma and head and neck angiosarcoma
main_goals: This paper investigates the clinical, molecular, and immune features of breast angiosarcoma (AS-B) in an Asian cohort and compares them to head and neck angiosarcoma (AS-HN). It utilized whole genome sequencing, gene expression profiling, and spatial transcriptomics to identify enriched pathways and cell types. The study suggests anti-angiogenic therapy as a potential treatment for AS-B.

title: Stromal architecture and fibroblast subpopulations with opposing effects on outcomes in hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['pathological image analysis', 'spatial proteomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'epigenomic sequencing', 'Stereo-seq']
main_goals: This study dissects the spatial heterogeneity of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) using pathological image analysis and spatial proteomics. It identifies two distinct stromal archetypes and corresponding fibroblast subpopulations (CAF-FAP and CAF-C7) spatially correlated with patient prognosis. The research highlights functional units and demonstrates that inhibiting CAF-FAP combined with anti-PD-1 improves tumor regression, suggesting stroma-targeted strategies for HCC.

title: Gene expression patterns of the developing human face at single cell resolution reveal cell type contributions to normal facial variation and disease risk.
main_goals: This paper presents a single-nucleus RNA sequencing atlas of human craniofacial development to understand cell type contributions to facial variation and disease risk. It resolves transcriptional dynamics of major cell types and subtypes, reveals human-biased gene expression differences, and links genetic variation to developmental processes. The findings provide insights into the origins of craniofacial disorders, the genetic basis of facial variation, and the evolutionary legacy of ancient hominins.

title: Bypassing cisplatin resistance in Nrf2 hyperactivated head and neck cancer through effective PI3Kinase targeting.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: This study evaluates the efficacy of PI3K inhibitors (PI3Ki) in bypassing Nrf2-mediated cisplatin resistance in HNSCC. The researchers investigated transcriptomic, metabolomic, and signaling changes driven by PI3Kis in cisplatin-resistant HNSCCs in vitro and tested efficacy in vivo in various xenograft models. The findings highlight the critical role of the PI3K-AKT-mTOR pathway in cisplatin-resistant HNSCC and the therapeutic potential of PI3K inhibitors like gedatolisib.

title: The spatial landscape of cancer hallmarks reveals patterns of tumor ecological dynamics and drug sensitivity.
biological_context: Human primary untreated tumors across 10 cancer types, with a focus on bladder cancer for treatment sensitivity analysis.
main_goals: This paper explores the spatial distribution of cancer hallmarks across various tumor types using spatial transcriptomics. It investigates how hallmark activity is organized between cancer cells and the tumor microenvironment, how genomic distance between subclones affects hallmark specialization, and how hallmark relationships relate to drug sensitivity in bladder cancer.

title: Reverse-engineering the FLT3-PI3K/AKT axis to enhance TILs function and improve prognosis in ovarian and cervical cancers.
main_goals: This study integrated single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to explore immune regulation in ovarian and cervical cancers, focusing on the PI3K/AKT pathway and FLT3. It provides spatially resolved evidence of FLT3's immune-modulatory role and suggests it as a promising immunotherapeutic target.

title: Natural killer cells occupy unique spatial neighborhoods in HER2<sup>-</sup> and HER2<sup>+</sup> human breast cancers.
biological_context: HER2- and HER2+ human breast cancers
main_goals: This study aims to evaluate NK cells at the single-cell spatial proteomics level and illustrates how spatial characteristics of NK cell neighborhoods vary within the context of HER2- and HER2+ breast cancers. It utilizes multiplex immunohistochemistry to quantitatively interrogate leukocyte lineages, focusing on NK cells and their phenotypes, in breast cancer patient cohorts.

title: Spatially resolved transcriptomics of benign and malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors.
main_goals: The study aimed to determine the spatial and biological heterogeneity of PNSTs using spatial transcriptomics on diseased peripheral nerve tissue. They identified distinct transcriptional signatures differentiating PNSTs and provided a spatial cellular differentiation map for MPNST. The study integrates morphological and high-dimensional molecular data to improve PNSTs classification.

title: Novel Integration of Spatial and Single-Cell Omics Data Sets Enables Deeper Insights into IPF Pathogenesis.
main_goals: The study integrates spatial multi-omics with scRNA-seq data to identify disease-associated cell types and potential targets for novel therapies in IPF intervention. It uses published spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing data and adopts the Query method and the Overlap method to determine cell type enrichments in histopathological regions. The approach aims to be applicable to other disease areas characterized by spatial heterogeneity.

title: Organizational Principles of the Primate Cerebral Cortex at the Single-Cell Level.
main_goals: The study aims to understand the organizational principles of neurons in the macaque cerebral cortex. By analyzing single-cell spatial transcriptomes, the researchers discover non-random neuronal distribution and the presence of neuronal clusters with specific cell-type combinations. The study suggests conserved organizational principles across cortical regions.

title: APOE Christchurch enhances a disease-associated microglial response to plaque but suppresses response to tau pathology.
main_goals: The study investigates the effect of the ApoeCh variant on the development of AD-related pathology using the 5xFAD model of amyloidosis and the PS19 model of tauopathy. It explores the impact of the ApoeCh variant on AD pathological development and the brain's response to plaques and tau using immunohistochemical, biochemical analysis, single-cell spatial omics, and bulk proteomics. The findings highlight the ability of the ApoeCh variant to modulate microglial responses based on the type of pathology.

title: Tissue-resident memory CD8 T cell diversity is spatiotemporally imprinted.
main_goals: The study aims to understand the origins of T<sub>RM</sub> cell diversity in the small intestine by investigating the spatiotemporal distribution of T<sub>RM</sub> cell differentiation. The goal is to determine how distinct tissue niches drive phenotypic heterogeneity of T<sub>RM</sub> cells. The study reveals that the regionalized signaling of the intestinal architecture supports two distinct T<sub>RM</sub> cell states.

title: Molecular and cellular morphology of placenta unveils new mechanisms of reproductive immunology.
main_goals: The study aims to investigate the cellular and molecular characteristics of early and late phase placentas to understand the immune regulation of human reproductive process. It seeks to trace the fetal and maternal origin of cells and understand the immune interactions between the fetus and the mother. The findings suggest a fetus-driven mechanism of immune balance involving cellular and humoral immunity in human reproduction.

title: The XCL1-XCR1 axis supports intestinal tissue residency and antitumor immunity.
main_goals: The main goal was to investigate the role of the XCL1-XCR1 axis in intestinal tissue-resident memory T cell (TRM) formation and antitumor immunity. The study found that XCL1 is critical for TRM formation and that cDC1 supports the positioning of intestinal CD8+ T cells. Enforced Xcl1 expression promoted intratumoral cDC1 accumulation and T cell persistence, leading to improved survival.

title: Single-cell transcriptomics reveals the heterogeneity and function of mast cells in human ccRCC.
main_goals: This study investigates the heterogeneity and effects of mast cells (MCs) in clear cell renal carcinoma (ccRCC) using single-cell transcriptomics, spatial transcriptomics and multiplex immunohistochemistry. The study revealed increased MC density in ccRCC and a shift in the MC phenotype from CTSG<sup>high</sup>MCs to more activated VEGFA+MCs, providing a potential therapeutic target for inhibiting ccRCC progression.

title: Targeting immune cellular populations and transcription factors: unraveling the therapeutic potential of JQF for NAFLD.
biological_context: Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) in mice
main_goals: The main goal was to investigate the mechanism of action of Jiangtang Qingre Formula (JQF) in treating NAFLD. The study used a high-fat diet-induced NAFLD mouse model and employed single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to understand JQF's treatment mechanisms by analyzing immune cell populations and transcription factors.

title: Comprehensive single-cell atlas of colorectal neuroendocrine tumors with liver metastases: unraveling tumor microenvironment heterogeneity between primary lesions and metastases.
biological_context: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumors with liver metastases
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry', 'multiplex immunofluorescence']
main_goals: The study aims to elucidate the variations in the tumor microenvironment (TME) between primary lesions (PL) and liver metastases (LM) in colorectal neuroendocrine tumors with liver metastases (CRNELM) patients using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, bulk RNA sequencing, and multiplex immunohistochemistry/immunofluorescence. The research identified distinct cell subsets and receptor-ligand interactions that may drive TME discrepancies and support metastatic tumor growth, highlighting potential therapeutic targets.

title: Finding and Profiling Renal Cells with Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper aims to identify and profile renal cells using spatial transcriptomics.

title: Single-cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Illuminate Bat Immunity and Barrier Tissue Evolution.
biological_context: Egyptian fruit bat gut, lung, and blood cells
main_goals: To investigate transcriptional patterns in Egyptian fruit bat tissues using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics of gut, lung, and blood cells. The study compares gene expression between bat, mouse, and human to identify unique transcriptional divergences, particularly in the complement system, that may be linked to bat resistance to pathogens. The study highlights the intricate evolutionary landscape of bat immunity.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptome and metabolome landscapes of cotton somatic embryos.
main_goals: To investigate the spatial and single-cell expression profiles of key genes and the metabolic patterns of key metabolites during cotton somatic embryogenesis by integrated scRNA-seq, ST, and SM. To functionally characterize the potential roles of two representative marker genes, AATP1 and DOX2, in the regulation of cotton somatic embryo development. To provide a publicly available web-based resource database for future studies.

title: Genomic and transcriptomic signatures of sequential carcinogenesis from papillary neoplasm to biliary tract cancer.
main_goals: The study aims to provide a comprehensive mutational and spatial transcriptomic landscape of papillary neoplasms of the bile duct and gallbladder. It offers insights into the mechanism of sequential carcinogenesis in papillary biliary tract tumors, pathology-genomic correlations, and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Parenchymal and inflammatory responses to ozone exposure in the aging healthy and surfactant protein C mutant lung.
biological_context: Aging wild-type and mutant mouse lung exposed to ozone
main_goals: The study examines structural, mechanical, and immunological responses to single acute ozone exposure in young, middle-aged, and old mice with and without a mutation in surfactant protein C. It uses spatial transcriptomics to highlight age-dependent shifts in inflammatory and extracellular matrix organization signaling. The results illustrate the structural and immunological impact of ozone in the aging wild-type and mutant lung.

title: Enhancer Dynamics and Spatial Organization Drive Anatomically Restricted Cellular States in the Human Spinal Cord.
main_goals: This study aims to understand the cellular diversity and organization of the healthy human spinal cord by analyzing enhancer dynamics and spatial organization using spatial transcriptomics and single nuclei epigenomics. It focuses on identifying cell-type specific cryptic enhancer activity and glial cell gene regulatory networks along the rostrocaudal axis. The study also addresses the functional significance of cellular organization in the context of paracrine signaling.

title: An integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomic atlas of thyroid cancer progression identifies prognostic fibroblast subpopulations.
main_goals: This study aims to define stromal cell subpopulations and tumor-stromal cross-talk occurring across thyroid cancer using integrated single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and bulk RNA-sequencing. It identifies distinct inflammatory and myofibroblastic cancer-associated fibroblast populations associated with tumor cell invasion and disease progression. The study provides an integrated atlas of thyroid cancer fibroblast subtypes and spatial characterization at sites of tumor invasion and de-differentiation.

title: A constitutive interferon-high immunophenotype defines response to immunotherapy in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: To identify an immunophenotype associated with response to immune checkpoint inhibition (ICI) in metastatic deficient mismatch repair (dMMR) colorectal cancer (CRC) patients. The study reports that an interferon-high immunophenotype locally enriched in cytotoxic lymphocytes and antigen-presenting macrophages is required for response. CD74 abundance can identify the constitutive interferon-high immunophenotype determining clinical benefit in CRC, independently of tumor mutational burden or MMR status.

title: Intratumoral Collagen Deposition Supports Angiogenesis Suggesting Anti-angiogenic Therapy in Armored and Cold Tumors.
main_goals: This study analyzes the association between immuno-collagenic subtypes and angiogenesis across diverse cancer types, focusing on armored & cold tumors. It investigates the role of collagen in driving angiogenesis and responsiveness to anti-angiogenic therapy in LUAD.

title: Single cell approaches define neural stem cell niches and identify microglial ligands that can enhance precursor-mediated oligodendrogenesis.
biological_context: Mouse forebrain neural stem cell niche under homeostatic and injury conditions
data_modalities_used: ['single cell RNA sequencing', 'single cell spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: The study characterizes the forebrain neural stem cell (NSC) niche under homeostatic and injury conditions using single cell RNA sequencing and single cell spatial transcriptomics. It identifies remyelination-associated microglial ligands that promote precursor proliferation and oligodendrogenesis. The data support a model where gliogenesis versus neurogenesis is determined by the local NSC neighborhood.

title: An atlas of neuropathic pain-associated molecular pathological characteristics in the mouse spinal cord.
biological_context: Mouse spinal cord under neuropathic pain conditions
main_goals: The study aims to characterize regional pathological heterogeneity of the spinal cord under neuropathic pain conditions by integrating spatial transcriptomics with single-nucleus RNA-sequencing and bulk RNA-sequencing. It also aims to systematically exhibit "cross-talk omics" between DRG neurons and SC dorsal horn neurons and glial cells, indicating an altered communication profile under NP conditions. Ultimately, it provides a foundation for designing therapeutic targets for neuropathic pain.

title: Distinct myeloid-derived suppressor cell populations in human glioblastoma.
main_goals: The study identifies two distinct MDSC populations in IDT-WT glioblastoma and reveals cross-talk between E-MDSCs and metabolic stem-like tumor cells in the pseudopalisading region. This interaction is absent in IDH-mutant gliomas. The study elucidates specific MDSCs that may facilitate glioblastoma progression and mediate tumor immunosuppression.

title: Spatiotemporal landscape of kidney in a mouse model of hyperuricemia at single-cell level.
main_goals: The paper investigates the spatiotemporal atlas of hyperuricemic nephropathy in a urate oxidase knockout mouse model using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, spatial proteomics, and spatial metabolomics. The goal is to discover emerging targets and pathways related to uric acid excretion.

title: Single-cell analysis reveals Mycobacterium tuberculosis ESX-1-mediated accumulation of permissive macrophages in infected mouse lungs.
biological_context: Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection in mouse lungs
main_goals: This study investigates the role of Mycobacterium tuberculosis (MTB) ESX-1 in mononuclear phagocyte (MNP) heterogeneity and response in mice and murine bone marrow-derived macrophages (BMDM) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The findings suggest that MTB ESX-1 facilitates the recruitment and differentiation of MNPs, which MTB can infect and manipulate for survival. The study identifies an ESX-1-dependent transcriptional signature of immune evasion in lung macrophages and BMDM, and reveals an up-regulation of permissive features within MTB lesions.

title: Elucidating stearoyl metabolism and NCOA4-mediated ferroptosis in gastric cancer liver metastasis through multi-omics single-cell integrative mendelian analysis: advancing personalized immunotherapy strategies.
main_goals: This study aims to enhance the understanding of the relationship between stearoyl metabolism and ferroptosis in promoting liver metastasis of gastric cancer and its role in the regulation of tumor heterogeneity. It also contributes to a deeper understanding of the dynamics of the gastric cancer tumor microenvironment (TME) and provides a basis for the development of better interventions to combat cancer metastasis.

title: Elucidating cardiomyocyte heterogeneity and maturation dynamics through integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study aims to create a comprehensive atlas of the transcriptional profiles of distinct cardiomyocyte subsets in neonatal mouse hearts, elucidating a continuum of maturation states and mapping these states across various cardiac regions. It also aims to identify transitional CMs characterized by a specific transcriptional signature as a potential target for therapeutic strategies.

title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomic analysis reveal a distinct population of APOE<sup>-</sup> cells yielding pathological lymph node metastasis in papillary thyroid cancer.
main_goals: The study aims to identify intratumoral and antimetastatic heterogeneity of advanced PTC using single-cell RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. They identified a distinct APOE- tumor cell population associated with cervical metastasis and poor prognosis and established a machine learning-based scRNA-seq data, 13-gene signature predictive of lymph node metastasis. The functions of APOE in PTC cell proliferation and invasion were confirmed through in vivo and in vitro assays.

title: Metabolically activated and highly polyfunctional intratumoral VISTA<sup>+</sup> regulatory B cells are associated with tumor recurrence in early-stage NSCLC.
main_goals: This study explores the landscape of B cell phenotypes, bioenergetics, and their interaction with T cells in NSCLC using polychromatic flow cytometry, mass cytometry, and spatial transcriptomics. The findings suggest a potential interaction between Bregs and T cells through the VISTA-PSGL-1 axis, that could influence NSCLC recurrence.

title: High cellular plasticity state of medulloblastoma local recurrence and distant dissemination.
main_goals: The main goal of this paper is to characterize cellular diversity and genetic features of medulloblastoma recurrence and dissemination using single-cell and spatial omics approaches. They identified distinct cellular populations and chromosomal alterations during MB progression and a subpopulation termed "high cellular plasticity (HCP)" associated with recurrence. Inhibiting HCP-associated markers suppressed MB progression in preclinical models.

title: Characterizing tertiary lymphoid structures associated single-cell atlas in breast cancer patients.
main_goals: The study aims to investigate TLS associated regions in breast cancer at the single-cell level using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. They identified cell types within the TLS associated regions and analyzed cell-cell communication. They also validated these findings in four independent breast cancer datasets.

title: Spatially resolved rewiring of mitochondria-lipid droplet interactions in hepatic lipid homeostasis.
main_goals: This study investigates the differences in lipid handling in response to nutrient deficiency and excess in hepatocytes using single-cell tissue imaging and spatial proteomics. It reveals extensive remodeling of lipid droplet (LD) and mitochondrial topology in response to dietary conditions and highlights the importance of organelle interactions in lipid metabolism.

title: Acquisition of discrete immune suppressive barriers contributes to the initiation and progression of preinvasive to invasive human lung cancer.
main_goals: The main goal was to construct a high-resolution map of the composition, lineage/functional states, developmental trajectories and multicellular crosstalk networks from microdissected non-solid and solid compartments of individual part-solid lung nodules. They aimed to uncover determinants of early disease emergence and progression in lung cancer.

title: Eosinophils Enhance Granuloma-Mediated Control of Persistent Salmonella Infection.
main_goals: To identify the host-protective role of eosinophils in controlling Salmonella Typhimurium infection within the mesenteric lymph nodes using a mouse model and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to understand how eosinophils contribute to the control of Salmonella exploitation of granuloma macrophages at a key site of bacterial persistence.

title: Cancer Research in the Age of Spatial Omics: Lessons from IMAXT.
main_goals: The IMAXT Cancer Grand Challenges team aimed to develop the "next generation" of pathology and cancer research by creating 3D molecularly annotated maps of tumors using single-cell and spatial omics tools. The team's activities fostered a spatial revolution in biology, enabling investigations into tumor heterogeneity and the tumor microenvironment.

title: Visualizing Cancer Heterogeneity at the Molecular and Cellular Levels: Lessons from Rosetta.
main_goals: The Rosetta team addressed the Cancer Grand Challenges by using spatial-omics approaches centered around mass spectrometry imaging to map tumor heterogeneity at the cellular and molecular scales with different levels of resolution.

title: Investigating lung cancer microenvironment from cell segmentation of pathological image and its application in prognostic stratification.
main_goals: The study aims to improve lung adenocarcinoma prognostic stratification by analyzing cellular abundance from pathological images using Hover-Net. They investigated the clinical and biological significance of epithelial cells, lymphocytes, macrophages, and neutrophils infiltration. The research identifies FABP7 as a prognostic biomarker based on neutrophil infiltration.

title: Spatial Genomics Identifies Heat Shock Proteins as Key Molecular Changes Associated to Adipose Periprostatic Space Invasion in Prostate Cancer.
main_goals: To identify molecular changes during PCa invasion of adipose space using Spatial Transcriptomic Profiling of PCa cells. The study focuses on the differential gene expression in PCa cells from the adipose periprostatic space.

title: Transcriptional determinants of goal-directed learning and representational drift in the parahippocampal cortex.
biological_context: Mouse perirhinal cortex during task learning
main_goals: The study investigates the circuit and molecular mechanisms underlying representational drift in the perirhinal cortex during task learning. They identify an IEG-defined network involved in stimulus-outcome associations and show that BDNF is crucial for task learning and IEG expression. The findings reveal cell types and molecules regulating long-term network stability permissive for task learning and memory allocation.

title: The role of histone lactylation genes in hepatocellular carcinoma prognostic models and their immune cell infiltration features: a comprehensive analysis of single-cell, spatial transcriptome, Mendelian randomization and experiment.
main_goals: The study aims to construct and validate a prognostic model for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) using differentially expressed histone lysine lactylation (Kla) genes. They integrated single-cell analysis, spatial transcriptomics, Mendelian randomization, and experimental validation to explore the role of Kla-related genes in HCC prognosis and immune cell infiltration. The established model may provide new strategies and insights for the treatment and diagnosis of HCC.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomic profiling revealed niche interactions sustaining growth of endometriotic lesions.
main_goals: The study aims to understand the molecular mechanisms underlying endometriosis by performing single-cell and spatial transcriptomic profiling of ectopic lesions and eutopic endometrium. They identified distinct cell populations and signaling pathways contributing to the pathogenesis of endometriosis, offering novel targets for therapeutic intervention.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis reveals significant differences in tumor microenvironment in HPV-dependent and HPV-independent vulvar squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to explore gene expression in HPV-dependent and HPV-independent VSCC. It aims to identify differences in the tumor microenvironment between the two etiologies. The study identifies more immune cells in HPVi SCC than in HPVd SCC.

title: Tigulixostat Alleviates Hyperuricemic Nephropathy by Promoting M2 Macrophage Polarization.
biological_context: Hyperuricemic nephropathy in Uox-KO mouse model
main_goals: This study investigates the effects of Tigulixostat on uric acid levels and hyperuricemic nephropathy (HN) in a Uox-KO mouse model using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial metabolomics, plasma metabolomics, and flow cytometry. The findings suggest Tigulixostat as a promising therapeutic option for managing hyperuricemia and related kidney conditions.

title: Metabolic Atlas of Human Eyelid Infiltrative Basal Cell Carcinoma.
main_goals: This study aims to analyze metabolic differences among iBCC cell types using single-cell and spatial metabolomics analysis and to examine metabolic environment at the tumor invasive area. It establishes a metabolic microenvironment atlas of iBCC, revealing significant metabolic differences and the dominance of lipid and lysosome metabolism. It also identifies potential metabolic markers and characteristic substances in the invasive area, offering new insights for immunotherapy and the exploration of BCC's metabolic mechanisms.

title: Microscopy and spatial-metabolomics identify tissue-specific metabolic pathways uncovering salinity and drought tolerance mechanisms in Avicennia marina and Phoenix dactylifera roots.
biological_context: Avicennia marina and Phoenix dactylifera roots under salinity and drought stress
main_goals: The study aims to uncover shared and distinct adaptive metabolic features in date palm and mangrove roots under salinity and drought stress by integrating tissue imaging with spatial metabolomics (MALDI-MSI). It identifies tissue- and species-specific metabolite distributions and key metabolites involved in stress adaptation pathways.

title: Multi-omics-based mapping of decidualization resistance in patients with a history of severe preeclampsia.
main_goals: The study aims to unravel the cellular and molecular characteristics of decidualization resistance (DR) in patients who have suffered severe preeclampsia (sPE) using a multi-omic strategy. It identifies shifts in cell composition, aberrant cell-cell communication, and disrupted responses to steroid hormones in the endometrium of sPE patients.

title: Antibody-based delivery of interleukin-2 modulates the immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment and achieves cure in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma syngeneic mice.
main_goals: This study investigates the preclinical efficacy of L19-IL2, an innovative targeted therapy based on antibody-cytokine fusion proteins. The fusion protein demonstrated potent anti-tumor activity in mice with pancreatic tumors resistant to standard chemotherapy, enhancing immune infiltration and cytotoxicity, remodeling the tumor microenvironment. The results pave the way for novel targeted treatment strategies in PDAC.

title: Subthreshold repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation induces cortical layer-, brain region-, and protocol-dependent neural plasticity.
main_goals: The study aims to determine the molecular mechanisms of rTMS and the brain regions they occur in by mapping changes to gene expression across the mouse brain in response to two rTMS protocols using spatial transcriptomics. The results reveal that rTMS alters the expression of genes related to several cellular processes and neural plasticity mechanisms across the brain in a brain region- and protocol-dependent manner, especially in the cortex.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Multi-Omics Analysis Reveal That Targeting JAG1 in Epithelial Cells Reduces Periodontal Inflammation and Alveolar Bone Loss.
main_goals: This study aims to compare the cellular mechanisms involved in periodontitis between humans and mice using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and spatial proteomics. It identifies key conserved and divergent features in cellular landscapes and transcriptional profiles across the two species and reveals a novel regulatory mechanism by which epithelial cells modulate macrophage behavior and inflammation through the JAG1-Notch pathway. The study validates that JAG1 inhibition reduces inflammation in epithelial cells, mitigating periodontitis.

title: Cellular cartography reveals mouse prostate organization and determinants of castration resistance.
main_goals: The study integrates single-cell RNA sequencing, single-cell multiomics, and spatial transcriptomics to define the cellular basis of cell identity and castration response in the mouse prostate. It aims to identify cellular orthologs and key determinants of ADT response and resistance by leveraging these data along with a meta-analysis of human prostates and prostate cancer. The findings reveal lobe-specific luminal epithelial cell types and androgen-insensitive stem-like epithelial populations, as well as castration-resistant luminal epithelial cells activating stress-responsive and stemness programs.

title: Interleukin-1β Drives Disease Progression in Arrhythmogenic Cardiomyopathy.
main_goals: The study aims to identify disease-associated spatial niches in ACM and investigate the role of interleukin-1β (IL-1β) in disease progression. By performing snRNAseq and spatial transcriptomics on myocardial samples, the researchers identified inflammatory-fibrotic niches and found that targeting IL-1β attenuates fibrosis, reduces inflammation, and preserves cardiac function in a mouse model of ACM. These findings suggest that targeting IL-1β may improve outcomes for patients with ACM.

title: Dendritic cells type 1 control the formation, maintenance, and function of tertiary lymphoid structures in cancer.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and other human tumors
main_goals: The study investigates the role of dendritic cells (DC), specifically conventional DC type 1 (cDC1), in the formation, maintenance, and function of tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) in solid tumors, focusing on NSCLC. It identifies cDC1's importance in antigen presentation and CD40 signaling for TLS maintenance and antitumor immunity. The findings suggest cDC1-targeting therapies as a strategy to enhance TLS function and improve anti-tumor immunity.

title: Molecular and spatial analysis of ganglion cells on retinal flatmounts: diversity, topography, and perivascularity.
main_goals: The study investigates the spatial organization of retinal ganglion cell (RGC) types in the mouse retina using MERFISH and immunohistochemistry. It identifies non-uniform distributions of RGC types and the existence of perivascular RGCs, showing preferential survival after optic nerve crush. The findings suggest a potential neuroprotective role of proximity to blood vessels for specific RGC types.

title: Multimodal transcriptomics reveal neurogenic aging trajectories and age-related regional inflammation in the dentate gyrus.
main_goals: Characterize transcriptomic signatures of neurogenic cells and their surrounding DG niche, identifying molecular changes associated with neurogenic aging. Identify the regional invasion of inflammatory cells into the hippocampus with age and show that early-onset neuroinflammation decreases neurogenic activity. Reveal the lifelong molecular dynamics of NSCs and their surrounding neurogenic DG niche with age.

title: Spatial transcriptomics unveils estrogen-modulated immune responses and structural alterations in the ectocervical mucosa of depot medroxyprogesterone acetate users.
biological_context: Ectocervical tissue from Kenyan sex workers
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to reveal the spatial localization of altered molecular markers in the ectocervical tissue of DMPA users. It identifies estrogen-modulated distinct ectocervical transcriptional profiles associated with DMPA usage and highlights spatially restricted activation of innate immune responses and dysregulation of barrier integrity markers.

title: Spatially-resolved analyses of muscle invasive bladder cancer microenvironment unveil a distinct fibroblast cluster associated with prognosis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study uses imaging mass cytometry (IMC) and single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) to assess the spatial heterogeneity of the MIBC microenvironment. They identified a distinct fibroblast cluster associated with poor prognosis. The study also identified potential L-R pairs involved in fibroblast-endothelial cell interactions.

title: Exploring the Molecular Mechanisms of Fisetin in Treating Periodontitis Through Multiomics and Network Pharmacology.
main_goals: To investigate the therapeutic effects of fisetin in treating periodontitis using network pharmacology, animal models, in vitro experiments, and single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify key cell populations affected by fisetin and validate its potential as a therapeutic agent for periodontitis.

title: Spatiotemporal dynamics of early oogenesis in pigs.
main_goals: The study integrates single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to understand spatial-temporal gene expression profiles and explore the spatial organization of ovarian microenvironments during early oogenesis in pigs. The work provides insight into the spatial characteristics of early oogenesis and the regulatory role of ovarian microenvironments in germ cell fate within a spatial context. The study also highlights the utility of pigs as valuable models for studying human oogenesis in a spatial context.

title: Molecular and spatial analysis of tertiary lymphoid structures in Sjogren's syndrome.
main_goals: The study aims to construct a cellular and spatial map of key components involved in the formation and function of tertiary lymphoid structures in Sjogren's disease by combining single-cell RNA-sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and proteomics. It identifies a fibroblast cell state and a pericyte/mural cell state with potential immunological functions, which may provide therapeutic cues for tertiary lymphoid structure-associated conditions in autoimmunity and cancer.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of healthy and fibrotic human liver at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: The study aims to map the spatial organization of cells in healthy and fibrotic human livers at single-cell resolution using MERFISH and snRNA-seq. It investigates the zonal distribution of hepatocytes, subsets of macrophages and mesenchymal populations, and the relationship between hepatocyte ploidy and gene expression. The study also identifies hepatocyte populations that expand with injury and lack zonal distributions in fibrotic livers.

title: Spatial Organization of Macrophages in CTL-Rich Hepatocellular Carcinoma Influences CTL Antitumor Activity.
data_modalities_used: ['multiplexed in situ staining', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial immune variations in CTL-rich HCCs to understand heterogeneous clinical outcomes. It identifies macrophage aggregation as a distinctive spatial pattern associated with an immunosuppressive microenvironment and poor prognosis. The findings suggest that the spatial distribution of macrophages is a biomarker of their functional diversities and microenvironment status.

title: Lineage Recording in Human Brain Organoids with iTracer.
main_goals: This paper provides a detailed protocol for applying iTracer, a lineage recorder, to study clonality and lineage dynamics during brain organoid development. iTracer combines reporter barcodes with inducible CRISPR-Cas9 scarring and is compatible with single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It can be adapted to any iPSC-derived culture system to dissect lineage dynamics.

title: Multi-omics approach reveals TGF-β signaling-driven senescence in periodontium stem cells.
biological_context: Periodontal ligament stem cells (PDLSCs) in murine jawbone tissues and human PDLSCs
main_goals: This study aims to clarify the role of TGF-β1 in PDLSC senescence and identify the underlying molecular mechanisms. The study presents the first spatially resolved transcriptomic landscape of murine jawbone tissues and uncovers DNA methylation as a crucial mechanism underlying TGF-β1-induced PDLSC senescence. These findings illuminate a previously unrecognized link between TGF-β1 signaling, ROS production, and epigenetic regulation.

title: A spatially resolved multi-omic single-cell atlas of soybean development.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: The study created a spatially resolved single-cell atlas of gene expression and chromatin accessibility across ten soybean tissues. They identified cell types, accessible chromatin regions, and transcription factor motifs defining cell identities. They also explored gene regulatory networks underpinning legume symbiotic nitrogen fixation and identified key regulators during embryogenesis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals unique metabolic profile and key oncogenic regulators of cervical squamous cell carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The study aims to understand the tumor microenvironment and metabolic characteristics of cervical squamous cell carcinoma using spatial transcriptomics, single-cell RNA sequencing, and TCGA data.
