The research identifies potential cancer-promoting factors and offers a valuable foundation for developing more effective treatment strategies for CSCC.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma with lymph node metastases.
biological_context: Esophageal squamous cell carcinoma with lymph node metastases
main_goals: This study aims to explore the spatial and molecular attributes of primary tumor samples, adjacent tissues, metastatic and non-metastatic lymph nodes in ESCC patients using single-cell sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and multiplex immunohistochemistry. The analysis revealed specific subclusters of epithelial cells enriched in metastatic lymph nodes and implicated stromal cells in ESCC metastasis. The findings enhance our comprehension of the cellular and molecular aspects of metastatic lymph nodes in ESCC patients.

title: Tertiary Lymphoid Structures are Linked to Enhanced Antitumor Immunity and Better Prognosis in Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates the relationship between tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) and muscle-invasive bladder cancer (MIBC). The findings indicate that elevated levels of B cells and TLS correlate with improved prognoses in patients with MIBC. A TLS-specific gene signature is developed that effectively predicts outcomes in MIBC and other cancers.

title: Spatial proteomics reveals sirtuin 1 to be a determinant of T-cell infiltration in human melanoma.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'microscopy', 'matrix-assisted laser desorption mass spectrometry imaging', 'liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: The study aims to decipher the proteomic landscape in human melanoma and identify potential therapeutic targets within the tumor microenvironment. Spatial proteomics was used to identify proteins enriched in tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte (TiL) compartments. Sirtuin 1 (SIRT1) was identified as a potential regulator of T-cell infiltration and a target for improving the efficacy of immune checkpoint inhibition.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis drives PET imaging of tight junction protein expression in pancreatic cancer theranostics.
main_goals: The study aims to identify and validate molecular targets for PET imaging in pancreatic cancer using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics data from human surgical samples. They develop a peptide-based molecular imaging agent targeted to claudin-4. The work motivates a data-driven approach to selection of molecular targets.

title: CRP deposition in human abdominal aortic aneurysm is associated with transcriptome alterations toward aneurysmal pathogenesis: insights from in situ spatial whole transcriptomic analysis.
main_goals: Investigate the effects of C-reactive protein (CRP) deposition on vessel walls in abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) by analyzing spatially resolved changes in gene expression. The aim was to elucidate pathways contributing to disease progression by comparing high and low CRP groups using spatial transcriptomics.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal SPP1-CD44 signaling drives primary resistance to immune checkpoint inhibitors in RCC.
main_goals: This study aims to unravel the tumor-immune interactions and signaling pathways driving primary resistance to ICIs in RCC by integrating single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and clinical sample analysis. The findings reveal a potential mechanism by which SPP1-CD44 signaling mediates tumor-immune cell interactions leading to ICI resistance, providing a theoretical basis for targeting and disrupting this signaling to overcome primary resistance in RCC.

title: THBS2 + cancer-associated fibroblasts promote EMT leading to oxaliplatin resistance via COL8A1-mediated PI3K/AKT activation in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: The study aims to elucidate the mechanisms by which specific subsets of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) contribute to oxaliplatin resistance in colorectal cancer (CRC). The study identified that THBS2 specifically derived from subsets of CAFs promotes oxaliplatin resistance by interacting with malignant cells via the collagen pathway, activating the PI3K-AKT signaling pathway and promoting EMT.

title: Spatiotemporal single-cell roadmap of human skin wound healing.
main_goals: The study aims to understand cellular dynamics and coordination in human wound repair by conducting single-cell multi-omics analyses on human skin wound tissues across different healing phases. It identifies FOSL1 as a critical driver of re-epithelialization and reveals the sequential support of keratinocyte migration by pro-inflammatory macrophages and fibroblasts. The study also compares human and mouse acute wound transcriptomes and uncovers a link between failed keratinocyte migration and impaired inflammatory response in chronic wounds.

title: Spatial metabolomics reveal metabolic alternations in the injured mice kidneys induced by triclocarban treatment.
main_goals: This study investigates the nephrotoxicity induced by long-term triclocarban (TCC) treatment in a mouse model using MALDI-MSI. It reveals the spatial distribution and abundance changes of TCC and its metabolites in the kidney, along with alterations in specific metabolic pathways associated with kidney damage.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Delineate the Microstructure and Immune Landscape of Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma in the Leading-Edge Area.
main_goals: The study aims to characterize the tumor microenvironment, especially the leading-edge area, of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (ICC) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It investigates the interactions between tumor cells and immune cells and identifies a unique 'triad structure' that promotes tumor growth and progression.

title: Encompassing view of spatial and single-cell RNA sequencing renews the role of the microvasculature in human atherosclerosis.
main_goals: The study aimed to generate an integrative high-resolution map of human atherosclerotic plaques by combining single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data to reveal cell-type-specific expression changes and spatially constrained alterations in cell-cell communication in atherosclerosis.

title: Integrative multi-omics analysis reveals a novel subtype of hepatocellular carcinoma with biological and clinical relevance.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'proteomic analysis', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics sequencing', 'genome sequencing', 'immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: The study aimed to construct a robust prognostic model for HCC and identify novel subgroups at the single-cell level using multi-omics data integration. This approach could potentially assist in the assessment of prognostic risk for HCC patients and facilitate personalized drug therapy. The study identifies a novel subtype, XPO1+Epithelial, associated with high-risk patients and influenced by fibroblasts.

title: A specific gene expression program underlies antigen archiving by lymphatic endothelial cells in mammalian lymph nodes.
main_goals: The study aims to understand how lymphatic endothelial cells (LECs) achieve durable antigen archiving in lymph nodes and whether LECs with high levels of antigen express unique transcriptional programs. They identify a unique transcriptional program within archiving LECs that predicts LEC archiving capacity and validate this model in mouse and human independent data sets. They also show that LEC antigen acquisition and archiving capacity can be improved over multiple exposures.

title: Multimodal Spatial Profiling Reveals Immune Suppression and Microenvironment Remodeling in Fallopian Tube Precursors to High-Grade Serous Ovarian Carcinoma.
biological_context: Fallopian tube precursors to high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma (HGSOC)
main_goals: This study integrates high-plex imaging and spatial transcriptomics to analyze human tissue samples at different stages of HGSOC development. The goal is to reveal immune modulating mechanisms within precursor epithelium, characterized by chromosomal instability, persistent IFN signaling, and dysregulated innate and adaptive immunity. The study identifies potential biomarkers and therapeutic targets for HGSOC interception.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in breast cancer reveals tumour microenvironment-driven drug responses and clonal therapeutic heterogeneity.
main_goals: This research utilizes spatial transcriptomics data from breast cancer patients to predict drug sensitivity, observing diverse response patterns across different tumour regions. It identifies therapeutic clusters with different drug responses and genetically identical subclones with different responses depending on their location. The study underscores the importance of considering the distance from the tumour core and microenvironment composition when identifying suitable treatments to target intratumour heterogeneity.

title: Pan-cancer single cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis deciphers the molecular landscapes of senescence related cancer-associated fibroblasts and reveals its predictive value in neuroblastoma via integrated multi-omics analysis and machine learning.
main_goals: The study aims to characterize senescence-related cancer-associated fibroblasts (senes CAFs) in neuroblastoma using pan-cancer single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis. It develops a senescence CAFs related signature (SCRS) to diagnose and predict prognosis in neuroblastoma and explores the biological function of JAK1.

title: Spatiotemporal Profiling Defines Persistence and Resistance Dynamics during Targeted Treatment of Melanoma.
main_goals: This study defined state change and lineage selection during melanoma treatment with spatiotemporal resolution, elucidating how choice and timing of therapeutic agents will impact the ability to eradicate resistant clones. Tracking clonal progression during treatment uncovers conserved, global transcriptional changes and local clone-clone and spatial patterns underlying the emergence of resistance, providing insights into therapy-induced tumor evolution.

title: Exploring tumor microenvironment interactions and apoptosis pathways in NSCLC through spatial transcriptomics and machine learning.
main_goals: To explore the role of programmed cell death (PCD) in NSCLC, investigate the intrinsic mechanisms of PCD and its interaction with the tumor microenvironment using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell sequencing. The study aims to construct prognostic models and identify potential therapeutic targets related to apoptosis in NSCLC.

title: BDNF augmentation reverses cranial radiation therapy-induced cognitive decline and neurodegenerative consequences.
main_goals: This study investigates the efficacy of riluzole (RZ) in mitigating the detrimental effects of radiation therapy (RT)-induced cognitive dysfunction (RICD) in a mouse model. The study aims to demonstrate the neuroprotective effects of RZ, including preservation of synaptic integrity, reduced neuroinflammation, and elevated BDNF levels in the irradiated brain.

title: Spatial transcriptome profiling identifies DTX3L and BST2 as key biomarkers in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma tumorigenesis.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'IHC', 'bulk RNA-sequencing', 'CosMx Spatial Molecular Imaging (SMI)', 'histology images']
main_goals: The study aimed to unravel transcriptional and immunologic alterations occurring during malignant transformation of ESCC and identify clinically significant biomarkers. It used digital spatial profiling, single-cell spatial transcriptomics, IHC, and public RNA-seq datasets to delineate spatial transcriptional reprogramming and dynamic cell signaling pathways that determine ESCC progression. DTX3L and BST2 were identified as potential biomarkers for ESCC progression.

title: Aging and head and neck cancer insights from single cell and spatial transcriptomic analyses.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: The study aims to explore the expression of Aging-related genes (ARGs) in HNSCC and analyze their prognostic significance using single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics analysis. It seeks to provide new theoretical support and directions for personalized treatment of HNSCC. The research also investigates the cellular characteristics of HNSCC and its interaction with the tumor microenvironment.

title: Initial regional cytoarchitectonic differences in dorsal and orbitobasal human developing frontal cortex revealed by spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper investigates regional cytoarchitectonic features in the developing human frontal lobe at the transcriptomic level using NanoString GeoMx DSP. It identifies differentially expressed genes between dorsal and orbitobasal regions at 15 PCW, a critical period for subplate formation. The study confirms early regional patterning in the prefrontal cortex.

title: Association of Synovial Innate Immune Exhaustion With Worse Pain in Knee Osteoarthritis.
main_goals: The objective was to identify synovial innate immune cell subsets and pathophysiologic mechanisms associated with worse pain in patients with knee OA. Synovial tissue biopsies were analyzed to identify associations between synovial histopathology and worse pain. Spatial transcriptomics and proteomics, followed by single-cell RNA sequencing, were used to identify synovial cell composition and cell-cell communication networks in patients with more severe OA pain.

title: Spatial transcriptomics and in situ immune cell profiling of the host ectocervical landscape of HIV infected Kenyan sex working women.
biological_context: HIV infection in Kenyan female sex workers
main_goals: This study investigates the ectocervical immunological landscape during chronic HIV infection in Kenyan female sex workers using spatial transcriptomics and multi-epitope ligand cartography (MELC). The study identifies HIV-associated cervical immune activity driven by T and B cell activity and a general antiviral state characterized by sustained interferon induction.

title: Single-Nucleus and Spatial Transcriptome Profiling Delineates the Multicellular Ecosystem in Hepatocellular Carcinoma After Hepatic Arterial Infusion Chemotherapy.
main_goals: This study aims to characterize the multicellular ecosystem in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) after hepatic arterial infusion chemotherapy (HAIC) treatment by integrating single-nucleus RNA sequencing with spatial transcriptomics. It identifies changes in immune cell populations and tertiary lymphoid structure formation post-HAIC treatment, highlighting the role of PD-1+CD8+ Tex-int cells in the tumor microenvironment.

title: Spatial Metabolomics Reveals the Effects of Dietary Capsaicin Intervention on Interscapular Adipose Tissue Metabolome in Mice.
biological_context: Interscapular adipose tissue and adjacent white adipose tissue in mice
main_goals: Investigate the effects of dietary capsaicin intervention on interscapular brown adipose tissue and adjacent white adipose tissue using spatial metabolomics. Determine metabolite alterations across brown adipose tissue regions and in adjacent white adipose tissue. Identify metabolic pathways affected by capsaicin treatment.

title: Neonatal Brain Injury Triggers Niche-Specific Changes to Cellular Biogeography.
biological_context: Mouse model of chronic neonatal hypoxia (newborn brain injury)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: The paper constructs a brain-wide map of the regenerative response to newborn brain injury using high-resolution imaging-based spatial transcriptomics. It develops a new method for inferring condition-associated differences in cell type spatial proximity. The study identifies mechanisms underlying reparative neurogenesis and gliogenesis and nominates pathways that may impede circuit rewiring following neonatal hypoxia.

title: Gradient boosting reveals spatially diverse cholesterol gene signatures in colon cancer.
main_goals: The study aims to identify cholesterol metabolism-related genes that are prognostic in colon cancer, using machine learning models and spatial transcriptomics to reveal their spatial distribution and interaction with the tumor microenvironment. They demonstrate that using cholesterol metabolism genes with XGBoost models improves stratification of CC patients. They also identified ADCY5 and SLC2A1 as significant prognostic genes.

title: Spatial transcriptomics identifies RBM39 as a gene associated with Gleason score progression in prostate cancer.
main_goals: This study utilized spatial transcriptomics to explore transcriptome patterns in prostate cancer regions with varying Gleason scores. The study aimed to identify genes associated with Gleason score progression. The differential expression of RBM39 was confirmed.

title: Deciphering the effects of radiopharmaceutical therapy in the tumor microenvironment of prostate cancer: an in-silico exploration with spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper investigates the effects of radiopharmaceutical therapy (RPT) in the tumor microenvironment of prostate cancer using spatial transcriptomics and computational modeling. It aims to determine dosimetry and cell survival probability of RPT to identify optimal personalized RPT strategies.  The study compares the efficacy of different RPT strategies targeting PSMA, FAP, and GRPR labeled with different radioisotopes.

title: Integrating spatial transcriptomics and snRNA-seq data enhances differential gene expression analysis results of AD-related phenotypes.
main_goals: This study integrates spatial transcriptomics and snRNA-seq data to enhance the power of spatially-informed cell-type specific differential gene expression analysis of Alzheimer's disease-related phenotypes. The study aims to identify genes and pathways associated with AD-related phenotypes that are not detectable by traditional methods, and potentially provide CLS-CTS targets for developing AD therapeutics.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis Identifies a SERPINA3-Expressing Astrocytic State Associated with the Human Neuritic Plaque Microenvironment.
main_goals: This paper uses spatial transcriptomics to analyze the microenvironment of neuritic amyloid plaques in Alzheimer's disease. It identifies a SERPINA3-expressing astrocytic state (Ast.5) associated with the plaques, and validates findings via immunofluorescence.

title: Childhood-onset lupus nephritis is characterized by complex interactions between kidney stroma and infiltrating immune cells.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to analyze kidney tissue from children with lupus nephritis. The research aims to understand the interactions between kidney stromal cells and infiltrating immune cells and how these interactions contribute to the disease. The study also aims to identify gene expression patterns that correlate with disease activity.

title: Development of mutated β-catenin gene signature to identify CTNNB1 mutations from whole and spatial transcriptomic data in patients with HCC.
main_goals: The paper aims to derive the Mutated β-catenin Gene Signature (MBGS) to predict CTNNB1-mutational status in patients with HCC, to aid in patient stratification for precision medicine. It uses bulk RNA-seq, whole-exome-sequencing, and spatial transcriptomic data to identify the MBGS and assess its performance.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics in Inflammatory Skin Diseases Using GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiling: A Practical Guide for Applications in Dermatology.
main_goals: This paper provides a technical guide for using GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler to analyze the transcriptome in inflammatory skin diseases. It aims to illustrate the potential of digital spatial profiling to dissect skin disease pathogenesis and offer a framework for other investigators.

title: Novel integrated multiomics analysis reveals a key role for integrin beta-like 1 in wound scarring.
main_goals: This paper uses a novel spatial multiomics method to study the molecular and spatial organization of the wound repair process. They identified Integrin beta-like 1 (Itgbl1) as a key gene in inflammation-related scarring and determined its role in granulation tissue formation and fibrogenesis during skin repair.

title: Mapping intratumoral myeloid-T cell interactomes at single-cell resolution reveals targets for overcoming checkpoint inhibitor resistance.
main_goals: The paper investigates how agonistic CD40 alters immune cell crosstalk in tumor models, and in combination with immune checkpoint blockade (ICB). It aims to identify targets for overcoming ICB resistance by analyzing single-cell RNA-sequencing data to determine cell-cell interactomes, and validate these findings using spatial transcriptomics and immunofluorescence.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals the Temporal Architecture of the Seminiferous Epithelial Cycle and Precise Sertoli-Germ Synchronization.
main_goals: This paper uses spatial transcriptomics to study the seminiferous epithelial cycle in mouse testis. It aims to identify transcriptional changes across the cycle, define correlations between germ and somatic cells, and elucidate regulatory mechanisms in spermatogenesis, specifically focusing on Sertoli cell synchronization.

title: Spatial Expression of Long Non-Coding RNAs in Human Brains of Alzheimer's Disease.
main_goals: This study analyzes the spatial expression of lncRNAs in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex of aged human brains using spatial transcriptomics. It aims to identify differentially expressed lncRNAs in Alzheimer's disease and explore their potential roles in the disease pathogenesis by analyzing interactions with proteins and their association with pathological features.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics of IPMN Reveals Divergent Indolent and Malignant Lineages.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMN) of the pancreas
main_goals: The paper uses spatial transcriptomics to analyze intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMN). It aims to identify transcriptomic states associated with cancer risk and distinguish between indolent and malignant lineages. The findings could improve IPMN risk stratification models.

title: Spatial transcriptome analysis reveals de novo regeneration of poplar roots.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to analyze the regeneration of poplar roots. It aims to map gene expression changes over time and space, identify distinct spatial domains/clusters, analyze cell differentiation trajectories, and discover potential biomarkers for root regeneration.

title: Biosynthesis-Based Spatial Metabolome of Condensed Tannin Reveals Its Role in Salt Tolerance of Non-Salt-Secretor Mangrove Kandelia obovata.
biological_context: Non-salt-secretor mangrove Kandelia obovata salt tolerance
main_goals: Identify the composition of autofluorescent inclusions (AFIs) in mangrove mesophyll cells as condensed tannin (CT). Analyze the spatial distribution and biosynthesis of CT using spatial metabolomics under salt stress. Demonstrate that CT synthesis and transport facilitate Na+ sequestration into vacuoles, conferring salt tolerance to Kandelia obovata.

title: Mapping out multiple sclerosis with spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The paper aims to use spatial transcriptomics technology to investigate and characterize multiple sclerosis.

title: Leveraging deep single-soma RNA sequencing to explore the neural basis of human somatosensation.
biological_context: Human somatosensation, dorsal root ganglion (DRG) neurons
main_goals: The study isolated somata from individual human DRG neurons and performed deep RNA sequencing to create a transcriptomic atlas with 16 neuronal types. The results were validated using spatial transcriptomics and RNAscope. The research aimed to explore the neural basis of human somatosensation and identify human-specific neuronal types.

title: Molecular Lineages and Spatial Distributions of Subplate Neurons in the Human Fetal Cerebral Cortex.
biological_context: Human fetal cerebral cortex development / neurogenesis
main_goals: This study investigates the molecular origin, lineage specification, and spatial distribution of subplate neurons (SPNs) in the human fetal cerebral cortex (GW 10-25). It uses spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing to create spatial landscapes and molecular trajectories of SPNs, highlighting enriched ECM gene expression in a region-specific manner.

title: Single-cell transcriptomics reveals IRF7 regulation of the tumor microenvironment in isocitrate dehydrogenase wild-type glioma.
main_goals: To analyze the gene expression regulatory network (GRN) in IDH wild-type gliomas using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified IRF7 as a key transcription factor enriched in microglia/macrophages within the tumor microenvironment and validated its role in glioma progression. A transcriptional regulatory activity map for IDH wild-type gliomas is presented.

title: Spatiotemporal lineage tracing reveals the dynamic spatial architecture of tumor growth and metastasis.
biological_context: Lung adenocarcinoma in Kras;p53 mouse model, tumor progression, metastasis
main_goals: To elucidate how tumor expansion, plasticity, and metastasis co-evolve with microenvironmental remodeling using integrated high-resolution spatial transcriptomics and lineage tracing in a mouse model of lung adenocarcinoma. The study aims to reveal how changes in cancer cell state and microenvironmental structures cooperate to promote tumor progression and metastasis.

title: Long-term exposure to triclocarban induces splenic injuries in mice: Insights from spatial metabolomics and lipidomics.
main_goals: Investigate the effects of long-term triclocarban (TCC) exposure on the mouse spleen using spatial metabolomics and lipidomics. Determine the spatial distribution of TCC and its metabolites within the spleen and identify region-specific metabolic disruptions. Provide insights into the potential risks of TCC exposure to immune function by highlighting biochemical impact.

title: Dynamic Evolution of Fibroblasts Revealed by Single-Cell RNA Sequencing of Human Pancreatic Cancer.
main_goals: To study the dynamics of fibroblasts in human pancreatic cancer using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify temporal and spatial trajectories of fibroblast differentiation and explore complex intercellular communication networks in the tumor microenvironment to find new therapeutic targets.

title: Comprehensive analysis of lactylation-related gene sets and mitochondrial functions in gastric adenocarcinoma: implications for prognosis and therapeutic strategies.
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the prognostic significance of lactylation-related gene sets and mitochondrial functions in gastric adenocarcinoma using multi-omics data including spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. The goals were to delineate the tumor microenvironment, identify prognostic molecular subtypes, build predictive models, and analyze immune landscapes to inform therapeutic strategies.

title: Tumour evolution and microenvironment interactions in 2D and 3D space.
biological_context: Tumour evolution and microenvironment interactions across 6 cancer types
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Visualization']
main_goals: To study spatial tumour evolution and microenvironment interactions in 2D and 3D using Visium ST, snRNA-seq, and CODEX. To define tumour microregions and spatial subclones, analyze their characteristics and immune cell infiltration, and reconstruct 3D tumour structures.

title: Multiparameter imaging reveals clinically relevant cancer cell-stroma interaction dynamics in head and neck cancer.
biological_context: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Phenotype analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Correlation Analysis']
main_goals: Identify clinically relevant tumor phenotypes and signatures in HNSCC using multiparameter imaging and single-cell analysis. Investigate the interplay between stromal and epithelial compartments, specifically the CAF-pEMT axis, using spatial transcriptomics and other methods to understand mechanisms driving cancer aggression and discover prognostic/predictive signatures.

title: Single-Cell Meta-Analysis Uncovers the Pancreatic Endothelial Cell Transcriptomic Signature and Reveals a Key Role for NKX2-3 in PLVAP Expression.
main_goals: Define a validated transcriptomic signature of pancreatic ECs, uncover intratissue transcriptomic heterogeneity, and show that NKX2-3 acts upstream of PLVAP. Provide an online resource for the community.

title: Single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics of paediatric ovary: Molecular insights into the dysregulated signalling pathways underlying premature ovarian insufficiency in classic galactosemia.
biological_context: Paediatric ovary, Classic Galactosemia (CG), Premature Ovarian Insufficiency (POI)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To investigate dynamic changes in gene expression and altered signalling pathways in paediatric ovary tissue from girls with classic galactosemia (CG) using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The goal is to identify molecular mechanisms underlying premature ovarian insufficiency (POI) in CG.

title: Senescent Syncytiotrophoblast Secretion During Early Onset Preeclampsia.
main_goals: To identify novel markers and signaling pathways for early onset preeclampsia using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. Identified elevated syncytiotrophoblast senescence markers (PAI-1, activin A) weeks before clinical diagnosis, suggesting their potential as early diagnostic tools.

title: Attenuated kidney oxidative metabolism in young adults with type 1 diabetes.
biological_context: Diabetic kidney disease in young adults with type 1 diabetes
main_goals: To investigate the relationship between impaired insulin sensitivity and kidney oxidative metabolism in young adults with type 1 diabetes using multi-omics approaches. The study aimed to identify early structural and metabolic changes potentially preceding clinical diabetic kidney disease. Key analyses involved single-cell RNA-Seq and spatial metabolomics.

title: RUNX2 as a novel biomarker for early identification of patients progressing to advanced-stage mycosis fungoides.
main_goals: The main goal was to identify biomarkers for predicting progression to advanced-stage mycosis fungoides (MF) using spatial transcriptomics and scRNA-seq on patient samples. They found RUNX2, SHMT2, and MCM7 were upregulated in malignant T-cells of progressing patients, highlighting RUNX2 as a potential novel biomarker. The study also aimed to show the power of integrating spatial and single-cell omics for such discoveries.

title: Perioperative chemoimmunotherapy induces strong immune responses and long-term survival in patients with HLA class I-deficient non-small cell lung cancer.
main_goals: To analyze the efficacy and response mechanisms of perioperative chemoimmunotherapy in NSCLC patients, focusing on the impact of HLA class I deficiency. The study integrates various molecular and spatial data modalities to understand how treatment affects the tumor microenvironment and patient outcomes, particularly in HLA-deficient tumors.

title: Spatial proteomics identifies JAKi as treatment for a lethal skin disease.
biological_context: Toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN), a lethal skin disease
main_goals: To systematically map molecular changes associated with Toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) using deep visual proteomics to identify potential druggable targets. The study aimed to uncover key pathogenic drivers and demonstrate the potential of targeted JAK inhibitors as a curative therapy for TEN.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Signatures of Early Acute T Cell-mediated Rejection in Kidney Transplants.
biological_context: Kidney transplant rejection (Acute T cell-mediated rejection, Borderline TCMR)
main_goals: Analyze spatial transcriptomic signatures in kidney transplant biopsies during early acute TCMR. Identify regional differences (glomerulus vs. interstitium) in transcriptional profiles. Investigate the potential involvement of innate immunity in rejection, contrary to a T cell-centric view.

title: Spatial multiomics atlas reveals smooth muscle phenotypic transformation and metabolic reprogramming in diabetic macroangiopathy.
biological_context: Diabetic macroangiopathy in human anterior tibial artery
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Network analysis', 'Enrichment Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To construct a spatial multiomics map of the anterior tibial artery in diabetic patients. To characterize vascular calcification and reveal smooth muscle cell phenotypic transformation trends and their transcriptional driving network. To identify activated metabolic pathways and key genes involved in diabetic vascular metabolic reprogramming using combined transcriptome and metabolome data.

title: The neuroendocrine transition in prostate cancer is dynamic and dependent on ASCL1.
main_goals: Develop an in vivo platform to study the neuroendocrine transition in prostate cancer. Identify the origin of neuroendocrine prostate cancer cells and reveal the dynamic role of ASCL1 in this process, highlighting the importance of therapy timing.

title: Imaging Mass Cytometry in Psoriatic Disease Reveals Immune Profile Heterogeneity in Skin and Synovial Tissue.
biological_context: Psoriatic disease, Psoriasis, Psoriatic arthritis, Skin, Synovial tissue
main_goals: To characterize structural and immune cell populations in psoriatic skin and synovial tissue using Imaging Mass Cytometry. The study aimed to identify immune cell differences, spatial relationships, and interpatient heterogeneity in patients with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis. It applied IMC and standard analysis steps like segmentation, clustering, and neighborhood analysis.

title: The activity of tertiary lymphoid structures in high grade serous ovarian cancer is governed by site, stroma, and cellular interactions.
main_goals: To understand antitumor immunity, specifically tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs), across different sites in high grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) using spatial analyses. The study aims to characterize differences in TLS development and activity across tumor sites, identify a prognostic spatial TLS signature, and investigate the role of stroma and mesenchymal stem cells in regulating TLS formation and function.

title: Discovery of prognostic lncRNAs in colorectal cancer using spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: Utilize spatial transcriptomics to identify lncRNAs associated with malignant regions in colorectal cancer. Validate these findings using public data and RNA-FISH. Propose identified lncRNAs (LINC01978, PLAC4, LINC01303) as potential early biomarkers for metastatic disease.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics of bladder Ewing sarcoma.
biological_context: Bladder Ewing sarcoma/primitive neuroectodermal tumor (bladder ES/PNET)
main_goals: To investigate the pathogenesis of bladder Ewing sarcoma/primitive neuroectodermal tumor (ES/PNET) using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify key cell types, signaling pathways, and potential therapeutic targets in this rare and malignant tumor.

title: Spatial multi-omics reveal intratumoral humoral immunity niches associated with tertiary lymphoid structures in pancreatic cancer immunotherapy pathologic responders.
data_modalities_used: ['HE-stained images', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics', 'BCR profiling', 'multi-modal spatial profiling']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To generate a spatial multi-omics atlas of PDAC treated with immunotherapy to characterize intratumoral tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) niches and their spatial relationships. The study used machine learning on spatial transcriptomics and proteomics data to identify TLS-associated features linked to treatment response and survival, revealing insights into TLS maturation, humoral immunity, and stromal remodeling.

title: Spatial analyses revealed S100P + TFF1 + tumor cells in spread through air spaces samples correlated with undesirable therapy response in non-small cell lung cancer.
main_goals: To use spatial analysis on non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) samples with and without Spread through air spaces (STAS) to characterize the STAS phenotype and identify associated biomarkers. The study investigated the heterogeneity of STAS tumor cells, identifying a S100P+TFF1+ subtype and correlating its presence with patient survival, therapy response to EGFR-TKI and immunotherapy, and specific signaling pathways like TGFb.

title: Single-cell RNA sequencing identifies a subtype of FN1 + tumor-associated macrophages associated with glioma recurrence and as a biomarker for immunotherapy.
main_goals: Identify a subtype of tumor-associated macrophages (FN1+ TAMs) associated with glioma recurrence using multi-omics data. Investigate their role in prognosis, microenvironment regulation, and potential as immunotherapy biomarkers. Provide a public web resource for exploring glioma immune microenvironment.

title: Imaging spatial transcriptomics reveals molecular patterns of vulnerability to pathology in a transgenic α-synucleinopathy model.
main_goals: Identify neuronal subtypes vulnerable to α-synuclein pathology in a transgenic mouse model using imaging spatial transcriptomics. Investigate the transcriptional underpinnings of this vulnerability, highlighting *Plk2* and *hSNCA* expression. Perform differential expression analysis to reveal downstream gene expression changes.

title: Endothelial pyroptosis-driven microglial activation in choroid plexus mediates neuronal apoptosis in hemorrhagic stroke rats.
main_goals: To identify the cellular origins and mechanisms of cytokine-driven inflammation following hemorrhagic stroke (ICH) in rats using Luminex, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to link endothelial pyroptosis to microglial activation and subsequent neuronal apoptosis in the choroid plexus.

title: Spatial multi-omics in whole skeletal muscle reveals complex tissue architecture.
data_modalities_used: ['Single-nucleus transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial metabolomics', 'RNA tomography', 'mass spectrometry imaging', 'multiplexed immunofluorescence staining']
main_goals: To elucidate the full tissue architecture of whole skeletal muscle by combining spatial transcriptomics (RNA tomography) and mass spectrometry imaging. The study aimed to map the spatial organization of gene expression, metabolism, and lipids and validate findings with immunofluorescence, revealing unexpected regional heterogeneity.

title: From single-cell to spatial transcriptomics: decoding the glioma stem cell niche and its clinical implications.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Regulatory Network Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Machine Learning']
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize glioma stem cells (GSCs), analyze their spatial interactions within the tumor microenvironment using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, and develop a prognostic signature. Key findings include the identification of a distinct GSC population, their proximity and interaction with MDSCs via MIF signaling, and the development of a robust 26-gene GSC signature (GSCS), with TUBA1C identified as a key gene validated functionally.

title: Comprehensive analysis of bulk, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics revealed IER3 for predicting malignant progression and immunotherapy efficacy in glioma.
main_goals: The paper aimed to comprehensively analyze the role of IER3 in glioma using bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics data, alongside experimental assays. It identified IER3 as a biomarker for predicting malignant progression, prognosis, and response to different therapies.

title: Characterization of regeneration initiating cells during Xenopus laevis tail regeneration.
main_goals: This paper aims to identify and characterize the cells initiating regeneration during Xenopus laevis tail regeneration shortly after injury. Using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, the authors discovered transient regeneration initiating cells (RICs) derived from basal epidermal cells, which modify the extracellular matrix and are crucial for successful regeneration.

title: Deciphering the role of LGALS2: insights into tertiary lymphoid structure-associated dendritic cell activation and immunotherapeutic potential in breast cancer patients.
main_goals: The paper aims to identify key markers within tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs) in breast cancer (BRCA) using integrated omics analysis. It identifies LGALS2, investigates its role in TLS-associated dendritic cell (DC) activation and the tumor microenvironment (TME) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, and validates its association with survival and immune response, highlighting its potential as a therapeutic target and biomarker.

title: SPP1+ macrophages in HR+ breast cancer are associated with tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes.
main_goals: To explore the role of SPP1+ macrophages in different breast cancer subtypes based on TIL levels. The study used single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to identify characteristics of SPP1+ macrophages and their spatial relationship and interactions with T-cells, particularly in TIL-high HR+ breast cancer.

title: Spatial proteomics and transcriptomics of the maternal-fetal interface in placenta accreta spectrum.
biological_context: Placenta Accreta Spectrum (PAS) at the maternal-fetal interface
main_goals: This study investigated alterations at the fetal-maternal interface in severe Placenta Accreta Spectrum (PAS) using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. It aimed to identify molecular and cellular changes associated with deep myometrial invasion, focusing on immune cells, gene expression, protein profiles, and ligand-receptor interactions.

title: Radiation immunodynamics in patients with glioblastoma receiving chemoradiation.
main_goals: To identify peripheral immunologic effects of standard adjuvant chemoradiotherapy in glioblastoma patients, focusing on key immune populations like myeloid-derived suppressor cells and CD8+ T lymphocytes. The study investigates the association of these changes with survival and links peripheral blood findings to baseline tumor tissue characteristics using spatial proteomics.

title: Craters on the melanoma surface facilitate tumor-immune interactions and demonstrate pathologic response to checkpoint blockade in humans.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To identify spatial domains (craters) on melanoma surfaces that facilitate immune response during immunotherapy, characterize their molecular and cellular composition (rich in B2M/antigen recognition molecules, harbor CD8+ T cells), and evaluate their potential as a diagnostic tool for predicting response to ICB therapy in humans.

title: Spatial microenvironments tune immune response dynamics in the Drosophila larval fat body.
biological_context: Drosophila larval fat body immune response
main_goals: This paper investigates the spatial microenvironments that tune immune response dynamics in the Drosophila larval fat body. It establishes live light sheet fluorescence microscopy of whole larvae to capture immune responses at single-cell resolution and uses spatial transcriptomics to identify immune microenvironments.

title: MAPK/ERK signaling in gliomas modulates interferon responses, T cell recruitment, microglia phenotype, and immune checkpoint blockade efficacy.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of MAPK/ERK signaling in modulating interferon responses, T cell recruitment, microglia phenotype, and immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) efficacy in glioblastoma. It aims to elucidate the mechanistic underpinnings of immunotherapy resistance and identify the MAPK/ERK pathway as a potential target for enhancing ICB treatment in glioblastoma.

title: Dissecting the immune infiltrate of primary luminal B-like breast carcinomas in relation to age.
biological_context: Luminal B-like breast carcinomas in relation to age
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of aging on the immune landscape of luminal breast cancer. Using multiplex immunohistochemistry, it characterizes the age-related dynamics of immune cells and checkpoint molecules within the tumor microenvironment of treatment-naïve patients. The findings reveal a decline in immune cell abundance and changes in immune checkpoint expression with aging.

title: Hypoxia induces ROS-resistant memory upon reoxygenation in vivo promoting metastasis in part via MUC1-C.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'in vivo models', 'in vitro models', 'tumor biopsies', 'patient-derived xenograft models']
main_goals: This study investigates how hypoxia in solid tumors influences metastasis, identifying post-hypoxic cells that retain hypoxia-inducible gene expression. It demonstrates that MUC1-C plays a crucial role in ROS resistance in these cells, and therapeutically targeting MUC1-C reduces hypoxia-driven metastasis.

title: Spatial metabolomics, LC-MS and RNA-Seq reveal the effect of red and white muscle on rabbit meat flavor.
biological_context: Rabbit meat quality and flavor, focusing on differences between red and white muscle fibers.
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the differences in meat quality and flavor between red and white muscle fibers in rabbits. It utilizes spatial metabolomics, LC-MS, and RNA-Seq to explore the molecular mechanisms underlying these differences and to determine the impact of myofiber composition on meat characteristics.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveal tumor microenvironment and SLCO2A1 correlated with tumor suppression in hypopharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Immune Infiltration Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate tumor microenvironment and identify tumor suppressor genes in hypopharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma (HSCC) using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to analyze cell distribution, signaling pathways, and immune infiltration, highlighting the role of SLCO2A1 as a potential tumor suppressor.

title: Metabolite Profiling of Hydroponic Lettuce Roots Affected by Nutrient Solution Flow: Insights from Comprehensive Analysis Using Widely Targeted Metabolomics and MALDI Mass Spectrometry Imaging Approaches.
biological_context: Hydroponic lettuce roots affected by nutrient solution flow
main_goals: To clarify how nutrient solution flow affects hydroponic lettuce root morphology and growth by applying untargeted metabolomics and MALDI mass spectrometry imaging. The study aims to understand the adaptive biological responses triggered by mechanical stimulus and identify key metabolites and metabolic pathways involved.

title: Spatial multiplexed immunofluorescence analysis reveals coordinated cellular networks associated with overall survival in metastatic osteosarcoma.
main_goals: This study aimed to spatially characterize the immune tumor microenvironment of metastatic osteosarcoma lung specimens. It sought to identify coordinated cellular networks associated with overall survival. The findings describe cellular interactions and neighborhoods linked to patient survival and suggest potential immunotherapeutic strategies.

title: Potential crosstalk between Naïve CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells and SPP1<sup>+</sup> Macrophages is associated with clinical outcome and therapeutic response in hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Prognostic prediction']
main_goals: This study investigated intercellular crosstalk between Naïve CD4+ T cells and SPP1+ Macrophages in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). The researchers developed a prognostic score (TMPS) based on this crosstalk to predict clinical outcomes and therapeutic responses in HCC patients. The TMPS demonstrated good performance across independent cohorts and could guide clinical decision-making.

title: Spatial Metabolomics Profiling Reveals Curcumin Induces Metabolic Reprogramming in Three-Dimensional Tumor Spheroids.
main_goals: To investigate the antitumor metabolic alteration caused by curcumin in a 3D tumor spheroids model using mass spectrometry imaging. The study aimed to reveal the impact of curcumin on tumor cell growth, proliferation, and the overall metabolic profile, as well as characterize curcumin's metabolic processes and identify remodeled metabolic pathways.

title: Single-cell multi-omics map of human fetal blood in Down syndrome.
biological_context: Human fetal blood in Down syndrome
main_goals: This study aimed to understand dysregulated hematopoiesis in Down syndrome by integrating multi-omic single-cell data from human fetal liver and bone marrow. It identified that Down syndrome HSCs are primed to differentiate, restructured regulatory interactions, and observed increased mitochondrial mass and oxidative stress.

title: Hidradenitis Suppurativa Tunnels Invasive Transcriptional Signature.
main_goals: This paper investigates the invasive transcriptional signature of Hidradenitis Suppurativa (HS) tunnels. It aims to understand the molecular mechanisms driving this specific feature of the disease.

title: Uncovering Plaque-Glia Niches in Human Alzheimer's Disease Brains Using Spatial Transcriptomics.
main_goals: The study applies spatial transcriptomics and immunohistochemistry to human Alzheimer's disease brains to investigate the interaction between amyloid-beta plaques and surrounding glial cells. It reveals distinct transcriptomic profiles in plaque-glia niches, linking Aβ levels to neuronal loss and glial activation to inflammation and neurodegeneration. The findings provide insights into glial responses to Aβ and lay the groundwork for future pathology genomics studies.

title: Dysfunctional β-cell longevity in diabetes relies on energy conservation and positive epistasis.
biological_context: Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) and pancreatic beta-cell function
main_goals: This study investigates the role of dysfunctional, long-lived beta-cells in type 2 diabetes. It explores how PFKFB3 contributes to their survival and dysfunction by analyzing transcriptional profiles from human T2D pancreata and mouse models. The findings suggest that PFKFB3 promotes the survival of 'loser' beta-cells through positive epistasis and that inhibiting PFKFB3 can restore glucose tolerance.

title: Spatial Isoforms Reveal the Mechanisms of Metastasis.
biological_context: Esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) with lymph node metastasis
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial isoform transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'T-cell receptor sequencing', 'human solid tumors', 'lymph nodes']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of spatial isoforms and CD8+ T cells in lymph node metastasis of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC). It identifies C1QC+ TAMs and CD74 isoforms as key contributors to chemoresistance and metastasis, suggesting CD74 isoforms as potential therapeutic targets.

title: UQCRB and LBH are correlated with Gleason score progression in prostate cancer: Spatial transcriptomics and experimental validation.
main_goals: This study applies Visium spatial transcriptomics to prostate cancer tissues to understand Gleason score progression. It identifies UQCRB and LBH as key genes involved in this progression, with their knockdown suppressing cancer cell proliferation and invasion. The findings are validated with TCGA data and experimental methods.

title: Investigating the mechanisms of inflammation and immune alterations in Parkinson's disease using spatial transcriptomics techniques.
biological_context: Parkinson's disease (PD) pathogenesis and mechanisms of inflammation and immune alterations
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Pathway Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: To investigate the mechanisms of inflammation and immune alterations in Parkinson's disease using spatial transcriptomic sequencing in an MPTP-induced mouse model. The study aims to provide insights into the pathological changes at specific brain regions and their association with neuronal damage and disease progression.

title: Spatial analysis reveals targetable macrophage-mediated mechanisms of immune evasion in hepatocellular carcinoma minimal residual disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper identifies targetable macrophage-mediated mechanisms of immune evasion in hepatocellular carcinoma minimal residual disease (MRD). It reveals that PD-L1+ M2-like macrophages interact with stem-like tumor cells, correlating with T cell exhaustion and poor survival. The study demonstrates that combined blockade of Pdl1 and Tgfβ can eliminate residual tumor cells by modulating macrophages and recruiting CD8+ T cells.

title: Inter-organ cross-talk in human cancer cachexia revealed by spatial metabolomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Metabolomics', 'Component analysis', 'Pathway enrichment analysis', 'Correlation network analysis', 'Machine learning']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the molecular inter-organ cross-talk in human cancer cachexia using spatial metabolomics. The researchers investigated metabolic alterations in various organs and serum of cachectic vs. control patients and developed machine learning classifiers for diagnostic purposes.

title: Combined single cell and spatial transcriptome analysis reveals hedgehog pathway-related genes as potential therapeutic targets for cervical cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates hedgehog pathway-related genes as potential therapeutic targets for cervical cancer. It utilizes single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify myofibroblasts with enriched hedgehog pathway activity and explores the role of MYH9 in these cells, linking MYH9-positive myofibroblasts to patient prognosis and immunotherapeutic efficacy.

title: Basal-to-inflammatory transition and tumor resistance via crosstalk with a pro-inflammatory stromal niche.
biological_context: Carcinoma, specifically basal cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma transition
main_goals: This paper identifies a new tumor state, the 'basal-to-inflammatory transition,' which is enriched in inflammation and therapy resistance. It details how this transition is driven by TREM1 myeloid cells and their cytokines, leading to reduced sensitivity to treatment. The study aims to deepen understanding of tumor microenvironment heterogeneity and nominate this state as a targetable entity.

title: Manganese exposure leads to depressive-like behavior through disruption of the Gln-Glu-GABA metabolic cycle.
biological_context: Manganese exposure induced depressive-like behavior and cognitive dysfunction in mice
main_goals: Investigate the relationship between manganese exposure and depression, and the underlying mechanisms. The study found that manganese exposure leads to depressive-like behavior and cognitive impairment in mice by disrupting the Gln-Glu-GABA metabolic cycle through downregulation of GAD1 in astrocytes.

title: ADAMTS12 promotes fibrosis by restructuring extracellular matrix to enable activation of injury-responsive fibroblasts.
main_goals: This paper identifies ADAMTS12 as a key factor promoting fibrosis by restructuring the extracellular matrix. It demonstrates that ADAMTS12 enables the activation and migration of injury-responsive fibroblasts, which are characterized by aberrant JAK/STAT signaling. The study uses in vivo knockout models and spatial transcriptomics to elucidate this mechanism.

title: Single-cell and Spatial Transcriptomic Analyses Implicate Formation of the Immunosuppressive Microenvironment during Breast Tumor Progression.
biological_context: Breast cancer progression (ductal carcinoma in situ to invasive ductal carcinoma)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Single-Cell Analysis', 'Spatial Analysis', 'Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate the formation of an immunosuppressive microenvironment during breast tumor progression by analyzing single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data from ductal carcinoma in situ and invasive ductal carcinoma samples. The study reveals tumor cell malignancy, T cell exhaustion, and the role of coinhibitory ligands in creating an immunosuppressive landscape.

title: A conserved cell-type gradient across the human mediodorsal and paraventricular thalamus.
biological_context: Human mediodorsal and paraventricular thalamus, cognition, mental illness
main_goals: To define the cellular composition of the mediodorsal thalamus (MD) and adjacent midline nuclei using single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified a conserved excitatory neuron gradient and explored its relationship with human brain evolution and genetic risk for psychiatric disorders.

title: Gene interactions analysis of brain spatial transcriptome for Alzheimer's disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Ligand-receptor communication', 'Transcription factor regulatory network', 'Spot-specific network', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to analyze gene interactions in the brain spatial transcriptome for Alzheimer's disease (AD) by examining ligand-receptor communication, transcription factor regulatory networks, and spot-specific networks. The goal is to reveal the dependence and dynamics of gene associations/interactions on spatial regions and pathological status during amyloid-β accumulation. The findings are validated using independent datasets from mouse models and human data.

title: Metabolic reprogramming by mutant GNAS creates an actionable dependency in intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms of the pancreas.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMNs) of the pancreas, a precursor to pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'genome-wide CRISPR/Cas9 screen', 'histology images']
main_goals: To unveil the consequences of mutant GnasR201C expression on phenotype, transcriptomic profile, and genomic dependencies in IPMNs. The study identified that KrasG12D and GnasR201C co-expression leads to gastric pyloric metaplasia and a dependency on glycolysis for cell survival, suggesting a potential therapeutic target.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Analysis: Maternal Obesity Impairs Myogenic Cell Migration and Differentiation during Embryonic Limb Development.
biological_context: Maternal obesity impairs embryonic limb development and muscle formation by affecting myogenic cell migration and differentiation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling', 'Signal Transduction']
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of maternal obesity on myogenic cell migration and differentiation during embryonic limb development using spatial transcriptomics. The findings indicate that maternal obesity impedes these processes, contributing to impaired fetal muscle development and altered offspring muscle function.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Identifies Cellular and Molecular Characteristics of Scleroderma Skin Lesions: Pilot Study in Juvenile Scleroderma.
data_modalities_used: ['Visium CytAssist spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'histopathological slides', 'gene expression analyses', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell Type Composition Estimation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study utilized spatial transcriptomics to investigate the cellular and molecular characteristics of skin lesions in juvenile scleroderma patients. The goals were to identify spatial domains, estimate cell type composition by integrating with scRNA-seq, and delineate immune infiltrates to enhance understanding of the disease pathogenesis. The findings demonstrated the biological relevance of spatial transcriptomics in this context.

title: Single-cell, single-nucleus and xenium-based spatial transcriptomics analyses reveal inflammatory activation and altered cell interactions in the hippocampus in mice with temporal lobe epilepsy.
biological_context: Temporal lobe epilepsy in mice hippocampus
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-nucleus RNA sequencing', 'Xenium-based spatial transcriptomics', 'sequencing']
main_goals: To establish a high-resolution single-cell transcriptomic atlas of the hippocampus in mice with temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) using single-cell RNA sequencing, single-nucleus RNA sequencing, and Xenium-based spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to reveal potential intrinsic mechanisms driving TLE-associated inflammatory activation and altered cell interactions.

title: Identification of microenvironment features associated with primary resistance to anti-PD-1/PD-L1 + antiangiogenesis in gastric cancer through spatial transcriptomics and plasma proteomics.
main_goals: To identify microenvironment features associated with primary resistance to anti-PD-1/PD-L1 and antiangiogenesis in gastric cancer. The study investigated mechanisms of inherent resistance by analyzing tumor microenvironment and plasma proteomics in patients treated with regorafenib and avelumab.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals tumor-derived SPP1 induces fibroblast chemotaxis and activation in the hepatocellular carcinoma microenvironment.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Differentiation']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of SPP1 secreted by tumor cells in activating hepatic stellate cells (HSCs) and inducing their differentiation into cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) within the hepatocellular carcinoma microenvironment. It identifies the SPP1-CD44 signaling axis as a key mechanism driving this interaction and suggests targeting this pathway for therapeutic benefit.

title: From genes to geography: Mapping allergic disease landscapes with spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper aims to map allergic disease landscapes using spatial transcriptomics. It focuses on applying existing spatial transcriptomics technologies like GeoMx and Visium to understand allergic asthma and atopic dermatitis.

title: Hepatic stellate cells promote hepatocellular carcinoma development by regulating histone lactylation: Novel insights from single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics analyses.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'transcriptomic data', 'Western blot', 'Real-time reverse transcription PCR', 'Cell Counting Kit 8 (CCK8) assay']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-cell interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Pathway Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Differential expression Analysis', 'Survival Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to evaluate the cellular heterogeneity and molecular mechanisms of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It investigated the role of hepatic stellate cells (HSCs) in HCC development by regulating histone lactylation. The findings highlight the pivotal role of HSCs in HCC pathogenesis through this mechanism.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptome assays reveal heterogeneity in gliomas through stress responses and pathway alterations.
biological_context: Glioma heterogeneity, specifically in high- and low-grade gliomas, with a focus on oxidative stress responses in oligodendrocyte precursor cells (OPCs).
covered_analysis_steps: ['scRNA-seq analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics analysis', 'pathway analysis', 'gene regulatory network inference (SCENIC)']
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the impact of oxidative stress response genes in oligodendrocyte precursor cells (OPCs) within gliomas using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identified distinct pathway activations and metabolic shifts in high- and low-grade gliomas under oxidative stress, highlighting the role of the AP1 transcription factor in promoting tumor cell survival and proliferation in high-grade gliomas.

title: Spatial resolved transcriptomics reveals distinct cross-talk between cancer cells and tumor-associated macrophages in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
main_goals: This study applies spatial transcriptomics and digital spatial profiling to characterize the tumor microenvironment of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (iCCA). It reveals spatial heterogeneities driven by physical proximity and identifies a cross-talk mechanism where TFF3 secreted by cancer cells reprograms macrophages to a tumor-promoting, immune-suppressive state.

title: Modulation of blood-tumor barrier transcriptional programs improves intra-tumoral drug delivery and potentiates chemotherapy in GBM.
main_goals: This study identifies a 12-gene signature associated with the blood-tumor barrier (BTB) in Glioblastoma (GBM). It demonstrates that the indirubin-derivative, 6-bromoindirubin acetoxime (BIA), can modulate these BTB genes, leading to improved delivery of chemotherapeutics like cisplatin and potentiating its efficacy. The research supports the development of BIA for improved GBM treatment.

title: Spatial characterization and stratification of colorectal adenomas by deep visual proteomics.
main_goals: This paper aimed to establish a molecular feature-based risk allocation framework for colorectal adenomas using Deep Visual Proteomics (DVP). DVP combines AI, microdissection, and mass spectrometry to characterize cellular heterogeneity and identify protein markers linked to recurrence and metabolic shifts. The study sought to refine early detection and personalize patient management strategies.

title: Combined single cell and spatial transcriptome analysis reveals cellular heterogeneity of hedgehog pathway in gastric cancer.
main_goals: This study combines single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the hedgehog pathway in gastric cancer. It identifies fibroblasts with enriched hedgehog pathway activity and highlights the role of CCND1 in their development and association with tumor progression, immune response, and chemotherapeutic efficacy.

title: Glioblastoma cells increase expression of notch signaling and synaptic genes within infiltrated brain tissue.
main_goals: This study characterizes the gene expression landscape of glioblastoma cells within infiltrated brain tissue using spatial transcriptomics. It identifies increased expression of neurodevelopmental and glial differentiation genes in these cells, suggesting new therapeutic targets for recurrent tumors after surgical resection.

title: Microbiota-induced S100A11-RAGE axis underlies immune evasion in right-sided colon adenomas and is a therapeutic target to boost anti-PD1 efficacy.
main_goals: To characterize differences between left-sided and right-sided colon adenomas, identify the microbiota-induced S100A11-RAGE axis underlying immune evasion in right-sided adenomas, and demonstrate its potential as a therapeutic target to enhance anti-PD1 efficacy.

title: Multiomics analyses decipher intricate changes in the cellular and metabolic landscape of steatotic livers upon dietary restriction and sleeve gastrectomy.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptome analysis', 'single-nuclei transcriptome analysis', 'spatial metabolomics', 'immunohistochemistry', 'circulating biomarkers', 'serum samples', 'AI-assisted image analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the intricate hepatic changes following dietary restriction (DR), sleeve gastrectomy (SG), or sham surgery in rats with diet-induced obesity-related MASLD, comparing them to a clinical cohort. It sought to understand the distinct metabolic or immunological changes induced by these interventions in MASLD livers. The findings highlight the role of PPARα, gut-liver axis, and metabolically active myeloid cells in SG's therapeutic effects on MASLD.

title: HMGB2 drives tumor progression and shapes the immunosuppressive microenvironment in hepatocellular carcinoma: insights from multi-omics analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify key factors influencing the immunosuppressive microenvironment in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and investigate the role of HMGB2 in HCC progression and immune evasion. The research used multi-omics approaches, including spatial transcriptomics and multiplex immunohistochemistry, to validate findings in clinical samples.

title: Spatial transcriptomics defines injury specific microenvironments and cellular interactions in kidney regeneration and disease.
biological_context: Mouse ischemia-reperfusion injury in the kidney
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To apply single-cell spatial transcriptomics to examine ischemia-reperfusion injury in the mouse kidney. The study aims to reveal injury-specific and spatially-dependent gene expression patterns and predict molecular interplay between kidney cells and fibroblasts. It also seeks to identify cellular microenvironments resembling tertiary lymphoid structures and associated molecular pathways.

title: The G protein-coupled receptor ADGRG6 maintains mouse growth plate homeostasis through IHH signaling.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of ADGRG6 in maintaining mouse growth plate homeostasis. It demonstrates that ADGRG6 is essential for regulating chondrocyte proliferation, differentiation, and signaling pathways like IHH and PTHrP. The findings elucidate the mechanisms by which this receptor contributes to skeletal growth.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Study Reveals Heterogeneous Metabolic Adaptation and a Role of Pericentral PPARα/CAR/Ces2a Axis During Fasting in Mouse Liver.
biological_context: Mouse liver adaptation to fasting and refeeding states
main_goals: To elucidate dynamic temporal-spatial gene cascades and liver zonation adaptation to nutritional shifts using spatial transcriptomics. The study identifies pericentral CAR as a regulator of triglyceride metabolism during fasting, influenced by Pparα activation and enhancing lipolysis via Ces2a.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Approach to Understanding Coronary Atherosclerotic Plaque Stability.
main_goals: To investigate the vascular microenvironment in patients with stable and unstable coronary atherosclerotic plaques using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to map the vascular transcriptome and characterize cell-specific and regional transcriptional alterations associated with plaque instability. It seeks to identify novel mediators of acute coronary syndrome and inform preventative/therapeutic strategies.

title: An aberrant immune-epithelial progenitor niche drives viral lung sequelae.
biological_context: Post-acute sequelae of SARS-CoV-2 (PASC) and viral lung disease
main_goals: The study identified an aberrant immune-epithelial progenitor niche in fibroproliferation in respiratory PASC using patient cohorts and a mouse model. It highlights CD8+ T cell-macrophage interactions driving fibrosis and proposes therapeutic strategies targeting IFNγ+TNF or IL-1β.

title: Morphogenic, molecular, and cellular adaptations for unidirectional airflow in the chicken lung.
biological_context: Chicken lung development and adaptation to unidirectional airflow
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study delineates the morphogenic, molecular, and cellular features that enable unidirectional airflow in the chicken lung. It identifies key developmental processes, including parabronchi formation and alveologenesis, and characterizes a novel luminal cell type. The research aims to explore evolutionary lung diversification and lay the foundation for functional genetic analysis.

title: Endogenous adenine is a potential driver of the cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic syndrome.
biological_context: Cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic (CKM) syndrome, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, heart failure with preserved ejection fraction, myocardial infarction
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', 'bulk metabolomics', 'single nucleus gene expression', 'urine adenine/creatinine ratio', 'snRNA-seq', 'heart adenine and MTAP gene expression']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Metabolomics Analysis', 'Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of endogenous adenine in the cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic (CKM) syndrome. It identifies adenine as upregulated in the hearts of patients with diabetes and left ventricular hypertrophy and demonstrates that adenine accumulation causes heart dysfunction and ischemic heart damage in preclinical models. The findings suggest adenine is a potential driver and therapeutic target for CKM syndrome-related heart diseases.

title: Type 1 innate lymphoid cells: a biomarker and therapeutic candidate in sarcoidosis.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of type 1 innate lymphoid cells (ILC1s) in sarcoidosis. It identifies an accumulation of ILC1s and a CXCL12/CXCR4 axis in sarcoidosis skin samples, and demonstrates their contribution to granuloma formation in a mouse model. The findings suggest ILC1s as potential diagnostic biomarkers and therapeutic targets for sarcoidosis.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals the Transcriptomic Signatures in a Mouse Model of Pediatric Metabolic Dysfunction-Associated Steatohepatitis.
biological_context: Pediatric metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH) in mice
main_goals: To develop and characterize a mouse model of pediatric MASH using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify transcriptomic signatures associated with the disease and explore potential links to disease pathogenesis, such as the role of cytochrome P450 2E1.

title: Microglia LILRB4 upregulation reduces brain damage after acute ischemic stroke by limiting CD8<sup>+</sup> T cell recruitment.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of LILRB4 in modulating the immune response and its potential protective effects against ischemic brain injury in mice. It demonstrates that LILRB4 in microglia plays a crucial role in moderating the post-stroke immune response by controlling CD8+ T cell infiltration and activation. The findings highlight the therapeutic potential of targeting LILRB4 for mitigating immune-mediated damage in ischemic stroke.

title: Re-analysis of single cell and spatial transcriptomics data reveals B cell landscape in gastric cancer microenvironment and its potential crosstalk with tumor cells for clinical prognosis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study aimed to explore the B cell landscape in the gastric cancer microenvironment and its potential crosstalk with tumor cells for clinical prognosis. It identified B cell subpopulations, differentiation trajectories, and co-localization patterns with tumor cells. The research also highlighted the CCL28-CCR10 signaling axis as a key player in tumor cell-B cell communication and the LAMA/CD44 axis as a potential prognostic marker for immunotherapy.

title: Eganelisib combined with immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy and chemotherapy in frontline metastatic triple-negative breast cancer triggers macrophage reprogramming, immune activation and extracellular matrix reorganization in the tumor microenvironment.
data_modalities_used: ['multiplex immunofluorescence', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'PD-L1 immunohistochemistry', 'flow cytometry', 'multiplex cytokine analysis']
main_goals: This paper presents translational analyses from a phase 2 clinical trial (MARIO-3) evaluating eganelisib combined with atezolizumab and nab-paclitaxel in frontline metastatic triple-negative breast cancer. The study aimed to understand the mechanisms of action, focusing on macrophage reprogramming, immune activation, and extracellular matrix reorganization within the tumor microenvironment. The findings support the therapeutic rationale for combining eganelisib with immunotherapy and chemotherapy.

title: Distinct clinical outcomes and biological features of specific KRAS mutants in human pancreatic cancer.
main_goals: This study examines the distinct clinical outcomes and biological features associated with specific KRAS mutations in human pancreatic cancer. It identifies that KRAS²G12R mutations are linked to earlier stage disease and improved survival compared to KRAS²G12D, exploring underlying biological mechanisms through spatial profiling and RNA-sequencing.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics of vulvar lichen sclerosus reveal multi-compartmental alterations in gene expression and signaling cross-talk.
main_goals: This study utilizes single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to analyze vulvar lichen sclerosus (VLS) lesions and controls. It reveals molecular and cellular heterogeneities and identifies unifying gene expression changes across cell types in VLS, highlighting cellular stress, T cell activation, aberrant signaling, and increased activation of IFN, JAK/STAT, and p53 pathways. The findings offer insights into VLS pathogenesis and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Characteristics of blood-brain barrier heterogeneity between brain regions revealed by profiling vascular and perivascular cells.
