biological_context: Blood-brain barrier heterogeneity between brain regions in mice
main_goals: The study investigated the molecular and anatomical specializations contributing to blood-brain barrier (BBB) heterogeneity between different brain regions. It identified molecular differences in vascular and perivascular cells and distinct interaction patterns, highlighting the role of both in BBB functional variation. The platform developed can aid in future BBB research and the development of targeted CNS therapeutics.

title: A targetable type III immune response with increase of IL-17A expressing CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells is associated with immunotherapy-induced toxicity in melanoma.
data_modalities_used: ['serum proteomic analyses', 'multiplex cytokine and chemokine assays', 'flow cytometry', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study investigates the molecular mechanisms behind immunotherapy-induced adverse events in melanoma. It identifies a link between type III immune responses, specifically IL-17A expressing CD4+ T cells, and these toxicities. The findings suggest anti-IL-17A as a potential therapeutic target for managing these adverse events.

title: Meningeal solitary fibrous tumor cell states phenocopy cerebral vascular development and homeostasis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'immunofluorescence', 'immunohistochemistry']
covered_analysis_steps: ['single-cell analysis', 'spatial transcriptomic analysis', 'cell-cell communication analysis', 'trajectory analysis', 'pseudotemporal ordering']
main_goals: This paper aims to define the cell states and spatial transcriptomic architecture of meningeal SFTs across histological grades and patient-matched samples. The study investigates the underlying pathways and cell-cell interactions in SFTs by comparing them to cerebral vascular development and homeostasis, and to meningiomas. The findings provide insights into the unique clinical behavior of meningeal SFTs and a framework for integrating multi-omics data.

title: Hypoxic Upregulation of IER2 Increases Paracrine GMFG Signaling of Endoplasmic Reticulum Stress-CAF to Promote Chordoma Progression via Targeting ITGB1.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler', 'data-independent acquisition proteomics', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'multiplexed quantitative immunofluorescence']
main_goals: This study investigates the oncogenic mechanism of the endoplasmic reticulum stress-CAF (ERS-CAF) subpopulation in chordoma. It reveals that hypoxia reprograms CAFs into ERS-CAFs via IER2 upregulation, leading to paracrine GMFG signaling that promotes chordoma progression by targeting ITGB1 on tumor cells. The findings highlight the IER2/GMFG/ITGB1 axis as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Unveiling Molecular Diversity in Cerebral Thrombi via Spatial Transcriptomics.
biological_context: Intracranial thrombosis, specifically in the middle cerebral artery related to atherosclerosis and stroke.
main_goals: This study aims to unveil the molecular diversity within cerebral thrombi using spatial transcriptomics. It investigates the cellular and molecular landscape of thrombi from patients undergoing thrombectomy for middle cerebral artery occlusion, providing insights into the biological processes underlying stroke.

title: Integration of Bioinformatics and Machine Learning to Identify CD8+ T Cell-Related Prognostic Signature to Predict Clinical Outcomes and Treatment Response in Breast Cancer Patients.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify a CD8+ T cell-related prognostic signature to predict clinical outcomes and treatment response in breast cancer patients. It leveraged bioinformatics and machine learning to construct a prognostic score (CTR score) from CD8+ T cell-related genes. The signature's relationship with the tumor microenvironment, immunotherapy response, and drug sensitivity was analyzed, and its expression heterogeneity was investigated.

title: Disturbance of Immune Microenvironment in Androgenetic Alopecia through Spatial Transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Clustering', 'Differential Expression Analysis', 'Protein-Protein Interaction Networks']
main_goals: This study investigated immune cells around the infundibulum of hair follicles in androgenetic alopecia (AGA) using spatial transcriptome profiling. The aim was to understand the immunological disruptions and identify cell types and molecular dysregulation in the peri-infundibular immune infiltration (PII) region. The findings revealed distinct immune landscapes and a bias towards a Th2 response in AGA patients compared to controls.

title: Heavy Metal Exposure-Mediated Dysregulation of Sphingolipid Metabolism.
biological_context: Respiratory diseases, particularly asthma, and the effects of heavy metal exposure on pulmonary cells.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'quantitative real-time PCR', 'in vitro model system', 'ex vivo human tissue models']
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of local high concentrations of specific heavy metals (NaAsO2, MnCl2, and CdCl2) on sphingolipid homeostasis and oxidative stress in pulmonary cells. It evaluates the expression of enzymatic regulators of sphingolipid metabolism and observed differential modulation. The study also identified heavy metal exposure-induced transcriptomic signatures of oxidative stress in epithelial cells and human lung tissues.

title: An integrated single-cell reference atlas of the human endometrium.
main_goals: To create a high-resolution reference atlas of the human endometrium (HECA) by integrating multiple single-cell transcriptomics datasets. This atlas identifies cell types, characterizes stromal-epithelial cell coordination via TGFβ signaling, and defines signaling between fibroblasts and progenitor cells in the basalis. HECA is also used to identify dysregulated cell types in endometriosis by integrating with GWAS data.

title: Spatially clustered type I interferon responses at injury borderzones.
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial distribution and cellular origin of Type I interferon responses at the borderzones of myocardial infarction. It identifies cardiomyocytes as the dominant initiators of this response, leading to the formation of interferon-induced cell colonies that contribute to pathological remodeling and increased risk of ventricular rupture. The findings suggest targeting IRF3 activation in non-immune cells as a therapeutic strategy.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptomic mapping of regenerative inflammation in skeletal muscle reveals a dynamic multilayered tissue architecture.
biological_context: Skeletal muscle regeneration following acute injury and in dystrophic muscle
main_goals: This study reconstructs the dynamic trajectories of myeloid cells in injured and dystrophic muscles to understand how macrophages spatially adapt and diversify their functions. It identifies distinct macrophage and DC subsets and their organized distribution in regenerative inflammation zones (RIZs) around damaged myofibers, revealing a multilayered tissue architecture that supports regeneration. The study also shows that glucocorticoid treatment disrupts these RIZs.

title: The heterogeneity of cellular metabolism in the tumour microenvironment of hepatocellular carcinoma with portal vein tumour thrombus.
biological_context: Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) with portal vein tumour thrombus (PVTT)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study comprehensively analyzed the metabolic heterogeneity of HCC, PVTT, and normal liver samples using multi-omics combinations. It identified optimal subtypes that interpret PVTT formation and development, and developed a combined index for predicting prognosis and immunotherapy responses. The study also highlighted the metabolism of polyamines, particularly ODC1, as a key metabolic pathway involved in the conversion of metabolic heterogeneity.

title: The co-location of CD14+APOE+ cells and MMP7+ tumour cells contributed to worse immunotherapy response in non-small cell lung cancer.
main_goals: This study investigated intra-tumour immune infiltration patterns and their spatial structures in NSCLC to understand their impact on immunotherapy response. It identified immune exclusion and activation patterns, with CD14+APOE+ cells and MMP7+ tumour cells co-locating and negatively impacting T-cell infiltration and immunotherapy outcomes.

title: A multidimensional analysis reveals distinct immune phenotypes and the composition of immune aggregates in pediatric acute myeloid leukemia.
biological_context: Pediatric acute myeloid leukemia (AML) bone marrow
main_goals: This study conducts a multidimensional analysis of the tumor immune microenvironment in pediatric AML and non-leukemic controls. It demonstrates that nearly one-third of pediatric AML cases have an immune-infiltrated bone marrow with altered macrophage ratios. The study also detects T cell networks and analyzes their composition using spatial transcriptomics.

title: Integrated multi-omics analyses reveal the pro-inflammatory and pro-fibrotic pulmonary macrophage subcluster in silicosis.
data_modalities_used: ['Bronchoalveolar lavage fluid analysis', 'Multiplex cytokine analysis', 'Single-cell RNA sequencing', 'Spatial transcriptomics', 'Histology', 'Hydroxyproline assay', 'Immunohistochemical staining', 'Quantitative polymerase chain reaction']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the phenotypic and functional heterogeneity of pulmonary macrophages in silicosis using integrated multi-omics analyses. The researchers identified a specific subcluster of Mmp12hi macrophages that are pro-inflammatory and pro-fibrotic, contributing to the progression of fibrosis. The findings suggest that this macrophage subset could be a potential therapeutic target for silicosis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics elucidates medulla niche supporting germinal center response in myasthenia gravis-associated thymoma.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptome analysis to investigate the pathology of thymoma and thymic hyperplasia in patients with myasthenia gravis. It identifies the enlarged medullary region in seropositive thymomas as containing MG-specific germinal center structures and enriched immune cells, linking it to MG pathology.

title: Multi-transcriptomics analysis of microvascular invasion-related malignant cells and development of a machine learning-based prognostic model in hepatocellular carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This study aimed to identify and characterize microvascular invasion (MVI)-related malignant cells in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and develop a machine learning-based prognostic model. The research delineated MVI-related malignant cell subtypes using multi-transcriptomics data, exploring their biological functions and interactions. The developed prognostic model demonstrated high sensitivity and specificity for predicting patient outcomes.

title: Spatial transcriptomic validation of a biomimetic model of fibrosis enables re-evaluation of a therapeutic antibody targeting LOXL2.
main_goals: This study aims to validate a biomimetic model of fibrosis using spatial transcriptomics by comparing it to active human lung fibrogenesis sites. The research evaluates a therapeutic antibody targeting LOXL2 within this model, revealing its anti-angiogenic but not anti-fibrotic activity, which has implications for previous clinical trial interpretations.

title: Intra-patient spatial comparison of non-metastatic and metastatic lymph nodes reveals the reduction of CD169<sup>+</sup> macrophages by metastatic breast cancers.
biological_context: Breast cancer metastasis to lymph nodes
main_goals: This study aimed to comprehensively characterize the effects of breast cancers on immune cells in lymph nodes by comparing non-metastatic and metastatic lymph nodes. It revealed a significant reduction in CD169+ macrophages in metastatic lymph nodes, suggesting a detrimental impact on anti-cancer immunity.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals profound subclonal heterogeneity and T-cell dysfunction in extramedullary myeloma.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'RNA tomography', 'tomo-seq', '10x Visium', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial heterogeneity analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This study aims to dissect the 3-dimensional architecture of extramedullary myeloma (EMD) and its microenvironment using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. It reveals profound subclonal heterogeneity, T-cell dysfunction, and spatial differences in antigen expression, highlighting potential new therapeutic avenues.

title: Multiplex spatial omics reveals changes in immune-epithelial crosstalk during inflammation and dysplasia development in chronic IBD patients.
biological_context: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and colitis-associated cancer (CAC)
data_modalities_used: ['digital spatial RNA profiling', 'RNAscope', 'imaging mass cytometry', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed imaging']
main_goals: This study investigates the molecular changes contributing to colitis-associated cancer (CAC) development in patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Using spatial omics techniques, it reveals distinct inflammatory patterns, including activated IL-17 pathways, engaged STAT3 signaling, and diminished cytotoxic T cell infiltration, which are associated with disease progression.

title: A single-cell and spatially resolved atlas of human osteosarcomas.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The study aims to provide a comprehensive single-cell and spatially resolved transcriptomics atlas of human osteosarcomas. It seeks to characterize cellular composition, functional states, and the impact of chemotherapy, as well as identify spatial niches associated with resistance and inter-cellular crosstalk.

title: Spatial transcriptomics profiling of gallbladder adenocarcinoma: a detailed two-case study of progression from precursor lesions to cancer.
biological_context: Gallbladder adenocarcinoma and its precursor lesions (Biliary intraepithelial neoplasia)
main_goals: To characterize the spatial transcriptomics of gallbladder cancer tumourigenesis in individual patients using GeoMx digital spatial profiling. The study investigated the progression from precursor lesions to cancer within two patients and identified the role of Semaphorin 4A (SEMA4A) repression in promoting tumour progression.

title: Host-pathogen interactions in the Plasmodium-infected mouse liver at spatial and single-cell resolution.
main_goals: To delineate host-pathogen interactions across Plasmodium berghei-infected mouse liver tissues at spatial and single-cell resolution. The study reveals changes in spatial gene expression, lipid metabolism, and distinct inflammation programs. It serves as a benchmark for investigating transcriptome changes during host-parasite interactions in tissues.

title: Spatial transcriptomic revealed intratumor heterogeneity and cancer stem cell enrichment in colorectal cancer metastasis.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer metastasis to the liver
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study applied spatial transcriptomics to investigate intratumor heterogeneity and cancer stem cell enrichment in colorectal cancer liver metastasis. It identified FOXD1 as a potential metastatic CSC marker and revealed distinct evolutionary trajectories during metastasis, providing insights into the cellular mechanisms underlying CRC metastasis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of fetal membrane-Decidual interface reveals unique contributions by cell types in term and preterm births.
biological_context: Fetal membrane-decidual interface during pregnancy, including term and preterm births.
main_goals: This study used single-cell transcriptomics to unravel the transcriptomics network at spatial levels within the fetal membrane-decidual interface. The goal was to discern the contributions of each layer (amnion epithelium, amnion mesenchyme, chorion, and decidua) to term and preterm birth outcomes. The findings identified spatially recognized differentially expressed genes and associated pathways, aiming to provide insights for targeted interventions against preterm birth.

title: Combining single-cell spatial transcriptomics and molecular simulation to develop in vivo probes targeting the perineural invasion region of adenoid cystic carcinoma.
biological_context: Adenoid cystic carcinoma (ACC) with perineural invasion (PNI)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell transcriptomic sequencing', 'in vivo experiments', 'in vitro experiments']
main_goals: To develop in vivo probes targeting the perineural invasion (PNI) region of adenoid cystic carcinoma (ACC) by combining spatial transcriptomics and single-cell sequencing. The study identified peptide probes targeting Major Histocompatibility Complex II (MHC-II) molecules on Schwann cells within the PNI region and validated their efficacy in labeling viable Schwann cells. These probes serve as a tool for dynamic in vivo marking of tumor invasion into nerves.

title: Advancing precision medicine in gliomas through single-cell sequencing: unveiling the complex tumor microenvironment.
main_goals: This paper aims to advance precision medicine in gliomas by leveraging single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to understand the complex tumor microenvironment. It examines the interactions of various cell types, including microglia, macrophages, endothelial cells, and T cells, and their impact on glioblastoma growth and therapeutic response. The ultimate goal is to identify novel therapeutic strategies targeting these interactions.

title: Breaking barriers: improving time and space resolution of arbuscular mycorrhizal symbiosis with single-cell sequencing approaches.
biological_context: Arbuscular mycorrhizal symbiosis, plant-fungal interaction for nutrient acquisition
main_goals: To highlight the potential of single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) approaches to improve the time and space resolution of arbuscular mycorrhizal (AM) symbiosis research. The paper discusses the challenges and benefits of scRNA-seq and suggests integration with spatial transcriptomics for a comprehensive understanding of AM symbiosis.

title: Characterisation of HBV and co-infection with HDV and HIV through spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Chronic Hepatitis B (CHB) with co-infection of Hepatitis Delta Virus (HDV) or Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)
main_goals: To evaluate spatial transcriptomics (NanoString GeoMx) for characterising the intrahepatic transcriptional landscape, cellular composition, and biological pathways in liver biopsy samples from patients with HBV and HDV or HIV co-infection. The study aims to provide insights into complex intrahepatic processes guiding personalized treatments.

title: Distinct tumor-TAM interactions in IDH-stratified glioma microenvironments unveiled by single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study delineates the phenotypic heterogeneity of tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) across IDH-stratified gliomas. It identifies distinct tumor-TAM crosstalk in IDH-WT gliomas, proposing SLAMF9 as a therapeutic target and revealing ANXA1-FPR1/3, FN1-ITGAVB1, VEGFA-NRP1, and TNFSF12-TNFRSF12A as key communication pathways. The findings offer insights into TAM roles and vulnerabilities in IDH-WT GBM.

title: Conserved B cell signaling, activation, and differentiation in porcine jejunal and ileal Peyer's patches despite distinct immune landscapes.
biological_context: Porcine jejunal and ileal Peyer's patches
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'ex vivo staining', 'in situ staining']
main_goals: This study aimed to define B cell signaling, activation, and differentiation in porcine jejunal and ileal Peyer's patches using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. Despite distinct immune landscapes between intestinal locations, the research identified conserved B cell dynamics and deduced activation/differentiation routes. The findings establish a benchmark for understanding intestinal immune induction.

title: LIM domain only 7: a novel driver of immune evasion through regulatory T cell differentiation and chemotaxis in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial proteomics', 'in vitro experiments', 'in vivo experiments', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study aimed to uncover PDAC's immune microenvironment heterogeneity and identify molecular mechanisms driving immune evasion, specifically focusing on the role of LIM domain only 7 (LMO7) in promoting regulatory T cell (Treg) differentiation and chemotaxis, leading to immune evasion in PDAC. It also investigates targeting the LMO7-Foxp1-TGF-β/CCL5 axis as a therapeutic strategy.

title: Origin, structure, and composition of the spider major ampullate silk fiber revealed by genomics, proteomics, and single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper aims to understand the bioprocessing and composition of spider silk fibers by identifying the proteins involved and mapping their production within the gland. It reveals the cellular and zonal organization of the major ampullate silk gland and the layered structure of the fiber. The study provides significant advancements in understanding the spider silk gland and the resulting fiber's architecture and composition.

title: Spatial multiomics reveals a subpopulation of fibroblasts associated with cancer stemness in human hepatocellular carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['multi-region proteomics', '10X Genomics Visium spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed imaging', 'bulk transcriptome']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Colocalization']
main_goals: This study aimed to decipher the expression heterogeneity, functional diversity, spatial distribution, colocalization, and interaction of fibroblasts in the liver tumor microenvironment. The researchers identified a novel subpopulation of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs), termed F5-CAF, associated with cancer stemness and unfavorable prognosis in hepatocellular carcinoma.

title: The spatial distribution of intermediate fibroblasts and myeloid-derived cells dictate lymph node metastasis dynamics in oral cancer.
biological_context: Oral cancer (gingivo-buccal oral squamous cell carcinoma)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Gene expression profiling', 'Differential gene expression', 'Deconvolution', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate the localization of genes and cell types within the invasive margins of oral cancer that could lead to nodal metastasis. The study identified the tumor-stromal interface as a critical region for disease progression and pinpointed specific genes and cell types contributing to metastasis.

title: CCL19-producing fibroblasts promote tertiary lymphoid structure formation enhancing anti-tumor IgG response in colorectal cancer liver metastasis.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs) in colorectal cancer liver metastasis (CRLM). It reveals that CCL19-producing fibroblasts promote TLS formation, which in turn enhances anti-tumor IgG responses. The findings suggest a therapeutic strategy using CCL19 to restrict CRLM.

title: Integrated analysis of spatial transcriptomics and CT phenotypes for unveiling the novel molecular characteristics of recurrent and non-recurrent high-grade serous ovarian cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'CT phenotypes', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'histology images']
main_goals: To integrate spatial transcriptomics and CT phenotypes to identify molecular characteristics of recurrent and non-recurrent high-grade serous ovarian cancer. The study aimed to uncover novel diagnostic and therapeutic targets by correlating spatial gene expression patterns with CT imaging features, contributing to personalized medicine approaches.

title: Divergent venom effectors correlate with ecological niche in neuropteran predators.
biological_context: Neuropteran predators (antlion Euroleon nostras and lacewing Chrysoperla carnea) and their venom systems
main_goals: This study investigated the venom systems in two neuropteran predators occupying distinct ecological niches (antlion Euroleon nostras and lacewing Chrysoperla carnea) using spatial transcriptomics, proteomics, morphological analysis, and bioassays. The aim was to understand how venom composition correlates with ecological niche and to identify the origin of venom proteins. The findings highlight the molecular evolution of venom as a key adaptation for antlions.

title: The neocortical infrastructure for language involves region-specific patterns of laminar gene expression.
biological_context: Human language network in the neocortex
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell expression data', 'postmortem cortical tissue samples']
main_goals: The study identified region-specific patterns of laminar gene expression in the human neocortex's language network. It found 56 genes with differential laminar expression between frontal and temporal language cortex, which are associated with structural connectivity and language-related disorders.

title: Dual mass spectrometry imaging and spatial metabolomics to investigate the metabolism and nephrotoxicity of nitidine chloride.
biological_context: Kidney metabolism and nephrotoxicity of nitidine chloride
main_goals: This study uses integrated mass spectrometry imaging and spatial metabolomics to investigate the metabolism and nephrotoxicity of nitidine chloride. It aims to identify the region-specific accumulation of nitidine chloride in the kidney, map its localization within renal tubules, and identify endogenous metabolites associated with chronic exposure to understand the underlying mechanisms of nephrotoxicity.

title: Single-nucleus chromatin accessibility and transcriptomic map of breast tissues of women of diverse genetic ancestry.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-type classification', 'Gene expression analysis', 'Integration with spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: To develop a comprehensive chromatin accessibility and gene expression atlas of the breast tissue using single-nucleus analysis. The study aims to classify cell types, establish relationships between chromatin accessibility and gene expression, and investigate genetic ancestry-dependent variability in breast biology. It also explores differences between lobular and ductal epithelial cells and age-associated changes.

title: Spatial proteomic profiling elucidates immune determinants of neoadjuvant chemo-immunotherapy in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study integrates clinical outcomes with spatial proteomic profiling using Imaging Mass Cytometry (IMC) to understand the immune microenvironment dynamics in response to neoadjuvant chemo-immunotherapy in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC). It identifies spatial features predictive of therapeutic outcomes and uses machine learning to develop predictive models for drug response.

title: Integrative single-cell RNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics analyses reveal diverse apoptosis-related gene expression profiles in EGFR-mutated lung cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'scRNA-seq analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of apoptosis-related genes in EGFR-mutated lung cancer, particularly in the context of acquired resistance to TKIs. It utilizes scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics to profile gene expression changes and identifies BCL2L1/BCL-XL as a key survival factor, with genetic and pharmacological inhibition showing promise in overcoming resistance.

title: The effects of age and dysfunction on meibomian gland population dynamics.
biological_context: Meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD) and aging in mice
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction']
main_goals: To use single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to probe changes in cell composition, differentiation, and gene expression associated with age-related gland atrophy and altered meibum quality in mice. The study aimed to identify mechanisms controlling meibomian gland function and dysfunction.

title: Spatial transcriptomic characterization of pathologic niches in IPF.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To bridge the gap in understanding IPF by providing spatial context to scRNA-seq data. The study aimed to identify disease-associated niches with unique cellular compositions and localizations in IPF lung tissue, facilitating the identification of drug targets and the development of in vitro models.

title: Single-cell sequencing combined with spatial transcriptomics reveals that the IRF7 gene in M1 macrophages inhibits the occurrence of pancreatic cancer by regulating lipid metabolism-related mechanisms.
main_goals: This study investigates the inhibitory role of IRF7 in M1 macrophages on pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PAAD) by regulating lipid metabolism. It explores the transfer of RPS18 via exosomes from M1 macrophages to PAAD cells, affecting ILF3 expression. The research also assesses the impact of IRF7/RPS18 on PAAD cell behavior and tumor formation in vivo.

title: Psoriatic arthritis subtypes are phenocopied in humanized mice.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of CD8+ T cells in psoriatic arthritis (PsA) using a humanized mouse model. The study aims to understand PsA pathogenesis, improve personalized therapies, and identify new therapeutic targets by recapitulating disease phenotypes in mice.

title: Single-cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Ferroptosis as The Most Enriched Programmed Cell Death Process in Hemorrhage Stroke-induced Oligodendrocyte-mediated White Matter Injury.
main_goals: This study used single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to investigate programmed cell death (PCD) in rat brains after hemorrhagic stroke. It identified ferroptosis as the primary PCD process affecting oligodendrocytes, occurring early post-ICH, and revealed a microglial LCN2/CSF1/CSF1R pathway mediating this ferroptosis, suggesting therapeutic targets.

title: A spatial expression atlas of the adult human proximal small intestine.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics', 'single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To reconstruct a comprehensive spatial expression atlas of the adult human proximal small intestine using spatial transcriptomics, spatial proteomics, and single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization. The study aims to describe zonated expression and cell type representation, characterize cell migration and function, and identify unique anatomical features like serrated and branched villi.

title: Age-related epithelial defects limit thymic function and regeneration.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell Segmentation']
main_goals: This study investigates age-related changes in thymic epithelial cells (TECs) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, lineage-tracing, and advanced imaging. It identifies atypical TEC states (aaTECs) that accumulate with age, impair thymic function, and hinder regeneration after injury. These findings highlight a mechanism of thymic involution linked to immune aging.

title: A single-cell transcriptomic map of the developing Atoh1 lineage identifies neural fate decisions and neuronal diversity in the hindbrain.
main_goals: This paper analyzes single-cell RNA sequencing and ATOH1 DNA binding in developing mouse hindbrain Atoh1 lineage neurons to identify neural fate decisions and neuronal diversity. It aims to provide markers for specific brainstem nuclei and insights into progenitor heterogeneity and migration. The study also identifies a population of proliferating unipolar brush cell progenitors.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptomics reveals distinct patterns of dysregulation in non-neuronal and neuronal cells induced by the Trem2<sup>R47H</sup> Alzheimer's risk gene mutation.
main_goals: This study analyzes the impact of the Trem2(R47H) mutation on specific cell types in mouse brain regions using MERFISH spatial transcriptomics. It aims to identify plaque and mutation-induced transcriptomic dysregulation in glial and neuronal cells, investigating inflammatory responses and BDNF signaling.

title: Enhanced microglial dynamics and a paucity of tau seeding in the amyloid plaque microenvironment contribute to cognitive resilience in Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: This study investigated postmortem brains of asymptomatic Alzheimer's disease (AsymAD) subjects to understand resilience mechanisms. It found that AsymAD cases exhibit enhanced microglial dynamics and reduced tau seeding activity in the amyloid plaque microenvironment compared to AD brains. These findings suggest potential protective mechanisms against AD pathology.

title: Dynamic development of microglia and macrophages after spinal cord injury.
main_goals: This study uses single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the distinct evolutionary paths of microglia and macrophages following spinal cord injury. The findings highlight differences in their activation states, communication with other cells, and potential neuroprotective pathways, which were validated by in vivo experiments.

title: Spatial immune landscapes of SARS-CoV-2 gastrointestinal infection: macrophages contribute to local tissue inflammation and gastrointestinal symptoms.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study investigated the spatial immune landscapes in the gastrointestinal tract of COVID-19 patients with gastrointestinal symptoms. It aimed to identify immune cell subgroups and their spatial distribution, correlating these findings with clinical symptoms and gene expression patterns. The research highlights the role of macrophages in local tissue inflammation and potential molecular targets for COVID-19-related gastrointestinal symptoms.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals organized and distinct immune activation in cutaneous granulomatous disorders.
biological_context: Cutaneous granulomatous disorders (cutaneous sarcoidosis, granuloma annulare, necrobiosis lipoidica, necrobiotic xanthogranuloma)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To understand spatial gene expression characteristics in noninfectious cutaneous granulomatous disorders by performing spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to compare patterns of immune activation and extracellular matrix alteration in a spatially resolved fashion, revealing distinct and organized immune activation patterns that correlate with hallmark histologic changes.

title: Single-cell tumor heterogeneity landscape of hepatocellular carcinoma: unraveling the pro-metastatic subtype and its interaction loop with fibroblasts.
main_goals: The study aimed to establish a heterogeneity landscape of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) malignant cells by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data. It identified three tumor cell subtypes, with a pro-metastatic subtype (S100A6+) playing a crucial role in metastasis. The research also uncovered a positive feedback loop between tumor cells and fibroblasts mediated by specific interactions, suggesting this as a potential anti-metastatic strategy.

title: Spatial transcriptome reveals the region-specific genes and pathways regulated by Satb2 in neocortical development.
main_goals: This study investigated the region-specific gene regulation by Satb2 in neocortical development using spatial transcriptomics and immuno-staining. It aimed to identify genes and pathways dysregulated in Satb2 knockout mice across different neocortical regions (VZ/SVZ, IZ, CP). The findings reveal Satb2's role in regulating neural precursor proliferation, neuronal differentiation, migration, and lineage-specific gene expression.

title: Transcriptional regulation of the postnatal cardiac conduction system heterogeneity.
main_goals: This study demonstrates the transcriptomic landscape of the postnatal mouse cardiac conduction system at single-cell resolution with spatial information. It uncovers region-specific markers and gene regulatory networks contributing to the system's heterogeneity. The findings are supported by experimental validation using neonatal myocytes and genomic assays.

title: A low level of tumor necrosis factor α in tumor microenvironment maintains the self-renewal of glioma stem cells by Vasorin-mediated glycolysis.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'immunoblotting', 'sphere formation assay', 'extreme limiting dilution', 'gene expression analysis', 'Mass spectrometry', 'RNA-sequencing detection', 'qRT-RNA', 'immunofluorescence', 'immunohistochemistry', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'in vitro models', 'in vivo models']
main_goals: This study explores the role of tumor necrosis factor α (TNFα) in the tumor microenvironment of glioma, specifically its effect on glioma stem cell (GSC) self-renewal and its correlation with patient prognosis. It investigates the mechanism by which a low level of TNFα, mediated by Vasorin (VASN), promotes GSC self-renewal through glycolysis, leading to inhibited TNFα secretion by tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs). The findings suggest that targeting VASN and TNFα could be a therapeutic strategy for glioblastoma.

title: 12-Lipoxygenase inhibition delays onset of autoimmune diabetes in human gene replacement mice.
main_goals: This study investigates the therapeutic potential of targeting 12-lipoxygenase (12-LOX) in a mouse model of autoimmune diabetes. It demonstrates that a 12-LOX inhibitor (VLX-1005) delays diabetes onset and alters the immune microenvironment of islets and macrophages. The study also highlights the utility of a human gene replacement mouse model for evaluating LOX inhibitors.

title: Integrated multi-omics profiling landscape of organising pneumonia.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'Visium CytAssist spatial transcriptomics', 'proteomics', 'metabolomics', 'mass spectrometry', 'Mice']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of lipid metabolism reprogramming in organizing pneumonia (OP), focusing on inflammation and fibrosis. It utilized multi-omics profiling to analyze tissues and a mouse model, identifying key genes and pathways involved in OP pathogenesis. The findings reveal a significant association between OP and lipid metabolism reprogramming, contributing to the understanding of OP mechanisms.

title: Precise Identification of Glioblastoma Micro-Infiltration at Cellular Resolution by Raman Spectroscopy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study demonstrates that Raman spectroscopy can precisely identify glioblastoma (GBM) micro-infiltration at cellular resolution in clinical specimens. It leverages spectral differences in biochemical metabolites to differentiate between infiltrative lesions and normal brain tissue. The developed approach, combined with machine learning, shows high accuracy and can detect even very low concentrations of cancer cells, potentially guiding complete tumor resection.

title: LEAFY and WAPO1 jointly regulate spikelet number per spike and floret development in wheat.
biological_context: Wheat inflorescence development, spikelet number per spike, and floret development.
main_goals: This study investigates the roles of LEAFY and WAPO1 transcription factors in regulating spikelet number per spike and floret development in wheat. It demonstrates their physical and genetic interaction and their influence on the transition of the inflorescence meristem to a terminal spikelet. The research also highlights genetic interactions with VRN1 and FUL2, providing insights into the genetic network governing this important agronomic trait.

title: Biallelic null variants in PNPLA8 cause microcephaly by reducing the number of basal radial glia.
biological_context: Human brain development, microcephaly, neurological disorders
data_modalities_used: ['cerebral organoids', 'induced pluripotent stem cells', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study identifies biallelic null variants in PNPLA8 as a cause of microcephaly by reducing the number of basal radial glia. It characterizes the phenotypic spectrum of PNPLA8-related neurological diseases and investigates the underlying mechanisms using cerebral organoids and spatial transcriptomics. The findings suggest PNPLA8 is crucial for phospholipid synthesis and basal radial glia production in human brain development.

title: Elucidating the multifaceted role of MGAT1 in hepatocellular carcinoma: integrative single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal novel therapeutic insights.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of glycosyltransferase-associated genes in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) pathogenesis and the tumor microenvironment using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to identify novel biomarkers and immunotherapeutic targets, particularly focusing on MGAT1.

title: Mapping the molecular landscape of Lotus japonicus nodule organogenesis through spatiotemporal transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper utilized spatial transcriptomics to map the molecular landscape of Lotus japonicus nodule organogenesis. It identified developmental trajectories of infection and peripheral zones, revealing biological processes and gene sets for symbiosis and material exchange. The study highlights LjNLP3 as a transcription factor orchestrating nodule maturation.

title: Spatial transcriptome and single-cell reveal the role of nucleotide metabolism in colorectal cancer progression and tumor microenvironment.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer progression and tumor microenvironment
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Prognosis', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of nucleotide metabolism in colorectal cancer (CRC) progression by integrating spatial transcriptomics and single-cell data. It identified two tumor cell subtypes (NUhighepi and NUlowepi) based on nucleotide metabolism and analyzed their interactions with the tumor microenvironment, particularly fibroblasts. The study also identified NME1 as a key gene inhibiting metastasis and developed a prognostic model (NRS) for predicting survival and immune therapy response.

title: CTHRC1<sup>+</sup> fibroblasts and SPP1<sup>+</sup> macrophages synergistically contribute to pro-tumorigenic tumor microenvironment in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: This study leverages single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify cellular populations and interactions within the pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) tumor microenvironment. It demonstrates that SPP1+APOE+ TAMs and CTHRC1+GREM1+ myCAFs synergistically promote an immune-suppressive TME through ECM deposition and EMT, highlighting their crosstalk as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Spatial metabolomics method to reveal the differences in chemical composition of raw and honey-fried Stemona tuberosa Lour. by using UPLC-Orbitrap Fusion MS and desorption electrospray ionization mass spectrometry imaging.
biological_context: Stemona tuberosa Lour. (ST) and honey-fried Stemona tuberosa Lour. (HST)
main_goals: This work aimed to analyze the variations in chemical constituents of Stemona tuberosa Lour. before and after honey-frying and to study the distribution of differential markers in the roots. The study utilized UPLC-Orbitrap Fusion MS and DESI-MSI to provide a rapid and effective visualization method for metabolite identification and spatial distribution.

title: Unraveling the dynamics of myometrial remodeling: insights from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics in term pregnancy.
main_goals: To unravel the dynamics of myometrial remodeling during term pregnancy by employing single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to provide insights into the cellular and molecular changes that occur in the myometrium at the end of pregnancy.

title: Applying Spatial Metabolomics To Investigate Age- and Drug-Induced Neurochemical Changes.
biological_context: Mouse brain aging and drug effects
main_goals: This paper investigates age- and drug-induced neurochemical changes in the mouse brain using spatial metabolomics. It reports significant, age-dependent alterations in brain lipids, particularly sulfatides and lysophosphatidic acids. The study also examined the effects of tacrine, an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor, on glutamine/glutamate ratios.

title: High CIB1 expression in colorectal cancer liver metastases correlates with worse survival and the replacement histopathological growth pattern.
data_modalities_used: ['proteomic analysis', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'spatial RNA-sequencing', 'bulk sequencing', 'formal-fixed paraffin-embedded immunohistochemical stainings']
main_goals: This study investigates the correlation between CIB1 expression and patient survival and histopathological growth patterns in colorectal cancer liver metastases. It found that high CIB1 expression is associated with worse survival and the aggressive replacement growth pattern. The findings suggest CIB1 may be a novel marker for stratifying these metastases.

title: Molecular analysis of human tick-bitten skin yields signatures associated with distinct spatial and temporal trajectories - A proof-of-concept study.
main_goals: To uncover molecular mechanisms in tick-bitten skin samples using spatial transcriptomics, revealing perturbations in keratinization and immune system regulation. The study highlights the temporal nature of the host response and offers promise for biomarker discovery for prognosis and therapy.

title: Characterization of Multicellular Niches Supporting Hematopoietic Stem Cells Within Distinct Zones.
biological_context: Fetal liver and adult bone marrow hematopoietic stem cell niches
main_goals: This study investigated the fetal liver as a primary hematopoietic site using spatial transcriptomics to reveal two distinct niches: the portal-vessel (PV) niche and the sinusoidal niche. It also identified two similar zones in adult bone marrow: the trabecular bone area (TBA) and central marrow (CM). The research characterizes the multicellular components and their roles in supporting HSCs with different cycling states.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics and Single-Nucleus Multi-omics Analysis Revealing the Impact of High Maternal Folic Acid Supplementation on Offspring Brain Development.
biological_context: Offspring brain development under high maternal folic acid supplementation
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of high maternal folic acid supplementation on offspring brain development using a mouse model. It employs spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus multi-omics to reveal affected gene pathways, identify vulnerable cell types, and understand the molecular mechanisms underlying these effects.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptomic profiling and modeling of mouse brain at single-cell resolution reveals cell proximity effects of aging and rejuvenation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To generate spatiotemporal data at single-cell resolution for the mouse brain across lifespan and develop machine learning models ('spatial aging clocks') to reveal cell proximity effects during aging and rejuvenation. The study identifies spatial transcriptomic fingerprints of aging and rejuvenation, and investigates the mediators of these proximity effects. It aims to provide tools for scalable assessment of intervention efficacy and studying cell-cell interactions.

title: POSTN<sup>+</sup> cancer-associated fibroblasts determine the efficacy of immunotherapy in hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: The study aimed to identify cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) subsets that determine immunotherapy efficacy in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It investigated the role of POSTN+ CAFs in creating an immunosuppressive microenvironment by recruiting SPP1+ macrophages via IL-6/STAT3 signaling, which hinders T-cell infiltration and reduces immunotherapy response.

title: Submandibular gland tissue RNAseq and spatial transcriptome analyses in IgG4-related disease.
main_goals: To identify genes that could provide clues leading to the discovery of drugs to treat IgG4-related disease (IgG4-RD). This study integrated bulk RNAseq and Visium spatial transcriptome analysis of submandibular gland tissue to identify pathogenic genes expressed in tertiary lymphoid tissues. The analysis aimed to pinpoint key genes, such as CDK1, potentially involved in the pathogenesis of IgG4-RD.

title: Study on the Anti-Inflammatory Mechanism of Coumarins in Peucedanum decursivum Based on Spatial Metabolomics Combined with Network Pharmacology.
biological_context: Anti-inflammatory mechanism of coumarins in Peucedanum decursivum root
main_goals: To visually study the spatial distribution and anti-inflammatory mechanism of coumarins in Peucedanum decursivum root using MALDI-TOF-MSI combined with network pharmacology. The study aimed to determine tissue localization and mechanism of action, identifying key targets and involved biological pathways for coumarins.

title: Mass Spectrometry Imaging Combined with Sparse Autoencoder Method Reveals Altered Phosphorylcholine Distribution in Imipramine Treated Wild-Type Mice Brains.
main_goals: To use AP-MALDI-MSI combined with dimensionality reduction methods to examine the distribution and impact of imipramine on endogenous metabolites in mouse brains. The study aimed to identify markers distinguishing control from treated mice and analyze the distribution changes of identified markers. It revealed a significant decrease in phosphorylcholine in imipramine-treated mice brains.

title: West Nile Virus-Induced Expression of Senescent Gene Lgals3bp Regulates Microglial Phenotype within Cerebral Cortex.
biological_context: West Nile Virus (WNV) encephalitis in mice, focusing on microglial phenotype and neuroinflammation during aging and infection.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'RNA sequencing', 'flow cytometry', 'Phenotype Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the relationship between West Nile Virus (WNV) infection and microglial senescence. It characterizes microglial gene signatures, focusing on the role of LGALS3BP in regulating neuroinflammation and microglial phenotype in WNV-infected and aged mice. The findings suggest LGALS3BP as a potential target for mitigating neuroinflammation.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Profiling Reveals Gene Expression Characteristics in Lymph Node-positive Breast Carcinoma.
main_goals: This study aimed to compare the spatially resolved transcriptomic profiles between node-positive and negative breast carcinomas to identify gene expression differences associated with lymph node metastasis. It highlights significant differences in transcriptional activities, underscoring the need for personalized treatment strategies.

title: Preexisting Skin-Resident CD8 and γδ T-cell Circuits Mediate Immune Response in Merkel Cell Carcinoma and Predict Immunotherapy Efficacy.
main_goals: This study investigates immune circuits in Merkel cell carcinoma (MCC) and identifies biomarkers for predicting response to immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) therapy. It utilizes multimodal data including spatial transcriptomics to reveal that preexisting tissue-resident CD8 and γδ T cells mediate immune response and predict immunotherapy efficacy. The findings highlight these T cell populations as potential therapeutic targets for MCC.

title: Analyses of combined Merkel cell carcinomas with neuroblastic components suggests that loss of T antigen expression in Merkel cell carcinoma may result in cell cycle arrest and neuroblastic transdifferentiation.
biological_context: Merkel cell carcinoma with neuroblastic components
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'immunohistochemistry', 'transcriptomics', 'whole exome sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'DNA methylation profiling']
main_goals: To describe and characterize two additional combined Merkel cell carcinomas with neuroblastic differentiation. The study aimed to provide comprehensive morphologic, immunohistochemical, transcriptomic, genetic, and epigenetic characterization, suggesting that loss of T antigen expression in Merkel cell carcinoma may lead to cell cycle arrest and neuroblastic transdifferentiation.

title: Single-cell multi-omic and spatial profiling of human kidneys implicates the fibrotic microenvironment in kidney disease progression.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell spatial-RNA expression', 'single-nuclear spatial-RNA expression', 'spot-level spatial-RNA expression (Visium)', 'single-cell resolution spatial-RNA expression (CosMx)', 'single-nuclear open chromatin']
main_goals: This study provides a comprehensive spatially resolved molecular roadmap of the human kidney and the fibrotic process in kidney disease. It identifies distinct microenvironments, including a fibrotic one, and demonstrates its utility in classifying kidneys and offering improved prognosis. The findings highlight the clinical utility of spatial transcriptomics.

title: Spatial resolution of the head and neck cancer tumor microenvironment to identify tumor and stromal features associated with therapy response.
biological_context: Head and Neck Cancer (HNC) tumor microenvironment
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study applied spatial transcriptomics and proteomics to characterize the head and neck cancer tumor microenvironment (TME) and identify features associated with therapy response. It aimed to discover biological differences in the TME that predict immunotherapy response. The findings demonstrate how spatial profiling can reveal novel alterations in the HNC TME contributing to therapy sensitivity and resistance.

title: Decoding the muscle transcriptome of patients with late-onset Pompe disease reveals markers of disease progression.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'snRNA-seq analysis', 'Histology Image Analysis']
main_goals: To uncover changes in gene expression profiles in LOPD muscle using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and GeoMx spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to compare the transcriptome of control myofibers with non-vacuolated and vacuolated myofibers from LOPD patients, identifying early metabolic abnormalities and markers of disease progression.

title: Spatial molecular profiling of mixed invasive ductal and lobular breast cancers reveals heterogeneity in intrinsic molecular subtypes, oncogenic signatures, and mutations.
main_goals: This paper investigates the spatial molecular profiling of mixed invasive ductal and lobular breast cancers (MDLC). It reveals significant differences between ductal and lobular tumor regions in terms of intrinsic subtype heterogeneity, oncogenic signatures, and mutations, highlighting intraregional heterogeneity. The findings suggest that this heterogeneity may lead to prognostic uncertainty and therapeutic dilemmas.

title: Interneuron diversity in the human dorsal striatum.
biological_context: Human dorsal striatum (caudate nucleus and putamen) interneuron diversity
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To elucidate the diversity and abundance of interneuron populations and their inherent transcriptional structure in the human dorsal striatum. The study proposes a comprehensive taxonomy of striatal interneurons with eight main classes and fourteen subclasses, detailing their transcriptomic identity and spatial expression profiles. It also delineates correspondences with previous classifications and highlights differences between caudate nucleus and putamen.

title: Spatial proteomics of human diabetic kidney disease, from health to class III.
main_goals: To analyze the spatial proteomics of human diabetic kidney disease (DKD) from health to class III using the Spatial TissuE Proteomics (STEP) pipeline. The study aimed to reveal alterations in protein expression, cellular phenotypic composition, and microenvironment structure associated with DKD progression.

title: Identification of tumor-specific T cell signature predicting cancer immunotherapy response in bladder cancer by multi-omics analysis and experimental verification.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'TCR sequencing', 'TCGA', 'GEO', 'Western blot', 'multicolor immunofluorescence', 'qRT-PCR', 'flow cytometry', 'spatial transcriptomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The study aimed to identify a tumor-specific T cell signature that can predict immunotherapy response in bladder cancer. They developed a five-gene signature (TstcSig) and validated its clinical relevance and correlation with immune characteristics. The signature showed better predictive performance compared to existing T cell signatures and was experimentally verified.

title: High-resolution diffusion magnetic resonance imaging and spatial-transcriptomic in developing mouse brain.
data_modalities_used: ['Diffusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging', 'Diffusion Tensor Imaging', 'Diffusion Kurtosis Imaging', 'NODDI', 'Spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study used high-resolution dMRI (DTI, DKI, NODDI) to investigate microstructural changes in the developing mouse brain. It integrated these MRI metrics with spatial transcriptomics, using the Allen Developing Mouse Brain Atlas. The research aimed to demonstrate correlations between gene expression and dMRI metrics, highlighting genotype-phenotype correlations at the molecular level.

title: LeishGEM: genome-wide deletion mutant fitness and protein localisations in Leishmania.
main_goals: LeishGEM is a genome-wide functional annotation community resource for Leishmania mexicana. It measures deletion mutant growth in vitro and in vivo and determines protein localization. The resource aims to enable data-driven identification of the mechanisms for Leishmania parasitism.

title: Distinctive Phenotypic and Microenvironmental Characteristics of Neuroendocrine Carcinoma and Adenocarcinoma Components in Gastric Mixed Adenoneuroendocrine Carcinoma.
main_goals: This study aimed to conduct an in-depth examination of gene expression and microenvironmental profiles of gastric neuroendocrine carcinoma (NEC) and mixed adeno-NEC (MANEC). It compared the epithelial and stromal components of different tumor types to identify distinct characteristics. The findings provide a validation dataset for future studies on MANEC management.

title: A spatiotemporal molecular atlas of mouse spinal cord injury identifies a distinct astrocyte subpopulation and therapeutic potential of IGFBP2.
main_goals: This study aims to resolve the spatiotemporal organization and cell-cell communication in injured mouse spinal cords. It identifies a distinct astrocyte subpopulation (Astro-GMii) and investigates the therapeutic potential of IGFBP2 for spinal cord injury.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of gastric cancer brain metastasis reveals atypical vasculature strategies with supportive immune profiles.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'digital spatial profiling', 'bulk transcriptomic data', 'in vivo single-cell transcriptomic data', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the spatial interactions among different cell components, especially the vasculature system and the brain microenvironment of GCBM patients using digital spatial profiling. The study mapped the orchestrated spatial characteristics of tumor and immunological compositions that support conventional and atypical vascularization strategies in GCBM. The data provided molecular insights for more effective combinations of anti-vascular and immune therapies.

title: Spatial proteomic profiling of tumor and stromal compartments in non-small-cell lung cancer identifies signatures associated with overall survival.
main_goals: This study aimed to uncover tumor and stromal signatures associated with overall survival in non-small-cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC) by profiling 78 proteins across different compartments of resected NSCLC tissues. The spatial proteomic data was used to identify protein signatures in tumor and stromal compartments that correlate with patient survival.

title: Integrated transcriptomics of human blood vessels defines a spatially controlled niche for early mesenchymal progenitor cells.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study characterizes the phenotype, potential, and microanatomic distribution of human perivascular progenitor cells using spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. It identifies heterogeneity between arterial and venous perivascular layers and delineates the tunica adventitia into inner and outer layers. The research infers a hierarchy of mesenchymal progenitors based on CD201 expression and its downstream effects on Wnt signaling and cell behavior.

title: Inactivated cGAS-STING Signaling Facilitates Endocrine Resistance by Forming a Positive Feedback Loop with AKT Kinase in ER+HER2- Breast Cancer.
main_goals: This paper investigates the mechanisms behind endocrine resistance in ER+HER2- breast cancer. It identifies the cGAS-STING pathway and its inactivation by hyperactivated AKT1 as key players forming a positive feedback loop that promotes resistance. The study proposes a therapeutic strategy combining an AKT1 inhibitor with a STING agonist to overcome this resistance.

title: DCX knockout ferret reveals a neurogenic mechanism in cortical development.
biological_context: Cortical development in ferrets, focusing on lissencephaly
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'snRNA-seq analysis', 'Neuronal lamination analysis']
main_goals: Establish DCX knockout ferrets as a model for lissencephaly, revealing the roles of DCX in neural progenitor cell proliferation and radial glial fiber extension. Provide a detailed atlas of the lissencephalic cortex using snRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics to illustrate disrupted neuronal lamination and cell interactions.

title: Novel insights into paclitaxel's role on tumor-associated macrophages in enhancing PD-1 blockade in breast cancer treatment.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'in vitro experiments', 'in vivo murine model']
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanisms by which paclitaxel (PTX) enhances PD-1 blockade efficacy in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) treatment. It demonstrates that PTX activates toll-like receptor 4 (TLR4) signaling in tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs), improving their antigen presentation and boosting CD8+ T cell responses. The findings highlight the immunomodulatory role of PTX in TNBC and the potential of targeting TAMs' antigen presentation.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals influence of microenvironment on intrinsic fates in melanoma therapy resistance.
main_goals: This study investigates the influence of the tumor microenvironment on intrinsic cell fates in melanoma therapy resistance. It uses spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing to reveal shared intrinsic resistance programs across different melanoma cell lines and their association with immune signatures in patient samples. The research demonstrates that therapy-resistant fates coexist with distinct immune microenvironments and can be influenced by tissue features.

title: The mechano-chemical circuit in fibroblasts and dendritic cells drives basal cell proliferation in psoriasis.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of dermal fibroblasts in psoriasis by identifying a mechano-chemical signaling pathway. It found that signals from dendritic cells enhance dermal stiffness, promoting epidermal cell hyperproliferation. The research used single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and other techniques to uncover a DC-fibroblast-epidermis communication axis involving LGALS9 and CD44.

title: Early human fetal lung atlas reveals the temporal dynamics of epithelial cell plasticity.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell Lineage', 'Gene Expression Regulation, Developmental']
main_goals: This study provides a comprehensive single-cell atlas of the developing human lung, detailing the temporal dynamics of epithelial cell plasticity and lineage development. It identifies progenitor cells expressing CFTR and maps their differentiation into specialized cell types, revealing temporal regulation of signaling pathways. Additionally, it benchmarks pluripotent stem cell-derived fetal lung models against native tissue development.

title: Unraveling the molecular architecture of autoimmune thyroid diseases at spatial resolution.
biological_context: Autoimmune thyroid diseases (Graves' disease, Hashimoto's thyroiditis)
main_goals: To unravel the molecular architecture of autoimmune thyroid diseases at spatial resolution using spatial transcriptomics. The study identifies damaged antigen-presenting thyroid follicular cells and distinct fibroblast subpopulations, including ADIRF+ myofibroblasts enriched in Graves' disease and inflammatory fibroblasts in Hashimoto's thyroiditis, as well as increased fenestrated PLVAP+ vessels in AITD.

title: Quantification and Profiling of Early and Late Differentiation Stage T Cells in Mantle Cell Lymphoma Reveals Immunotherapeutic Targets in Subsets of Patients.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Protein Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The study aimed to understand immune regulation in Mantle Cell Lymphoma (MCL) by combining image analysis and spatial omics to profile T cells at different differentiation stages. It identified potential immunotherapeutic targets by analyzing T-cell infiltration and immune suppressive markers in MCL patient tissues.

title: Molecular and cellular mechanisms of teneurin signaling in synaptic partner matching.
biological_context: Drosophila brain development, specifically synaptic partner matching in the olfactory circuit
data_modalities_used: ['in situ proximity labeling', 'genetic interaction studies', 'quantitative partner matching assays', 'single-axon resolution imaging']
main_goals: This study elucidates the molecular and cellular mechanisms by which teneurins mediate synaptic partner matching in the Drosophila brain. It identifies a specific signaling pathway involving teneurin binding to a RhoGAP, leading to Rac1 activation and subsequent stabilization of axon branches. The research utilizes proximity labeling and genetic interaction studies to reveal how teneurin signaling locally affects F-actin levels and promotes precise synaptic connections.

title: The architecture of silk-secreting organs during the final larval stage of silkworms revealed by single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Silk glands of mulberry silkworms during the final larval stage
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-cell communication analysis', 'Gene expression profiling', 'Spatial gene expression analysis', 'Transcriptional regulation analysis']
main_goals: To systematically map the cellular and spatial composition of silkworm silk glands using single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to profile cell types, cell state dynamics, identify regulatory networks, and elucidate the role of the ecdysone receptor in silk protein synthesis and endoreplication.

title: Mitophagy and clear cell renal cell carcinoma: insights from single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Prognostic Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study analyzes mitophagy in ccRCC using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to reveal the role of mitophagy in tumor cell metabolism, development, and survival, identifying key mitophagy cell populations and prognostic genes. The study highlights the importance of the UBB gene in ccRCC progression.

title: The CEBPB<sup>+</sup> glioblastoma subcluster specifically drives the formation of M2 tumor-associated macrophages to promote malignancy growth.
main_goals: This study investigated the interaction between a specific glioblastoma (GBM) cell subcluster (GBM cluster 6) and M2 tumor-associated macrophages (M2 TAMs) within the GBM microenvironment. It revealed that the CEBPB transcriptional network in GBM subcluster 6 drives the formation and polarization of M2 TAMs via molecules like MCP1 and the SPP1-Integrin αvβ1-Akt signaling pathway. The findings offer insights into controlling GBM progression by understanding these cellular interactions.

title: Spatial transcriptomics implicates impaired BMP signaling in NF1 fracture pseudarthrosis in murine and patient tissues.
main_goals: To perform spatial transcriptomics on normal and NF1-deficient fracture healing models (murine and human) to define molecular signatures and identify mechanisms underlying NF1 pseudarthrosis. The study aims to demonstrate the feasibility of delineating tissue-specific heterogeneity in fracture healing and provide in situ molecular evidence of impaired BMP signaling in NF1 pseudarthrosis.

title: Sustained generation of neurons destined for neocortex with oxidative metabolic upregulation upon filamin abrogation.
biological_context: Mouse brain development, specifically neocortex generation
main_goals: This paper investigates the sustained generation of neurons resembling upper layer neocortical neurons in the adult mouse V-SVZ. It links this neurogenesis to oxidative metabolic upregulation, increased mitochondrial biogenesis, and vascular abundance, suggesting potential therapeutic avenues for enhancing neurogenesis.

title: Expression of novel androgen receptors in three GnRH neuron subtypes in the cichlid brain.
biological_context: Androgenic control of GnRH neurons in the cichlid brain (A. burtoni)
main_goals: This paper investigates the expression of two androgen receptor paralogs (ar1 and ar2) in three subtypes of GnRH neurons in the cichlid brain using a combination of immunohistochemistry, HCR, and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to understand the differential control of these neurons by androgenic signaling based on AR expression patterns.

title: Positionally distinct interferon stimulated dermal immune acting fibroblasts promote neutrophil recruitment in Sweet's syndrome.
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular landscape of Sweet's syndrome by identifying positionally distinct fibroblasts that contribute to neutrophil recruitment, mediated by interferon signaling. It defines the immune-acting fibroblasts and their role in the disease pathogenesis.

title: Medulloblastoma Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Tumor Microenvironment Heterogeneity with High-Density Progenitor Cell Regions Correlating with High-Risk Disease.
main_goals: This study performed spatial transcriptomic sequencing on pediatric medulloblastoma samples to reveal inter- and intra-tumoral heterogeneity within the tumor microenvironment. It identified dense regions of quiescent progenitor-like MB cells enriched in high-risk disease and increased stromal components following relapse, highlighting potential therapeutic targets.

title: Anti-CTLA-4 m2a Antibody Exacerbates Cardiac Injury in Experimental Autoimmune Myocarditis Mice By Promoting Ccl5-Neutrophil Infiltration.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To decipher how anti-CTLA-4 m2a antibody aggravates cardiac injury in experimental autoimmune myocarditis (EAM) mice. The study found that the antibody increases Cxcl1, promoting neutrophil infiltration and Ccl5-neutrophil subpopulation activity, which in turn drives M1 macrophage polarization and exacerbates cardiac injury. The findings suggest targeting neutrophils, Cxcl1, or Cxcr2 could be a strategy for preventing ICIs-associated myocarditis.

title: Effect of Bioactive Black Phosphorus Nanomaterials on Cancer-Associated Fibroblast Heterogeneity in Pancreatic Cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This study investigates the effect of bioactive black phosphorus nanomaterials on cancer-associated fibroblast heterogeneity in pancreatic cancer using spatial transcriptomics. It demonstrates that bioactive BP suppresses CAF activation and reduces the abundance of inflammatory and myofibroblastic CAFs, suggesting its potential as a PDAC treatment.

title: Integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomic analysis to unveil heterogeneity in high-grade serous ovarian cancer.
main_goals: The study integrates single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to investigate heterogeneity in high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC). It aims to understand the cellular diversity, microenvironment, and identify biomarkers associated with prognosis, with a focus on CHODL's role in metastasis and tumor proliferation.

title: Increased prevalence of hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal state and enhanced phenotypic heterogeneity in basal breast cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates the relationship between epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) and luminal-basal plasticity in basal breast cancer. It utilizes multi-modal transcriptomic data to identify associations and employs mathematical modeling to understand the underlying mechanisms of phenotypic heterogeneity, aiming to provide a framework for characterizing and restricting it.

title: Single-Cell Transcriptome Analysis Reveals 2 Subtypes of Tumor Cells of Sclerosing Pneumocytoma With Distinct Molecular Features and Clinical Implications.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'microarray-based spatial transcriptomic analyses', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Single-Cell Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the molecular features of PSP tumor cells using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identified two distinct subtypes of tumor cells (MEDP cells and AT2Cs) with different biological characteristics and spatial distribution, providing insights into the histology and biological behaviors of PSP.

title: Development of human pancreatic cancer avatars as a model for dynamic immune landscape profiling and personalized therapy.
main_goals: Development of human pancreatic cancer avatars to profile the dynamic immune landscape and assess personalized therapy. These avatars maintain tumor microenvironment stability, enabling spatial and temporal analysis of immune cell populations and response to treatments like gemcitabine.

title: Application of spatial-omics to the classification of kidney biopsy samples in transplantation.
main_goals: To explore the application of spatial-omics, particularly mass spectrometry imaging, for the classification of kidney biopsy samples in transplantation. The paper highlights the potential of spatial-omics to provide new insights into the pathophysiology of allograft failure, identify novel therapeutic targets, and develop tailored immunotherapeutic interventions by overcoming limitations of current diagnostic methods.

title: Integrating single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to elucidate a specialized subpopulation of astrocytes, microglia and vascular cells in brains of mouse model of lipopolysaccharide-induced sepsis-associated encephalopathy.
biological_context: Sepsis-associated encephalopathy (SAE) in a mouse model
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the cellular and molecular alterations in the brains of a mouse model with sepsis-associated encephalopathy (SAE) using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and Stereo-seq. The research identified a specialized subpopulation of astrocytes, microglia, and vascular cells (V1A2M2 niche) and their associated ligand-receptor pairs, suggesting a role in SAE pathogenesis or mortality observed in Anxa1 knockout mice.

title: Identification of Hypoxia-ALCAM<sup>high</sup> Macrophage- Exhausted T Cell Axis in Tumor Microenvironment Remodeling for Immunotherapy Resistance.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironment remodeling for immunotherapy resistance in cancer
main_goals: This study integrates bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics to characterize the hypoxia-associated intercellular communication hub involving malignant cells, ALCAMhigh macrophages, and exhausted CD8+ T cells at the tumor boundary. It reveals that hypoxia promotes ALCAM expression in macrophages, which in turn drives T cell exhaustion, leading to immunotherapy resistance. The findings highlight a novel ALCAMhigh macrophage-exhausted T cell axis as a target for overcoming hypoxia-induced resistance in cancers.
