title: Mapping the complexity and diversity of tertiary lymphoid structures in primary and peritoneal metastatic gastric cancer.
main_goals: To map the complexity and diversity of tertiary lymphoid structures (TLSs) in primary and peritoneal metastatic gastric cancer. The study investigates how immune cell composition and function of TLSs differ based on tumor location and the tumor immune environment, associating immature TLSs in peritoneal metastases with poor prognosis and lack of response to immune checkpoint blockade.

title: Abnormal metabolism in melanocytes participates in the activation of dendritic cell in halo nevus.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to understand halo nevus. It identifies abnormal metabolism, specifically uridine diphosphate glucose (UDP-G), in melanocytes and its role in activating dendritic cells (DCs). The findings suggest that melanocyte-derived UDP-G contributes to DC activation and the immune response in halo nevus, potentially offering insights into related conditions like vitiligo.

title: Patho-transcriptomic analysis of invasive mucinous adenocarcinoma of the lung (IMA): comparison with lung adenocarcinoma with signet ring cell features (SRCC).
biological_context: Invasive mucinous adenocarcinoma of the lung (IMA) and lung adenocarcinoma with signet ring cell features (SRCC)
main_goals: To analyze IMA and compare it with SRCC using spatial transcriptomics, identify distinct cell clusters and gene expression patterns, and investigate downstream targets of transcription factors HNF4A and SPDEF, revealing targetable tumor cell types.

title: Loss of cell junctional components and matrix alterations drive cell desquamation and fibrotic changes in Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.
main_goals: This study investigates the histopathological abnormalities in distal bronchioles of IPF patients, focusing on epithelial desquamation. It uses spatial transcriptomics and proteomics to reveal downregulated cell junctional components, upregulated EMT signatures, and dysregulated basement membrane matrix, contributing to epithelial detachment and fibrotic changes. The research highlights the disruption of matrix-cell junctional regulation as a key mechanism in IPF pathogenesis.

title: Ehmt2 inactivation in pancreatic epithelial cells shapes the transcriptional landscape and inflammation response of the whole pancreas.
biological_context: Pancreatic inflammation and injury response modulated by EHMT2 gene inactivation in exocrine cells
main_goals: This study elucidates the role of EHMT2 in maintaining pancreatic transcriptional landscape and protecting against inflammation. It investigates how EHMT2 inactivation in pancreatic epithelial cells affects the overall organ's response to injury and inflammation, revealing insights into molecular and cellular mechanisms involved in inflammatory pancreatic diseases.

title: Decoding heterogeneous and coordinated tissue architecture in glioblastoma using spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: To decode heterogeneous and coordinated tissue architecture in glioblastoma using spatial transcriptomics. The study investigates gene expression heterogeneity, identifies enriched tissue stem cell signatures in specific regions, and links upregulated genes to ECM-receptor interaction, proteoglycans, VEGF, and ANGPT signaling pathways. It also examines the spatial relevance of glycogen metabolism, oxidative phosphorylation, and creatine metabolism signatures.

title: Integrated-omics profiling unveils the disparities of host defense to ECM scaffolds during wound healing in aged individuals.
biological_context: Wound healing in aged mice using ECM scaffolds
main_goals: To explore the mechanisms underlying the age-related disparity in host defense to ECM scaffolds during wound healing. The study identified dysfunctional Spp1+ macrophages in aged mice that impede the type II immune response, inhibiting epidermal cell and fibroblast repair. Findings aim to inform the development of precision-based biomaterials for aged individuals.

title: Unfolding the mysteries of heterogeneity from a high-resolution perspective: integration analysis of single-cell multi-omics and spatial omics revealed functionally heterogeneous cancer cells in ccRCC.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study integrates single-cell multi-omics and spatial omics data to analyze intra-tumor heterogeneity in ccRCC. It classifies cancer cells into meta programs and investigates their spatial distribution, clinical prognostic values, regulatory networks, and therapeutic sensitivities. The findings aim to inform the design of rational therapeutic strategies for ccRCC.

title: CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells display a spectrum of recall dynamics during re-infection with malaria parasites.
biological_context: Re-infection with malaria parasites in mice, focusing on CD4+ T cell responses
main_goals: This paper examines antigen-experienced CD4+ T cells during re-infection with malaria parasites in mice. It utilizes scRNA-seq/TCR-seq and spatial transcriptomics to characterize the diverse recall dynamics of different CD4+ T cell subsets, revealing varying responses and identifying graphical user interfaces for studying gene expression dynamics and clonal relationships.

title: Glycolysis in hepatic stellate cells coordinates fibrogenic extracellular vesicle release spatially to amplify liver fibrosis.
main_goals: This paper demonstrates that glycolysis in hepatic stellate cells (HSCs) amplifies liver fibrosis by promoting fibrogenic extracellular vesicle (EV) release in the pericentral zone. It shows that inhibiting HSC glycolysis reduces liver fibrosis and abrogates the upregulation of EV-related pathways in the pericentral zone. Mechanistically, glycolysis enhances EV release by upregulating EV-related genes via histone modifications.

title: Aging- and alcohol-associated spatial transcriptomic signature in mouse acute pancreatitis reveals heterogeneity of inflammation and potential pathogenic factors.
biological_context: Alcohol-associated acute pancreatitis in aging mice
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate aging- and alcohol-associated spatial transcriptomic signatures in mouse acute pancreatitis by establishing an aging AAP mouse model and applying Visium spatial transcriptomics. It revealed spatial heterogeneity of inflammatory processes and identified differentially expressed genes and pathways in aging versus young AAP mice.

title: Integrating Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics to Uncover and Elucidate GP73-Mediated Pro-Angiogenic Regulatory Networks in Hepatocellular Carcinoma.
main_goals: The study aimed to characterize the hypervascular nature of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identified a GP73-mediated pro-angiogenic regulatory network involving interactions with vascular endothelial cells and elucidated its role in tumor vascular development. The study also investigated the mechanistic basis of this network and its clinical relevance for anti-angiogenic therapy response in HCC.

title: Spatial transcriptomics combined with single-nucleus RNA sequencing reveals glial cell heterogeneity in the human spinal cord.
main_goals: To map the cellular and molecular heterogeneity of astrocytes, microglia, and oligodendrocytes in the human spinal cord using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study also compares these findings with mouse models and investigates sex differences in gene expression within human spinal cord glial cells.

title: Extracellular Microenvironment Alterations in Ductal Carcinoma In Situ and Invasive Breast Cancer Pathologies by Multiplexed Spatial Proteomics.
biological_context: Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) and invasive breast cancer (IBC)
main_goals: This study investigated alterations in the extracellular microenvironment of Ductal Carcinoma In Situ (DCIS) and Invasive Breast Cancer (IBC) using multiplexed spatial proteomics. It aimed to differentiate between these pathologies based on their ECM proteomes and understand the spatial regulation of these changes, revealing insights into the invasive cancer field effect.

title: Integration of transcriptomics and spatial biology analyses reveals Galactomyces ferment filtrate promotes epidermal interconnectivity via induction of keratinocyte differentiation, proliferation and cellular bioenergetics.
biological_context: Human skin epidermal biology and homeostasis
main_goals: This study evaluates the impact of Galactomyces Ferment Filtrate (GFF) on epidermal differentiation and response to oxidative stress using transcriptomics and spatial biology. The research investigates GFF's effects on keratinocyte differentiation, proliferation, cell adhesion, and cellular bioenergetics, highlighting its role in promoting epidermal interconnectivity.

title: Long-Term Follow-up of Levonorgestrel Intrauterine Device for Atypical Hyperplasia and Early Endometrial Cancer Reveals Relapse Characterized by Immune Exhaustion.
biological_context: Endometrial atypical hyperplasia (AH) and endometrioid endometrial cancer (EEC)
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the long-term follow-up of patients treated with levonorgestrel intrauterine device (LIUD) for atypical hyperplasia (AH) and early endometrial cancer (EEC). It sought to identify clinical factors associated with relapse and explore molecular mechanisms, particularly immune responses and exhaustion, at the time of relapse using spatial transcriptomics.

title: Analysis of the chemical constituents and their metabolites in Orthosiphon stamineus Benth. via UHPLC-Q exactive orbitrap-HRMS and AFADESI-MSI techniques.
data_modalities_used: ['UHPLC-Q exactive orbitrap-HRMS', 'AFADESI-MSI', 'rat plasma', 'rat serum', 'kidney tissue homogenate']
main_goals: This study aimed to analyze the chemical constituents and their metabolites in Orthosiphon stamineus Benth. using UHPLC-Q exactive orbitrap-HRMS and AFADESI-MSI techniques. It sought to identify beneficial ingredients absorbed in rat plasma and visualize compound distribution in kidney tissue to provide theoretical support for the application of Orthosiphon stamineus Benth. in kidney disease treatment.

title: Deciphering the molecular landscape of human peripheral nerves: implications for diabetic peripheral neuropathy.
main_goals: To gain deep mechanistic insight into diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) using bulk and spatial RNA sequencing on human peripheral nerves. The study identified key pathway differences, distinct immunological features in sural nerves, and shifts in endothelial and immune cells associated with severe axonal loss. It also highlighted perturbed RNA transport in sensory axons as a potential contributor to DPN.

title: Spatial Single-cell Analysis Decodes Cortical Layer and Area Specification.
main_goals: To examine the molecular, cellular, and cytoarchitectural development of human fetal cortex with spatially resolved single-cell resolution using MERFISH. The study uncovers an early establishment of the six-layer structure and identifies sharp molecular borders between visual cortices, challenging existing notions of arealization.

title: Identification of a gene expression signature of vascular invasion and recurrence in stage I lung adenocarcinoma via bulk and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify a gene expression signature of vascular invasion (VI) in stage I lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and develop a transcriptomic predictor for VI. The research utilized bulk and spatial transcriptomics to understand molecular and microenvironment features associated with angioinvasive LUAD. The findings suggest that VI-associated gene expression changes are detectable and can predict VI, potentially enabling tailored management strategies.

title: Unveiling Spatial Immune Cell Profile in Kidney Allograft Rejections Using 36-plex Immunofluorescence Imaging.
main_goals: To unveil novel spatial indices associated with transplant rejection using a spatial bioinformatic approach on 36-plex immunofluorescence data. The study aimed to characterize immune cell profiles in kidney allograft rejections and identify spatial features related to different rejection types and patient outcomes.

title: The Effect of Exposure to Neighborhood Violence on Glucocorticoid Receptor Signaling in Lung Tumors.
biological_context: Lung cancer in Black men in Chicago
main_goals: This study investigates the relationship between exposure to neighborhood violence and glucocorticoid receptor (GR) signaling in lung tumors. The authors aimed to understand how social stress influences tumor biology by examining GR binding and gene expression in relation to violent crime rates in Chicago neighborhoods. The findings suggest that social stress, through GR reprogramming, may contribute to lung cancer disparities.

title: DDIT3 is associated with breast cancer prognosis and immune microenvironment: an integrative bioinformatic and immunohistochemical analysis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of DDIT3 in breast cancer prognosis and its interaction with the immune microenvironment. It utilizes a multi-omics integration strategy to identify a prognostic signature and explore spatial expression patterns, aiming to provide insights for personalized treatment.

title: Multi-omic profiling of breast tumor microenvironment uncovers a role of mitochondrial calcium gatekeepers.
main_goals: This study elucidates the role of mitochondrial calcium uptake 1/2 (MiCU1/2) in breast cancer using multi-omics. It establishes MiCU1/2 as a diagnostic biomarker and therapeutic target by correlating its expression with clinical status, patient survival, and immune infiltration, and identifies potential drugs targeting MiCU1/2-high cells.

title: Spatial and Single-Cell Investigations Illuminate Theragnostic value and Immune Landscape of Mitochondrial Dynamin-Like GTPase in Breast Cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of OPA1/3 in breast cancer and its interplay with the immune microenvironment. It reveals that OPA1/3 is upregulated in breast cancer and correlates with poor prognosis, suggesting its potential as a diagnostic, prognostic, and survival biomarker.

title: Multiomics integration-based immunological characterizations of adamantinomatous craniopharyngioma in relation to keratinization.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To perform an integrative analysis of single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics on ACP specimens to characterize the immunological microenvironment and intercellular network. The study aimed to identify potential therapeutic targets by understanding the cellular composition and interactions within the tumor microenvironment, particularly focusing on TAMs and keratinization.

title: IRF4 requires ARID1A to establish plasma cell identity in multiple myeloma.
data_modalities_used: ['functional genomics screening', 'spatial proteomics', 'global chromatin mapping', 'immunohistochemistry', 'mass spectrometry', 'CRISPR screening', 'in vivo studies in mice']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of ARID1A in establishing plasma cell identity in multiple myeloma, identifying ARID1A as a requirement for IRF4 expression and function. It demonstrates that targeting SWI/SNF activity is toxic to MM cells and shows potential as a therapeutic strategy for relapsed/refractory disease, especially in combination with MEK inhibitors.

title: Spatial proteomics of skeletal muscle using thin cryosections reveals metabolic adaptation at the muscle-tendon transition zone.
biological_context: Skeletal muscle and the muscle-tendon transition zone
main_goals: This study performs a spatial proteomics analysis of mouse soleus muscle, including the muscle-tendon transition zone, using thin cryosections and LC-MS. The analysis reveals proteins related to neuronal activity, fatty acid biosynthesis, and the renin-angiotensin system (RAS) that increase from muscle to tendon. It also demonstrates that the RAS regulates ECM synthesis in tenocytes, acting as an additional regulator of the matrix within muscle-tendon junctions.

title: Microenvironment shapes small-cell lung cancer neuroendocrine states and presents therapeutic opportunities.
data_modalities_used: ['spatially resolved transcriptomics', 'quantitative mass spectrometry-based proteomics', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study maps the Small Cell Lung Cancer (SCLC) tumor microenvironment (TME) using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. It identifies cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) as crucial for immune exclusion and poor prognosis, suggesting TME-driven reprogramming of neuroendocrine cell states. The research aims to highlight the TME's role in SCLC adaptability and open avenues for therapeutic interventions.

title: Spatial Transcriptome-Wide Profiling of Small Cell Lung Cancer Reveals Intra-Tumoral Molecular and Subtype Heterogeneity.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study analyzes the spatial transcriptome-wide profiling of small cell lung cancer (SCLC) to understand intra-tumoral molecular and subtype heterogeneity. It identifies distinct molecular profiles, biological functions, immune features, and molecular subtypes within spatially localized histological regions and establishes connections to patient survival and therapeutic response. A gene signature, ITHtyper, is developed for patient risk stratification from bulk RNA-seq profiles.

title: Development of a nanoparticle-based tendon-targeting drug delivery system to pharmacologically modulate tendon healing.
main_goals: To develop a nanoparticle-based drug delivery system that targets the healing tendon to deliver therapeutic agents and improve functional and mechanical recovery following acute tendon injury.

title: APOE Christchurch enhances a disease-associated microglial response to plaque but suppresses response to tau pathology.
main_goals: This study investigated the effect of the APOE Christchurch (APOECh) variant on Alzheimer's disease pathology using mouse models. The research explored how APOECh impacts microglial responses to amyloid and tau pathologies, aiming to understand its protective mechanisms.

title: Ablation of Vitamin D Signaling in Cardiomyocytes Leads to Functional Impairment and Stimulation of Pro-Inflammatory and Pro-Fibrotic Gene Regulatory Networks in a Left Ventricular Hypertrophy Model in Mice.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of vitamin D signaling in cardiomyocytes during left ventricular hypertrophy by ablating the vitamin D receptor (VDR) specifically in these cells. The researchers used transverse aortic constriction (TAC) to induce hypertrophy and spatial transcriptomics to analyze gene expression changes in cardiac tissue. Their findings suggest that vitamin D signaling in cardiomyocytes offers a protective role under stress.

title: Longitudinal Neuropathological Consequences of Extracranial Radiation Therapy in Mice.
biological_context: Cancer-related cognitive impairment (CRCI) induced by extracranial radiation therapy (ECRT)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'immunohistochemistry', 'Nanostring nCounter® glial profiling', 'neuroinflammation gene panels', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Protein Analysis', 'Histology Image Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: To investigate the longitudinal neuropathological consequences of ECRT in mice and identify signaling pathways involved in ECRT-related CRCI. The study aimed to understand the role of neuroinflammation and glial cell activation in the pathogenesis of CRCI by analyzing brain tissue, spinal cord, and skin following radiation treatment.

title: Traumatic brain injury promotes neurogenesis at the cost of astrogliogenesis in the adult hippocampus of male mice.
biological_context: Traumatic brain injury (TBI) effects on the adult hippocampus of male mice
main_goals: To investigate how traumatic brain injury (TBI) affects hippocampal neurogenesis and astrogliogenesis in adult male mice. The study uses single cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to assess changes in neural stem cells and their derivatives. It aims to identify cellular targets to counteract TBI-induced cellular changes in the hippocampus.

title: Inhibition of the eukaryotic initiation factor-2α kinase PERK decreases risk of autoimmune diabetes in mice.
data_modalities_used: ['insulin-producing β cells', 'human islets', 'T1D-susceptible mice', 'Single-cell RNA-Seq', 'spatial proteomics', 'EndoC-βH1 human β cells']
main_goals: This study investigates the inhibition of the eukaryotic initiation factor-2α kinase PERK as a strategy to prevent autoimmune diabetes. The authors found that PERK inhibition reduced islet inflammation, preserved beta cell mass, and altered antigen presentation pathways in beta cells. They identified PD-L1 stabilization as a mechanism by which PERK inhibition may reduce beta cell immunogenicity.

title: The crosstalk role of CDKN2A between tumor progression and cuproptosis resistance in colorectal cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'pathological image analysis', 'TCGA multi-omics analysis', 'in vitro experimental validation']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of CDKN2A in cuproptosis resistance and tumor progression in colorectal cancer. It explores CDKN2A's distribution, expression, epigenetic modification, regulation, and genomic features. The findings associate CDKN2A with cuproptosis resistance, malignant phenotype, and a pro-tumor niche, suggesting therapeutic potential for radiation and chemotherapy in high-CDKN2A tumors.

title: Spatial metabolomics reveals key features of hippocampal lipid changes in rats with postoperative cognitive dysfunction.
biological_context: Postoperative cognitive dysfunction (POCD) after cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) in rats
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the role of lipid metabolism in postoperative cognitive dysfunction (POCD) in rats following cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB). It utilized spatial metabolomics and imaging techniques to identify lipid changes in the hippocampus and investigated the impact of modulating specific lipid metabolism pathways on POCD.

title: Spatial transcriptomics at the brain-electrode interface in rat motor cortex and the relationship to recording quality.
biological_context: Brain tissue response to implanted electrodes in rat motor cortex
main_goals: To study the foreign body reaction to implanted electrodes in the brain using spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify changes in gene expression related to electrode implantation and correlate these changes with glial reactivity, neuronal loss, and electrophysiological recording quality, seeking potential biomarkers.

title: Transcriptional switches in melanoma T Cells: Facilitating polarizing into regulatory T cells.
main_goals: This paper elucidates mechanisms of Treg self-maintenance and communication in melanoma, identifies novel functional molecules (SPOCK2, SH2D2A, ITGB2, LTA, CLEC2C, CLEC2D) and a melanoma Treg-specific regulatory tag set (Mel TregS). It also introduces SERS technology for clinical disease monitoring.

title: Spatial transcriptomics in embryonic mouse diaphragm muscle reveals regional gradients and subdomains of developmental gene expression.
main_goals: This paper provides spatially resolved gene expression data for embryonic mouse diaphragms. It reveals gene signatures for specific muscle regions, neuromuscular junctions, and myotendinous junctions. The data also helps in understanding the effects of genetic mutations on muscle development and gene expression.

title: Intrinsic Gata4 expression sensitizes the aortic root to dilation in a Loeys-Dietz syndrome mouse model.
biological_context: Loeys-Dietz syndrome (LDS) mouse model and human aortic VSMCs
main_goals: To identify molecular determinants of aortic root vulnerability in Loeys-Dietz syndrome (LDS) by investigating vascular smooth muscle cell (VSMC) heterogeneity. The study found that Gata4-expressing VSMCs, predominantly in the aortic root, have a less differentiated, proinflammatory profile and contribute to aortic root dilation in LDS mice. Postnatal Gata4 deletion reduced dilation, indicating its sensitizing role.

title: Tissue gene expression profiles and communication networks inform candidate blood biomarker identification in psoriasis and atopic dermatitis.
main_goals: This study aims to identify transcriptional signatures and communication networks in keratinocytes and T lymphocytes from patients with psoriasis and atopic dermatitis using spatial transcriptomics. The goal is to advance biomarker development and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: Identifying proteomic risk factors for overall, aggressive, and early onset prostate cancer using Mendelian Randomisation and tumour spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Prostate cancer (overall, aggressive, and early onset)
main_goals: This study investigates the association of genetically predicted circulating protein levels with prostate cancer risk using Mendelian Randomization and colocalization. It also utilizes spatial transcriptomic data to assess the role of identified proteins in tumour aggressiveness. The aim is to identify proteomic risk factors for prostate cancer and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Feasibility of MALDI-MSI-Based Proteomics Using Bouin-Fixed Pathology Samples: Untapping the Goldmine of Nephropathology Archives.
biological_context: Nephropathology, specifically focusing on renal tissue and kidney diseases.
main_goals: This paper explores the feasibility of using MALDI-MSI on Bouin-fixed paraffin-embedded (BFPE) renal tissue, a common but challenging fixative in nephropathology. It evaluates the impact of preanalytical conditions and compares BFPE with formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) samples. The study demonstrates that BFPE samples can effectively distinguish parenchyma regions and substructures, supporting their utility in spatial proteomics research.

title: Spatial transcriptomics analysis identifies a tumor-promoting function of the meningeal stroma in melanoma leptomeningeal disease.
main_goals: This paper characterizes the tumor microenvironment of melanoma leptomeningeal disease (LMD) using spatial transcriptomics. It identifies a tumor-promoting function of the meningeal stroma, mediated by SERPINA3, and demonstrates a mechanism to overcome associated drug resistance.

title: Single-cell multi-ome and immune profiles of the Inspiration4 crew reveal conserved, cell-type, and sex-specific responses to spaceflight.
biological_context: Spaceflight effects on astronaut immune system
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize the immune response to spaceflight by generating multi-omic data from the Inspiration4 crew. The researchers identified a conserved 'spaceflight signature' in gene expression and observed specific changes in T cells and MHC class I genes, linking immune disruption to microbiome shifts. The findings provide a roadmap for countermeasures to maintain astronaut health.

title: Spatially resolved multiomics on the neuronal effects induced by spaceflight in mice.
biological_context: The study investigates the impact of spaceflight on the mouse brain, specifically focusing on neurogenesis, synaptogenesis, synaptic transmission, astrocyte activation, and immune dysfunction.
main_goals: To elucidate the impact of spaceflight on the mouse brain using an integrated approach of single-cell multiomics and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify alterations in brain processes and pathways affected by spaceflight and to provide a basis for future research.
data_links_mentioned: ['National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open Science Data Repository (OSDR)']

title: Deciphering lung granulomas in HIV & TB co-infection: unveiling macrophages aggregation with IL6R/STAT3 activation.
biological_context: HIV and Tuberculosis co-infection in the lung
main_goals: To elucidate histopathological features and inflammation regulation in HIV & TB co-infection by comparing it to TB alone. The study revealed distinct immune responses, particularly macrophage aggregation and IL6R/STAT3 activation in HIV & TB granulomas, suggesting potential therapeutic targets.

title: Energy competition remodels the metabolic glucose landscape of psoriatic epidermal cells.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA-sequencing', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'glucose uptake experiments', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study explored the role of metabolic competition in epidermal cell proliferation and differentiation in psoriatic skin. It identified that highly proliferative basal cells in psoriasis win glucose competition, upregulate OXPHOS via COX7B, increase ROS, and activate glutathione metabolism for antioxidant capacity. The study also noted glucose starvation and high SLC7A11 expression in suprabasal cells leading to disulfide stress and impaired differentiation.

title: Integrated spatial metabolomics and network pharmacology to explore the pharmacodynamic substances and mechanism of Radix ginseng-Schisandra chinensis Herb Couple on Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: This study uses integrated spatial metabolomics and network pharmacology to explore the pharmacodynamic substances and mechanism of the Radix ginseng-Schisandra chinensis herbal couple on Alzheimer's disease in a rodent model. It identifies biomarkers linked to AD pathology and elucidates potential therapeutic targets and mechanisms of the herbal combination.

title: Spatiotemporal transcriptomic landscape of rice embryonic cells during seed germination.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Gene Expression Profiling', 'Single-Cell Analysis']
main_goals: The study characterizes the spatiotemporal transcriptomic landscape of rice embryonic cells during seed germination using Stereo-seq and scRNA-seq. It identifies novel cell types, delineates gene expression dynamics, and highlights key genes involved in germination processes. The research aims to provide a detailed understanding of cellular functions regulating seed vigor and seedling establishment.

title: Plasmodium infection induces phenotypic, clonal, and spatial diversity among differentiating CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell Differentiation']
main_goals: This study investigates the phenotypic, clonal, and spatial diversity of CD4+ T cells during Plasmodium infection. It characterizes T cell differentiation states, spatial organization within the spleen, and molecular interactions with other immune cells. The research also explores the role of CCR5 in promoting T cell expansion and differentiation.

title: Shared and unique transcriptomic signatures of antidepressant and probiotics action in the mammalian brain.
biological_context: Mammalian brain responses to antidepressant and probiotic treatments
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Differential Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To examine the transcriptomic effects of antidepressants (bupropion, desipramine, fluoxetine) and a probiotic formulation (Lacidofil®) across 10 regions of the mammalian brain. The study aims to understand shared and divergent mechanisms by intersecting gene expression data with neuropsychiatric GWAS loci, MDD transcriptomic portraits, and mouse models of stress and depression, revealing region-specific and treatment-specific molecular responses.

title: Granuloma Annulare Exhibits Mixed Immune and Macrophage Polarization Profiles with Spatial Transcriptomics.
biological_context: Granuloma annulare (GA) is an idiopathic condition characterized by granulomatous inflammation in the skin.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Transcriptomics']
main_goals: To improve the understanding of spatially localized gene expression patterns underlying Granuloma Annulare (GA) by profiling the spatial gene expression landscape. The study aimed to reveal mixed T helper 1 and T helper 2 signals and spatially distinct M1 and M2 macrophage polarization characteristics within the GA microenvironment. It sought to identify key regulators of granulomatous inflammation, such as IFN-γ, TNF, and IL-32.

title: PIK3CA inhibition in models of proliferative glomerulonephritis and lupus nephritis.
biological_context: Proliferative glomerulonephritis and lupus nephritis in mice and humans
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'genetically engineered mouse models']
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of the PIK3CA pathway in proliferative glomerulonephritis and lupus nephritis. It demonstrates that PIK3CA inhibition, specifically by alpelisib, improves kidney function and lesions in mouse models. The study also reveals that PIK3CA inhibition impacts immune cells in lupus nephritis, reducing proinflammatory cytokines and autoantibodies.

title: Multi-omic profiling reveals potential biomarkers of hepatocellular carcinoma prognosis and therapy response among mitochondria-associated cell death genes in the context of 3P medicine.
main_goals: The study developed a novel predictive model, MCDI, for LIHC prognosis and therapy response. It leveraged machine learning and multi-omic data to identify key mitochondrial cell death genes. The model integrates into the PPPM framework to improve clinical decision-making for LIHC patients.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal a high glycolysis B cell and tumor-associated macrophages cluster correlated with poor prognosis and exhausted immune microenvironment in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study utilized multiple omics technologies to identify metabolic features of highly malignant DLBCL cells and tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs), along with their associated tumor microenvironment. It found that high-glycolysis malignant DLBCL tissues exhibit an immunosuppressive microenvironment and identified glycolysis genes and IFN_TAMs as potential prognostic markers and therapeutic targets in DLBCL.

title: A spatial portrait of the human sebaceous gland transcriptional program.
biological_context: Human sebaceous gland differentiation and sebum production
main_goals: To map the landscape of sebaceous gland differentiation by characterizing the progressive transcriptional changes of sebocytes. The study aims to provide a high-resolution spatial portrait of the sebaceous gland transcriptional landscape and identify candidate molecules for regulating sebaceous gland homeostasis.
code_availability.link_in_abstract_or_ti: freely available and browsable online tool

title: Interferon-γ induces combined pyroptotic angiopathy and APOL1 expression in human kidney disease.
biological_context: Human kidney disease, including COVID-19, HIV, and APOL1 nephropathy
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'immunoblotting', 'quantitative fluorescence-based assays', 'multiomic analyses', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of Interferon-gamma (IFN-γ) in kidney diseases. It demonstrates that IFN-γ induces pyroptotic angiopathy and APOL1 expression in human kidney organoids and patient samples. The study suggests that targeting IFN-γ signaling could be a therapeutic strategy for APOL1-mediated collapsing glomerulopathy.

title: Single-Cell Spatial Transcriptomics Unveils Platelet-Fueled Cycling Macrophages for Kidney Fibrosis.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of platelets in kidney injury and repair, identifying platelet-modulated cycling M2 macrophages as key mediators of fibrosis. It highlights thrombospondin 1 (THBS1) as a target for mitigating kidney fibrosis by reducing the profibrotic M2 macrophage subset.

title: Cell type mapping of inflammatory muscle diseases highlights selective myofiber vulnerability in inclusion body myositis.
biological_context: Inflammatory muscle diseases (Inclusion Body Myositis and Immune-mediated Necrotizing Myopathy)
main_goals: To map cell-type-specific drivers underlying IBM pathogenesis by pairing single-nucleus RNA sequencing with spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to compare these drivers with those in IMNM and non-inflammatory skeletal muscle. The findings highlight selective myofiber vulnerability and potential mechanisms of degeneration in IBM.

title: Specialized Tfh cell subsets driving type-1 and type-2 humoral responses in lymphoid tissue.
biological_context: Humoral immunity and T follicular helper cell specialization under type-1 and type-2 immune responses
main_goals: This paper investigates the specialization of T follicular helper (Tfh) cells under type-1 and type-2 immune responses. Using machine learning, they established gene expression signatures for Tfh1 and Tfh2 cells and validated these signatures. They further dissected Tfh cell heterogeneity using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, identifying a Gzmk+ Tfh cell population specific for type-1 conditions.

title: GJA4 expressed on cancer associated fibroblasts (CAFs)-A 'promoter' of the mesenchymal phenotype.
data_modalities_used: ['HE-stained images', 'immunohistochemistry', 'single-cell analysis', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunofluorescence staining', 'Sirius red staining', 'wound healing assays', 'transwell assays', 'western blotting', 'CCK8 assay', 'in vivo experiments']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of GJA4 expressed on cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in promoting the mesenchymal phenotype in colorectal cancer. It explores the mechanisms by which GJA4 promotes fibroblast activation and EMT, and its synergistic effects with M2 macrophages on the tumor immune microenvironment. The findings suggest that GJA4+ fibroblasts and M2 macrophages are potential targets for enhancing tumor immunotherapy.

title: Spatial recovery of the murine gut microbiota after antibiotics perturbation.
biological_context: Murine gut microbiota recovery after antibiotic perturbation
main_goals: The study investigates the spatial organization and recovery of the murine gut microbiota after antibiotic treatment using a high-phylogenetic-resolution microbiota mapping technique. It employs a novel analytical framework to characterize spatial changes and identify species involved in recovery.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal alterations in trophoblasts at invasion sites and disturbed myometrial immune microenvironment in placenta accreta spectrum disorders.
main_goals: This study aimed to reveal alterations in trophoblasts at invasion sites and disturbed myometrial immune microenvironment in placenta accreta spectrum disorders using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. It identified specific trophoblast subpopulations invading the myometrium and characterized immune and inflammation-associated pathways in PAS tissues. The findings elucidate the interplay between immune escape in trophoblasts and immune tolerance in myometrial smooth muscle cells during invasion in PAS.

title: Integrated spatial and multimodal single-cell transcriptomics reveal patient-dependent cell heterogeneity in splenic marginal zone lymphoma.
data_modalities_used: ["3'-single-cell RNA-sequencing", 'Cellular Indexing of Transcriptomes and Epitopes by sequencing (CITE-seq)', "5'-V(D)J single-cell RNA-sequencing", 'spatial transcriptomics', 'imaging mass cytometry', 'paired blood/spleen samples']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'B-cell receptor and T-cell receptor repertoires']
main_goals: To perform in-depth characterization of splenic marginal zone lymphoma (SMZL) through integrated spatial and multimodal single-cell analyses. The study aimed to characterize SMZL transcriptome profiles, including B-cell receptor and T-cell receptor repertoires, and to investigate patient-dependent cell heterogeneity. Findings provide a comprehensive high-resolution description of SMZL biological hallmarks, including inter- and intra-patient heterogeneity at transcriptomic and protein levels.

title: Single-cell and spatiotemporal profile of ovulation in the mouse ovary.
main_goals: To detail the precise window of ovulation at single-cell resolution in mouse ovaries. The study mapped the spatiotemporal profile of ovarian cell types using parallel single-cell RNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics, identified ovulation-dependent gene markers, and performed cell-cell interaction analyses to understand ovulation drivers.

title: Integrated analysis of multiple transcriptomic approaches and machine learning integration algorithms reveals high endothelial venules as a prognostic immune-related biomarker in bladder cancer.
main_goals: This study integrates multiple transcriptomic approaches and machine learning algorithms to identify high endothelial venules (HEVs) as a prognostic immune-related biomarker in bladder cancer. It reveals a correlation between higher HEV levels and improved immune response and prognosis, identifying HEV-related genes for patient stratification. LDLRAD3 is proposed as a potential target for enhancing immunotherapy efficacy.

title: Multi-model analysis of gallbladder cancer reveals the role of OxLDL-absorbing neutrophils in promoting liver invasion.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'proteomics', 'multiplexed immunohistochemistry', 'in vitro assays']
main_goals: This study analyzed the tumor microenvironment of gallbladder cancer (GBC) with a focus on liver invasion. It identified a subset of neutrophils that absorb oxidized low-density lipoprotein (oxLDL) via OLR1, which promotes tumor invasion. The research also elucidated the cellular interactions and niche components that foster these pro-tumoral neutrophils.

title: Age-related Differences in Spatially Resolved Transcriptomic Profiles of Patients With Hormone Receptor-positive Breast Carcinoma.
main_goals: To compare spatially resolved transcriptomic profiles between younger (<=50 years) and older (>50 years) patients with hormone receptor (HR)-positive breast carcinoma. The study identified age-related differences in gene expression and transcriptional pathways, highlighting the need for age-specific treatment strategies.

title: Colorectal cancer-associated fibroblasts inhibit effector T cells via NECTIN2 signaling.
covered_analysis_steps: ['scRNA-seq analysis', 'spatial proteomics analysis', 'co-culture experiments', 'in vivo functional assays', 'clinical data analysis']
main_goals: This paper aimed to characterize fibroblast heterogeneity in colorectal cancer (CRC) using scRNA-seq and spatial proteomics. The researchers identified a novel cluster of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs), termed TinCAFs, that inhibit effector T cells via NECTIN2 signaling. The study demonstrates that NECTIN2 is a poor prognostic factor and suggests TinCAFs as a potential target for immunotherapy.

title: Microglia-astrocyte crosstalk in the amyloid plaque niche of an Alzheimer's disease mouse model, as revealed by spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics (CosMx and Stereo-seq) to characterize transcriptomic alterations, cellular compositions, and signaling perturbations in the amyloid plaque niche of an Alzheimer's disease mouse model. It reveals heterogeneity in plaque niche cellular composition and differential glial responses, highlighting how microglia accumulation disrupts astrocytic signaling, leading to neuronal synaptic imbalance.

title: Interactions between LAMP3+ dendritic cells and T-cell subpopulations promote immune evasion in papillary thyroid carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)', 'spatial transcriptomics RNA sequencing', 'immunohistochemistry', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry', 'bulk RNA-seq']
main_goals: This study investigates the interactions between LAMP3+ dendritic cells and T-cell subpopulations to understand immune evasion in papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC). It identifies LAMP3+ DCs as key players promoting CD8+ T cell exhaustion and regulatory T cell infiltration, contributing to an immune-suppressive microenvironment. The findings offer new strategies for PTC immunotherapy.

title: The enhanced energy metabolism in the tumor margin mediated by RRAD promotes the progression of oral squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: This study investigated the enhanced energy metabolism in the tumor margin of OSCC and identified RRAD as a mediator of this process. It found that downregulation of RRAD enhances glucose uptake and malignant behaviors by activating the CAMKIV-CREB1 axis, leading to GLUT3 transcription. The research suggests GLUT3 as a potential therapeutic target for OSCC.

title: Early Injury Landscape in Vein Harvest by Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics.
biological_context: Vein graft injury following cardiovascular bypass surgery
main_goals: To elucidate the response of the vein conduit wall during harvest and following implantation to identify maladaptive pathways driving graft failure and potential therapeutic targets. The study employed single-nuclei RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to analyze vein grafts from a canine model. The findings highlight the genomic response to vein conduit harvest and distension, and its exacerbation after implantation, suggesting potential early targets for therapies.

title: Distinctive multicellular immunosuppressive hubs confer different intervention strategies for left- and right-sided colon cancers.
main_goals: This study leverages single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to investigate the heterogeneity between left- and right-sided colon cancers. It identifies distinct multicellular immunosuppressive hubs associated with each side and proposes different intervention strategies based on these findings.

title: Spatial analysis of recurrent glioblastoma reveals perivascular niche organization.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This paper analyzes matched primary and recurrent glioblastoma tissues to understand the relationships between genetic and tumor microenvironment diversity. It investigates how extracellular matrix texture predicts genetic traits and reveals structured organization of the perivascular niche in recurrent GBM, enriched in immunosuppressive macrophages. The study highlights the importance of tissue organization in GBM evolution and genetic/spatial dependencies.

title: Role of ferroptosis in neuroimmunity and neurodegeneration in multiple sclerosis revealed by multi-omics data.
main_goals: This study explores the role of ferroptosis in multiple sclerosis by integrating multi-omics data. It defines a ferroptosis scoring metric, identifies ferroptosis hotspots in active lesions, and associates ferroptosis with neurodegeneration and microglia activation. The paper also establishes a diagnostic model for multiple sclerosis based on ferroptosis-related genes.

title: Enhanced Complement Expression in the Tumor Microenvironment Following Neoadjuvant Therapy: Implications for Immunomodulation and Survival in Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: This study investigates the effects of neoadjuvant therapy (NAT) on pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) carcinoma cells and the tumor microenvironment (TME). It found that NAT remodels the TME by upregulating complement genes, which is associated with improved survival and reduced immunosuppression. The findings suggest complement dynamics as a potential biomarker for NAT-treated PDAC.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis Identifies Epithelium-Macrophage Crosstalk in Endometriotic Lesions.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify cell type-specific gene expression changes in superficial peritoneal endometriotic lesions and elucidate the crosstalk among the stroma, epithelium, and macrophages compared to patient-matched eutopic endometrium. Spatial transcriptomics highlighted increased signaling between the lesion epithelium and macrophages, emphasizing the role of the epithelium in driving lesion inflammation.

title: Examining the Effects of Nutrient Supplementation on Metabolic Pathways via Mitochondrial Ferredoxin in Aging Ovaries.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'human ovarian pathology', 'clinical biopsy data']
main_goals: This study investigates the effects of nutrient supplementation on metabolic pathways via mitochondrial ferredoxin in aging ovaries. Using multi-omics analysis, it identified a decline in FDX1 expression with ovarian aging. A clinical trial demonstrated that nutrient supplementation (DHEA, ubiquinol CoQ10, Cleo-20 T3) significantly elevated FDX1 levels, suggesting a potential for improving oocyte quality in aging women.

title: Desorption Electrospray Ionization Mass Spectrometry Imaging Techniques Depict a Reprogramming of Energy and Purine Metabolism in the Core Brain Regions of Chronic Social Defeat Stress Mice.
biological_context: Mouse brain in chronic social defeat stress model, associated with depression
main_goals: Develop and apply DESI-MSI to detect metabolites in mouse brain tissue, classifying brain regions and identifying metabolic changes in a chronic social defeat stress model. The study found significant alterations in energy and purine metabolism in specific brain regions.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis of non-small cell lung cancer.
biological_context: Non-small cell lung cancer (adenocarcinoma and squamous-cell carcinoma)
main_goals: This study analyzes approximately 900,000 cells from treatment-naive non-small cell lung cancer patients using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to understand the tumor microenvironment, particularly the role of myeloid cells and immune cell interactions. Key findings include an inverse relationship between anti-inflammatory macrophages and cytotoxic immune cells, differences in immune checkpoint inhibitor co-expression between cancer subtypes, and evidence of macrophage transcriptional reprogramming.

title: Single-cell multiomics profiling reveals heterogeneous transcriptional programs and microenvironment in DSRCTs.
main_goals: This study profiled DSRCTs using single-cell multi-omics to reveal heterogeneous transcriptional programs and microenvironment components. It identified distinct tumor cell subpopulations and investigated the role of the EWSR1::WT1 oncogenic driver and tumor microenvironment in shaping these states. The findings highlight an epithelial signature associated with improved patient survival.

title: Molecular cascades and cell type-specific signatures in ASD revealed by single-cell genomics.
biological_context: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) in the human brain
main_goals: To examine cell composition and transcriptomics in postmortem brains of autistic individuals using deep single-nucleus RNA sequencing (snRNA-seq), snATAC-seq, and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify dysregulation of cell type-specific gene regulatory networks (GRNs) and connect these alterations to genetic susceptibility in ASD.

title: Integrating single-cell and spatial analysis reveals MUC1-mediated cellular crosstalk in mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study integrated single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to profile the mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma tumor microenvironment. It identified key intercellular interactions, including MUC1+ malignant cells with ZEB1+ endothelial cells, and found that FGF7+/THBS1+ myofibroblasts and MS4A4A+ macrophages play roles in the immunosuppressive TME. The research aims to provide insights into MCA progression, potential prognostic biomarkers, and therapeutic strategies.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptomics reveals a dystrophic trajectory following a developmental bifurcation of myoblast cell fates in facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
main_goals: This study uses MERFISH spatial transcriptomics to profile RNA transcripts in differentiating myoblasts from control and FSHD samples. It reveals a dystrophic trajectory following a developmental bifurcation of myoblast cell fates, identifying FSHD-induced transcriptomic alterations linked to DUX4 activity.

title: Transcriptomic and spatial dissection of human ex vivo right atrial tissue reveals proinflammatory microvascular changes in ischemic heart disease.
biological_context: Ischemic heart disease and heart failure
main_goals: To dissect gene expression changes in human ex vivo right atrial tissue and pericardial fluid in ischemic heart disease and heart failure using single-nuclei RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to reveal inflammatory microvascular dysfunction and changes in right atrial tissue composition as diseases progress, potentially identifying mechanisms promoting severe disease.

title: Spatially resolved cell atlas of the teleost telencephalon and deep homology of the vertebrate forebrain.
main_goals: To generate a spatially-resolved transcriptional atlas of the teleost telencephalon and compare its cell-types and anatomical regions with other vertebrates to gain insights into the organization and evolution of the vertebrate forebrain.

title: Metabolic coordination between skin epithelium and type 17 immunity sustains chronic skin inflammation.
data_modalities_used: ['immunofluorescence', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'ex vivo human psoriatic lesions', 'murine model of skin inflammation']
main_goals: This paper investigates the metabolic coordination between skin epithelium and type 17 immunity in sustaining chronic skin inflammation. It reveals that HIF1α, downstream of IL-17 signaling, drives psoriatic epithelial remodeling and that glycolysis fuels epithelial pathology and enhances γδ T17 cell responses via lactate production. The findings identify a metabolic hierarchy coordinating inflammatory disease.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals gene interactions and signaling pathway dynamics in rat embryos with anorectal malformation.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Gene Regulatory Networks']
main_goals: To investigate gene interactions and signaling pathway dynamics in rat embryos with anorectal malformation using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to capture location-specific information in the embryonic cloaca region and understand the molecular mechanisms underlying ARM development.

title: Characteristics of lipid metabolism after treatment of colon cancer mice with American ginseng vesicles.
main_goals: To provide a theoretical basis for tumor initiation and development by measuring the spatial distribution of lipids and metabolites in intestinal tissue. The study compiled lipid profiles in colon cancer mouse tumor tissue using spatial metabolomics and compared changes in lipid distribution after treatment with American Ginseng vesicles.

title: Identification of ligand and receptor interactions in CKD and MASH through the integration of single cell and spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) and Metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To identify ligand-receptor interactions in CKD and MASH by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to provide a comprehensive analysis of cell-specific L-R interactions to gain insights into signaling pathways and identify potential therapeutic targets.

title: Spatially resolved transcriptomic profiling of placental development in dairy cow.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference']
main_goals: This paper employed Stereo-seq to map spatial gene expression patterns in the cow placenta at different gestational stages. It aimed to understand the molecular and cellular interactions between trophoblast cells and their niches, and the mechanisms governing trophoblast differentiation and functionalization, identifying key transcription factors and genes involved.

title: Beyond the Granuloma: New Insights into Cardiac Sarcoidosis Using Spatial Proteomics.
data_modalities_used: ['archival human cardiac tissue samples', 'high-plex spatial protein analysis']
main_goals: To study the immunologic, fibrotic, and metabolic landscape of cardiac sarcoidosis using spatial proteomics on archival human tissue. The study also aimed to develop a predictive model to discriminate between control and sarcoidosis tissue, even without overt histologic inflammation.

title: Quinolinic acid links kidney injury to brain toxicity.
biological_context: Kidney failure and its neurological consequences
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial metabolomics analysis', 'Bulk metabolomics analysis', 'Pathway enrichment analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the link between kidney dysfunction and neurological impairment by analyzing the metabolic alterations in mouse models of kidney failure and in patients with advanced CKD. It identifies the kynurenine pathway, particularly quinolinic acid, as a key mediator connecting kidney decline to brain toxicity and systemic inflammation.

title: Discrete placental gene expression signatures accompany diabetic disease classifications during pregnancy.
biological_context: Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) during pregnancy
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Visualization', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To investigate whether subtypes of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDMA1 and GDMA2) and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) during pregnancy are associated with distinct gene expression profiles in specific placental cell populations and microenvironments. The study aimed to combine RNA-sequencing, single-cell RNA-sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics to reveal these disease gene signatures at high resolution.

title: Spatial metabolomics using mass-spectrometry imaging to decipher the impact of high red meat diet on the colon metabolome in rat.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer, Colonic epithelium metabolism affected by diet
main_goals: To investigate the metabolic impact of a high red meat diet on the rat colonic epithelium using Mass Spectrometry Imaging (MSI). The study aimed to analyze metabolite changes and their spatial distribution within the epithelial substructure to understand the effects of diet on colon metabolism and potentially identify biomarkers related to increased oxidative stress.

title: IGF2BP3 promotes glutamine metabolism of endometriosis by interacting with UCA1 to enhances the mRNA stability of GLS1.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Gene Expression Regulation']
main_goals: This study aimed to examine the influence of IGF2BP3 on endometriosis and elucidate its underlying molecular mechanism. It investigated the interaction of IGF2BP3 with UCA1 to enhance GLS1 mRNA stability and glutamine metabolism in endometriosis. The findings highlight IGF2BP3 as a potential therapeutic target for endometriosis.

title: Integrative molecular and spatial analysis reveals evolutionary dynamics and tumor-immune interplay of in situ and invasive acral melanoma.
main_goals: This paper characterizes the evolutionary dynamics and tumor-immune interplay during the progression of acral melanoma from in situ to invasive stages. It reveals distinct patterns of regional expansion in invasive acral melanoma and identifies aggressive subsets associated with specific macrophage subtypes and EMT. The study also proposes adnexal involvement and APOE/CD163 as predictive and prognostic biomarkers.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal metastasis mechanism and microenvironment remodeling of lymph node in osteosarcoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanism of lymph node metastasis in osteosarcoma and the remodeling of the metastatic lymph node microenvironment. It identifies a novel signaling axis (ETS2/IBSP) potentially promoting metastasis and elucidates how osteosarcoma cells reshape the lymph node microenvironment through interactions with various cell types.

title: Modeling blood-brain barrier formation and cerebral cavernous malformations in human PSC-derived organoids.
biological_context: Human blood-brain barrier formation and cerebral cavernous malformations
main_goals: The paper reports the construction of human blood-brain barrier (hBBB) assembloids from human pluripotent stem cell-derived organoids. These assembloids successfully mimic hBBB development and function, and are used to model cerebral cavernous malformations (CCMs), revealing CCM-related molecular and cellular alterations.

title: Cell-mediated cytotoxicity within CSF and brain parenchyma in spinal muscular atrophy unaltered by nusinersen treatment.
biological_context: spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) and its treatment with nusinersen
main_goals: To longitudinally investigate the effects of SMA and nusinersen treatment on local immune responses in the CSF and brain parenchyma. The study aimed to elucidate the role of cell-mediated cytotoxicity in SMA pathogenesis and identify it as a potential therapeutic target.

title: IL-12/IL23 blockade reveals patterns of asynchronous inflammation in pyoderma gangrenosum.
main_goals: To elucidate the dysregulated immune landscape of Pyoderma Gangrenosum (PG) and identify lesional skin changes associated with IL-12/IL-23 blockade. The study used spatial transcriptomics and comparative computation analysis on biopsies from PG patients before and after ustekinumab treatment, revealing complex inflammatory patterns including B cell infiltration and tertiary lymphoid structures.

title: Systematic dissection of tumor-normal single-cell ecosystems across a thousand tumors of 30 cancer types.
biological_context: Tumor microenvironment across 30 cancer types and adjacent/healthy normal tissues
main_goals: To comprehensively investigate tumor-normal ecosystems, this study performs an integrative analysis of single-cell transcriptomes, spatial transcriptomics, TCGA data, and bulk tumors across a thousand tumors and multiple cancer types. It defines cell states, identifies hallmark gene signatures, characterizes fibroblast distinctions, and reveals interferon-enriched community states and their rewiring and response to immunotherapy.

title: Double-negative B cells and DNASE1L3 colocalise with microbiota in gut-associated lymphoid tissue.
biological_context: Intestinal homeostasis and immune response to gut microbiota
main_goals: This paper identifies the double negative 2 subset of B cells and their interaction with dendritic cells in the subepithelial dome of gut-associated lymphoid tissue. It proposes that fundamental features of autoimmune diseases are microbiota-associated components of normal intestinal immunity.

title: Tracking in situ checkpoint inhibitor-bound target T cells in patients with checkpoint-induced colitis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper tracks checkpoint inhibitor (CPI)-bound T cells in patients with CPI-induced colitis using multimodal single-cell and subcellular spatial transcriptomics. It investigates the cellular origins and spatial organization of these cells and their relationship with tissue inflammation and epithelial damage, aiming to inform preventive strategies.

title: Dissecting microenvironment in cystadenomas and hepatic cysts based on single nucleus RNA-sequencing data.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Tumor Microenvironment Analysis', 'Pseudotime trajectory analysis', 'Copy number variation inference']
main_goals: To understand the differences in the microenvironment between cystadenomas and hepatic cysts using single-nucleus RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptome sequencing. The study aimed to reveal transcriptome signatures and regulators of immune and stromal cells, identify malignant degrees of hepatic stellate cells, and explore dynamic transformations of hepatocytes. It also investigated immune infiltration and T-cell regulatory mechanisms in cystadenomas.

title: Single nucleus and spatial transcriptomic profiling of healthy human hamstring tendon.
main_goals: To determine the transcriptomes and location of all cell types in healthy hamstring tendon using single nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified 12 distinct cell types, including novel ones for tendons, and analyzed their location and transcriptional networks, highlighting the central role of fibroblasts in tendon homeostasis.

title: Mapping dynamic molecular changes in hippocampal subregions after traumatic brain injury through spatial proteomics.
biological_context: Traumatic brain injury (TBI) in mouse hippocampus
main_goals: This study uses spatial proteomics to map dynamic molecular changes in hippocampal subregions after traumatic brain injury (TBI) at acute and subacute phases. It aims to identify subregion-specific vulnerabilities and potential recovery mechanisms.

title: Deep Learning for Cell Migration in Nonwoven Materials and Evaluating Gene Transfer Effects following AAV6-ND4 Transduction.
biological_context: LHON fibroblasts in an artificial 3D environment after adeno-associated virus transduction
main_goals: This study uses deep learning to analyze cell settlement, migration, homing, and proliferation of LHON fibroblasts in a 3D artificial environment after AAV6-ND4 transduction. The research aims to demonstrate the restoration of normal cell phenotype after gene manipulation and to model tissue formation for drug testing and disease study, inspired by biomimicry principles.

title: Multi-omics study on the molecular mechanism of anlotinib in regulating tumor metabolism.
main_goals: This study investigates the molecular mechanisms of anlotinib in regulating tumor metabolism by analyzing metabolite distribution and expression levels using spatial metabolomics. It integrates transcriptomics and proteomics to identify key metabolic pathways modulated by anlotinib, aiming to discover potential metabolic biomarkers for treatment.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics analysis of human adrenal aging.
main_goals: This study aimed to elucidate the mechanisms linking functional and structural alterations of the human adrenal cortex during aging. Researchers conducted single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics analysis of the aged human adrenal cortex. The findings suggest layer-specific alterations in signaling pathways and highlight the role of macrophages in age-related inflammation and senescence.

title: Bioengineered vascular grafts with a pathogenic TGFBR1 variant model aneurysm formation in vivo and reveal underlying collagen defects.
biological_context: Thoracic aortic aneurysm (TAA) formation in a humanized animal model.
main_goals: To establish a functional human thoracic aortic aneurysm (TAA) model in an animal host using bioengineered vascular grafts (BVGs) derived from gene-edited induced pluripotent stem cells. The study aimed to reveal underlying collagen defects contributing to TAA formation. The developed BVG model demonstrated disease pathology and provided insights into molecular mechanisms.

title: Mapping the cellular biogeography of human bone marrow niches using single-cell transcriptomics and proteomic imaging.
biological_context: Human bone marrow hematopoiesis and acute myeloid leukemia
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To map the cellular biogeography of human bone marrow niches using single-cell transcriptomics and proteomic imaging. The study discovered transcriptionally distinct subtypes of non-hematopoietic cells, predicted hematopoietic-non-hematopoietic interactions, and linked cellular signaling with spatial proximity. It revealed specific microenvironmental neighborhoods for early myelopoiesis and HSPCs, and identified mesenchymal stromal cell expansion in AML patients.

title: Deciphering novel TCF4-driven mechanisms underlying a common triplet repeat expansion-mediated disease.
data_modalities_used: ['long-read sequencing', 'short-read sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'exome data', 'primary patient-derived corneal endothelial cells (CECs)']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Alternative Splicing', 'Differential Gene Expression', 'Differential Exon Usage', 'Pathway Enrichment', 'Spatial Transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study aims to decipher novel TCF4-driven mechanisms underlying Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy (FECD) by analyzing patient-derived corneal endothelial cells. It investigates expansion-specific transcriptomic biomarkers using various sequencing techniques and identifies TCF4 isoform ratio skewing and potential TCF4 variants independent of CTG18.1 expansions as pathogenic mechanisms.

title: An integrated single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics atlas reveals the molecular landscape of the human hippocampus.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Visualization']
main_goals: To define molecular profiles for hippocampal cell types and spatial domains using integrated snRNA-seq and spatially-resolved transcriptomics data from human donors. The study aims to characterize the molecular landscape, identify cell-type-specific gene expression patterns, and understand their spatial organization within the hippocampus. The data is made accessible through interactive web applications.

title: How Mycobacterium tuberculosis builds a home: Single-cell analysis reveals M. tuberculosis ESX-1-mediated accumulation of anti-inflammatory macrophages in infected mouse lungs.
biological_context: Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection in mouse lungs
main_goals: This study investigates the role of Mycobacterium tuberculosis's ESX-1 secretion system in recruiting and differentiating immune cells within infected mouse lungs. Using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics, the authors found that ESX-1 is crucial for attracting diverse mononuclear phagocyte subsets with high bacterial burden and inducing an anti-inflammatory signature in these cells.

title: Integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to elucidate the crosstalk between cancer-associated fibroblasts and cancer cells in hepatocellular carcinoma with spleen-deficiency syndrome.
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the intercellular crosstalk in HCC with spleen deficiency syndrome (SDS) by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It revealed that platelet-derived growth factor (PDGF) signaling between cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and cancer cells is enhanced in HCC-SDS, leading to ECM remodeling and TGF-β pathway activation. The findings suggest that CAFs physically surround cancer cells, potentially forming a barrier to immune cell infiltration under SDS.

title: ALOX15<sup>+</sup> M2 macrophages contribute to epithelial remodeling in eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps.
biological_context: Eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps (eCRSwNP)
data_modalities_used: ['digital spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell sequencing', 'Hematoxylin and eosin staining', 'immunohistochemical staining', 'immunofluorescence staining']
main_goals: This study investigated the role of ALOX15+ M2 macrophages in epithelial remodeling in eosinophilic chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps (eCRSwNP). It found that ALOX15+ M2 macrophages are specifically increased in eCRSwNP and contribute to epithelial remodeling by producing chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 13.

title: Opening the Black Box: Spatial Transcriptomics and the Relevance of Artificial Intelligence-Detected Prognostic Regions in High-Grade Serous Carcinoma.
biological_context: High-grade serous carcinoma of the ovary (HGSC)
main_goals: This study applies spatially resolved transcriptomics to profile AI-identified tumor regions in high-grade serous carcinoma of the ovary (HGSC). The goal is to identify molecular features associated with patient outcome by comparing transcriptomic profiles of AI-defined regions with background tumor regions. The findings aim to demonstrate that AI-guided spatial transcriptomic analysis can improve the recognition of biologically relevant features for patient outcomes.

title: Exploring kidney allograft rejection: A proof-of-concept study using spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This study explores the potential of spatial transcriptomics to study kidney allograft rejection by mapping gene expression patterns in different pathologic states. It reveals distinct immune cell signatures and their spatial organization, and demonstrates differential spatial enrichment of rejection-associated gene expression patterns in renal allograft biopsies.

title: scRNA-seq characterizing the heterogeneity of fibroblasts in breast cancer reveals a novel subtype SFRP4<sup>+</sup> CAF that inhibits migration and predicts prognosis.
main_goals: This study characterized the heterogeneity of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in breast cancer using scRNA-seq. It identified a novel SFRP4+ CAF subtype that inhibits cancer cell migration and EMT by modulating the WNT signaling pathway. The SFRP4+ CAF subtype also serves as a potential prognostic biomarker for breast cancer patients.

title: Unlocking Skin's Symphony: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveal the Harmonious Interplay among Diverse Cell Populations.
main_goals: This paper aims to reveal the harmonious interplay among diverse cell populations in human skin by leveraging single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It explores the complex cellular ecosystem and gene expression patterns within the skin.

title: Spatial transcriptomics unravels palmitoylation and zonation-dependent gene regulation by AEG-1 in mouse liver.
biological_context: Obesity-induced metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH) and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in mouse liver.
main_goals: To elucidate how palmitoylation influences AEG-1-mediated gene regulation in regard to hepatic zonation using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify zone-specific differential gene expression in AEG-1 mutant mice compared to wild-type, potentially contributing to metabolic dysfunction and dysregulated drug metabolism leading to MASH and HCC.

title: Upregulation of EMR1 (ADGRE1) by Tumor-Associated Macrophages Promotes Colon Cancer Progression by Activating the JAK2/STAT1,3 Signaling Pathway in Tumor Cells.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro coculture of CC cells with macrophages']
main_goals: This study explores the role of EMR1 and its signaling interactions with macrophages in colon cancer progression. It investigates how TAMs induce EMR1 expression in colon cancer cells, which in turn activates JAK2/STAT1,3 signaling, promoting proliferation, migration, and motility, and reducing apoptosis. The findings suggest clinical significance for EMR1 in colon cancer progression and potential interventions.

title: Single-cell analyses reveal transient retinal progenitor cells in the ciliary margin of developing human retina.
main_goals: This paper provides a comprehensive single-cell characterization of transcriptional and chromatin accessibility changes during human retinal development. It demonstrates the transient presence of early retinal progenitors in the ciliary margin zone and identifies key transcription factors involved in their regulation. The findings offer insights into the processes underlying retinal progenitor cell specification and differentiation.

title: Targeting PDGF signaling of cancer-associated fibroblasts blocks feedback activation of HIF-1α and tumor progression of clear cell ovarian cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates the mechanisms underlying chemoresistance in ovarian clear cell carcinoma (OCCC). It identifies cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and their interaction with OCCC cells, mediated by PDGF signaling, as crucial for chemoresistance and tumor progression by influencing HIF-1α activity. The paper also demonstrates the therapeutic potential of targeting CAFs with ripretinib in combination with chemotherapy.

title: Molecular stratification of the human fetal vaginal epithelium by spatial transcriptome analysis.
main_goals: To perform a spatial transcriptomic analysis within the human fetal vaginal wall to categorize the epithelium into distinct zones, identify unique transcriptomic signatures and markers, and understand the differentiation trajectory and biological processes within these zones, particularly the basal zone. The research aims to provide a molecular atlas of the human vaginal epithelium with potential applications in vaginal reconstruction and drug delivery.

title: Pan-cancer analysis implicates novel insights of lactate metabolism into immunotherapy response prediction and survival prognostication.
biological_context: Pan-cancer analysis of tumor cells and immune microenvironment in relation to immunotherapy response and survival prognostication.
main_goals: This study aims to explore the role of lactate metabolism (LM) in predicting immunotherapy response and patient survival.
