biological_context: Atherosclerosis development in murine and human aortas and human plasma.
main_goals: The study aimed to identify specific metabolic changes in plaque, media, adventitia, and cardiac tissue between control and atherosclerotic murine aortas in a spatially resolved manner. Second, it assessed the translatability of these changes to human tissue and plasma for cardiovascular risk estimation. The study identified plaque-progression lipids LPC(18:0) and LPA(18:1) in human plasma, which reflect cardiovascular risk.

title: Unveiling the hidden role of disulfidptosis in kidney renal clear cell carcinoma: a prognostic signature for personalized treatment.
main_goals: The study aimed to investigate disulfidptosis-related biomarkers for KIRC prognosis prediction and individualized treatment. A DRPS prognostic model with four features (CHAC1, COL7A1, FOXM1, SHOX2) was constructed and validated. The model was used to explore tumor immune microenvironment, genetic drivers, drug sensitivity, and immunotherapy response according to DRPS risk stratification.

title: Placenta accreta spectrum disorder at single-cell resolution: a loss of boundary limits in the decidua and endothelium.
main_goals: The study aimed to gain insights into placenta accreta spectrum disorder by using single-cell and spatially resolved transcriptomics to characterize cellular heterogeneity at the maternal-fetal interface. The research identified transcriptional and protein changes in the stroma that shift the etiologic explanation away from invasive trophoblast to loss of boundary limits in the decidua.

title: Translatome profiling reveals Itih4 as a novel smooth muscle cell-specific gene in atherosclerosis.
main_goals: The main goal was to profile smooth muscle cell (SMC)-specific gene expression directly from tissue in the context of atherosclerosis using translating ribosome affinity purification sequencing (TRAP-seq). They identified Itih4 as a novel SMC-expressed gene in atherosclerotic plaques. The study generated an SMC-specific TRAP mouse line to study atherosclerosis.

title: Spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA sequencing reveal a transcriptomic atlas of adult human spinal cord.
main_goals: The study aimed to classify spinal cord neurons into subclusters, determine their spatial distribution, and compare the human findings with mouse data. It also explored sex differences in spinal neuronal subclusters and examined interactions between DRG and spinal cord neuronal subclusters. The results provide a resource for future research on spinal cord physiology and diseases.

title: Mosaic loss of Y chromosome is associated with aging and epithelial injury in chronic kidney disease.
main_goals: The study aims to investigate the presence and impact of mosaic loss of Y chromosome (LOY) in the kidney in the context of aging and chronic kidney disease. It utilizes single-cell RNA and ATAC sequencing, as well as spatial transcriptomics, to link LOY with epithelial injury, pro-inflammatory profiles, and future kidney function decline. The study also hypothesizes LOY as a marker of increased DNA damage and cellular senescence in other tissues.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals that metabolic characteristics define the tumor immunosuppression microenvironment via iCAF transformation in oral squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: The study aims to clarify the relationship between different metabolic regions and the tumor immune microenvironment in OSCC using single cell and spatial transcriptomics. It delineates the coordinate work axis of epithelial cells-iCAFs-Tregs in OSCC and highlights potential targets for therapy. The study found that fibroblasts transform into iCAFs in hypermetabolic regions, leading to Treg infiltration and increased TGF-β secretion, promoting an immunosuppressive microenvironment.

title: Molecular features of luminal breast cancer defined through spatial and single-cell transcriptomics.
main_goals: The study aimed to profile spatially resolved cell populations within estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) breast cancer patient-derived xenografts (PDXs) using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. They investigated the role of these populations in estrogen-dependent tumor growth and assessed the translational implications by analyzing clinical outcomes in publicly available cohorts. The study identified a proliferative cell population as a causative feature of luminal B breast cancer, contributing to its aggressive behaviors.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics in a Case of Follicular Thyroid Carcinoma Reveals Clone-Specific Dysregulation of Genes Regulating Extracellular Matrix in the Invading Front.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Evolutionary Tree Reconstruction']
main_goals: The main goal of this study is to detail the spatial transcriptional landscape of an FTC and compare the invasive front with the central core tumor areas. It aims to identify the molecular signals orchestrating the tumor's ability to invade the capsule and blood vessels. The study also reconstructs the evolutionary tree to identify the invasive clones.

title: Glomerular spatial transcriptomics of IgA nephropathy according to the presence of mesangial proliferation.
main_goals: The study investigates gene expression profiles of IgAN glomeruli based on the presence of mesangial proliferation using spatial transcriptomic profiling. It aims to identify differentially expressed genes between different IgAN subtypes and controls. The results may contribute to understanding structure-specific pathophysiology and molecular changes in IgAN.

title: In situ tissue profile of rat trigeminal nerve in trigeminal neuralgia using spatial transcriptome sequencing.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Dimension Reduction', 'Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: The goal of this study was to investigate the interactions between different types of cells in TN, particularly the impact and intrinsic mechanism of demyelination on the trigeminal ganglion, and to identify new important target genes and regulatory pathways in TN. This study provides spatial transcriptomics sequencing data on TN, reveals new markers, and redefines the relationship between the ganglion and myelin sheath.

title: Metabolic heterogeneity affects trastuzumab response and survival in HER2-positive advanced gastric cancer.
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the impact of metabolic heterogeneity on trastuzumab treatment efficacy in HER2-positive advanced gastric cancer. The work reveals that tumor metabolic heterogeneity is associated with prognosis and trastuzumab response based on tissue metabolomics.

title: Clinically relevant molecular hallmarks of PFA ependymomas display intratumoral heterogeneity and correlate with tumor morphology.
biological_context: Posterior fossa type A (PF-EPN-A, PFA) ependymoma
main_goals: The study aimed to determine molecular differences in morphologically different areas of PF-EPN-A ependymomas and to understand their clinical significance. The study revealed intratumoral heterogeneity with clinical implications.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis of the mouse brain following chronic social defeat stress.
biological_context: Mouse brain following chronic social defeat stress
main_goals: This study aims to comprehensively compare the transcriptional changes in multiple brain regions following chronic social defeat stress (CSDS) using spatial transcriptomics (ST). The study identified gene synchrony changes in different brain regions, the impact of CSDS on inhibitory neurons and synaptic functions, and the pronounced transcriptional changes in specific brain regions (Hippocampus, Isocortex, and Amygdala) associated with depressive psychiatric disorders. The research provides insights into CSDS susceptibility at the ST level.

title: Targeting stroma and tumor, silencing galectin 1 treats orthotopic mouse hepatocellular carcinoma.
main_goals: This study examines inhibiting galectin 1 (Gal1) as a treatment option for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). The study demonstrates that Gal1 silencing has a promising potential for HCC treatment by inhibiting matrix formation and recognition of foreign antigen in CD45+ cell-enriched areas located at tumor-margin. It also increases immune cells and expands cytotoxic T cells within the tumor.

title: Spatial characterization of interface dermatitis in cutaneous lupus reveals novel chemokine ligand-receptor pairs that drive disease.
data_modalities_used: ['spectral flow cytometry', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics', 'digital spatial profiling (DSP)', 'Olink targeted proteomics']
main_goals: The study examines chemokine ligand-receptor pairs to understand the immunopathogenesis of cutaneous lupus erythematosus (CLE). Spatial transcriptomics and spatial proteomics were used to examine discreet locations within the tissue and map a pathway from keratinocyte injury to lymphocyte recruitment in CLE.

title: A spatial cell atlas of neuroblastoma reveals developmental, epigenetic and spatial axis of tumor heterogeneity.
data_modalities_used: ['sc/snRNA-seq', 'bulk RNA-seq', 'whole exome sequencing', 'DNA methylation profiling', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics']
main_goals: The study generates a comprehensive cell atlas of neuroblastoma tumors to characterize inter- and intra-tumoral heterogeneity. It integrates multiple omics datasets to identify malignant cell states, spatial compartmentalization, and signaling patterns. The atlas is shared through the Human Tumor Atlas Network Data Commons.

title: Aberrant activation of wound healing programs within the metastatic niche facilitates lung colonization by osteosarcoma cells.
main_goals: The purpose of this study is to identify metastasis-specific therapeutic vulnerabilities by delineating the cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying osteosarcoma lung metastatic niche formation. The study uses single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to characterize molecular changes induced within lung tissues by disseminated osteosarcoma cells and evaluate the ability of nintedanib to impair metastasis progression.

title: Spatially Resolved Transcriptomic Signatures of Hippocampal Subregions and Arc-Expressing Ensembles in Active Place Avoidance Memory.
main_goals: To measure gene expression changes in the dorsal hippocampus following the recall of active place avoidance (APA) memory using bulk RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to identify regionalized transcriptomic profiles and distinct IEG expressing spatial transcriptomic spots supporting APA memory recall.

title: Mapping three-dimensional intratumor proteomic heterogeneity in uterine serous carcinoma by multiregion microsampling.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'mass spectrometry', 'reverse phase protein arrays', 'RNA-sequencing', 'laser microdissection']
main_goals: The goal of this study was to provide a deeper view of the tumor microenvironment of uterine serous carcinoma through multi-region microsampling and quantitative proteomics. The study identified extensive three-dimensional heterogeneity within the USC tumor microenvironment, with disease-relevant biomarkers present in both the tumor and the stroma. These data underscore the critical need for upfront enrichment of cellular subpopulations from tissue specimens for spatial proteogenomic analysis.

title: A spatiotemporal molecular atlas of the ovulating mouse ovary.
biological_context: Mouse ovarian follicle maturation and ovulation
main_goals: This study uses spatiotemporal transcriptomics to map cell type- and ovulation stage-specific molecular programs during follicle maturation and ovulation in mice. It aims to provide insights into the cellular and molecular processes that regulate ovarian follicle maturation and ovulation. The ultimate goal is to advance therapeutic strategies in reproductive medicine.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis drives PET imaging of tight junction protein expression in pancreatic cancer theranostics.
main_goals: The study aims to identify and validate pancreatic cancer surface receptor targets for molecular imaging and theranostics using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. The findings suggest claudin-4 as a potential theranostic target and develop a peptide-based molecular imaging agent targeting claudin-4.

title: Multi-Omics Reveals the Role of Osteopontin/Secreted Phosphoprotein 1 in Regulating Ovarian Aging.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the role of SPP1 in ovarian aging using multi-omics data analysis. It identifies SPP1 as a potential gene related to ovarian aging through spatial transcriptomic and single-cell RNA-sequencing analyses. The study also reveals associations between SPP1 and ITGAV, ITGB1, CD44, MMP3, and FN1.

title: Multi-omics data integration shines a light on the renal medulla.
main_goals: The paper highlights the use of multi-omics data integration to build a reference set of medullary tissue marker genes to define the medullary role in kidney function. It exemplifies the strength and utility of multi-omic data integration for characterizing molecular programs in the renal medulla.

title: Deep spatial proteomics reveals region-specific features of severe COVID-19-related pulmonary injury.
main_goals: The study aims to generate a region-resolved proteomic atlas of hallmark pathological pulmonary structures in severe COVID-19-related lung injury. This is achieved by integrating histological examination, laser microdissection, and ultrasensitive proteomics to identify pathway dysregulations and region-specific enrichment of functional markers.

title: Artificial intelligence-based analysis of tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte spatial distribution for colorectal cancer prognosis.
main_goals: The study aims to investigate CD3 CT prognostic ability in patients with CRC by using AI technology to quantify the spatial distribution of CD3 + and CD8 + T cells. The fully automated deep learning-based workflow was devised to facilitate tissue segmentation and T-cells quantification in whole-slide images (WSIs). CD3 CT was confirmed as a stage-independent predictor for overall survival in CRC patients.

title: Study on the white frost formation mechanism during storage of Phyllanthus emblica Linn. fruit based on component analysis and spatial metabolomics.
main_goals: This study aims to reveal the material basis and formation mechanism of white frost on the surface of Phyllanthus emblica Linn. fruit (PEF) using component analysis and spatial metabolomics. The relationship between the surface white frost and the quality of PEF medicinal materials is investigated, providing valuable information for quality evaluation.

title: Deciphering head and neck cancer microenvironment: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals human papillomavirus-associated differences.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: The study aimed to characterize the molecular features of primary and lymph node metastatic HNSCC tumors based on HPV status using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It identified HPV-associated differences in cellular composition and molecular alterations, focusing on PKM2 and the EPHA2 pathway.

title: Integrative analysis of disulfidptosis and immune microenvironment in hepatocellular carcinoma: a putative model and immunotherapeutic strategies.
main_goals: This study aims to explore the landscape of disulfidptosis and the immune microenvironment of HCC cells by integrating bulk RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and single-cell RNA sequencing. The authors developed a novel model to predict the prognosis of patients with HCC based on disulfidptosis. They also explored possible targets for HCC treatment.

title: Investigative needle core biopsies for multi-omics in Glioblastoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial-transcriptomics', 'metabolomics', 'proteomics', 'phosphoproteomics', 'T-cell clonotype analysis', 'MHC Class I immunopeptidomics']
main_goals: The study investigates the feasibility and utility of using stereotactic needle core biopsies to generate multi-omics data for understanding the tumor microenvironment in glioblastoma patients. It aims to assess the quality of data obtained from these biopsies and evaluate their potential for evaluating treatment responses and understanding disease processes.

title: Decoding mTOR signalling heterogeneity in the tumour microenvironment using multiplexed imaging and graph convolutional networks.
main_goals: This study investigates mTOR signalling heterogeneity in colorectal tumours using multiplexed imaging and graph convolutional networks. It aims to understand how complex mTOR signalling in different tissue compartments influences patient prognosis. The study identifies predictive features of mTOR activity in immune cells and validates observations using spatial transcriptomics.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic and Metabolomic Landscapes of Oral Submucous Fibrosis-Derived Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma and its Tumor Microenvironment.
biological_context: Oral Submucous Fibrosis-Derived Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma and its Tumor Microenvironment
main_goals: The study aims to understand the molecular mechanisms underlying the malignant transformation of OSCC from OSF by integrating spatial transcriptomics (ST) and spatial metabolomics (SM). It investigates the spatial location of cancer cells, fibroblasts, and immune cells, as well as the transcriptomic and metabolomic landscapes in OSF-derived OSCC tissues. The study also aims to reveal metabolic reprogramming and cell-cell interactions in the tumor microenvironment.

title: Spatial transcriptomic interrogation of the tumour-stroma boundary in a 3D engineered model of ameloblastoma.
biological_context: Ameloblastoma (benign epithelial tumour of the jawbone)
main_goals: This study investigates the stromal-specific effect on tumour behavior in a 3D engineered model of ameloblastoma using spatial transcriptomics. The study demonstrates that different stromal components (bone stroma vs. gingival fibroblast stroma) induce distinct gene expression changes in ameloblastoma cells, affecting oncogene expression and matrix remodeling, respectively. The findings highlight the importance of biologically relevant stroma in engineered tumour models.

title: Integration of Pan-Cancer Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Stromal Cell Features and Therapeutic Targets in Tumor Microenvironment.
main_goals: This study performs a pan-cancer analysis of stromal cells using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to uncover distinct features of stromal subsets. It identifies functional modules, spatial locations, and clinical and therapeutic relevance of these subsets across cancer types, aiming to provide a systematic view of heterogeneous stromal populations and suggest future therapeutic avenues.

title: Profibrotic Subsets of SPP1<sup>+</sup> Macrophages and POSTN<sup>+</sup> Fibroblasts Contribute to Fibrotic Scarring in Acne Keloidalis.
data_modalities_used: ['bulk RNA sequencing', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'immunofluorescence staining', 'biopsy']
main_goals: To investigate the pathogenesis of acne keloidalis by applying bulk RNA sequencing, single-cell RNA sequencing, and spatial transcriptomics to occipital scalp biopsy specimens of lesional and adjacent no-lesional skin in patients with clinically active disease. The study aimed to identify key cell populations and communication pathways involved in the fibrotic scarring process.

title: Sfrp1 inhibits lung fibroblast invasion during transition to injury-induced myofibroblasts.
biological_context: Mouse lung regeneration, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed immunostainings', 'single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'cell differentiation assays', 'invasion assays']
main_goals: The study reveals the convergence of spatially and transcriptionally distinct fibroblast lineages into transcriptionally uniform myofibroblasts and identifies SFRP1 as a modulator of TGFβ1-driven fibroblast phenotypes in fibrogenesis. It investigates fibroblast fates during mouse lung regeneration and validates findings in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis patient tissues.

title: Spatial Omics Reveals that Cancer-Associated Glycan Changes Occur Early in Liver Disease Development in a Western Diet Mouse Model of MASLD.
biological_context: Mouse model of Metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD)
main_goals: The study aims to elucidate the N-glycome profile during the progression of MASLD to liver cancer using MALDI-IMS. They identified specific N-glycan structures, including fucosylated and highly branched N-linked glycans, at very early stages of liver injury. They propose these findings as promising biomarkers for the early diagnosis of liver injury in MASLD.

title: Profiling the heterogeneity of colorectal cancer consensus molecular subtypes using spatial transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: The study aims to decipher the spatially resolved cellular and molecular composition of colorectal cancer (CRC) using Spatial Transcriptomics (ST) and single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq). It focuses on mapping the intratumoral heterogeneity of consensus molecular subtypes (CMS) and their microenvironment, and identifying cell communication events in the tumor-stroma interface. The research intends to advance personalized therapy by resolving CRC molecular heterogeneity.

title: Single-cell, single-nucleus, and spatial transcriptomics characterization of the immunological landscape in the healthy and PSC human liver.
biological_context: Primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC) and healthy human liver
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-nucleus RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'Visium', 'Nanostring GeoMx DSP', 'flow cytometry']
main_goals: To generate a comprehensive atlas of the PSC liver using multi-omic modalities and protein-based functional validation. The study aimed to understand the cellular composition of the affected liver and how it underlies disease pathogenesis. The atlas expands our understanding of the cellular complexity of PSC and has potential to guide the development of novel treatments.

title: Spatial proteomics reveals phenotypic and functional differences in T cell and macrophage subsets during villitis of unknown etiology.
main_goals: To evaluate the phenotypic and functional differences between T cells and macrophages associated with villitis of unknown etiology (VUE). The study uses GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiling to analyze placental tissue from VUE cases and controls. The goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the immuno-pathogenesis of VUE.

title: Single-cell and spatial profiling identify three response trajectories to pembrolizumab and radiation therapy in triple negative breast cancer.
main_goals: The study aims to identify patient groups that respond differently to pembrolizumab and radiation therapy in triple negative breast cancer using single-cell transcriptomics and spatial proteomics. The analysis revealed three response trajectories: non-responders, responders with pre-existing anti-tumor immunity, and responders who mount a maximal immune response after combination therapy.

title: Unique macrophage phenotypes activated by BMP signaling in breast cancer bone metastases.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify unique macrophage phenotypes activated by BMP signaling in breast cancer bone metastases and to investigate the role of BMP inhibition in restricting metastasis progression.

title: Human disease-specific cell signatures in non-lesional tissue in Multiple Sclerosis detected by single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The study aimed to identify cell type-specific differences in non-lesional brain tissue from individuals with MS compared to controls using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The researchers identified region- and cell type-specific differences in non-lesional samples from individuals diagnosed with MS and/or exhibiting secondary demyelination with other neurological conditions, including differences in oligodendrocytes and microglia.

title: Spatial transcriptomics analysis identifies a unique tumor-promoting function of the meningeal stroma in melanoma leptomeningeal disease.
main_goals: The main goal of this paper is to characterize the tumor microenvironment of the leptomeningeal tissues and patient-matched extra-cranial metastatic sites in melanoma LMD using spatial transcriptomic analyses. They identify a tumor-promoting role of meningeal stroma mediated through upregulation of SERPINA3. They demonstrate a mechanism for overcoming microenvironment-mediated drug resistance unique to this metastatic site.

title: Spatial profiling of the interplay between cell type- and vision-dependent transcriptomic programs in the visual cortex.
main_goals: The study aims to characterize the spatial organization of L2/3 cell types in the mouse primary visual cortex with and without visual experience using spatial transcriptomics. It investigates how visual deprivation affects transcriptomic changes and cell type identity. The study integrates spatial transcriptomic measurements with single-nucleus RNA-seq data to understand how vision patterns L2/3 cortical cell types during the postnatal critical period.

title: Single-cell RNA-seq reveals the metabolic status of immune cells response to immunotherapy in triple-negative breast cancer.
main_goals: This study identifies metabolic 'sub-subtypes' associated with ICB non-response in TNBC by developing an analytic pipeline to reveal metabolic heterogeneity within immune cell subtypes. The study uncovers the mechanisms of regulation for these sub-subtypes, particularly the role of pDCs and macrophages. The proposed analytical pipeline can be used to examine metabolic heterogeneity within cell types that correlate with diverse phenotypes.

title: Regulatory T cells in skin mediate immune privilege of the hair follicle stem cell niche.
biological_context: Hair follicle stem cell niche in skin
main_goals: This study investigates the role of regulatory T cells (Tregs) in maintaining immune privilege within the hair follicle stem cell niche in the skin. The authors developed a model to selectively deplete skin Tregs and observed subsequent T cell-mediated inflammation of hair follicles. Spatial transcriptomics was used to identify aberrant IL-2 signaling in a rare form of human alopecia.

title: Author Correction: Spatial transcriptomics uncover sucrose post-phloem transport during maize kernel development.
main_goals: Uncover sucrose post-phloem transport during maize kernel development using spatial transcriptomics.

title: The spatial transcriptomic landscape of human gingiva in health and periodontitis.
main_goals: The study applied Stereo-seq to obtain a spatial transcriptome atlas of the gingiva in healthy individuals and periodontitis patients. The aim was to identify major cell types and inflammation-related signaling pathways in periodontitis.

title: Single-cell landscape of idiopathic multicentric Castleman disease in identical twins.
biological_context: Idiopathic multicentric Castleman disease (iMCD) in identical twins
main_goals: To provide evidence of the putative cell-of-origin of IL-6 signals in iMCD and describe a distinct monocytic host immune response phenotype through a unique identical twin model, using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell sequencing.

title: Presence of onco-fetal neighborhoods in hepatocellular carcinoma is associated with relapse and response to immunotherapy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: The study aims to identify cell subsets involved in HCC relapse and response to immunotherapy by employing single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and bulk RNA sequencing. It identifies POSTN<sup>+</sup> CAFs as a key onco-fetal interacting hub and explores the association between onco-fetal reprogramming, EMT, tumor cell proliferation, and T<sub>reg</sub> cell recruitment.

title: The molecular cytoarchitecture of the adult mouse brain.
main_goals: To construct a comprehensive atlas of cell types in each brain structure by integrating single-nucleus RNA sequencing and Slide-seq. This atlas allows for characterization of cell type composition, neuropeptide and neurotransmitter signalling, region-specific gene expression, and heritability enrichment of neurological and psychiatric phenotypes.

title: T cell-mediated curation and restructuring of tumor tissue coordinates an effective immune response.
main_goals: This study characterizes the tumor microenvironment in melanoma using multiplexed imaging. It investigates dynamic immune cell infiltration and tumor cell neighborhoods in response to T cell therapy and checkpoint inhibitors. The study aims to identify spatial correlates of immunotherapy outcomes and inform cellular therapy evaluation and engineering.

title: A human embryonic limb cell atlas resolved in space and time.
main_goals: The study characterizes human embryonic limb development using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies novel cell populations, two waves of muscle development, and anatomical segregation of genes. The research also performs cross-species comparison with mouse embryonic limbs.

title: Functional and spatial proteomics profiling reveals intra- and intercellular signaling crosstalk in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: This paper investigates the signaling crosstalk in colorectal cancer using patient-derived organoids (PDOs) and imaging mass-cytometry. It aims to understand tumor cell intrinsic signaling and the impact of the tumor microenvironment (TME) to inform precision oncology.

title: Temporal and spatial analysis of astrocytes following stroke identifies novel drivers of reactivity.
main_goals: This paper uses spatial transcriptomics and snRNA-seq to analyze astrocytes in mouse forebrain after ischemic injury. The study aims to understand the temporal and spatial dynamics of astrocyte reactivity, identifying distinct astrocyte subtypes and their responses to injury. The findings offer insights into the heterogeneity of reactive astrocytes and their potential roles in post-injury processes.

title: Multiplexed 3D Analysis of Immune States and Niches in Human Tissue.
biological_context: pre-invasive melanoma in situ and metastatic melanoma
main_goals: This study utilizes a high-resolution 3D imaging approach combining CyCIF imaging and confocal microscopy to characterize organelles and structures at a sub-micron scale while quantifying millimetre-scale spatial features. The approach allows for precise cell phenotyping and scoring cell proximity. The study investigates the microenvironment in pre-invasive and metastatic melanoma.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals novel genes during the remodelling of the embryonic human arterial valves.
main_goals: This study utilizes Spatial Transcriptomics to investigate the transcriptome of developing human arterial valves. It identifies novel genes and pathways involved in valve development and highlights the limitations of existing databases in representing valve transcriptomes.

title: Integrated single-nuclei and spatial transcriptomic analysis reveals propagation of early acute vein harvest and distension injury signaling pathways following arterial implantation.
biological_context: Vein graft failure following cardiovascular bypass surgery
main_goals: To elucidate the response of the vein conduit wall during harvest and following implantation using single-nuclei RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomics; to identify key maladaptive pathways driving graft failure; to identify potential therapeutic targets for biologic intervention.

title: A multidimensional analysis reveals distinct immune phenotypes and the composition of immune aggregates in pediatric acute myeloid leukemia.
main_goals: To conduct a multidimensional analysis of the tumor immune microenvironment in pediatric AML and non-leukemic controls; to characterize the composition, phenotype, and spatial organization of immune cells in the pediatric AML bone marrow; to identify potential targetable immune-evasion mechanisms specific to pediatric AML.

title: Programs, Origins, and Niches of Immunomodulatory Myeloid Cells in Gliomas.
data_modalities_used: ['scRNA-seq', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'mitochondrial DNA-based lineage tracing', 'organoid explant systems']
main_goals: To understand the immunomodulatory properties of glioma-associated myeloid cells using scRNA-seq, spatial transcriptomics, and lineage tracing.  To determine the factors driving the expression of these immunomodulatory programs. To provide a framework for developing more effective immunotherapies.

title: Differential chromatin accessibility and transcriptional dynamics define breast cancer subtypes and their lineages.
main_goals: To characterize the links between gene expression and chromatin accessibility in different breast cancer subtypes and their cells of origin using multi-omic techniques. To identify key genes and regulatory networks defining basal-like and luminal breast cancer lineages. To provide spatial detail for key markers of benign and malignant cell types and immune cell colocation.

title: Machine learning links T cell function and spatial localization to neoadjuvant immunotherapy and clinical outcome in pancreatic cancer.
main_goals: To investigate the impact of neoadjuvant αCD40 therapy on T cells in the tumor microenvironment (TME) of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) using machine learning to analyze single-cell, spatial, and highly multiplexed proteomic data.  To identify potential biomarkers of disease-free survival (DFS) for αCD40-treated patients. To demonstrate the utility of machine learning in molecular cancer immunology applications.

title: Human neural stem cells restore spatial memory in a transgenic Alzheimer's disease mouse model by an immunomodulating mechanism.
main_goals: To elucidate the therapeutic mechanisms of human neural stem cells (hNSCs) in an Alzheimer's disease mouse model using spatial transcriptomics.  The study aimed to determine if hNSC transplantation restored spatial memory and to identify the underlying mechanisms, specifically investigating the role of microglia-mediated neuroinflammation.

title: Breast Cancer Macrophage Heterogeneity and Self-renewal are Determined by Spatial Localization.
main_goals: To map the determinants of functional heterogeneity of tumor microenvironment (TME) macrophages in breast cancer using an ex vivo organotypic TME model, in vivo murine models, and human samples.  To identify the signals regulating macrophage heterogeneity and accumulation, focusing on a self-renewing macrophage subset.  To explore the therapeutic potential of disrupting macrophage self-renewal in breast cancer.

title: Comprehensive single cell aging atlas of mammary tissues reveals shared epigenomic and transcriptomic signatures of aging and cancer.
biological_context: Mouse mammary glands, human breast tumors
main_goals: To investigate how aging affects the transcriptomic and epigenomic programs of mouse mammary glands at single-cell resolution; to identify age-related changes in epithelial, stromal, and immune cells; to determine if transcriptional signatures of aging mammary cells are found in human breast tumors.

title: Spatial transcriptomics and neurofilament light chain reveal changes in lesion patterns in murine autoimmune neuroinflammation.
biological_context: Experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE) and Multiple Sclerosis
main_goals: To investigate the spatio-temporal patterns of neuroaxonal damage in EAE, using spatial transcriptomics and other techniques to understand the role of CNS myeloid cells in neurodegeneration and the relationship between lesion patterns and serum neurofilament light (sNfL) levels.

title: Treatment with tumor-treating fields (TTFields) suppresses intercellular tunneling nanotube formation in vitro and upregulates immuno-oncologic biomarkers in vivo in malignant mesothelioma.
main_goals: To determine whether tunneling nanotubes (TNTs) are a therapeutic target for Tumor-Treating Fields (TTFields) therapy in malignant pleural mesothelioma (MPM).  To characterize TTFields-induced changes to molecular profiles in vivo using spatial transcriptomics. To develop a new method, SPOTT (Spatial Profiling of Tunneling nanoTubes), for visualizing TNTs in intact tissue and superimposing them over spatial genomic data.

title: Exploring myometrial microenvironment changes at the single-cell level from nonpregnant to term pregnant states.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: To characterize the changes in the myometrial microenvironment at the single-cell level between nonpregnant and term pregnant states using scRNA-Seq and spatial transcriptomics.  To identify spatially distinct cell populations and alterations in cell proportions, particularly smooth muscle cells and macrophages.  To provide insights into myometrial remodeling and the anti-inflammatory response during pregnancy.

title: In Situ Spatial Reconstruction of Distinct Normal and Pathological Cell Populations Within the Human Adrenal Gland.
main_goals: To investigate the centripetal differentiation model in the human adrenal cortex using spatially resolved in situ transcriptomics, characterize aldosterone-producing micronodules (APMs), and better understand adrenal diseases such as primary aldosteronism.  The study aimed to identify distinct cell populations and their positional relationships within the human adrenal gland.  Results supported the centripetal differentiation model and characterized APM heterogeneity.

title: Spiny projection neurons exhibit transcriptional signatures within subregions of the dorsal striatum.
main_goals: To identify cell-type-specific spatiomolecular signatures of direct and indirect SPNs within subregions of the dorsal striatum using RNA profiling in situ hybridization.  The study aimed to reveal the molecular identity of SPNs mediated by differentially expressed genes across striatal territories. This provides a foundation for understanding normal striatal function and region-specific dysfunction in striatal disorders.

title: Comparative spatial proteomics of Plasmodium-infected erythrocytes.
main_goals: To determine the steady-state subcellular location of more than 12,000 parasite proteins across five different Plasmodium species by subcellular fractionation of infected erythrocytes. To compare the pan-species spatial proteomes and their expression patterns to understand species-specific host adaptation processes.

title: Investigation of the active ingredients of Shuangshen Ningxin Fomula and the mechanism underlying their protective effects against myocardial ischemia-reperfusion injury by mass spectrometric imaging.
main_goals: To investigate the active ingredients of Shuangshen Ningxin Formula and their protective effects against myocardial ischemia-reperfusion injury in rats.  To elucidate the mechanism of this protection using spatial metabolomics and MALDI-TOF MS imaging.  To demonstrate the utility of MALDI-TOF MS in detecting the spatial distribution of small molecule metabolites in the myocardium during pharmacological research.

title: Spatial Mechano-Signaling Regulation of GTPases through Non-Degradative Ubiquitination.
main_goals: To investigate the spatial regulation of GTPase ubiquitination in endothelial cells under shear stress.  To identify WWP2 as a novel regulator of RAP1 ubiquitination and its role in maintaining endothelial barrier integrity. To demonstrate the consequences of WWP2 deficiency on ROS production, lipid oxidation, and inflammation.

title: Spatial and single-cell profiling of the metabolome, transcriptome and epigenome of the aging mouse liver.
main_goals: To investigate how spatial location within the liver affects cellular aging trajectories.  The study integrated spatial transcriptomics with single-cell multi-omics data to reveal zonation-specific age-related changes in metabolism, epigenome, and transcriptome.  The findings highlight the influence of microenvironment changes on cellular epigenetic, metabolic, and phenotypic outputs during liver aging.

title: An integrated study to decipher immunosuppressive cellular communication in the PDAC environment.
main_goals: To decipher cellular communication in the pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma tumor microenvironment using spatial transcriptomics, scRNA-seq, and bulk RNA-seq.  To identify key cell types and genes involved in immunosuppression. To highlight the role of TAMs and the LGALS9 gene in PDAC immunosuppression as potential therapeutic targets.

title: Unraveling temporal and spatial biomarkers of epithelial-mesenchymal transition in colorectal cancer: insights into the crucial role of immunosuppressive cells.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To characterize the spatiotemporal relationship between EMT-invasive malignant tumors and immune cells in colorectal cancer using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics.  To identify key genes involved in CRC progression and the role of immunosuppressive cells in tumor formation. To provide a framework for delineating the spatiotemporal invasive niche in CRC.

title: Spatial transcriptomics uncover sucrose post-phloem transport during maize kernel development.
main_goals: To visualize gene expression patterns in maize kernels during grain filling using spatial transcriptomics, identify cell populations and molecular markers, and elucidate spatial storage mechanisms of starch, protein, and oil. The study aimed to provide insights into functional genes controlling agronomic traits in maize kernels.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Resolve an Emphysema-Specific Lymphoid Follicle B Cell Signature in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease.
biological_context: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) and Emphysema
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Differential gene expression analysis']
main_goals: To characterize the transcriptomic signatures from lymphoid follicles (LFs) in smokers with and without COPD and varying degrees of emphysema.  To identify emphysema-induced transcriptional networks and determine the association between centrilobular emphysema and genes involved in B cell maturation and antibody production.  To resolve the role of off-targeted B cell activation within LFs in autoimmune-mediated emphysema pathogenesis.

title: Spatiotemporal single-cell transcriptomic profiling reveals inflammatory cell states in a mouse model of diffuse alveolar damage.
main_goals: To analyze inflammatory cell states in a mouse model of diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.  To identify the role of fibroblasts in neutrophil recruitment during DAD-induced neutrophilic inflammation. To characterize the spatial organization of the inflamed niche in the lung.

title: Preneoplastic liver colonization by 11p15.5 altered mosaic cells in young children with hepatoblastoma.
main_goals: To identify mosaic genetic alterations of the 11p15.5 locus in the liver of hepatoblastoma patients, characterize their functional consequences (IGF2 overexpression, H19 downregulation, alteration of liver zonation, enriched extracellular matrix and angiogenesis), and identify a 60-gene signature in 11p15.5 altered hepatocytes using spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNAseq.

title: Spatial transcriptomic interrogation of the murine bone marrow signaling landscape.
main_goals: To apply spatial transcriptomics to fully mineralized tissue (mouse femurs), to combine spatial transcriptomics and scRNAseq to define the cellular components of the stem cell niche, identify cell-cell communication, and gain a comprehensive understanding of local and global SSPC regulatory networks.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals unique gene expression changes in different brain regions after sleep deprivation.
main_goals: To define the impact of brief sleep deprivation across the mouse brain using spatial transcriptomics.  To identify differentially expressed genes and their regional variations after sleep deprivation.  To develop bioinformatic tools for registering tissue sections and gene expression data for brain-wide comparison.

title: Spatially resolved gene expression profiles of fibrosing interstitial lung diseases.
main_goals: The study aims to dissect gene expression profiles between lung microenvironments (LMEs) within and across different types of fibrosing interstitial lung diseases (ILDs) using digital spatial profiling. It identifies differentially expressed genes between LMEs within each condition and across histologically similar regions between conditions. The study also aims to classify previously unclassified ILD cases based on gene expression profiles and unsupervised clustering.

title: Spatial proteomics of Onchocerca volvulus with pleomorphic neoplasms shows local and systemic dysregulation of protein expression.
main_goals: The study aims to assess the protein inventory of Onchocerca volvulus neoplasms and identify proteins associated with tumor development using laser capture microdissection and mass spectrometry. The protein expression in neoplasms was compared to normal tissues to identify proteins linked to the development of PN and systemic dysregulation of protein expression contributing to worm mortality.

title: Spatial, transcriptomic, and epigenomic analyses link dorsal horn neurons to chronic pain genetic predisposition.
main_goals: This study investigates the genetic basis of chronic pain by analyzing dorsal horn neurons. It utilizes a multi-species approach integrating rhesus macaque snRNA-seq data with human and mouse datasets to create a species-conserved atlas of neuron subtypes. The research then links chronic pain genetic variants to regulatory elements in these neurons using single-nucleus open chromatin analysis.

title: Spatial transcriptomic sequencing reveals immune microenvironment features of Mycobacterium tuberculosis granulomas in lung and omentum.
biological_context: Tuberculosis granulomas in lung and omentum
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This study aims to analyze the transcriptome profiles of cell populations based on their spatial location and to understand the core transcriptome characteristics of granuloma formation and development. It reveals shifts in the immune microenvironment of pulmonary and omental granulomas and identifies key genes involved in their formation. The findings provide insights into tuberculosis pathogenesis and potential novel adjuvant treatments.

title: A prenatal skin atlas reveals immune regulation of human skin morphogenesis.
main_goals: The study aimed to create a multi-omics reference atlas of prenatal human skin to understand the interplay between immune and non-immune cells in skin morphogenesis. They compared a hair-bearing skin organoid model to prenatal and adult skin to identify cellular and molecular similarities and differences. The study also investigated the role of macrophages in endothelial development within the skin.

title: Bulk integrated single-cell-spatial transcriptomics reveals the impact of preoperative chemotherapy on cancer-associated fibroblasts and tumor cells in colorectal cancer, and construction of related predictive models using machine learning.
main_goals: Investigate the impact of preoperative chemotherapy on cancer-associated fibroblasts and epithelial cells in colorectal cancer using bulk, single-cell, and spatial transcriptomics. Identify prognostic cell subpopulations affected by chemotherapy and construct a machine learning-based predictive model for prognosis and treatment response.

title: Matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization mass spectrometry imaging as a new tool for molecular histopathology in epilepsy surgery.
biological_context: Human focal cortical dysplasia (FCD) in epilepsy
main_goals: This study evaluates matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization mass spectrometry imaging (MALDI-MSI) as a potential tool for molecular histopathology in epilepsy surgery, focusing on focal cortical dysplasia (FCD). The goals include demonstrating its capability to identify distinct histopathological features and lesion boundaries, visualize spatial distribution of markers, and generate lists of potential discriminant peptides.

title: Spatial metabolomics identifies distinct tumor-specific and stroma-specific subtypes in patients with lung squamous cell carcinoma.
main_goals: To identify distinct tumor- and stroma-specific subtypes in lung squamous cell carcinoma patients using spatial metabolomics. To correlate these subtypes with immunological features, metabolic pathways, and clinical outcomes (prognosis, chemotherapy resistance) to improve personalized therapy.

title: Spatiotemporal genomic profiling of intestinal metaplasia reveals clonal dynamics of gastric cancer progression.
biological_context: Intestinal metaplasia and gastric cancer progression
main_goals: This paper performs a spatiotemporal genomic and transcriptomic profiling of intestinal metaplasia (IM) to understand gastric cancer progression. It identifies driver genes, cellular heterogeneity, and molecular subtypes within IM. The study demonstrates improved GC risk prediction using combined clinical-genomic models and suggests a role for microbial dysbiosis.

title: Clonal Proliferation Within Smooth Muscle Cells in Unstable Human Atherosclerotic Lesions.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Differential Expression Analysis']
main_goals: To investigate the existence and molecular characteristics of smooth muscle cell clones in unstable human atherosclerotic lesions using a novel BaseScope approach and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to determine the extent of clonality and identify differential gene expression in clonal vs. nonclonal regions.

title: Genetic vulnerability to Crohn's disease reveals a spatially resolved epithelial restitution program.
biological_context: Intestinal mucosa healing and Crohn's disease vulnerability
main_goals: To dissect intestinal mucosa healing by integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. To investigate how a Crohn's disease risk variant (HGFAC R509H) disrupts the healing program by impairing growth factor activation and downstream cellular responses.

title: Characterization of spatial lipidomic signatures in tick-bitten guinea pig skin as a model for host-vector-pathogen interaction profiling.
biological_context: Host-vector-pathogen interactions in tick-bitten guinea pig skin
main_goals: Demonstrate the adaptability of spatial omics methods to study host-vector-pathogen interactions at the tick-host interface during a blood meal. Aims to better understand complex molecular interactions for spatially aware therapeutic target discovery.

title: Molecular signature incorporating the immune microenvironment enhances thyroid cancer outcome prediction.
main_goals: To identify biomarkers of aggressive thyroid malignancy using multi-omics data including spatial technologies. To develop a Molecular Aggression and Prediction (MAP) score that improves prognostication. To highlight the importance of the immune microenvironment in outcome prediction and potential immunotherapy response in thyroid cancer.

title: Spatial Distribution of Immune Cells Drives Resistance to Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Organization Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Predictive Modeling', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To use spatial transcriptomics to investigate the multidimensional organization of TNBC at diagnosis and its contribution to response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy (NAC). The study aimed to identify spatially-defined characteristics and transcriptional programs that predict patient response (pCR vs pNR) and provide insights for personalized therapy.

title: Developmental estrogen exposure in mice disrupts uterine epithelial cell differentiation and causes adenocarcinoma via Wnt/β-catenin and PI3K/AKT signaling.
biological_context: Mouse uterus, endometrial adenocarcinoma, developmental exposure
main_goals: To determine the causative factors linking developmental estrogen exposure (DES) to adult endometrial adenocarcinoma in mice. Used scRNAseq and spatial transcriptomics to reveal that DES exposure disrupts uterine epithelial cell differentiation, leading to a proliferating progenitor population and activation of Wnt/β-catenin and PI3K/AKT signaling, along with stromal inflammation, resulting in malignant transformation.

title: Spatial transcriptomics map of the embryonic mouse brain - a tool to explore neurogenesis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To generate a spatial transcriptomics map of the embryonic day 13.5 mouse brain. To define specific cell type populations and transcriptional signatures across brain areas. To integrate spatial data with single-cell RNAseq data, providing a resource for exploring neurogenesis and cell crosstalk.

title: A spatial sequencing atlas of age-induced changes in the lung during influenza infection.
main_goals: Characterize age-induced changes in mouse lung during influenza infection using scRNA-seq, spatial transcriptomics, and bulk RNA-seq. Identify age-dependent, cell type-specific changes in immune, endothelial, and epithelial cells, including profiles related to inflammation, coagulation, and fibrosis. Provide a high-throughput atlas for studying age-related influenza response.

title: Cancer-associated fibroblasts undergoing neoadjuvant chemotherapy suppress rectal cancer revealed by single-cell and spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Rectal cancer treated with neoadjuvant chemotherapy
main_goals: To examine the cell dynamics in the tumor microenvironment of rectal cancer patients before and after neoadjuvant chemotherapy using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, focusing on cancer-associated fibroblasts and their association with therapeutic response.

title: Myelin-associated oligodendrocytic basic protein-dependent myelin repair confers the long-lasting antidepressant effect of ketamine.
biological_context: Mouse models of depression (chronic social defeat stress) focusing on medial prefrontal cortex and hippocampus
main_goals: To investigate the mechanisms underlying ketamine's long-lasting antidepressant effects, focusing on myelination changes in the mouse brain using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify myelin-related genes, demonstrate ketamine's effect on OPC differentiation and myelination, elucidate the role of Mobp, explore AMPAR signaling, and compare the effects of R-ketamine and S-ketamine on myelination.

title: Single-cell landscape and spatial transcriptomic analysis reveals macrophage infiltration and glycolytic metabolism in kidney renal clear cell carcinoma.
biological_context: Kidney renal clear cell carcinoma (KIRC) and mouse kidney injury
main_goals: To investigate the clinical relevance of the glycolytic factor PGAM1 in kidney renal clear cell carcinoma (KIRC). The study uses multi-omics data including spatial and single-cell transcriptomics to analyze PGAM1's association with immune cell infiltration, prognosis, and potential as a therapeutic target in KIRC.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals the distinct organization of mouse prefrontal cortex and neuronal subtypes regulating chronic pain.
biological_context: Adult mouse prefrontal cortex and chronic pain
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-type identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Organization Analysis']
main_goals: To decode the cellular and circuit organization of the adult mouse prefrontal cortex using spatially resolved single-cell transcriptome profiling. The study aims to reveal distinct cell-type composition, gene-expression patterns, and neuronal subtypes, particularly focusing on those involved in chronic pain.

title: An interactive resource of molecular signalling in the developing human haematopoietic stem cell niche.
biological_context: Human haematopoietic stem cell development in the AGM region
main_goals: Analyze the progression of dorso-ventral polarised signalling in the human AGM region during HSC emergence (CS13-CS17) using spatial transcriptomics. Identify stage-specific changes in signalling and provide an online interactive resource of molecular signalling data.

title: Pan-cancer spatially resolved single-cell analysis reveals the crosstalk between cancer-associated fibroblasts and tumor microenvironment.
biological_context: Pan-cancer (multiple common and rare cancer types) focusing on Cancer-associated fibroblasts and Tumor Microenvironment
main_goals: To identify functional subgroups of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and their spatial distribution across multiple cancer types using integrated spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. To analyze the spatially-resolved crosstalk between CAFs and the tumor microenvironment (TME) and investigate CAF roles in immunotherapy response. To provide a web interface for exploring pan-cancer CAF data.

title: Comprehensive cell atlas of the first-trimester developing human brain.
main_goals: To build a comprehensive cell atlas of the first-trimester developing human brain using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to reveal cell states, trajectories, and their spatial organization to understand early brain development.

title: Single-Molecule Spatial Transcriptomics of Human Thoracic Aortic Aneurysms Uncovers Calcification-Related CARTPT-Expressing Smooth Muscle Cells.
biological_context: Human thoracic aortic aneurysm (TAA) and controls
main_goals: The study aims to apply high-resolution single-molecule spatial transcriptomics to human thoracic aortic aneurysm (TAA) tissue to uncover spatially distinct cell subtypes. It identifies a CARTPT-expressing smooth muscle cell (SMC) subtype enriched in male TAA samples. Functional studies explore the role of CART in promoting an osteochondrogenic switch in aortic SMCs, suggesting a potential link to medial calcification.

title: Stomach encyclopedia: Combined single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal cell diversity and homeostatic regulation of human stomach.
biological_context: Healthy human stomach, gastric and metaplastic cells, intestinal metaplasia
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To reveal cell diversity and homeostatic regulation of the human stomach using combined single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. To construct a large dataset ('stomach encyclopedia') and identify new cell markers and cell-cell interactions. To provide a fundamental resource for future stomach research.

title: Multi-species atlas resolves an axolotl limb development and regeneration paradox.
biological_context: Axolotl limb development and regeneration, multi-species comparison
main_goals: The main goals are to establish the presence of AER-like cells in axolotls, analyze their re-formation during limb regeneration using spatial transcriptomics, investigate the mesoderm's contribution, and resolve the debate surrounding the axolotl AER in limb development and regeneration.

title: Spatial Heterogeneity of Integrins and Their Ligands in Primary Breast Tumors.
main_goals: Characterize the morphological and spatial heterogeneity of primary breast tumors. Study the spatial expression profiles of integrins and their ligands using spatial transcriptomics and the NICHES algorithm to map ligand-receptor signaling and visualize heterogeneity. Investigate inter- and intra-tumoral heterogeneity in the context of integrin-ligand functional clusters.

title: Spatial downregulation of CD74 signatures may drive invasive component development in part-solid lung adenocarcinoma.
biological_context: Lung adenocarcinoma progression in part-solid nodules
main_goals: To define the spatial composition and evolutionary trajectories of early-stage lung adenocarcinoma using spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing. The study identified malignant cell populations, their evolutionary relationship, spatial immune infiltration patterns, and suggested a role for the CD74 axis in immune escape.

title: Cell type-specific gene expression dynamics during human brain maturation.
main_goals: To build a joint paediatric and adult cell type atlas of the human temporal lobe using snRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. To explore cell type-specific gene expression dynamics and identify differences between paediatric and adult cell types during brain maturation. To provide resources that improve understanding of brain development.

title: Transcriptomics and proteomics reveal distinct biology for lymph node metastases and tumour deposits in colorectal cancer.
main_goals: To compare the biology of lymph node metastases (LNMs) and tumour deposits (TDs) in colorectal cancer using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. The study aimed to identify differences in molecular profiles and microenvironment composition to understand their role in cancer spread and prognosis.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis of virtual prostate biopsy reveals confounding effect of tissue heterogeneity on genomic signatures.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Pseudo-bulk analysis']
main_goals: To analyze prognostic genetic signatures using virtual prostate biopsy models derived from spatial transcriptomic data. The study demonstrates how tissue heterogeneity (benign, stroma, tumour subtype, grade, clone) within virtual biopsies confounds results from bulk genomic analyses compared to spatially resolved analysis, highlighting limitations of current clinical biopsy genomics.

title: Combined near infrared photoacoustic imaging and ultrasound detects vulnerable atherosclerotic plaque.
data_modalities_used: ['near infrared photoacoustic imaging', 'ultrasound imaging', 'immunohistochemistry', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics']
main_goals: The paper aims to demonstrate the potential of combined near infrared photoacoustic imaging and ultrasound to detect vulnerable atherosclerotic plaque. It also seeks to determine the origin of the photoacoustic signal using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics, establishing a methodology for fusing molecular imaging with spatial omics.

title: Integrating single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveals endoplasmic reticulum stress-related CAF subpopulations associated with chordoma progression.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This paper dissects the heterogeneity, spatial distribution, and clinical implication of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in chordoma using multi-omics data, including scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. It identifies an endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS)-related CAF subpopulation in recurrent tumors associated with poor prognosis. The study also demonstrates the spatial existence of these ERS-CAFs close to tumor cells, correlating this proximity and density with tumor malignant phenotype and adverse patient outcomes.

title: Integration of single-nuclei RNA-sequencing, spatial transcriptomics and histochemistry defines the complex microenvironment of NF1-associated plexiform neurofibromas.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To define the complex microenvironment of NF1-associated plexiform neurofibromas (PN) by integrating single-nuclei RNA-sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and histochemistry. The study aims to chart cellular heterogeneity, provide spatial context, and identify potential cell-cell communication pathways driving disease progression.

title: Molecular portraits of patients with intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma who diverge as rapid progressors or long survivors on chemotherapy.
data_modalities_used: ['digital pathology', 'whole-transcriptome profiling', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'targeted digital spatial profiling (GeoMx)', 'single cell RNA-sequencing']
main_goals: This paper aims to identify pretreatment molecular profiles (transcriptome signatures) in diagnostic biopsies that predict chemotherapy outcome in advanced iCCA patients, differentiating rapid progressors from long survivors. It investigates the biological bases of innate chemoresistance, focusing on tumor-myeloid dynamics and the liver microenvironment, and proposes the identified signature as a potential metric for chemotherapy outcome.

title: Tracing immune cells around biomaterials with spatial anchors during large-scale wound regeneration.
biological_context: Wound regeneration and scarring in mice using biomaterials
main_goals: To investigate immune responses around biodegradable aligned extracellular matrix scaffolds during large-area wound regeneration using multimodal analysis including scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics. The study aims to understand the role of immune cells, particularly regulatory T cells and macrophages, in mitigating tissue fibrosis and promoting wound healing and hair follicle neogenesis.

title: Self-organizing models of human trunk organogenesis recapitulate spinal cord and spine co-morphogenesis.
biological_context: Human trunk organogenesis, spinal cord and spine development
main_goals: To generate human trunk-like organoids recapitulating spinal cord and spine co-morphogenesis. To use single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to demonstrate the spatial organization, patterning, and differentiation of tissues along an antero-posterior axis in these organoids. To show that in vivo-like multi-tissue organization can be achieved in human organoids.

title: Deep spatial-omics analysis of Head & Neck carcinomas provides alternative therapeutic targets and rationale for treatment failure.
biological_context: Head and Neck Oropharyngeal Squamous Cell Carcinomas (OPSCCs)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To perform deep spatial-omics analysis of Head & Neck carcinomas, specifically p16+ OPSCC, to identify alternative therapeutic targets and understand treatment failure. The study uses spatial transcriptomics and spatial proteomics to analyze tumor cells and immune cell profiles in a patient failing ICI and Lenvatinib therapies.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals light-induced chlorenchyma cells involved in promoting shoot regeneration in tomato callus.
main_goals: This study explores the spatial transcriptome of tomato callus during shoot regeneration to understand the molecular basis of the process. It reveals cellular heterogeneity within the callus, identifies key factors for shoot primordia formation, and highlights the role of light-induced chlorenchyma cells in promoting regeneration.

title: High risk clear cell renal cell carcinoma microenvironments contain protumour immunophenotypes lacking specific immune checkpoints.
biological_context: High risk clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC)
main_goals: To define the tumour infiltrating immunophenotypes within the clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC) tumour microenvironment (TME) using spatial transcriptomics and other sequencing data. The study aims to identify predictive immunophenotypes and understand why perioperative immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) trials for ccRCC have failed. Findings reveal high-risk ccRCC TMEs contain protumour immunophenotypes lacking specific checkpoint gene expression.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of a lycophyte root sheds light on root evolution.
biological_context: Lycophyte root evolution in Selaginella moellendorffii
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to investigate root evolution and development in the lycophyte Selaginella moellendorffii. It aims to compare gene expression patterns in lycophyte roots to those in seed plants, analyze the roles of specific genes (SHR, SCR, WOX13a) in root tissue organization and root cap formation, and provide a spatial data resource for the Selaginella root.

title: Helicase-like transcription factor (HLTF)-deleted CDX/TME model of colorectal cancer increased transcription of oxidative phosphorylation genes and diverted glycolysis to boost S-glutathionylation in lymphatic intravascular metastatic niches.
biological_context: Colorectal cancer (CRC) in a cell line-derived xenograft (CDX) model with tumor microenvironment (TME)
main_goals: This paper investigates the metabolic reprogramming induced by HLTF deletion in colorectal cancer cells and the tumor microenvironment within a CDX model. It shows that HLTF deletion leads to increased OXPHOS and altered glycolysis supporting S-glutathionylation, which helps mitigate oxidative stress in lymphatic metastatic niches and promotes metastasis.

title: Spatiotemporal molecular dynamics of the developing human thalamus.
main_goals: To delineate the molecular trajectories of cell fate specification and organization in the developing human thalamus using single cell and multiplexed spatial transcriptomics. The study identified that molecularly-defined thalamic neurons differentiate in the second trimester and organize into spatially and molecularly distinct nuclei, detailing glutamatergic and GABAergic neuron subtypes.

title: Spatial whole transcriptome profiling of primary tumor from patients with metastatic prostate cancer.
main_goals: To explore spatial gene expression heterogeneity within primary prostate tumors from patients with metastatic disease using spatial transcriptomics. The study identified T cell clusters potentially mediating aggressive phenotypes in CRPC and immune-stroma cross-talk in NEPC, with potential prognostic biomarker implications.

title: Immune checkpoint blockade induces distinct alterations in the microenvironments of primary and metastatic brain tumors.
biological_context: Brain metastases and glioblastoma treatment with immune checkpoint blockade
main_goals: This study compares the immune cellular landscape and microenvironmental changes induced by immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) in brain metastases (BrM) versus recurrent glioblastoma (rGBM). It reveals distinct T cell infiltration patterns and macrophage populations in BrM after ICB, offering insights into improving ICB efficacy for brain tumor patients.

title: Defining the identity and the niches of epithelial stem cells with highly pleiotropic multilineage potency in the human thymus.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell resolution', 'in vitro culture', 'spatial phenotyping', 'spatial transcriptomics', '3D imaging']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Cell Differentiation']
main_goals: This study defines specific epithelial populations in the human thymus at single-cell resolution, identifying thymic epithelial stem cells with pleiotropic multilineage potency. It characterizes their transcriptional profile, phenotypic traits, and niches, demonstrating their long-term clonal expansion and self-organizing capacity in vitro. The findings expand knowledge of stem cell biology and offer avenues for addressing thymic atrophy.

title: A lipid-associated macrophage lineage rewires the spatial landscape of adipose tissue in early obesity.
biological_context: Early obesity and adipose tissue dysfunction
main_goals: This study investigates the spatial distribution and dynamics of macrophage populations in adipose tissue during early diet-induced obesity. It integrates single-cell RNA-Seq, spatial transcriptomics, and imaging to identify a precursor population to lipid-associated macrophages (pre-LAMs) and their spatial association with adipose tissue dysfunction. The findings refine understanding of macrophage diversity in obesity and highlight lipid signaling pathways involved in their development.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of a giant pilomatricoma.
main_goals: This paper describes the case of a giant pilomatricoma and characterizes its spatial gene expression profile using 10X spatial transcriptomics. The analysis revealed distinct transcriptomic clusters within the tumor, each with unique patterns related to hair follicle factors, keratin expression, and beta-catenin pathway activity.

title: Integrated spatial transcriptomics and lipidomics of precursor lesions of pancreatic cancer identifies enrichment of long chain sulfatide biosynthesis as an early metabolic alteration.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMN) and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC)
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'spatial metabolomics', 'MALDI-MS', 'Visium', 'lipidomics', 'cystic fluid analysis', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'bulk transcriptomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study integrates spatial transcriptomics and lipidomics to identify early metabolic alterations in pancreatic cancer precursor lesions (IPMN). It highlights the enrichment of long-chain sulfatide biosynthesis as a key early event and proposes targeting this pathway as a potential therapeutic strategy.

title: Spatial Metabolomics Reveals the Multifaceted Nature of Lamprey Buccal Gland and Its Diverse Mechanisms for Blood-Feeding.
biological_context: Lamprey buccal gland and its role in blood-feeding
main_goals: To analyze the metabolic profiles of lamprey tissues to understand the role of the buccal gland in blood-feeding. The study identified prostaglandins and kynurenine pathway metabolites as key components that assist in blood feeding by modulating host vascular reactivity. A spatial metabolomics database was also constructed.

title: Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Focal and Normal Areas of Myocyte Disarray in Human Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differential expression analysis', 'Functional enrichment analysis', 'Ligand-receptor pair analysis', 'Deconvolution analysis']
main_goals: To identify focal and spatially restricted transcriptional alterations in Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy (HCM) by comparing areas of myocyte disarray with normal tissue using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to reveal novel therapeutic targets by analyzing gene expression changes, cellular composition, and signaling pathways within HCM tissue. The findings identify potential disease-modifying targets for HCM therapy.

title: Endogenous adenine mediates kidney injury in diabetic models and predicts diabetic kidney disease in patients.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of endogenous adenine in diabetic kidney disease (DKD). It proposes that adenine is a causative factor in DKD and identifies the urine adenine/creatinine ratio (UAdCR) as a predictive biomarker for DKD progression. The study uses spatial metabolomics and single-cell transcriptomics to understand adenine's mechanism of action in kidney pathology.

title: Strigolactones repress nodule development and senescence in pea.
biological_context: Rhizobium-legume nodule symbiosis in Pisum sativum (pea)
main_goals: This study investigates the impact of strigolactone biosynthesis and signaling mutants on nodule growth and development in pea plants. It utilizes mutant analysis and spatial metabolomics to understand how strigolactones affect nodule maturation, nitrogen fixation, and gene expression.

title: Metabolic heterogeneity in adrenocortical carcinoma impacts patient outcomes.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial metabolomics', 'MALDI Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry imaging', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Correlation of spatial features with outcomes']
main_goals: This paper investigates metabolic heterogeneity in adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) using spatial metabolomics. It aims to identify metabolic subpopulations and assess their correlation with patient outcomes and potential impact on chemotherapy. The study uses MALDI-FT-ICR-MS imaging to assess metabolic diversity and identify prognostic factors.

title: Molecular insights using spatial transcriptomics of the distal lung in congenital diaphragmatic hernia.
biological_context: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia (CDH) distal lung in neonates
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to identify distinct transcriptomic profiles in the distal lung parenchyma of CDH patients compared to controls. It highlights differences in gene expression related to alveolar epithelial cells, angiogenesis, response to vitamin A, coagulation, and TNF-alpha signaling. The research also identifies sex-specific differences in CDH lungs and is the first to apply spatial transcriptomics to CDH patients.

title: Regulatory roles of Osteopontin in lung epithelial inflammation and epithelial-telocyte interaction.
biological_context: Lung epithelial inflammation and injury, including acute lung injury and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
main_goals: This study aims to explore the mechanisms by which Osteopontin (OPN) regulates lung epithelial inflammation and the interaction between epithelial cells and telocytes in acute and chronic lung injury. The research investigates the role of OPN in OPN-knockdown or over-expressed bronchial epithelia and in OPN knockout animal models, assessing its effects on inflammatory responses and cell communication.

title: MacroH2A restricts inflammatory gene expression in melanoma cancer-associated fibroblasts by coordinating chromatin looping.
biological_context: Melanoma and its tumor microenvironment, specifically focusing on cancer-associated fibroblasts.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of macroH2A variants in melanoma cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs). It demonstrates that macroH2A deficiency leads to increased inflammatory gene expression in CAFs, driven by altered chromatin looping, which in turn promotes tumor growth and suppresses anti-tumor immunity.
