The findings highlight a stromal role for macroH2A in regulating the tumor microenvironment.

title: Zika virus co-opts microRNA networks to persist in placental niches detected by spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Zika virus infection and persistence in the placenta, leading to congenital infection and fetal pathogenesis.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'Argonaute high-throughput sequencing ultraviolet-crosslinking and immunoprecipitation', 'bulk RNA-sequencing', 'sequencing', 'histology images']
main_goals: The study aimed to test the hypothesis that Zika virus functionally disrupts placental microRNAs, enabling viral persistence and fetal pathogenesis. The researchers investigated how Zika virus persists in the placenta without causing overt inflammation by analyzing microRNA alterations and their targets in human and murine models. They used spatial transcriptomics to identify Zika virus-specific placental niches and found that enhancing RNA interference pathways with enoxacin rescued Zika virus-associated pathogenesis.

title: Illustrate the distribution and metabolic regulatory effects of pterostilbene in cerebral ischemia-reperfusion rat brain by mass spectrometry imaging and spatial metabolomics.
main_goals: This study investigates the distribution and metabolic regulatory effects of pterostilbene in a rat model of cerebral ischemia-reperfusion. It applies mass spectrometry imaging and spatial metabolomics to understand pterostilbene's mechanism against brain injury, focusing on microcirculation, infarct volume, neurological function, and metabolic pathways.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals distinct and conserved tumor core and edge architectures that predict survival and targeted therapy response.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study characterizes distinct tumor core and leading edge transcriptional architectures in HPV-negative oral squamous cell carcinoma using spatial and single-cell transcriptomics. It identifies conserved and tissue-specific gene expression profiles associated with these architectures, linking them to clinical outcomes and drug response.

title: Role and Therapeutic Potential for Targeting Fibroblast Growth Factor 10/FGFR1 in Relapsed Rheumatoid Arthritis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'quantitative real-time PCR', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry', 'collagen-induced arthritis model in rats', 'primary human-derived pannus cell culture']
main_goals: This study investigated the role and therapeutic potential of targeting Fibroblast Growth Factor 10 (FGF10)/FGFR1 in relapsed Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA). By combining scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics on patient samples, the researchers identified key signaling pathways dysregulated in relapsed RA, specifically highlighting the FGF pathway. They further validated these findings and demonstrated therapeutic efficacy of an FGFR1 inhibitor in a rat model, suggesting FGF10/FGFR1 as a potential therapeutic target for relapsed RA.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveal markers of histopathological changes in Duchenne muscular dystrophy mouse models.
biological_context: Duchenne muscular dystrophy in mouse models
main_goals: To identify gene expression signatures underlying skeletal muscle pathology and link gene expression to muscle histology in Duchenne muscular dystrophy mouse models using spatial transcriptomics. The study also aims to identify cell types contributing to histological alterations and predict future affected muscle fibers.

title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing and subcellular spatial transcriptomics facilitate the translation of liver microphysiological systems for regulatory application.
biological_context: Liver microphysiological systems for regulatory application
main_goals: This paper aims to facilitate the translation of liver microphysiological systems (MPS) for regulatory applications by integrating single-cell RNA-sequencing and subcellular spatial transcriptomics. The study likely demonstrates how these advanced techniques can provide deeper insights into liver function and responses in an MPS context, making them more useful for drug testing and safety assessments.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of the human heart.
main_goals: This paper focuses on spatial transcriptomics of the human heart, likely applying existing methodologies to explore gene expression patterns within the cardiac tissue. It aims to provide insights into the spatial organization and cellular composition of the human heart at the transcriptomic level.

title: Integrative multi-omics analyses unravel the immunological implication and prognostic significance of CXCL12 in breast cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study aimed to comprehensively detect the role of CXCL12 in breast cancer and explore novel CXCL12-related biomarkers to build a prognostic model. The researchers constructed and validated a prognostic signature based on CXCL12-related genes and analyzed its association with the tumor immune microenvironment, patient prognosis, and potential therapeutic agents.

title: Therapeutic implications for localized prostate cancer by multiomics analyses of the ageing microenvironment landscape.
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize the aging microenvironment (AME) in prostate cancer (PCa) and its therapeutic implications. The researchers identified AME regulatory patterns, constructed an Ageing Microenvironment Index (AMI) with prognostic and immunotherapy prediction ability, and validated its clinical relevance using spatial transcriptomics and drug response databases. The study also explored therapeutic strategies involving identified oncogenes.

title: Disease-associated astrocytes and microglia markers are upregulated in mice fed high fat diet.
main_goals: To examine gene expression associated with astrocytes and microglia in mice fed a high-fat diet (HFD) and humans with Alzheimer's disease (AD). The study identified overlapping AD-associated differentially expressed genes, including C4b, and investigated its localization and potential interaction with neurons using spatial transcriptomics. The findings aim to link the pathogenesis of obesity, diabetes, and AD and propose C4b as a potential early marker for AD.

title: CD8<sup>+</sup> tissue-resident memory T cells induce oral lichen planus erosion via cytokine network.
main_goals: This study investigated the function of CD8+ tissue-resident memory T (CD8+ Trm) cells in oral lichen planus (OLP). Using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics, it revealed that CD8+ Trm cells are increased and exhibit enhanced cytokine production in erosive OLP, providing a novel molecular mechanism for OLP erosion.

title: Spatial transcriptomics analysis of esophageal squamous precancerous lesions and their progression to esophageal cancer.
biological_context: Esophageal squamous precancerous lesions (ESPL) and their progression to esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC)
main_goals: This study performs spatial whole-transcriptome atlas analysis to identify molecular indicators for predicting the risk of progression from esophageal squamous precancerous lesions (ESPL) to esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC). It identifies TAGLN2 as a promoter of ESCC progression and CRNN as an inhibitor, suggesting them as candidate indicators.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals heterogeneity of macrophages in the tumor microenvironment of granulomatous slack skin.
biological_context: Granulomatous slack skin (GSS), a rare subtype of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma
main_goals: This study used spatial transcriptomics to investigate the characteristics of macrophages in the tumor microenvironment of granulomatous slack skin (GSS). It identified distinct macrophage subpopulations and their potential roles in the disease, suggesting MMP9 inhibitors as a therapeutic strategy.

title: Spatial and single-nucleus transcriptomic analysis of genetic and sporadic forms of Alzheimer's Disease.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Deconvolution', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study presents a transcriptomic survey of Alzheimer's disease (AD) using spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA-seq on cortical samples from early-stage AD, late-stage AD, and AD in Down Syndrome. The aim is to understand cell-type and spatially specific changes in AD pathogenesis and bridge the gap between mouse models and sporadic AD by studying AD in Down Syndrome. The research also links gene expression changes directly to amyloid pathology accumulation.

title: Acquisition of drug resistance in basal cell nevus syndrome tumors through basal to squamous cell carcinoma transition.
biological_context: Gorlin syndrome and basal cell carcinoma (BCC) drug resistance
main_goals: This paper investigates the mechanisms of drug resistance in Gorlin syndrome patients treated with SMO inhibitors, specifically focusing on a case of SMO-resistant tumor progression. The study uses multi-omics and spatial transcriptomics to identify a basal to squamous cell carcinoma transition as a resistance mechanism and nominates PCYT2, ETNK1, and the phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthetic pathway as novel genetic suppressors of this transition. The findings offer insights into tumor evolution and resistance mechanisms for both Gorlin syndrome and sporadic BCCs.

title: Enhanced microglial dynamics and paucity of tau seeding in the amyloid plaque microenvironment contributes to cognitive resilience in Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: This study investigated postmortem brains of asymptomatic Alzheimer's disease (AsymAD) cases to understand resilience mechanisms. It found distinct microglial dynamics and reduced tau seeding in the amyloid plaque microenvironment in AsymAD compared to AD, suggesting protective roles for enhanced microglia motility and limited tau aggregation.

title: Application of spatial transcriptomics analysis using the Visium system for the mouse nasal cavity after intranasal vaccination.
biological_context: Mouse nasal cavity after intranasal vaccination against SARS-CoV-2
main_goals: This study aimed to analyze the behavior of immunocompetent cells in the mouse nasal cavity over time after intranasal vaccination using spatial transcriptomics. The researchers established a method for Visium spatial transcriptomics in the mouse nasal cavity and identified early gene expression changes related to immune cell activation, particularly microfold (M) cells.

title: Molecular Signatures of Glomerular Neovascularization in a Patient with Diabetic Kidney Disease.
biological_context: Diabetic kidney disease with periglomerular neovascularization
main_goals: This paper applies spatial transcriptomics to a patient with diabetic kidney disease to identify molecular signatures of periglomerular neovascularization. It demonstrates how advanced molecular techniques can supplement histopathological diagnosis and provide deeper insights into disease pathogenesis.

title: Netrin-1 blockade inhibits tumour growth and EMT features in endometrial cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['mouse tumour gene profiling', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA-seq', 'patient biopsies', 'RECIST v.1.1']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'single-cell gene expression analysis', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'gene expression profiling']
main_goals: This paper investigates the efficacy of netrin-1 blockade using an anti-netrin-1 antibody (NP137) in endometrial cancer. It demonstrates that NP137 reduces tumor progression in a mouse model and shows promising results in a Phase I trial in patients with advanced endometrial cancer, with a notable inhibition of epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT). The study also suggests that NP137 combined with carboplatin-paclitaxel outperforms standard chemotherapy alone.

title: Decoding key cell sub-populations and molecular alterations in glioblastoma at recurrence by single-cell analysis.
main_goals: This study aimed to understand the molecular mechanisms driving glioblastoma (GBM) recurrence by integrating single-cell RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data from primary and recurrent GBM specimens. It identified key cell subpopulations and molecular alterations, highlighting genes involved in extracellular matrix organization and potential regulatory transcription factors like MAFK and NFATC4. The research also observed changes in non-tumor cells and their association with a specific GBM subpopulation.

title: Spatially resolved cell atlas of the teleost telencephalon and deep homology of the vertebrate forebrain.
biological_context: Teleost telencephalon and vertebrate forebrain evolution
main_goals: To generate a spatially-resolved transcriptional atlas of the cichlid fish telencephalon by combining spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA-sequencing. The study compares cell-types and anatomical regions in the cichlid telencephalon with those in amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals to uncover conserved cell-types and regions in the vertebrate forebrain.

title: Macrophage and neutrophil heterogeneity at single-cell spatial resolution in human inflammatory bowel disease.
biological_context: Inflammatory bowel diseases (Ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease)
main_goals: This study aims to explore the cellular heterogeneity in human inflammatory bowel diseases, focusing on macrophages and neutrophils. By applying single-cell RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomics (CosMx Spatial Molecular Imaging), the researchers spatially localize immune cell subsets and uncover macrophage diversity based on tissue localization. The findings highlight the importance of myeloid and stromal compartments in patient-to-patient heterogeneity and reveal a communication network between macrophages and inflammatory fibroblasts.

title: Integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomic profiling reveals higher intratumour heterogeneity and epithelial-fibroblast interactions in recurrent bladder cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['scRNA data-based ST deconvolution analysis', 'spatial communication analysis']
main_goals: This study integrated single-cell and spatial transcriptomic profiling to investigate the tumor microenvironment of recurrent bladder cancer. It revealed higher intratumor heterogeneity and significant epithelial-fibroblast interactions, particularly between cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and malignant cells, in recurrent tumors compared to primary tumors. These findings highlight potential mechanisms underlying bladder cancer recurrence.

title: Multidirectional characterization of cellular composition and spatial architecture in human multiple primary lung cancers.
main_goals: To characterize the cellular and spatial architecture of human multiple primary lung cancers (MPLCs) by combining single-cell RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified a novel epithelial cell subtype (CLDN2+ AT2) and a potential immunotherapeutic target (TNFRSF18/GITR) while highlighting inter-lesion heterogeneity.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of human placentas reveal distinct RNA patterns associated with morphology and preeclampsia.
main_goals: This study demonstrates the application of spatial transcriptomics to human placental tissue. It reveals distinct RNA patterns correlating with placental morphology and identifies differences in RNA levels in terminal villi and hemoglobin-associated structures between healthy pregnancies and those with preeclampsia.

title: Mapping diversity in African trypanosomes using high resolution spatial proteomics.
main_goals: This paper maps the spatial proteomes of two African trypanosome species across two life stages. It provides comprehensive spatial proteomes for over 2500 proteins per cell type, offering insights into parasitic adaptation and diversity.

title: Spatial proteomics landscape and immune signature analysis of renal sample of lupus nephritis based on laser-captured microsection.
main_goals: To reveal a spatial proteomic and immune signature of kidney function regions in lupus nephritis using laser capture microdissection and data-independent acquisition proteomics. The study identified immune cell infiltration patterns and potential biomarkers in different kidney regions of lupus nephritis patients.

title: A spatially resolved timeline of the human maternal-fetal interface.
biological_context: Human maternal-fetal interface during the first half of pregnancy
data_modalities_used: ['spatial proteomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed ion beam imaging by time-of-flight', 'antibody panel', 'transcriptomics profiles']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Proteomics Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To construct a spatiotemporal atlas of the human maternal-fetal interface in the first half of pregnancy using a multiomics approach combining spatial proteomics and transcriptomics. The study investigated the evolution of maternal immune and stromal cells and their correlation with spiral artery remodeling (SAR) progression. An integrated model of SAR was developed based on these findings.

title: An atlas of healthy and injured cell states and niches in the human kidney.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell assays', 'single-nucleus assays', 'spatial imaging technologies', 'spatial transcriptomics', '3D imaging']
main_goals: To create a high-resolution cellular atlas of healthy and diseased human kidneys by integrating multiple single-cell, single-nucleus, and spatial imaging assays. The study defines cell types, cellular states altered in injury, and their spatial localization within injury neighborhoods, linking these to immune responses and repair pathways.

title: Cancer-associated fibroblast classification in single-cell and spatial proteomics data.
main_goals: To define and functionally annotate CAF phenotypes using single-cell RNA sequencing data and validate these phenotypes at the protein level using multiplexed imaging mass cytometry. The study aims to establish a general CAF classification scheme for comparing CAF phenotypes across studies and guiding treatment strategies.

title: Spatially resolved immune exhaustion within the alloreactive microenvironment predicts liver transplant rejection.
main_goals: This study developed a highly multiplexed imaging mass cytometry panel and analysis pipeline to study archival liver transplant biopsy specimens. It generated a spatially resolved proteomic atlas, identified cell populations and interactions associated with rejection, and created a predictive model for clinical outcomes. The data provides mechanistic insights into immune exhaustion in T-cell mediated rejection and identifies potential immunotherapy targets.

title: Siglec-9 acts as an immune-checkpoint molecule on macrophages in glioblastoma, restricting T-cell priming and immunotherapy response.
biological_context: Glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) and its response to immunotherapy
main_goals: This paper identifies Siglec-9 on macrophages as an immune-checkpoint molecule in glioblastoma. It demonstrates that targeting Siglec-9 in combination with anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy can enhance antitumor efficacy by promoting T-cell activation. The study uses scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics to identify Siglec-9 expressing macrophages in non-responders to immunotherapy.

title: Endocrine Therapy Synergizes with SMAC Mimetics to Potentiate Antigen Presentation and Tumor Regression in Hormone Receptor-Positive Breast Cancer.
main_goals: This paper investigates the synergistic effects of endocrine therapy (ET) and SMAC mimetics in hormone receptor-positive (HR+) breast cancer. It reveals that ET enhances tumor immunogenicity by upregulating beta2-microglobulin and facilitating NF-kappaB signaling, which primes the tumor microenvironment for improved antigen presentation. The combination of ET and SMAC mimetics leads to augmented T-cell migration, enhanced T-cell-mediated cytotoxicity, and significant tumor regression.

title: Integrating spatial and single-nucleus transcriptomic data elucidates microglial-specific responses in female cynomolgus macaques with depressive-like behaviors.
biological_context: Depressive-like behaviors in female cynomolgus macaques
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This study integrates spatial and single-nucleus transcriptomic data to investigate microglial-specific responses in female cynomolgus macaques exhibiting depressive-like behaviors. It identifies a pro-inflammatory microglia subpopulation enriched in these conditions and maps gene modules associated with specific behaviors to distinct cell types and cortical layers.

title: An integrated single-cell analysis of human adrenal cortex development.
biological_context: Human adrenal cortex development during the first 20 weeks of gestation
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'IHC', 'micro-focus computed tomography']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper investigates key aspects of human adrenal gland development during the first 20 weeks of gestation using an integrated approach. It demonstrates rapid adrenal growth and vascularization, characterizes steroidogenic pathway development, and identifies core transcriptional regulators and potential ligand-receptor interactions. The findings have clinical implications for understanding adrenal insufficiency and related disorders.

title: Spatially resolved multiomics of human cardiac niches.
biological_context: Human heart cardiac niches, conduction system, and epicardium
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This paper aims to discover cellular niches within the human heart using spatially resolved multiomics. It profiles the cardiac conduction system, identifies compartmentalization within the sinoatrial node, and introduces a druggable target prediction tool, drug2cell, for chronotropic effects. The study also reveals immune cell enrichment in the epicardium.

title: Multi-transcriptomics reveals brain cellular responses to peripheral infection in Alzheimer's disease model mice.
biological_context: Alzheimer's disease in mice with peripheral infection
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates how low-grade peripheral infection affects brain transcriptomics and Alzheimer's disease (AD)-like pathology in APP/PS1 mice. It aims to reveal cell-type- and spatial-specific transcriptional changes related to brain barrier function and neuroinflammation. The findings provide insights into the mechanisms linking peripheral inflammation to AD pathology.

title: Stem cell-like T cell depletion in the recurrent head and neck cancer immune microenvironment.
biological_context: Recurrent head and neck cancer following chemoradiotherapy
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the composition and spatial relationships between tumor and immune cells in recurrent head and neck cancer after chemoradiotherapy. The authors aimed to understand the immune microenvironment in recurrent HPV-related head and neck cancers and its implications for anti-tumor immune responses.

title: Spatially resolved transcriptomic profiles reveal unique defining molecular features of infiltrative 5ALA-metabolizing cells associated with glioblastoma recurrence.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images', 'radiography', 'two-photon excitation fluorescence microscopy', 'bulk RNA profiling', 'FACS-isolated cells', 'single-cell transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study aims to elucidate the molecular and cellular features of 5ALA-metabolizing cells in glioblastoma. It investigates how these cells contribute to tumor recurrence by analyzing spatially resolved transcriptomic profiles and their association with patient survival. The goal is to identify therapeutic targets for delaying GBM recurrence.

title: Spatial cellular architecture predicts prognosis in glioblastoma.
main_goals: This study investigates the association between spatial cellular organization and glioblastoma prognosis. It develops a deep learning model to predict transcriptional subtypes from histology images and analyzes millions of tissue spots to identify survival-associated tumor architectures. The findings establish a link between spatial cellular architecture and clinical outcomes in glioblastoma.

title: Spatial Metabolomics and Lipidomics Reveal the Mechanisms of the Enhanced Growth of Breast Cancer Cell Spheroids Exposed to Triclosan.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Metabolite distribution analysis', 'Lipid distribution analysis']
main_goals: This study investigated the mechanisms behind the enhanced growth of breast cancer cell spheroids exposed to triclosan (TCS) using spatial metabolomics and lipidomics. The research aimed to understand how TCS affects cellular metabolism and lipid profiles and how these changes correlate with spheroid growth.

title: Nerve growth factor receptor (Ngfr) induces neurogenic plasticity by suppressing reactive astroglial Lcn2/Slc22a17 signaling in Alzheimer's disease.
data_modalities_used: ['APP/PS1dE9 mouse model', 'histological analyses', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial proteomics', '3D human astroglial cultures']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of Nerve growth factor receptor (Ngfr) in inducing neurogenic plasticity in the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD). It explores how Ngfr expression can suppress reactive astroglial Lcn2/Slc22a17 signaling, leading to improved neurogenesis and alleviation of AD pathology. The findings suggest that enhancing pro-neurogenic astroglial fate may have therapeutic potential in AD.

title: SARS-CoV-2 niches in human placenta revealed by spatial transcriptomics.
data_modalities_used: ['Visium Spatial Transcriptomics', 'H&E staining', 'single-cell transcriptomics', 'single-nuclei transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: To map placental transcription at high resolution to identify functional niches and understand the spatial impact of SARS-CoV-2 infection on these niches. The study aimed to reveal dynamic responses to SARS-CoV-2 in coordinate microenvironments in the absence and presence of clinically evident disease.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics identify a macrophage population associated with skeletal muscle fibrosis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell transcriptomics', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro assays', 'adoptive transfer assays']
main_goals: This study used single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify a macrophage population associated with skeletal muscle fibrosis. It found that macrophages in dystrophic muscle are characterized by fibrotic factors like galectin-3 and osteopontin (Spp1). The research demonstrated that Spp1 from macrophages regulates stromal progenitor differentiation and that gal-3+ macrophages are chronically activated in dystrophic muscle and elevated in human myopathies.

title: Genome-wide mapping of cancer dependency genes and genetic modifiers of chemotherapy in high-risk hepatoblastoma.
main_goals: This study reports an improved MYC-driven hepatoblastoma-like murine model and maps cancer dependency genes and genetic modifiers of chemotherapy in high-risk hepatoblastoma. It identifies druggable targets shared with human hepatoblastoma and demonstrates how PRKDC inhibition combined with doxorubicin-based chemotherapy enhances therapeutic efficacy. The findings provide disease models and identify potential therapeutic targets for high-risk hepatoblastoma.

title: Lactobacillus casei-Derived Postbiotics Elevate the Bioaccessibility of Proteins via Allosteric Regulation of Pepsin and Trypsin and Introduction of Endopeptidases.
main_goals: To profile the functional mechanism of Lactobacillus casei-derived postbiotic supplementation in goat milk digestion using a spatial-omics strategy integrated with variational autoencoders. The study aimed to elucidate how postbiotics affect protein bioaccessibility through allosteric regulation of digestive enzymes and the introduction of endopeptidases, leading to increased generation of bioactive peptides.

title: A cellular and molecular spatial atlas of dystrophic muscle.
biological_context: Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) in mouse skeletal muscle
main_goals: To generate a high-resolution cellular and molecular spatial atlas of dystrophic muscle in the D2-mdx mouse model. The study aimed to reveal the non-uniform distribution of cell populations and spatiotemporal gene expression signatures contributing to asynchronous regeneration and widespread pathology in DMD. The goal was to identify targetable pathways for DMD therapy.

title: Spatially resolved expression landscape and gene-regulatory network of human gastric corpus epithelium.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper aims to uncover the spatially resolved expression landscape and gene-regulatory network of human gastric corpus epithelium. It identifies key cell populations, signaling pathways, and regulatory elements, providing insights into cellular diversity and homeostasis.

title: GENE EXPRESSION WITHIN A HUMAN CHOROIDAL NEOVASCULAR MEMBRANE USING SPATIAL TRANSCRIPTOMICS.
biological_context: Macular neovascularization in age-related macular degeneration
main_goals: This study performed spatial RNA sequencing on human donor eyes with and without macular neovascularization to identify genes enriched in the neovascular area. The authors used deconvolution algorithms to predict the cell types responsible for dysregulated gene expression and identified potential upstream regulators driving these changes. The study also investigated spatial gene expression patterns in other retinal and choroidal tissues.

title: Spatial proteomics reveals human microglial states shaped by anatomy and neuropathology.
biological_context: Human brain aging and Alzheimer's disease
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to spatially map proteomic cellular states and niches in the human brain using MIBI. It identified a spectrum of microglial profiles (microglial state continuum) that varied across brain regions and within local microenvironments. The study also showed shifts in microglial states towards a dysfunctional low MSC in the AD hippocampus.

title: Genetic and immune determinants of E. coli liver abscess formation.
biological_context: E. coli liver abscess formation in mice
main_goals: This paper characterizes E. coli liver abscesses in mice and identifies host determinants of abscess susceptibility. It uses spatial transcriptomics and single-cell RNA sequencing to reveal immune cell clusters surrounding necrotic regions. The study suggests that hyperactivation of the hepatic innate immune response, mediated by TLR4, drives liver abscess susceptibility.

title: Role of endogenous adenine in kidney failure and mortality with diabetes.
biological_context: Diabetic kidney disease (DKD), Kidney failure, End-stage kidney disease (ESKD), Mortality
main_goals: To determine if urine adenine/creatinine ratio (UAdCR) could be a mechanistic biomarker for ESKD in patients with diabetes. The study also investigated the localization of adenine in kidney pathology, its role in stimulating matrix and mTOR, and the effect of empagliflozin on UAdCR. The findings suggest that endogenous adenine may be a causative factor in DKD.

title: Targeting Fibroblast-Endothelial Interactions in LAM Pathogenesis: 3D Spheroid and Spatial Transcriptomic Insights for Therapeutic Innovation.
main_goals: To explore mechanisms of LAM pathogenesis by investigating fibroblast-endothelial interactions using spatial transcriptomics and a 3D spheroid model. The study identified elevated PDGFR and FGFR in LAMFs, and demonstrated that multikinase inhibition with sorafenib reduces invasion, suggesting it as a promising therapeutic strategy.

title: Combined near infrared photoacoustic imaging and ultrasound detects vulnerable atherosclerotic plaque.
main_goals: To demonstrate the potential of combining near-infrared photoacoustic imaging and ultrasound imaging to detect and differentiate stable and vulnerable atherosclerotic plaque. The study also aimed to determine the origin of the photoacoustic signal by correlating it with specific plaque components and cellular markers.

title: Integration analysis of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal the cellular heterogeneity landscape in glioblastoma and establish a polygenic risk model.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study integrates single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to analyze the cellular heterogeneity and tumor microenvironment in glioblastoma. It establishes a polygenic risk model (TPRGRS) based on malignant cell transition trajectories and clinical characteristics to predict GBM patient prognosis. The research provides insights into GBM heterogeneity and suggests personalized drug regimens.

title: Dissecting the spermatogonial stem cell niche using spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: The study aims to dissect the molecular, cellular, and spatial composition of SSC niches using spatial transcriptomics. It spatially maps ligand-receptor interactions in mouse and human testes, identifies key molecules regulating SSC functions, and investigates the role of spatial re-distribution of inflammation-related interactions in testicular injury.

title: Differentiation of IL-26<sup>+</sup> T<sub>H</sub>17 intermediates into IL-17A producers via epithelial crosstalk in psoriasis.
main_goals: This study identifies a population of blood T_H17 intermediates that produce high levels of IL-26 and differentiate into IL-17A-producing T_H17 cells upon TGF-β1 exposure in psoriatic skin. The research demonstrates that these IL-26+ T_H17 intermediates induce TGF-β1 in basal keratinocytes, promoting their own differentiation into IL-17A-producing cells through epithelial crosstalk. The study highlights IL-26-producing cells as an early differentiation stage of T_H17 cells that influences its maturation in psoriatic skin.

title: Cortical somatostatin interneuron subtypes form cell-type-specific circuits.
biological_context: Cortical somatostatin interneuron subtypes in the brain
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This paper investigates the circuit specificity of different somatostatin interneuron subtypes in the cortex. The authors demonstrate that these subtypes have distinct laminar organizations, projection patterns, and selective connectivity with specific neuronal populations, providing evidence for cell-type-specific cortical circuits.

title: AT2 cell-derived IgA trapped by the extracellular matrix in silica-induced pulmonary fibrosis.
main_goals: The study investigates the role of AT2 cell-derived IgA in silica-induced pulmonary fibrosis. It identifies AT2-like epithelial cells secreting IgA, which is then trapped by the extracellular matrix and activates fibroblasts, exacerbating fibrosis. The findings suggest blocking IgA secretion from pulmonary epithelial cells as a potential therapeutic strategy.

title: Cell-type specific defects in PTEN-mutant cortical organoids converge on abnormal circuit activity.
biological_context: Human brain development, autism spectrum disorders, PTEN mutation
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-type specific analysis', 'Developmental timing analysis', 'Circuit activity analysis']
main_goals: To identify cell-type specific developmental events affected by heterozygous PTEN mutations in human cortical organoids and to understand how these variations affect local circuit activity. The study investigates donor-dependent phenotypes and their convergence on disrupted neuronal activity.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal 5-methylcytosine RNA methylation regulators immunologically reprograms tumor microenvironment characterizations, immunotherapy response and precision treatment of clear cell renal cell carcinoma.
main_goals: This study explored the role of 5-methylcytosine (m5C) RNA modification in ccRCC by establishing a novel m5C RNA modification-related gene index (M5CRMRGI). It investigated the index's effect on the tumor microenvironment (TME) using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, aiming to predict prognosis and immunotherapy response.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Identifies Expression Signatures Specific to Lacrimal Gland Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma Cells.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify a specific LGACC gene signature using spatial transcriptomics and bulk RNA sequencing. The goal was to understand the molecular and cellular landscape of LGACC and inform novel targeted therapies. The research identified specific gene expression patterns originating from LGACC cells and other tissue components, along with relevant signaling pathways.

title: Spatial enrichment of the type 1 interferon signature in the brain of a neuropsychiatric lupus murine model.
biological_context: Neuropsychiatric lupus erythematosus (NPSLE) in a murine model.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Single-nucleus sequencing analysis']
main_goals: This study aims to understand how type 1 interferon signaling in the central nervous system contributes to neuropsychiatric symptoms in a lupus model. The researchers investigate the spatial enrichment of type 1 interferon signatures in the brain and their impact on cellular communication and neuronal development.

title: TGF-β1 mediates tumor immunosuppression aggravating at the late stage post-high-light-dose photodynamic therapy.
main_goals: This study systematically illustrated the dynamic changes of immune states post-PDT within the tumor microenvironment, demonstrating that high-light-dose PDT induces early immune activation followed by late immunosuppression mediated by activated TGF-β1 upregulation. The mechanism of PDT-induced TGF-β1 accumulation and immunosuppression was elucidated through a ROS/TGF-β1/MMP-9 positive feedback loop and CD44-mediated local amplification, further confirmed by spatial transcriptomics. A TGF-β blockade strategy was presented as a promising combinational strategy to reverse PDT-associated immunosuppression.

title: Spatially resolved transcriptomic analysis of the germinating barley grain.
main_goals: The study developed a spatial transcriptomics workflow for germinating barley grain to reveal specific spatial expression patterns of functional gene categories at a sub-tissue level. It identified genes with specific spatial expression patterns over time and highlighted auxin transport genes' role in establishing the embryo axis. The research provides a spatially resolved cellular map for barley germination and identifies functional genomics targets for cellular restricted processes during germination.

title: Spatial determination and prognostic impact of the fibroblast transcriptome in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
main_goals: This paper defines the transcriptome of tumor-proximal and tumor-distal cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) using spatial transcriptomics and scRNA-Seq. It links CAF transcriptomes to clinical outcomes, identifying distinct CAF populations and their prognostic significance. The findings suggest that targeting tumor-proximal CAFs, HIF-1α, and immune stimulation could be a multi-modal therapeutic approach for PDAC.

title: CCL24 regulates biliary inflammation and fibrosis in primary sclerosing cholangitis.
main_goals: This study investigated the role of CCL24 in primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC) and evaluated the therapeutic potential of blocking CCL24. The researchers used Mdr2-/- mice as a PSC model and demonstrated that CCL24 neutralization improved inflammation, fibrosis, and cholestasis markers. They also confirmed elevated CCL24 expression in human PSC patients and showed its pro-proliferative effects on cholangiocytes and hepatic stellate cells.

title: Interactions between MFAP5 + fibroblasts and tumor-infiltrating myeloid cells shape the malignant microenvironment of colorectal cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'Immunohistochemistry', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: This study explored the biological properties of MFAP5+ fibroblasts and their interactions with tumor-infiltrating myeloid cells in colorectal cancer. It aimed to elucidate the pro-tumorigenic mechanisms of these fibroblasts and identify potential therapeutic targets. The research integrated single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and bulk RNA sequencing data.

title: Mesenchymal-like Tumor Cells and Myofibroblastic Cancer-Associated Fibroblasts Are Associated with Progression and Immunotherapy Response of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplex immune staining', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study aims to understand the plasticity of cancer cells and their cross-talk with the microenvironment in ccRCC to predict therapeutic response. It identifies mesenchymal-like ccRCC cells and myofibroblastic cancer-associated fibroblasts (myCAFs) as correlated with metastases, poor survival, and resistance to immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) therapy. The research highlights their spatial proximity and interaction as critical factors in ccRCC progression and ICI response.

title: Concerted epithelial and stromal changes during progression of Barrett's Esophagus to invasive adenocarcinoma exposed by multi-scale, multi-omics analysis.
main_goals: This study analyzed the progression of Barrett's Esophagus to invasive adenocarcinoma using multi-omics analysis. It revealed coordinated changes in epithelial and stromal components, including the early appearance of carcinoma-associated fibroblasts and an immunosuppressive microenvironment.

title: A spatial map of hepatic mitochondria uncovers functional heterogeneity shaped by nutrient-sensing signaling.
main_goals: To investigate mitochondrial heterogeneity in the liver across the periportal and pericentral axis using intravital microscopy, spatial proteomics, and functional assessments. The study aims to understand how nutrient gradients shape mitochondrial function and how nutrient-sensing pathways like AMPK and mTOR influence these spatially distinct mitochondrial phenotypes.

title: Myeloid cell influx into the colonic epithelium is associated with disease severity and non-response to anti-Tumor Necrosis Factor Therapy in patients with Ulcerative Colitis.
main_goals: This study details major epithelial and immune cell perturbations in active Ulcerative Colitis (UC) using high-dimensional epithelial cell profiling. It identifies specific cell populations and transcriptomic signatures associated with disease severity and non-response to anti-TNF therapy, aiming to facilitate therapeutic decision-making in UC patients.

title: Targeted Energy Metabolomics Combined with Spatial Metabolomics Study on the Efficacy of Guhong Injection Against Cerebral Ischemia Reperfusion.
main_goals: This study explored tissue-specific metabolic alterations in the brain of rats with cerebral ischemia-reperfusion (I/R) injury and evaluated the therapeutic effect of Guhong injection (GHI). It used a combination of LC-QQQ-MS and MALDI-MSI to identify metabolic reprogramming and the impact of GHI.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals a cnidarian segment polarity program in Nematostella vectensis.
biological_context: Cnidarian segment polarity in Nematostella vectensis larvae
main_goals: To demonstrate the molecular basis for segment polarization in developing larvae of Nematostella vectensis using spatial transcriptomics. The study identified conserved homeodomain genes Lbx and Uncx that define opposing subsegmental domains and showed that Lbx mutagenesis disrupts segment polarity.

title: Increased PDGFRB and NF-κB signaling caused by highly prevalent somatic mutations in intracranial aneurysms.
main_goals: This study identifies a high prevalence of somatic mutations in genes related to PDGFRB and NF-κB signaling in intracranial aneurysms (IAs). It demonstrates that these mutations can constitutively activate signaling pathways, enhance cell motility, and induce inflammation, leading to arterial dilatation in an animal model. The findings suggest a new avenue for pharmacological interventions.

title: Spatial transcriptomics combined with single-cell RNA-sequencing unravels the complex inflammatory cell network in atopic dermatitis.
main_goals: This study aimed to unravel the complex inflammatory cell network in atopic dermatitis (AD) skin by combining spatial transcriptomics with single-cell RNA-sequencing. It characterized cellular infiltrates, identified specific cell types and their spatial distribution, and elucidated the ligand-receptor interactions within lesional AD skin. The findings provide in-depth knowledge of AD skin lesions to guide treatment development.

title: Clonal expansion of intra-epithelial T cells in breast cancer revealed by spatial transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper presents ST-FFPE, a spatial transcriptomics method for FFPE samples to study the tumor microenvironment. Using this method on triple-negative breast cancer, it reveals clonal expansion of intra-epithelial T cells. The findings suggest an accumulation of antigen-specific T cells within the tumor core.

title: Investigating the Role of Ferroptosis-Related Genes in Ovarian Aging and the Potential for Nutritional Intervention.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'human ovarian pathology', 'clinical biopsy', 'multi-histological predictions']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of ferroptosis-related genes in ovarian aging using spatial transcriptomics, scRNA-seq, and clinical data. It explores the interaction between ferroptosis and energy metabolism in aging germ cells and evaluates the effect of nutrient supplementation (DHEA, Ubiquinol CoQ10, Cleo-20 T3) on key ferroptosis genes and IVF outcomes in older women. The findings suggest that these interventions can improve metal ion and energy metabolism, thereby enhancing oocyte quality.

title: Terroir Influence on Polyphenol Metabolism from Grape Canes: A Spatial Metabolomic Study at Parcel Scale.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Visualization', 'correlation network']
main_goals: This study investigated how soil-related terroir factors influence the polyphenol composition in grape canes using spatial metabolomics and correlation-based networks. It demonstrated that continuous changes in soil features and topography impact polyphenol composition and proposed spatial metabolomics driven by correlation-based networks as a new field-phenotyping tool.

title: Alterations in the preneoplastic breast microenvironment of BRCA1/2 mutation carriers revealed by spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Preneoplastic breast tissue in BRCA1/2 mutation carriers
main_goals: This study investigates defects in mammary epithelial cell differentiation and microenvironmental alterations in preneoplastic breast tissues from BRCA1/2 mutation carriers using spatial transcriptomics. It aims to uncover spatially defined receptor-ligand interactions and identify differences in signaling pathways between BRCA1 and BRCA2 deficient cells. The findings are intended to lay the foundation for designing innovative breast cancer chemoprevention strategies.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals molecular dysfunction associated with Lewy pathology.
biological_context: Parkinson's disease and Lewy pathology in the human cortex and a mouse model
main_goals: To identify specific classes of excitatory neurons vulnerable to Lewy pathology in the cortex and to define a conserved gene expression signature (LAMDA) of molecular dysfunction in aggregate-bearing neurons. The study aims to characterize molecular changes induced by Lewy aggregates in both human PD and a mouse model.

title: Cerebellar axonopathy in Shivers horses identified by spatial transcriptomic and proteomic analyses.
biological_context: Shivers in horses, a movement disorder characterized by abnormal hindlimb movement when walking backward, proposed to be caused by Purkinje cell (PC) axonopathy.
main_goals: To define region-specific differences in gene expression within the lateral cerebellar hemisphere and compare cerebellar protein expression between Shivers horses and controls using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics. The study aimed to investigate whether axonal degeneration is a characteristic feature of Shivers.

title: Spatial Transcriptional Mapping Reveals Site-Specific Pathways Underlying Human Atherosclerotic Plaque Rupture.
data_modalities_used: ['histology', 'electron microscopy', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'genome-wide association studies']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the exact location and underlying mechanisms of atherosclerotic plaque ruptures, identifying therapeutic targets against cardiovascular events. It mapped site-specific transcriptional signatures associated with proximal rupture-prone regions of carotid atherosclerotic plaques. The findings led to the geographical mapping of novel therapeutic targets, such as matrix metallopeptidase 9, against plaque rupture.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics of Intraductal Papillary Mucinous Neoplasms of the Pancreas Identifies NKX6-2 as a Driver of Gastric Differentiation and Indolent Biological Potential.
biological_context: Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMN) of the pancreas, precursor lesions to pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC)
main_goals: This study used spatial transcriptomics to identify NKX6-2 as a key transcription factor driving gastric differentiation in low-grade IPMNs. Loss of NKX6-2 expression is associated with IPMN progression. Reexpression of Nkx6-2 in murine models recapitulates gastric differentiation and morphology.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal changes in cell heterogeneity during progression of human tendinopathy.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This study utilizes single-cell and spatial RNA sequencing to understand cellular heterogeneity and molecular mechanisms underlying tendinopathy progression in human tendons. It identifies tenocyte subpopulations, differentiation trajectories of stem/progenitor cells, and spatial relationships between stromal cells and diseased tenocytes. The research elucidates tendinopathy pathogenesis as inflammatory infiltration followed by chondrogenesis and endochondral ossification, identifying potential therapeutic targets.

title: Drivers of heterogeneity in synovial fibroblasts in rheumatoid arthritis.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-cell ATAC sequencing', 'multiplexed imaging', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vitro modeling']
main_goals: This paper explores the drivers of heterogeneity in fibroblast-like synoviocytes (FLS) in rheumatoid arthritis. The study utilizes paired single-cell RNA and ATAC sequencing, multiplexed imaging, and spatial transcriptomics to identify distinct FLS states driven by local cytokine signaling from immune cells.

title: Comparative spatial transcriptomic profiling of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 Delta and Omicron variants infections in the lungs of cynomolgus macaques.
biological_context: SARS-CoV-2 Delta and Omicron variant infections in cynomolgus macaque lungs
main_goals: This study aimed to reveal the spatial transcriptomic profiles of pulmonary microstructures in cynomolgus macaques infected with SARS-CoV-2 Delta and Omicron variants. It sought to understand the host immune response alterations and identify potential transcriptional biomarkers within pulmonary microstructures during infection with these variants. The study aimed to elucidate the molecular basis for pulmonary immune response changes, noting consistent host immune response mechanisms between variants with limited transcriptional alterations in large airways.

title: Intrinsic TGF-β signaling attenuates proximal tubule mitochondrial injury and inflammation in chronic kidney disease.
biological_context: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) and proximal tubule mitochondrial injury and inflammation
main_goals: To depict the role of TGF-β signaling on proximal tubule mitochondrial homeostasis and tubulo-interstitial interactions in CKD. The study investigates how TGF-β signaling affects PT mitochondria and inflammation in CKD using various omics and biochemical analyses. Findings suggest potential therapeutic targets to mitigate CKD progression.

title: Spatial transcriptomics stratifies psoriatic disease severity by emergent cellular ecosystems.
main_goals: To stratify psoriatic disease severity using spatial transcriptomics and identify differences in cellular ecosystems between healthy and inflamed skin. The study revealed distinct molecular features in mild vs. severe PsO, suggesting significant alterations in distal unaffected skin sites in severe cases.

title: Spatially Resolved Multi-Omics Single-Cell Analyses Inform Mechanisms of Immune Dysfunction in Pancreatic Cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplex immunohistochemistry', 'mass cytometry', 'snRNA-seq', 'spatial proteomics']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Spatial Visualization']
main_goals: To provide a detailed, spatially resolved view of the immune micromilieu in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) by integrating multiple single-cell omics modalities. The study aims to understand the mechanisms of immune dysfunction in PDAC and identify potential therapeutic targets by characterizing immune cell states and their spatial organization, comparing them to lung adenocarcinoma.

title: Spatial transcriptomics of murine bone marrow megakaryocytes at single-cell resolution.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'immunofluorescence', 'murine whole transcriptome array', 'Nanostring GeoMx digital spatial profiling']
main_goals: To combine spatial context and transcriptomics to assess the heterogeneity of murine bone marrow megakaryocytes in situ at a single-cell level. The study investigated the effect of spatial location on megakaryocyte heterogeneity, particularly in relation to the vasculature and proximal/distal regions of the bone marrow.

title: Deconvolution of spatial sequencing provides accurate characterization of hESC-derived DA transplants in vivo.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to analyze fully differentiated human embryonic stem cell-derived dopaminergic transplants in vivo. It aims to characterize the transcriptomic landscape of these grafts and identify the spatial distribution of dopaminergic cell populations.

title: Single-cell proteo-genomic reveals a comprehensive map of centrosome-associated spliceosome components.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To elucidate RNP interaction networks at the centrosome using spatial proteomics and transcriptomics. Identified cell-type specific centrosome-associated spliceosome interactions and validated interactions between BUD31 and OFD1. Characterized cholangiocarcinoma as a target of centrosome-associated spliceosome alterations, providing a reference for cytoplasmic condensates functions.

title: Spatial Gene Expression Analysis Reveals Characteristic Gene Expression Patterns of De Novo Neuroendocrine Prostate Cancer Coexisting with Androgen Receptor Pathway Prostate Cancer.
biological_context: Neuroendocrine Prostate Cancer (NEPC) and Androgen Receptor Pathway Prostate Cancer (ARPC)
data_modalities_used: ['Visium CytAssist Spatial Gene Expression', 'formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) samples', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'gene expression analysis', 'histology images']
main_goals: This paper reports spatial gene expression analysis in a patient with coexisting de novo metastatic NEPC and ARPC. It highlights characteristic gene expression patterns in NEPC and ARPC sites, identifying specific upregulated and downregulated genes within the tumor microenvironment. The findings aim to contribute to the development of novel treatments for NEPC.

title: Mapping metabolite change in the mouse brain after esketamine injection by ambient mass spectrometry imaging and metabolomics.
main_goals: This paper maps metabolite changes in the mouse brain after esketamine injection using ambient mass spectrometry imaging. It identifies key metabolic pathways affected, particularly glycerophospholipid and sphingolipid metabolism, and explores potential mechanisms of esketamine's antidepressant effect.

title: Single-nucleus ribonucleic acid-sequencing and spatial transcriptomics reveal the cardioprotection of Shexiang Baoxin Pill (SBP) in mice with myocardial ischemia-reperfusion injury.
main_goals: To explore the cardioprotective mechanism of Shexiang Baoxin Pill (SBP) in myocardial ischemia-reperfusion (I/R) injury using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to identify cellular changes and gene expression patterns induced by SBP treatment.

title: Three-Dimensional Morphological Analysis Revealed the Cell Patterning Bases for the Sexual Dimorphism Development in the Liverwort Marchantia polymorpha.
main_goals: This study performs three-dimensional morphological analyses of gametophytic sexual branch differentiation in Marchantia polymorpha. It reveals that germline precursor specification initiates early and their spatial distribution predicts sex-specific gametangia arrangement. The findings suggest a tightly coupled progression of germline segregation and sexual dimorphism development.

title: Non-muscle-invasive bladder cancer molecular subtypes predict differential response to intravesical Bacillus Calmette-Guérin.
main_goals: This study identified three distinct molecular subtypes (BRS1, BRS2, BRS3) of non-muscle-invasive bladder cancer that predict differential response to intravesical Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG) therapy. The BRS3 subtype, characterized by high epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition and basal markers, showed an immunosuppressive profile and was enriched in tumors recurring after BCG. The study validated these subtypes in a second cohort and confirmed a commercially approved assay's ability to predict BRS3 tumors, aiming to improve patient selection for BCG treatment.

title: Integrating Spatial Transcriptomics and Single-nucleus RNA Sequencing Reveals the Potential Therapeutic Strategies for Uterine Leiomyoma.
biological_context: Uterine leiomyoma and its surrounding pseudocapsule
main_goals: This study integrated spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA sequencing to map the cellular architecture and gene expression of uterine leiomyoma and its pseudocapsule. It revealed potential therapeutic targets for hormonotherapy and non-hormonal therapy, as well as strategies for bleeding control during myomectomy.

title: Distinct Th17 effector cytokines differentially promote microglial and blood-brain barrier inflammatory responses during post-infectious encephalitis.
biological_context: Post-infectious encephalitis induced by Group A Streptococcus (GAS) infections
main_goals: This study investigates the inflammatory responses in microglia and the blood-brain barrier (BBB) during post-infectious encephalitis caused by Group A Streptococcus (GAS). It identifies distinct effector cytokines from Th17 lymphocytes that contribute to these responses and suggests IL-17A as a potential therapeutic target.

title: Single-Cell RNA Sequencing and Spatial Transcriptomics Reveal Pathogenesis of Meningeal Lymphatic Dysfunction after Experimental Subarachnoid Hemorrhage.
biological_context: Subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) and meningeal lymphatic dysfunction
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in vivo experiments', 'in vitro experiments']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study investigates the alterations in meningeal lymphatic vessels (mLVs) after subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. It aims to elucidate the mechanisms of mLVs injury and identify potential therapeutic targets by analyzing cellular, molecular, and spatial patterns. The findings highlight the role of the THBS1-CD47 pathway in mLVs dysfunction after SAH.

title: Integrated single-nucleus sequencing and spatial architecture analysis identified distinct injured-proximal tubular types in calculi rats.
main_goals: To evaluate the cell biology and immune-communications in urolithiasis-mediated kidney injury by characterizing distinct injured-proximal tubular cell types and their interactions with immune cells. The study aims to provide new insights for kidney stone treatment and prevention by analyzing gene expression profiles at the single-nucleus level.

title: The single-cell and spatial transcriptional landscape of human gastrulation and early brain development.
biological_context: Human gastrulation and early brain development
main_goals: This paper aims to delineate the dynamic molecular and cellular landscape of early gastrulation and human brain development using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. It describes cell type diversification, spatial patterning of neural tube cells, signaling pathways involved in neuroepithelial cell differentiation, and outlines neuron differentiation trajectories. The study also compares conserved and distinctive features with mouse development.

title: Large-Scale Integration of Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data Reveals Astrocyte Diversity and Transcriptomic Modules across Six Central Nervous System Disorders.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Integration with other omics', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This paper integrates large-scale single-cell RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq) data from publicly available datasets to analyze astrocyte diversity and transcriptomic modules across six central nervous system (CNS) disorders. It aims to reveal previously unidentifiable astrocyte subpopulations and characterize their heterogeneity in pathological conditions, offering insights into disease mechanisms.

title: Early alterations in the MCH system link aberrant neuronal activity and sleep disturbances in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease.
main_goals: This paper investigates early alterations in the melanin-concentrating hormone (MCH) system in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease (AD). It demonstrates how MCH function is impaired, contributing to aberrant neuronal activity and sleep disturbances, which are characteristic of early AD. The study identifies progressive changes in MCH axon morphology, linking these to AD pathology and hippocampus-dependent functional deficits.

title: Single-nucleus and Spatially Resolved Intratumor Subtype Heterogeneity in Bladder Cancer.
main_goals: This study investigates the extent and clinical impact of intratumor subtype heterogeneity in bladder cancer using single-nucleus and spatial transcriptomics. The findings suggest that continuous subtype scores derived from bulk RNA-seq can improve clinical risk stratification for patients.

title: Receptor for hyaluronan-mediated motility (RHAMM) defines an invasive niche associated with tumor progression and predicts poor outcomes in breast cancer patients.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of the hyaluronan receptor RHAMM in breast cancer invasion and progression. It developed a 27-gene RHAMM-related signature (RRS) to predict patient outcomes and used experimental models to demonstrate RHAMM's role in invasion. The study concludes that RHAMM promotes the formation of 'invasive niches'.

title: Spatial amine metabolomics and histopathology reveal localized brain alterations in subacute traumatic brain injury and the underlying mechanism of herbal treatment.
data_modalities_used: ['histopathology', 'immunofluorescence', 'HE-stained images', 'Nissl staining', 'spatial metabolomics', 'liquid microjunction surface sampling-tandem mass tag-ultra performance liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry']
main_goals: This study reveals the local amine-metabolite and histological changes in the subacute stage of TBI. It demonstrates that Xuefu Zhuyu decoction (XFZYD) may promote TBI recovery by normalizing amine metabolites and spatially promoting dopamine production and angiogenesis.

title: Spatial metabolomics reveals glycogen as an actionable target for pulmonary fibrosis.
data_modalities_used: ['Matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization imaging', 'histopathological annotation', 'mouse models']
main_goals: This study demonstrates the application of a bioinformatic pipeline for MALDI imaging datasets to assess metabolic heterogeneity in human lung diseases. The authors hypothesize and provide evidence that metabolic channeling between glycogen and N-linked glycans is critical for pulmonary fibrosis progression, identifying lysosomal glycogen utilization as a requirement for this disease.

title: Spatially resolved multi-omics highlights cell-specific metabolic remodeling and interactions in gastric cancer.
data_modalities_used: ['mass spectrometry imaging', 'spatial metabolomics', 'spatial lipidomics', 'microarray-based spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This paper integrates mass spectrometry imaging-based spatial metabolomics and lipidomics with microarray-based spatial transcriptomics to visualize intratumor metabolic heterogeneity and cell metabolic interactions in gastric cancer. It identifies tumor-associated metabolic reprogramming at metabolic-transcriptional levels and characterizes an immune cell-dominated 'tumor-normal interface' region with distinct transcriptional signatures and immunometabolic alterations.

title: Spatial resolution of cellular senescence dynamics in human colorectal liver metastasis.
main_goals: This study investigates the role of cellular senescence in human colorectal liver metastasis (CRLM) using spatial transcriptomics, 3D-microscopy, and multicellular transcriptomics. It identifies two subtypes of senescent metastatic cancer cells (SMCCs) with distinct characteristics and prognostic roles, elucidating their underlying mechanisms and immune regulatory effects.

title: Compartmentalized spatial profiling of the tumor microenvironment in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma identifies immune checkpoint molecules and tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily members as biomarkers of response to immunotherapy.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: This study employed targeted spatial profiling of proteins on pre-treatment tissues from patients with recurrent or metastatic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) to identify biomarkers of response to immunotherapy. It found that immune checkpoint molecules and Tumor Necrosis Factor Receptor superfamily members were differentially expressed and associated with treatment outcome.

title: Dissecting order amidst chaos of programmed cell deaths: construction of a diagnostic model for KIRC using transcriptomic information in blood-derived exosomes and single-cell multi-omics data in tumor microenvironment.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: To construct a diagnostic model for KIRC using transcriptomic information from blood-derived exosomes and single-cell multi-omics data of the tumor microenvironment. The study aimed to identify programmed cell death-related genes (CDRGs) and develop a predictive model for KIRC.
data_links_mentioned: ['exoRBase', 'The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA)', 'GTEx databases', 'Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) database']

title: Probing pathways by which rhynchophylline modifies sleep using spatial transcriptomics.
biological_context: Rhynchophylline (RHY) effects on sleep and brain molecular mechanisms in mice
main_goals: To define the effects of rhynchophylline (RHY) on sleep architecture and oscillations throughout a 24-h cycle and to identify the underlying molecular mechanisms using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to provide support for RHY's sleep-inducing effect and highlight its effects on the transcriptome with high spatial resolution.

title: Re-convolving the compositional landscape of primary and recurrent glioblastoma reveals prognostic and targetable tissue states.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The study aimed to define compositional tissue-states in primary and recurrent glioblastoma using single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. These tissue-states were correlated with clinical and prognostic features and showed enrichment in specific metabolic pathways, suggesting potential therapeutic targets. The research demonstrated that targeting fatty acid biosynthesis could impact these pernicious tissue-states.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Human Skin Delineates Intercellular Communication and Pathogenic Cells.
biological_context: Human and mouse skin homeostasis and disease (psoriasis, zinc-deficiency dermatitis)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This study integrated human and mouse skin transcriptomic data to delineate intercellular communication and pathogenic cells. It improved cell-type annotation using spatial transcriptomics, identified human-specific keratinocyte subpopulations with potential roles in epidermal thickness and disease, and nominated therapeutic targets by analyzing genodermatoses. The findings suggest subpopulation dysfunction as a hallmark of skin diseases.

title: Phenotypic characterization of spatial immune infiltration niches in non-small cell lung cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize the spatial immune infiltration niches in NSCLC and identify key differences in phenotype and function associated with spatial context. The authors mapped protein expression to spatial immune niches, highlighting metabolic-driven immune regulatory mechanisms and the importance of spatial profiling for predicting therapeutic response.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics identify a macrophage population associated with skeletal muscle fibrosis.
biological_context: Skeletal muscle homeostasis and fibrosis in muscular dystrophy and myopathies
main_goals: This study uses single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to identify a novel macrophage population associated with skeletal muscle fibrosis. It characterizes the molecular attributes of these macrophages in dystrophic muscle, identifies galectin-3 and spp1 as key markers, and suggests spp1's role in regulating macrophage-stromal progenitor interactions. The findings were also observed in human myopathy samples.

title: Single-cell RNA-seq with spatial transcriptomics to create an atlas of human diabetic kidney disease.
main_goals: This study utilized single-cell RNA-sequencing and spatial transcriptomic analyses to create an atlas of human diabetic kidney disease (DKD). The research aimed to identify distinct cell populations, understand intercellular interactions, and explore signaling pathways involved in DKD pathogenesis. The findings provide insights into potential therapeutic targets for DKD.

title: Understanding Long-Term Survival of Patients with Ovarian Cancer-The Tumor Microenvironment Comes to the Forefront.
main_goals: This paper investigates the tumor microenvironment (TME) in long-term versus short-term survivors of high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC). It identifies distinct roles of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and specific markers associated with poor survival, suggesting CAFs promote tumorigenicity and chemoresistance.

title: The immunopeptidome landscape associated with T cell infiltration, inflammation and immune editing in lung cancer.
main_goals: This study surveyed tumor regions and adjacent lung tissues from patients with lung cancer to explore the heterogeneous expression and presentation of tumor antigens. It associated diverse immune cell populations with the immunopeptidome and found potential neoantigens in T cell-excluded tumors. The findings suggest implications for combination therapies tailored to the patient's mutanome and immune microenvironment.

title: Spatial transcriptomic analysis of Sonic hedgehog medulloblastoma identifies that the loss of heterogeneity and promotion of differentiation underlies the response to CDK4/6 inhibition.
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to analyze Sonic hedgehog (SHH) medulloblastoma. It aims to understand how spatial organization impacts response to CDK4/6 inhibitors, specifically Palbociclib. The research identifies regional responses, including reduced proliferation and induced neuronal differentiation, and highlights tumor-cell interface characteristics.

title: Primary Aldosteronism: Spatial Multiomics Mapping of Genotype-Dependent Heterogeneity and Tumor Expansion of Aldosterone-Producing Adenomas.
main_goals: To decipher the roles of transcriptome and metabolome reprogramming in APA pathogenesis by analyzing spatial transcriptomics and metabolomics data. The study identified intratumoral transcriptional heterogeneity and distinct transcriptional profiles in CYP11B2-immunopositive regions, correlating with genotype-dependent differences in metabolite abundance and tumor expansion. It also suggested the existence of tumor precursor states in adjacent adrenal tissue.

title: Spatial transcriptomics reveals the heterogeneity and FGG+CRP+ inflammatory cancer-associated fibroblasts replace islets in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Clustering', 'Dimension Reduction', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study used spatial transcriptomics to investigate the spatial heterogeneity of the tumor microenvironment in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma. It identified distinct cell subpopulations and revealed that inflammatory cancer-associated fibroblasts replace islets in the tumor stroma, with impaired exocrine function being significant during disease progression.

title: Clinical molecular subtyping reveals intrinsic mesenchymal reprogramming in gastric cancer cells.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Gene Expression Profiling', 'Transcriptome', 'cellular deconvolution', 'spatial transcriptomics analysis', 'network analysis', 'pharmacogenomic database analyses']
main_goals: This study identifies molecular subtypes of gastric cancer based on gene signatures, revealing intrinsic mesenchymal reprogramming driven by TGF-β signaling. It demonstrates the utility of these subtypes in predicting prognosis and therapeutic response, and proposes targeting TGF-β signaling as a therapeutic strategy for medically intractable gastric cancer.

title: Spatial single cell analysis of tumor microenvironment remodeling pattern in primary central nervous system lymphoma.
main_goals: To determine the overall tumor microenvironment (TME) characteristics and transition mechanisms in primary central nervous system lymphoma (PCNSL). The study identified a TME remodeling pattern driven by immune pressure and a key FKBP5+ tumor subgroup. It also discovered spatial and temporal distributions of immune checkpoint molecules and CAR-T target molecules relevant to immunotherapy.

title: Identification and Characterization of the Wilms Tumor Cancer Stem Cell.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'bulk RNA sequencing', 'single cell RNA sequencing', 'in vitro experiments', 'transplantation experiments']
main_goals: This study identifies and characterizes nephrogenic progenitor (NP) cells with cancer stem cell characteristics driving Wilms tumor (WT). It demonstrates that SIX2+CITED1+ cells fulfill cancer stem cell criteria and recapitulate WT in transplantation studies. The interplay between ITGβ1 and ITGβ4 regulates self-renewal versus differentiation in these cells, and spatial transcriptomics maps gene expression and interactive networks involved in WT development.

title: Contribution of LRP1 in Human Congenital Heart Disease Correlates with Its Roles in the Outflow Tract and Atrioventricular Cushion Development.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper investigates the contribution of LRP1 in human congenital heart disease (CHD) by analyzing its expression patterns and the impact of its variants. It integrates single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics data with genetic analysis to correlate LRP1's role with heart development, particularly in the outflow tract and atrioventricular cushion.

title: Proteomic Profiling of Fallopian Tube-Derived Extracellular Vesicles Using a Microfluidic Tissue-on-Chip System.
main_goals: This study established a microfluidic platform to culture human fallopian tube epithelium (hFTE) for extracellular vesicle (EV) collection and proteomic profiling. It reported 295 common hFTE sEV proteins and correlated sEV protein profiles with cell-type-specific transcripts using spatial transcriptomics, revealing differentially expressed proteins in secretory cells. The work provides insights into the baseline proteomic profile of hFTE sEVs and their correlation with lineage-specific transcripts, potentially aiding in understanding ovarian cancer carcinogenesis and reproductive functions.
