covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatiotemporal analysis', 'Kernel density estimation', 'spatial and temporal clusters with statistical significance', 'maximum entropy modeling']
main_goals: To trace the spatial occurrence and distribution of human plague cases in Pernambuco, Brazil, using satellite-based data and a historical survey to better understand the disease dynamics. The study aimed to characterize the spatial and temporal dispersion of cases and observe the shift from urban to wild-sylvatic areas, as well as reemergence patterns.

title: Cingulate networks associated with gray matter loss in Parkinson's disease show high expression of cholinergic genes in the healthy brain.
main_goals: To examine the transcriptomic signature of structural covariance networks associated with gray matter loss in Parkinson's disease, utilizing postmortem microarray data from the healthy brain. The study investigated the molecular processes underlying posterior and anterior cingulate networks that show gray matter reduction in Parkinson's patients.

title: Spatial mapping of SARS-CoV-2 and H1N1 lung injury identifies differential transcriptional signatures.
biological_context: COVID-19 and H1N1 influenza lung injury
main_goals: This study used spatial transcriptomics on autopsy-derived lung tissue from patients with SARS-CoV-2, H1N1, and dual infection. It aimed to identify differential transcriptional signatures in ARDS regions to understand the similarities and differences between SARS-CoV-2 and H1N1-induced lung injury. The findings highlight regional coagulopathy, extracellular remodeling, and macrophage activation in SARS-CoV-2, suggesting potential therapeutic targets for COVID-19-related ARDS.

title: Systemic Tissue and Cellular Disruption from SARS-CoV-2 Infection revealed in COVID-19 Autopsies and Spatial Omics Tissue Maps.
data_modalities_used: ['transcriptional profiling', 'nasopharyngeal swabs', 'autopsy tissues', 'spatial protein profiling', 'spatial expression profiling', 'GeoMx', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To define body-wide and tissue-specific damage caused by SARS-CoV-2 infection. The study aims to reveal systemic disruption of cellular and transcriptional pathways from COVID-19 across all tissues, providing insights into molecular mechanisms of severe infection and comparing it to other lung injury states.

title: Genetic disruption of WASHC4 drives endo-lysosomal dysfunction and cognitive-movement impairments in mice and humans.
biological_context: Mouse and human brain development and function, specifically related to intellectual disability and movement disorders
main_goals: This paper investigates the cellular etiology of intellectual disability associated with mutations in the WASH complex subunit SWIP. It generates a mouse model to study the impact of a specific mutation and finds that it leads to endo-lysosomal dysfunction, neurodegeneration, and progressive motor deficits. Similar movement deficits were observed in human patients with the mutation.

title: Identifying CNS-colonizing T cells as potential therapeutic targets to prevent progression of multiple sclerosis.
main_goals: This study investigates whether chronic immune cell accumulation behind the blood-brain barrier contributes to therapeutic resistance in progressive multiple sclerosis. It identifies a specific pathogenic T cell population in the brains of progressive MS patients and suggests that these cells may infiltrate the CNS earlier in the disease course, offering a potential therapeutic target to prevent treatment-resistant progression.

title: Spatiotemporal single-cell RNA sequencing of developing chicken hearts identifies interplay between cellular differentiation and morphogenesis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial mapping of differentiation transitions', 'Spatially resolved expression analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study combines single-cell and spatial transcriptomics to analyze the development of the chicken heart. It aims to create a census of cellular lineages, their spatial organization, and interactions, and to identify anatomically restricted expression programs and genes implicated in congenital heart disease.

title: Shotgun transcriptome, spatial omics, and isothermal profiling of SARS-CoV-2 infection reveals unique host responses, viral diversification, and drug interactions.
main_goals: The study aimed to develop fast diagnostic tests and large-scale metatranscriptomics platforms for SARS-CoV-2 infection. It also aimed to profile host and viral responses, track viral evolution, and identify drug interactions using clinical specimens and autopsy tissues. The findings inform public health strategies and potential treatments for COVID-19.

title: Molecular characterization of the conoid complex in Toxoplasma reveals its conservation in all apicomplexans, including Plasmodium species.
biological_context: Apicomplexan parasite invasion mechanisms, specifically focusing on the conoid complex and its conservation across different species like Toxoplasma gondii and Plasmodium.
main_goals: To develop a molecular inventory and understand the organization of conoid-associated proteins in Toxoplasma gondii using spatial proteomics and high-resolution microscopy. The study aimed to assess the conservation of the conoid complex across Apicomplexa, including Plasmodium species, by investigating protein localization and expression in different parasitic forms.

title: Transcriptome-scale spatial gene expression in the human dorsolateral prefrontal cortex.
main_goals: This paper uses the Visium platform to define spatial gene expression in the human dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, identifying layer-enriched signatures and integrating them with snRNA-seq data. It highlights the clinical relevance of spatially defined expression for neuropsychiatric disorders and introduces a framework for unsupervised clustering in spatial transcriptomics data. A web application is provided for community data exploration.

title: Biomarker Discovery in Patients with Immunotherapy-Treated Melanoma with Imaging Mass Cytometry.
biological_context: Metastatic melanoma patients treated with immunotherapy
data_modalities_used: ['Imaging Mass Cytometry (IMC)', 'quantitative immunofluorescence (QIF)', 'digital spatial profiling', 'mRNA expression']
main_goals: To characterize the tumor microenvironment of patients with metastatic melanoma who received immunotherapy using IMC to identify indicative factors of treatment response. The study aimed to validate findings with other multiplexing methods and assess correlations with patient survival. A key finding was the identification of beta2-microglobulin (B2M) as a potential biomarker.

title: A spatially resolved brain region- and cell type-specific isoform atlas of the postnatal mouse brain.
main_goals: The study presents a single-cell investigation of differential isoform expression (DIE) between brain regions in the postnatal mouse brain. It aims to create a spatially resolved brain region- and cell type-specific isoform atlas, quantifying isoform expression with cell-type and spatial resolution.

title: Spatiotemporal analysis of human intestinal development at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: This study uses single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to characterize human intestinal morphogenesis over time. It identifies cell states, morphogenetic programs, and principles of axis formation, neural, vascular, and immune development. The work also defines fibroblast subtypes, Peyer's patch origins, and potential links to rare developmental intestinal disorders.

title: Differences in spatial distribution of medicinal plant resources in Yinshan region of Inner Mongolia.
biological_context: Medicinal plant resources in the Yinshan region of Inner Mongolia
main_goals: This study analyzes the spatial distribution differences of medicinal plant resources in the Yinshan area of Inner Mongolia using geostatistical methods. It aims to inform protection policies and promote industry development by identifying areas with high and low resource abundance and concentration.

title: A single cell atlas of the human liver tumor microenvironment.
biological_context: Human liver cancer (cholangiocarcinoma and liver metastases)
data_modalities_used: ['single cell RNA-sequencing', 'spatial analysis', 'transcriptomics', 'laser-capture microdissected regions', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: To create a single-cell atlas of the human liver tumor microenvironment. The study aims to resolve the molecular identities and intercellular interactions of different cell types in liver pathologies, reconstructing ligand-receptor maps and a zonation atlas of hepatocytes.

title: Functional analysis of TLK2 variants and their proximal interactomes implicates impaired kinase activity and chromatin maintenance defects in their pathogenesis.
biological_context: Neurodevelopmental disorders (specifically 'Mental Retardation Autosomal Dominant 57' - MRD57)
data_modalities_used: ['whole exome sequencing', 'array-CGH', 'spatial proteomics', 'BioID', 'single-cell gel electrophoresis', 'lymphoblastoid cells']
main_goals: This study identifies novel pathogenic variants in TLK2 associated with the neurodevelopmental disorder MRD57, expands the understanding of its clinical phenotype, and investigates the molecular mechanisms underlying these mutations. It demonstrates impaired kinase activity and altered chromatin interactions of mutated TLK2, implicating these defects in the pathogenesis of the disorder.

title: Spatial proteomics defines the content of trafficking vesicles captured by golgin tethers.
biological_context: Intracellular traffic between compartments of the secretory and endocytic pathways, specifically endosome-derived vesicles destined for the trans-Golgi network (TGN).
main_goals: To define the content of different endosome-derived vesicles destined for the TGN by combining vesicle relocalisation with organelle proteomics and Bayesian analysis. The study aimed to identify proteins re-routed by specific golgin proteins (golgin-97 and GCC88) and to illustrate a general strategy for analysing intracellular sub-proteomes.

title: Decoding Cellular Mechanisms for Mechanosensory Discrimination.
main_goals: The study aimed to link single-cell RNA-sequencing and in vivo functional imaging to explore molecular and cellular mechanisms of touch detection. It uncovered transcriptomic logic underlying mechanosensory neuron sensitivity and selectivity, and revealed the role of Piezo2 in tuning these neurons.

title: Decoding myofibroblast origins in human kidney fibrosis.
main_goals: This study aimed to understand the cellular origins and functional heterogeneity of scar-forming myofibroblasts in human kidney fibrosis using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The research identified distinct subpopulations of pericytes and fibroblasts as the main sources of myofibroblasts and detected NKD2 as a potential therapeutic target.

title: The spatio-temporal landscape of lung pathology in SARS-CoV-2 infection.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the cellular composition and spatial architecture of human acute lung injury in SARS-CoV-2 infection at single-cell resolution using high-parameter imaging mass cytometry. It unravels the disordered structure of the infected lung and the distribution of immune infiltration, identifying key cell types and their spatial relationships as the disease progresses. The aim is to provide a biologically interpretable landscape of lung pathology from structural, immunological, and clinical standpoints.

title: Mapping endothelial-cell diversity in cerebral cavernous malformations at single-cell resolution.
main_goals: To comprehensively characterize subclasses of brain endothelial cells (ECs) under normal conditions and after deletion of Pdcd10 (Ccm3) in a mouse model of CCM using single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and immunohistochemistry. The study aims to identify the origin of CCM lesions and understand the plasticity of the brain vascular system.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics Reveals Genes Associated with Dysregulated Mitochondrial Functions and Stress Signaling in Alzheimer Disease.
main_goals: To uncover novel and known molecular targets in the hippocampus and olfactory bulbs that may contribute to early synaptic deficits and olfactory dysfunction in AD mice. The study identified spatially differentially expressed genes related to stress responses, transcription, and mitochondrial functions, including Bok.

title: Regional-Scale In-Depth Analysis of Soil Fungal Diversity Reveals Strong pH and Plant Species Effects in Northern Europe.
biological_context: Soil fungal diversity and its drivers in Northern Europe
main_goals: To conduct a regional-scale in-depth analysis of soil fungal diversity using long-read third-generation sequencing. The study aimed to identify the key drivers of fungal diversity, including soil pH, plant species, and environmental factors, and investigate their effects on different fungal groups.

title: Onco-fetal Reprogramming of Endothelial Cells Drives Immunosuppressive Macrophages in Hepatocellular Carcinoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Gene Expression Profiling', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study characterized the cellular landscape of human liver from development to disease using scRNA sequencing. It revealed fetal-like reprogramming of the HCC tumor microenvironment, identifying shared onco-fetal characteristics between fetal liver and HCC. The research implicates VEGF and NOTCH signaling in maintaining this ecosystem and proposes novel therapeutic targets for HCC.

title: Multi-layered Spatial Transcriptomics Identify Secretory Factors Promoting Human Hematopoietic Stem Cell Development.
biological_context: Human embryonic hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) development
main_goals: To identify secreted signals underlying human HSC development by combining spatial transcriptomics and gene expression profiling. The study revealed endothelin 1 as a regulator of human HSC development and provided gene expression datasets for future research.

title: The Stress-Like Cancer Cell State Is a Consistent Component of Tumorigenesis.
biological_context: Zebrafish melanoma, triple-negative breast cancer, oligodendroglioma, pancreatic adenocarcinoma
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'single-cell RNA sequencing', 'zebrafish melanoma modeling', 'human samples', 'histology images']
main_goals: This study validates the existence of a stress-like cancer cell state across various cancer types using a combination of zebrafish melanoma modeling, spatial transcriptomics, and human samples. The findings indicate that this state is present from early tumorigenesis and is conserved across different cancers. Furthermore, the study provides evidence that these stress-like cells possess higher tumor-seeding capabilities and exhibit increased growth resistance to MEK and BRAF inhibitors.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics of Nematodes Identifies Sperm Cells as a Source of Genomic Novelty and Rapid Evolution.
biological_context: Nematode evolution and gene expression divergence
main_goals: This study uses spatial transcriptomics to compare gene expression in two nematode species, Caenorhabditis elegans and Pristionchus pacificus. It identifies sperm cells as a source of genomic novelty and rapid evolution, supporting the 'out of testis' hypothesis in nematodes. The research highlights the role of novel genes in phenotypic diversity and proposes new functions for uncharacterized genes.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics and In Situ Sequencing to Study Alzheimer's Disease.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'in situ sequencing', 'mouse brain sections', 'human brain sections', 'gene expression']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the transcriptional changes occurring around amyloid plaques in an Alzheimer's disease mouse model using spatial transcriptomics and in situ sequencing. It demonstrates early alterations in myelin and oligodendrocyte genes and later involvement of a plaque-induced gene network including the complement system, oxidative stress, lysosomes, and inflammation. The findings highlight the utility of spatial omics for understanding dysregulated cellular networks in Alzheimer's disease.

title: Contact area-dependent cell communication and the morphological invariance of ascidian embryogenesis.
main_goals: This paper quantifies cell behavior during ascidian embryogenesis using light-sheet imaging and automated cell segmentation/tracking. It establishes that the area of contact between signaling and responding cells is a key determinant of cell communication, explaining the reproducibility of embryonic geometries and asymmetric cell divisions. The work suggests geometric control of embryonic inductions as an alternative to morphogen gradients and that cell signaling range sets the scale of embryonic reproducibility.

title: Multimodal Analysis of Composition and Spatial Architecture in Human Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
biological_context: Human squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC) and matched normal skin
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'multiplexed ion beam imaging', 'snRNA-seq', 'multiplexed imaging']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: This paper defines the cellular composition and architecture of human squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC) by integrating single-cell RNA sequencing, spatial transcriptomics, and multiplexed ion beam imaging. It identifies tumor-specific keratinocyte (TSK) populations, maps ligand-receptor networks to cell types, and reveals features of immunosuppression. The study also uses xenografts and CRISPR screens to identify gene networks essential for tumorigenesis.

title: Spatial analysis of cerebral palsy in children and adolescents and its association with health vulnerability.
biological_context: Cerebral Palsy in children and adolescents
main_goals: To perform a spatial analysis of Cerebral Palsy (CP) in children and adolescents and analyze its association with health vulnerability in a city in Brazil using spatial statistics and GIS. The study aimed to understand the social context of CP and guide local health decision-making.

title: Spatial Characterization of the Human Centrosome Proteome Opens Up New Horizons for a Small but Versatile Organelle.
main_goals: This paper presents an extensive inventory of human centrosome and centriolar satellite protein components using immunofluorescence and confocal microscopy. It identifies networks of candidate proteins involved in ubiquitination and protein phosphatases, supporting the centrosome's role in cell signaling. The study also highlights the overrepresentation of multi-localizing proteins in centriolar satellites, indicating dynamic functions.

title: Phenotypic Profiling of Reference Chemicals across Biologically Diverse Cell Types Using the Cell Painting Assay.
biological_context: Characterizing the phenotypic effects of reference chemicals in diverse human-derived cell lines
main_goals: This paper aimed to assess the feasibility and optimization requirements of the Cell Painting assay for novel, biologically diverse human cell types. It characterized the phenotypic effects of reference chemicals across six different cell lines, demonstrating that similar biological activity profiles can be achieved without cell type-specific cytochemistry protocol adjustments, though image acquisition and segmentation parameters require optimization.

title: An in vitro model of early anteroposterior organization during human development.
main_goals: To demonstrate an in vitro model of early anteroposterior organization during human development using gastruloids derived from human embryonic stem cells. The study shows that these gastruloids exhibit patterned gene expression, including a signature of somitogenesis, providing an experimentally tractable system to study human-specific axial organization.

title: Lgr5+ telocytes are a signaling source at the intestinal villus tip.
biological_context: Intestinal villus tip epithelium and its surrounding stroma
data_modalities_used: ['laser capture micro-dissection', 'single cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study uncovers spatially zonated populations of mesenchymal cells along the crypt-villus axis, identifying Lgr5+ telocytes at the villus tip. These villus tip telocytes (VTTs) signal through Bmp morphogens and Wnt5a and are shown to regulate the zonation of enterocyte gene expression at the villus tip.

title: Quantitative determination of niraparib and olaparib tumor distribution by mass spectrometry imaging.
main_goals: This paper presents a quantitative method to visualize the tumor distribution of niraparib and olaparib using mass spectrometry imaging. It demonstrates the different penetration of these two PARP inhibitors into ovarian tumors in mice. The study highlights the potential of MSI for spatial quantitative drug measurement.

title: Unique and highly specific cyanogenic glycoside localization in stigmatic cells and pollen in the genus Lomatia (Proteaceae).
biological_context: Floral chemical defense in the genus Lomatia (Proteaceae)
main_goals: To investigate the within-flower distribution and localization of cyanogenic glycosides (CNglycs) in the genus Lomatia using MALDI-MSI. The study aimed to understand the strategic allocation of CNglycs, their potential functions, and differences between species across a climatic gradient. Findings revealed high CNglyc concentrations in pollen and specialized cells, challenging existing defense theories.

title: Spatial proteomics revealed a CX<sub>3</sub>CL1-dependent crosstalk between the urothelium and relocated macrophages through IL-6 during an acute bacterial infection in the urinary bladder.
biological_context: Acute bacterial infection in the urinary bladder
main_goals: This study investigated the crosstalk between the urothelium and relocated macrophages during acute bacterial infection in the urinary bladder using spatial proteomics. It revealed a CX3CL1-dependent mechanism mediated by IL-6 that facilitates macrophage migration into the urothelium and reduces bacterial burden.

title: Untangling early embryo development using single cell genomics.
biological_context: Mammalian pre-gastrulation development, early embryo development
main_goals: This paper reviews the application of single-cell transcriptomics and spatial transcriptomics to study early mammalian embryo development. It highlights how these technologies provide insights into gene regulatory networks, epigenetic mechanisms, lineage segregation, pluripotency establishment, and signaling pathways. The advancement of these technologies is expected to translate into biotechnological applications, particularly in livestock production.

title: Single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal somitogenesis in gastruloids.
biological_context: Somitogenesis in mouse gastruloids and embryos
main_goals: This study compares mouse gastruloids with mouse embryos using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics to reveal cell types, validate gene expression patterns of somitogenesis regulators, and demonstrate the functionality of the somitogenesis clock in vitro. It also shows that gastruloids can generate somites with correct rostral-caudal patterning when embedded in Matrigel, highlighting their utility for studying development in a high-throughput manner.

title: Identification of Chloroplast Envelope Proteins with Critical Importance for Cold Acclimation.
biological_context: Cold acclimation and freezing tolerance in plants, specifically the role of the chloroplast envelope.
main_goals: To identify chloroplast envelope proteins critical for cold acclimation by analyzing protein abundance changes under cold conditions using mass spectrometry. The study validates findings through mutant analysis and proposes roles for identified proteins in freezing tolerance.

title: Spatial transcriptomics identifies spatially dysregulated expression of GRM3 and USP47 in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
main_goals: To implement spatially resolved RNA sequencing in human post mortem cortical tissue from an ALS patient to identify dysregulated transcripts contributing to motor neuron degeneration. The study aimed to validate findings using BaseScope and extend analysis to a broader cohort of ALS cases and tissues.

title: Combined single-cell and spatial transcriptomics reveal the molecular, cellular and spatial bone marrow niche organization.
main_goals: This study systematically maps the molecular, cellular, and spatial composition of distinct bone marrow niches by combining single-cell and spatially resolved transcriptomics. It identified CAR cell subsets and their peri-vascular micro-niches and demonstrated that 3D bone marrow organization can be inferred from single-cell transcriptome data using the RNA-Magnet algorithm.

title: A Spatiotemporal Organ-Wide Gene Expression and Cell Atlas of the Developing Human Heart.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Single-Cell Analysis']
main_goals: To characterize the organ-wide orchestration of gene expression in the developing human heart with single-cell spatial resolution. The study mapped cell-type-specific gene expression to anatomical domains across three developmental stages. A web resource was generated to facilitate future studies on human cardiogenesis.

title: Exploring inflammatory signatures in arthritic joint biopsies with Spatial Transcriptomics.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Differential Gene Expression Analysis', 'Pathway Analysis', 'Immune cell type identification', 'Visualization']
main_goals: To explore inflammatory signatures in synovial biopsies from rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and spondyloarthritis (SpA) patients using spatial transcriptomics. The study aimed to demonstrate spatial transcriptomics as a proof-of-principle for unbiased mRNA studies at the site of inflammation. It identified distinct transcriptomic profiles for RA and SpA, highlighting differences in immune cell infiltration and cellular functions.

title: Imaging the dynamic recruitment of monocytes to the blood-brain barrier and specific brain regions during Toxoplasma gondii infection.
biological_context: Toxoplasma gondii infection in mouse brain
data_modalities_used: ['2-photon intravital imaging', 'light-sheet microscopy', 'optical clearing', 'histology images', 'multiplexed imaging']
main_goals: This study investigates the dynamic and regional recruitment of monocytes to the blood-brain barrier and specific brain regions during Toxoplasma gondii infection in mice. It utilizes intravital imaging and optical clearing coupled with microscopy to observe monocyte behavior and localization in relation to parasite clusters. The findings highlight a consistent pattern of monocyte infiltration to the olfactory tubercle during infection.

title: Comparative spatial lipidomics analysis reveals cellular lipid remodelling in different developmental zones of barley roots in response to salinity.
biological_context: Salinity stress response in barley roots
data_modalities_used: ['liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry', 'inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry', 'matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization mass spectrometry imaging', 'reverse transcription - quantitative real time polymerase chain reaction']
main_goals: This study aimed to assess changes in lipid profiles and elemental composition in different developmental zones of barley roots in response to short-term salt stress using a spatial approach. The researchers investigated molecular signatures of lipids, ions, and transcripts to understand cellular lipid remodeling.

title: A spatially restricted fibrotic niche in pulmonary fibrosis is sustained by M-CSF/M-CSFR signalling in monocyte-derived alveolar macrophages.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridisation', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of different macrophage populations in a spatially restricted model of asbestos-induced pulmonary fibrosis. It identifies monocyte-derived alveolar macrophages as key contributors to fibrosis and highlights M-CSF/M-CSFR signaling as a therapeutic target for sustained self-maintenance of these pathogenic macrophages.

title: Geospatial modeling of microcephaly and zika virus spread patterns in Brazil.
biological_context: Microcephaly and Zika Virus infection in Brazil
main_goals: This study investigates regional characteristics at the municipal level in Brazil associated with the incidence of microcephaly and its relationship with Zika virus. Using exploratory spatial data analysis and spatial autoregressive Tobit models, the research aims to understand the uneven distribution of microcephaly across the country. The findings highlight that ZIKV alone cannot explain the variations in microcephaly incidence, with regional attributes playing a mediating role.

title: Transcriptional profiling of single fiber cells in a transgenic paradigm of an inherited childhood cataract reveals absence of molecular heterogeneity.
biological_context: Inherited childhood cataract (lamellar cataract) in a transgenic mouse model
main_goals: To investigate the role of transcriptional heterogeneity in terminal differentiation and the functional phenotype (transparency) of the lens in a transgenic model of lamellar cataract. The study aimed to analyze single fiber cells from a transgenic mouse model to understand early molecular events leading to cataractogenesis, specifically examining the absence of molecular heterogeneity.

title: Spatial proteomics reveal that the protein phosphatase PTP1B interacts with and may modify tyrosine phosphorylation of the rhomboid protease RHBDL4.
main_goals: This paper uses BioID proximity proteomics to identify proteins interacting with or in close proximity to RHBDL4. They found PTP1B as a potential interactor and showed that RHBDL4 tyrosine phosphorylation affects its binding to p97/VCP and ubiquitinated proteins. This work provides a foundation for understanding RHBDL4's roles in ERAD.

title: The use of Fourier-transform infrared spectroscopy to characterize connective tissue components in skeletal muscle of Atlantic cod (Gadus morhua L.).
biological_context: Connective tissue components in skeletal muscle of Atlantic cod (Gadus morhua L.)
main_goals: This study investigates Fourier-transform infrared spectroscopy (FTIR) as a method to measure connective tissue components in Atlantic cod muscle. FTIR was used to differentiate fish fed different diets based on collagen type I content and to spatially map collagen type I and glycosaminoglycans (GAGs). The findings suggest FTIR can identify spectral markers and map the distribution of these components.

title: Spatiotemporal dynamics of molecular pathology in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
biological_context: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) in mouse spinal cords and human postmortem spinal cords
main_goals: To characterize the underlying molecular mechanisms in ALS by using spatial transcriptomics to obtain gene expression measurements of mouse spinal cords over the course of disease, as well as of postmortem tissue from ALS patients. The study identifies pathway dynamics, distinguishes regional differences between microglia and astrocyte populations at early time points, and discerns perturbations in several transcriptional pathways shared between murine models of ALS and human postmortem spinal cords.

title: Regional protein expression in human Alzheimer's brain correlates with disease severity.
main_goals: This paper uses spatial proteomics to analyze regional protein expression changes in human Alzheimer's brain, correlating these changes with disease severity. The study aims to provide insights into disease progression, identify novel AD-related pathways, and understand the spatial gradient of protein expression changes.

title: Mapping the Surface Microbiome and Metabolome of Brown Seaweed Fucus vesiculosus by Amplicon Sequencing, Integrated Metabolomics and Imaging Techniques.
biological_context: Surface epibiome and metabolome of the brown alga Fucus vesiculosus.
main_goals: This study aimed to analyze the surface epibiome and the composition and spatial distribution of the surface metabolome of Fucus vesiculosus. It combined amplicon sequencing, imaging, and untargeted metabolomics to identify microbial communities and map metabolites on the algal surface and within its tissues. The study identified predominant bacterial phyla and visualized fungi, and characterized the surface metabolome, distinguishing it from the whole tissue metabolome.

title: Spatial risk analysis on occurrences and dispersal of Biomphalaria straminea in and endemic area for schistosomiasis.
biological_context: Schistosomiasis transmission and vector snail distribution in a rural endemic area of Brazil.
data_modalities_used: ['histology images', 'faecal contamination data', 'rainfall data', 'snail distribution data']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Risk Analysis', 'Kernel density estimation', 'Kriging', 'Maximum entropy (MaxEnt) modeling']
main_goals: To characterize the distribution of Biomphalaria straminea breeding sites in an endemic municipality for schistosomiasis and to develop predictive models for the occurrence and dispersal of this vector snail to new areas. The study utilized geostatistical tools to identify areas at risk and estimate dispersal patterns, linking snail abundance to rainfall patterns and faecal contamination.

title: Spatial Analysis of Single Fiber Cells of the Developing Ocular Lens Reveals Regulated Heterogeneity of Gene Expression.
main_goals: This paper uses spatial transcriptomics to analyze single fiber cells in the developing ocular lens. It investigates the regulated heterogeneity of gene expression in these cells during differentiation, revealing a regulated intermediate state in the development of a functional phenotype.

title: Spatial Transcriptomics of C. elegans Males and Hermaphrodites Identifies Sex-Specific Differences in Gene Expression Patterns.
biological_context: C. elegans males and hermaphrodites germline and reproductive tract
main_goals: This paper generated high-resolution, anteroposterior gene expression maps of C. elegans males and hermaphrodites using spatial transcriptomics. They developed computational methods for discovering region- and tissue-specific genes and identified sex-specific gene expression differences in the germline, sperm, and male reproductive tract. The study highlights the utility of spatial gene expression maps for identifying tissue-specific gene functions.

title: Spatial Reconstruction of Single Enterocytes Uncovers Broad Zonation along the Intestinal Villus Axis.
biological_context: Intestinal villus axis zonation of enterocyte function
main_goals: This study reconstructs the spatial zonation of single enterocytes along the intestinal villus axis using a large panel of landmark genes identified through transcriptomics of laser capture microdissected villus segments. It reveals distinct functional programs, including anti-bacterial, nutrient absorption machineries for carbohydrates, peptides, and fats, and immune-modulatory programs, expressed sequentially along the villus.

title: Spatially Resolved Transcriptomics Enables Dissection of Genetic Heterogeneity in Stage III Cutaneous Malignant Melanoma.
biological_context: Stage III cutaneous malignant melanoma lymph node metastases
main_goals: This study adapted spatial transcriptomics (ST) technology to melanoma lymph node biopsies to explore the transcriptional landscape and identify gene expression profiles linked to specific histologic entities. The application of ST revealed complex intratumoral composition, coexistence of melanoma signatures within single regions, and distinct expression patterns in lymphoid tissue near the tumor, highlighting the importance of spatial information for understanding tumor progression and therapy outcome.

title: Resolution Matters: Correlating Quantitative Proteomics and Nanoscale-Precision Microscopy for Reconstructing Synapse Identity.
biological_context: Neuronal synapse localization of transmembrane receptors
main_goals: This paper illustrates the power of combining super-resolution microscopy with unbiased proteomics to quantitatively address protein distribution and interaction at the neuronal synapse. It highlights how this workflow can lead to a better understanding of cellular physiology and pathobiology by enabling inferences from dynamic analyses.

title: Spatial maps of prostate cancer transcriptomes reveal an unexplored landscape of heterogeneity.
main_goals: Investigate tissue-wide gene expression heterogeneity in multifocal prostate cancer using spatial transcriptomics. Extract distinct expression profiles for different tissue components and identify gene expression gradients in the stroma adjacent to tumor regions.

title: Gene expression profiling of periodontitis-affected gingival tissue by spatial transcriptomics.
data_modalities_used: ['spatial transcriptomics', 'histology images', 'RNA sequencing', 'reverse transcription quantitative polymerase chain reaction', 'immunohistochemistry']
main_goals: This study aimed to characterize gene expression in periodontitis-affected gingival tissue using spatial transcriptomics. The research identified distinct gene expression clusters corresponding to different tissue regions and pinpointed significantly up-regulated genes in inflamed areas, providing insights into periodontitis pathogenesis.

title: Neuronal atlas of the dorsal horn defines its architecture and links sensory input to transcriptional cell types.
biological_context: Neuronal subtypes in the dorsal horn of the spinal cord and their role in sensory processing
main_goals: To classify sensory neurons in the mouse dorsal horn using single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomics. The study identified distinct molecular subtypes and mapped their laminar enrichment, revealing a layered organization and linking specific neuron types to heat and cold stimuli.

title: Identification of a neural crest stem cell niche by Spatial Genomic Analysis.
main_goals: To identify a neural crest stem cell niche by examining gene expression at single-cell resolution in vivo using multiplex single molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization coupled with machine learning for cell segmentation. The study reveals spatially distinct subpopulations and a niche centered around the dorsal midline with high expression of neural crest and pluripotency genes.

title: Single-cell heterogeneity in ductal carcinoma in situ of breast.
main_goals: To analyze cell-level heterogeneity in ductal carcinoma in situ of the breast using multiplexed immunofluorescence. The study aimed to document epithelial cell heterogeneity within and between ducts, and between patients, and to understand the interaction between epithelial tumor cells and immune infiltrates.

title: TruSeq-Based Gene Expression Analysis of Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded (FFPE) Cutaneous T-Cell Lymphoma Samples: Subgroup Analysis Results and Elucidation of Biases from FFPE Sample Processing on the TruSeq Platform.
main_goals: This study aimed to analyze gene expression profiles of CTCL samples using the TruSeq platform, specifically investigating the impact of sample processing year (pre- and post-2009) on results. The authors sought to determine the robustness of previous findings and explore biases introduced by FFPE sample processing on the TruSeq platform. They also aimed to identify novel differentially expressed genes and understand how sample processing affects clustering and DEG identification.

title: Mapping the Spatial Proteome of Metastatic Cells in Colorectal Cancer.
main_goals: To study metastasis mechanisms in colorectal cancer using spatial proteomics in the KM12 cell model. The study provides localization data for quantified proteins and identifies deregulated proteins and pathways associated with metastasis at a subcellular level.

title: Downregulation of EGFR in hypoxic, diffusion-limited areas of squamous cell carcinomas of the head and neck.
biological_context: Squamous cell carcinomas of the head and neck region (HNSCC)
main_goals: To study the expression of EGFR and the hypoxia marker CA IX in relation to diffusion distances from microvessels in HNSCC. The study aimed to understand the role of the hypoxic tumor microenvironment in mediating resistance against anti-EGFR strategies.

title: Spatio-Temporal Metabolite Profiling of the Barley Germination Process by MALDI MS Imaging.
biological_context: Barley germination process over seven days
main_goals: To perform spatio-temporal metabolite profiling of the barley germination process using MALDI MS imaging. The study aimed to identify and localize metabolites, and to develop new analysis and visualization strategies for time-series MSI data to reveal germination-dependent developmental patterns.

title: Metabolic spatial connectivity in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis as revealed by independent component analysis.
main_goals: To disclose brain networks involved in ALS pathological processes using spatial independent component analysis (ICA) and evaluate their discriminative value in separating patients from controls. The study aimed to improve diagnostic accuracy for ALS by applying ICA to FDG-PET data.

title: Transcriptome-wide analysis of the MADS-box gene family in the orchid Erycina pusilla.
main_goals: This study identified and characterized 28 MADS-box genes in the orchid Erycina pusilla. It aimed to provide useful information for orchid breeding, studies of flowering, and evolution by analyzing gene structure, phylogenetic relationships, and expression profiles.

title: Application of independent component analysis on Raman images of a pharmaceutical drug product: pure spectra determination and spatial distribution of constituents.
main_goals: The aim was to extract the pure signals from a Raman image of a pharmaceutical tablet using Independent Component Analysis (ICA) in order to examine the distribution of actives and major excipients within the tablet. The ICA_by_blocks method was used. The calculated ICA signals were compared with the pure spectra of the formulation compounds.

title: Sex steroid receptor expression and localization in benign prostatic hyperplasia varies with tissue compartment.
main_goals: This study aimed to quantitatively characterize the tissue distribution and staining intensity of androgen receptor (AR) and estrogen receptor-alpha (ERα) in human benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) compared to normal prostate. Multiplexed immunohistochemistry and a multispectral imaging platform were used to detect and quantify AR and ERα expression. The results underscore the importance of tissue layer localization and expression of steroid hormone receptors in the prostate.

title: Image database analysis of Hodgkin lymphoma.
main_goals: The paper reports an analysis of digital color images of HL tissue slides. It implements a pipeline to handle and explore image data of CD30 stained HL tissue images to identify relevant regions that contain malignant cells. The pipeline separates relevant tissue region from the background and assigns pixels to predefined classes using a supervised recognition method.

title: p53-Dependent subcellular proteome localization following DNA damage.
main_goals: The study investigates the effect of p53 activation by measuring the subcellular distribution of proteins in HCT116 cells with and without p53 using a MS-based proteomics method. It aims to understand the cellular response to DNA damage following treatment of HCT116 cells with etoposide in both p53 wild-type and null genetic backgrounds.

title: Spatial transcriptome profiling by MERFISH reveals fetal liver hematopoietic stem cell niche architecture.
biological_context: Fetal liver hematopoietic stem cell niche
main_goals: To investigate the spatial organization and transcriptional profile of individual cells in fetal liver, identify cell-cell interactions within the HSC niche, and determine the impact of Tet2 loss on HSCs and niche regulation.

title: A Map of Human Type 1 Diabetes Progression by Imaging Mass Cytometry.
main_goals: To analyze the progression of type 1 diabetes using imaging mass cytometry (IMC), reconstruct the evolution of β cell loss and insulitis, and reveal the cellular changes preceding β cell destruction.

title: Single-cell connectomic analysis of adult mammalian lungs.
main_goals: To identify conserved patterns of cell-cell cross-talk in adult mammalian lungs using single-cell RNA sequencing.  To provide a systems-level portrait of signaling between alveolar cell populations. To identify key pathways governing lung pathophysiology and inform regenerative efforts.

title: Single-Cell Transcriptomic Analysis of Primary and Metastatic Tumor Ecosystems in Head and Neck Cancer.
biological_context: Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
main_goals: To profile the transcriptomes of single cells from HNSCC patients to understand the tumor ecosystem, identify subtypes based on malignant and stromal composition, and establish partial epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (p-EMT) as a predictor of metastasis.

title: The spatially resolved transcriptional profile of acute T cell-mediated rejection in a kidney allograft.
biological_context: Acute T cell-mediated rejection (TCMR) in kidney allograft
main_goals: Used the GeoMX Digital Space Profiling platform to analyze the spatially resolved transcriptional profile of acute T cell-mediated rejection in a kidney allograft biopsy. Investigated differences between rejected and normal biopsies and spatial variability within the rejected graft. Revealed spatial heterogeneity in the graft response to alloimmune attack.

title: Spatiotemporal Immune Landscape of Colorectal Cancer Liver Metastasis at Single-Cell Level.
main_goals: To describe the spatiotemporal immune landscape of colorectal cancer liver metastasis at single-cell level, identify immunosuppressive cells (MRC1+ CCL18+ M2-like macrophages) and their metabolic activity using scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics, and investigate the impact of neoadjuvant chemotherapy, while also developing a pipeline (scMetabolism) for single-cell metabolism quantification.

title: Molecular architecture of the developing mouse brain.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA sequencing', 'spatial transcriptomics', 'in situ mRNA sequencing']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To provide a comprehensive single-cell transcriptomic atlas of the embryonic mouse brain between gastrulation and birth. The study identifies cell states and maps their spatial organization using single-cell RNA sequencing and in situ mRNA sequencing.

title: Pathogenic variants damage cell composition and single cell transcription in cardiomyopathies.
biological_context: Cardiomyopathy and heart failure in human hearts
main_goals: To characterize the single-nucleus transcriptome and cell composition of failing human hearts with cardiomyopathy-causing variants using snRNA-seq. The study aims to identify genotype-specific cellular and molecular features, including pathways and interactions, to understand heart failure mechanisms and suggest therapeutic targets.

title: Spatiotemporal gene expression trajectories reveal developmental hierarchies of the human cortex.
biological_context: Developing human telencephalon and cerebral cortex
main_goals: To identify discrete cell types and spatiotemporal gene expression trajectories during human telencephalon development. To reveal developmental hierarchies governing cell-type diversity in the human cortex. To understand how spatial and temporal factors contribute to distinct neuronal lineages.

title: A taxonomy of transcriptomic cell types across the isocortex and hippocampal formation.
biological_context: Adult mouse isocortex and hippocampal formation (HPF)
main_goals: To profile transcriptomes of approximately 1.3 million cells from the adult mouse isocortex and hippocampal formation to derive a comprehensive cell-type taxonomy. The study aims to reveal the repertoire of glutamatergic and GABAergic neuron types, explore homology between HPF and isocortical types, and identify spatial variations in cell types across these brain regions. Ultimately, the goal is to establish a molecular architecture and shed light on its relationship with brain development, evolution, connectivity, and function.

title: Single-cell reconstruction of the early maternal-fetal interface in humans.
main_goals: To profile the single-cell transcriptomes of the early human maternal-fetal interface, including placenta, maternal blood, and decidua. To characterize the cellular composition and subsets within the decidua and placenta. To develop a tool for predicting cell-cell communication and identify key regulatory interactions in this environment.

title: Single-cell spatial transcriptome reveals cell-type organization in the macaque cortex.
biological_context: Macaque cerebral cortex and its comparison with human and mouse
main_goals: To create a comprehensive single-cell and spatial transcriptomic atlas of the macaque cortex, defining 264 cell types and mapping their spatial distribution. To characterize cell-type layer and region preferences and analyze regional differences and neighborhood complexity. To relate cell-type distribution to cortical hierarchy and identify primate-specific cell types through cross-species comparison.

title: Spatially resolved cell atlas of the mouse primary motor cortex by MERFISH.
main_goals: Generate a molecularly defined and spatially resolved cell atlas of the mouse primary motor cortex using MERFISH. Identify neuronal and non-neuronal cell clusters and reveal their spatial organization. Investigate gene expression gradients and neuronal projection targets.

title: Occurrence of tertiary lymphoid tissue is associated with T-cell infiltration and predicts better prognosis in early-stage colorectal cancers.
data_modalities_used: ['Histology images', 'Immunohistochemistry', 'Confocal microscopy', 'Clinical data analysis', 'Retrospective study', 'Lymphocyte Count']
main_goals: This paper investigates the occurrence of tertiary lymphoid tissue (TLT) in early-stage colorectal cancer (CRC) and its association with tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes (TILs) and patient prognosis. It evaluates TLT as a pathway for lymphocyte recruitment in a mouse model and in human samples. The study aims to establish TLT as a potential prognostic biomarker for stage II CRC.

title: The CD4/CD8 ratio of tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes at the tumor-host interface has prognostic value in triple-negative breast cancer.
main_goals: Investigate the prognostic significance of CD4 and CD8 tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte (TIL) subsets at different spatial locations (tumor-host interface vs. intratumoral stroma) in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). They found that the CD4/CD8 ratio specifically at the tumor-host interface was significantly associated with relapse-free and overall survival.

title: High resolution mapping of the tumor microenvironment using integrated single-cell, spatial and in situ analysis.
main_goals: This paper integrates single-cell, spatial, and in situ gene expression analysis technologies to explore tissue heterogeneity in large FFPE human breast cancer sections. The goals are to identify molecular differences between tumor regions, find biomarkers for invasive carcinoma progression, and study cell neighborhoods including rare boundary cells.

title: Coordinated Cellular Neighborhoods Orchestrate Antitumoral Immunity at the Colorectal Cancer Invasive Front.
main_goals: To identify and characterize coordinated cellular neighborhoods at the colorectal cancer invasive front using highly multiplexed imaging. To understand how these spatial neighborhoods relate to antitumoral immunity and patient outcome. To reveal specific cellular players and their spatial relationships that orchestrate the immune response in CRC.

title: A single cell transcriptomics map of paracrine networks in the intrinsic cardiac nervous system.
biological_context: Intrinsic cardiac nervous system, Right atrial ganglionic plexus (RAGP)
data_modalities_used: ['single cell transcriptomics', 'RNA-seq', 'qPCR', 'neuronal tracing', 'laser capture microdissection', 'spatial tracking']
main_goals: To create a spatially-tracked single neuron transcriptomics map of the right atrial ganglionic plexus (RAGP), analyze the transcriptomic composition of RAGP neurons, and identify paracrine neuromodulatory networks.

title: Single-cell mass cytometry reveals cross-talk between inflammation-dampening and inflammation-amplifying cells in osteoarthritic cartilage.
main_goals: This study uses mass cytometry to profile healthy and OA cartilage at a single-cell level, revealing distinct chondrocyte progenitor and inflammation-modulating subpopulations. The researchers identified inflammation-amplifying (Inf-A) and inflammation-dampening (Inf-D) cell populations and devised a pharmacological strategy targeting them to decrease inflammation. The study also stratified OA patients based on the proportions of inflammatory to regenerative cells, enabling precision therapeutic approaches.

title: Single-cell RNA-seq highlights intratumoral heterogeneity in primary glioblastoma.
main_goals: This paper uses single-cell RNA sequencing to profile cells from primary glioblastomas, revealing significant intratumoral heterogeneity in transcriptional programs related to oncogenic signaling, proliferation, immune response, and hypoxia. It identifies a continuum of stemness-related expression states and potential regulators of stemness in vivo. The study also demonstrates how established glioblastoma subtype classifiers are variably expressed at the single-cell level, highlighting the prognostic implications of this heterogeneity.

title: Molecular Architecture of the Mouse Nervous System.
main_goals: This paper presents a detailed census of cell types in the mouse nervous system using RNA sequencing of single cells. It maps cell types spatially and derives a hierarchical taxonomy, focusing on neuronal and glial cell diversity. The resource aims to provide a foundation for understanding the molecular architecture and enabling cell-type-specific genetic manipulation.

title: Multiplexed imaging reveals an IFN-γ-driven inflammatory state in nivolumab-associated gastritis.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis']
main_goals: The study presents a case of nivolumab-associated autoimmune gastritis and uses multiplexed ion beam imaging by time-of-flight (MIBI-TOF) to analyze gastric tissue. The goal was to elucidate the immunology underlying this condition by mapping infiltrating immune cells and identifying key molecular contributors like IFN-γ producing epithelial cells.

title: Molecular, spatial, and functional single-cell profiling of the hypothalamic preoptic region.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell RNA-sequencing', 'imaging-based in situ cell-type identification and mapping', 'fluorescence microscopy']
main_goals: To develop an imaging-based method for in situ cell-type identification and mapping, combined with single-cell RNA-sequencing, to create a molecularly annotated and spatially resolved cell atlas of the mouse hypothalamic preoptic region. The study aimed to identify neuronal populations and their spatial organizations, and define specific neuronal populations activated during social behaviors.

title: Single-cell analysis reveals fibroblast heterogeneity and myeloid-derived adipocyte progenitors in murine skin wounds.
biological_context: Murine skin wound healing and regeneration of adipocytes and fibroblasts
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate fibroblast heterogeneity during murine skin wound healing using single-cell RNA-sequencing. It identified distinct fibroblast lineages and revealed that myeloid-derived cells contribute to adipocyte regeneration, challenging previous assumptions about fibroblast plasticity.

title: Multimodal Analysis of Composition and Spatial Architecture in Human Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
main_goals: This study performs a multimodal analysis of human squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) to characterize its cellular composition and spatial architecture. It integrates multiplexed imaging with spatial transcriptomics to map cell types and their interactions within the tumor microenvironment. The findings reveal distinct spatial domains and provide a comprehensive understanding of SCC heterogeneity.

title: Immune Escape in Breast Cancer During In Situ to Invasive Carcinoma Transition.
biological_context: Breast cancer progression from in situ to invasive carcinoma
main_goals: To investigate immune escape mechanisms during breast tumor progression by analyzing leukocyte composition and gene expression in normal breast tissue, DCIS, and IDC. The study identifies shifts in immune cell populations and regulatory molecules associated with the transition from in situ to invasive carcinoma.

title: Perturbed myoepithelial cell differentiation in BRCA mutation carriers and in ductal carcinoma in situ.
biological_context: Human breast tissue, focusing on normal breast tissues of BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutation carriers and sporadic ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS).
main_goals: This study investigates the differentiation of myoepithelial cells in normal breast tissues of BRCA mutation carriers and in ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS). It aims to understand how myoepithelial cell differentiation is perturbed in these conditions and how these perturbations might relate to breast cancer risk and progression. The findings suggest that reduced co-expression of p63 and TCF7 in myoepithelial cells of BRCA1 carriers and in DCIS may contribute to increased cancer risk and invasive progression, respectively.

title: Immune cell topography predicts response to PD-1 blockade in cutaneous T cell lymphoma.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This paper aimed to identify predictive biomarkers for PD-1 blockade response in cutaneous T cell lymphoma (CTCL). It found that topographical differences in immune cell positioning, rather than cell frequencies, correlated with treatment response. The study developed a spatial biomarker, the SpatialScore, based on these topographical differences.

title: Multiplexed In Situ Imaging Mass Cytometry Analysis of the Human Endocrine Pancreas and Immune System in Type 1 Diabetes.
biological_context: Type 1 Diabetes in the human endocrine pancreas
main_goals: The study developed a multiplexed imaging mass cytometry panel to analyze the human endocrine pancreas and immune system in Type 1 Diabetes (T1D). It applied this panel to samples from T1D and control donors to visualize alterations in islet architecture, endocrine cell composition, and immune cell presentation, providing insights into T1D pathophysiology.

title: Single-cell spatial reconstruction reveals global division of labour in the mammalian liver.
data_modalities_used: ['single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization', 'transcriptome sequencing', 'single-cell analysis']
main_goals: To reconstruct the spatial division of labour in the mammalian liver by measuring the entire transcriptome of thousands of mouse liver cells and inferring their lobule coordinates using zonated landmark genes. This approach provides high spatial resolution zonation profiles for all liver genes, uncovering widespread gene zonation and specific spatial ordering of biological processes.

title: Single-Cell RNA Sequencing Reveals a Dynamic Stromal Niche That Supports Tumor Growth.
biological_context: Murine melanoma and draining lymph nodes
main_goals: This paper uses single-cell RNA sequencing to examine the stromal compartment in murine melanoma and draining lymph nodes across tumor development. It identifies temporally distinct stromal populations and their roles in supporting tumor growth and modulating the immune landscape. The study highlights the interplay between stromal cells and immune cells, particularly the role of complement component C3.

title: Dermal Condensate Niche Fate Specification Occurs Prior to Formation and Is Placode Progenitor Dependent.
biological_context: Hair follicle formation and development in mammals.
main_goals: This paper investigates the timing and molecular events of dermal condensate (DC) niche specification and formation during embryonic hair placode development. It identifies DC precursors, defines their molecular trajectory from fibroblasts, and demonstrates the requirement of epidermal Wnt signaling and FGF20 for their specification, uncovering a progenitor-dependent niche precursor fate.

title: Cancer-associated fibroblast heterogeneity in axillary lymph nodes drives metastases in breast cancer through complementary mechanisms.
biological_context: Breast cancer metastases in axillary lymph nodes
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering']
main_goals: This paper identifies four Cancer-Associated Fibroblast (CAF) subpopulations in metastatic lymph nodes and demonstrates their distinct roles in promoting breast cancer metastasis. The study reveals that specific CAF subsets correlate with invasion and distant metastases, suggesting their potential as prognostic markers in axillary lymph nodes.

title: Multiplexed imaging mass cytometry of the chemokine milieus in melanoma characterizes features of the response to immunotherapy.
data_modalities_used: ['multiplexed imaging mass cytometry', 'protein markers', 'RNA transcripts', 'spatial proteomics', 'spatial transcriptomics']
main_goals: This study uses multiplexed imaging mass cytometry to characterize chemokine expression and function in melanoma. It aims to understand the role of chemokines in immune cell trafficking and the formation of tertiary lymphoid structures in response to immunotherapy.

title: Tertiary lymphoid structures improve immunotherapy and survival in melanoma.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of B cells in anti-tumor responses in metastatic melanoma. It finds that the co-occurrence of tumor-associated CD8+ T cells and CD20+ B cells, forming tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS), is associated with improved survival. The study also identified a gene signature predictive of clinical outcomes in response to immune checkpoint blockade and suggests exploring therapeutic strategies to induce TLS formation.

title: Single-cell Transcriptome Profiling reveals Dermal and Epithelial cell fate decisions during Embryonic Hair Follicle Development.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Trajectory Inference', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Cell Differentiation', 'Cell Lineage']
main_goals: This study aims to investigate the molecular pathways driving hair follicle de novo morphogenesis by profiling single-cell transcriptomes during embryonic development. It delineates cell fate decisions in dermal and epithelial cells and reveals key molecular players and intercellular communication involved in hair follicle development.

title: Tertiary lymphoid structures critical for prognosis in endometrial cancer patients.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Differential gene expression analysis', 'Immunohistochemistry', 'co-immunofluorescence', 'Multivariable Cox regression analysis']
main_goals: This study investigates the role of B-cells and tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) in endometrial cancer (EC). It identifies L1CAM as a marker for mature TLS and demonstrates that L1CAM-expressing TLS are associated with specific molecular subtypes of EC and have a favorable prognostic impact. The research establishes L1CAM as a simple biomarker for predicting outcome in EC patients.

title: Hierarchical patterning modes orchestrate hair follicle morphogenesis.
main_goals: This paper investigates the interplay between reaction-diffusion systems and mesenchymal self-organization in orchestrating hair follicle morphogenesis. It identifies key signaling interactions (FGF, WNT, BMP, TGF-beta) and demonstrates how these processes coordinate to create periodic patterns in the skin.

title: The emergent landscape of the mouse gut endoderm at single-cell resolution.
biological_context: Mouse embryo endoderm development until midgestation
main_goals: This paper delineates the ontogeny of the mammalian endoderm by generating a large dataset of single-cell transcriptomes from mouse embryos. It models differentiating cells to characterize developmental trajectories and defines the transcriptional architecture of endoderm populations, revealing relationships between epiblast and endoderm lineages and mapping the regionalized identity of cells within the nascent gut endoderm.

title: Single-Cell RNA-Sequencing Reveals a Continuous Spectrum of Differentiation in Hematopoietic Cells.
main_goals: This study applied single-cell RNA-sequencing to zebrafish hematopoietic cells undergoing thrombocyte lineage commitment. By computationally reconstructing developmental chronology, it placed cells along a differentiation continuum, revealing coordinated transcriptional programs and heterogeneity. The study also observed a decrease in total gene expression and mRNA content during lineage commitment.

title: KGF and EGF signalling block hair follicle induction and promote interfollicular epidermal fate in developing mouse skin.
biological_context: Hair follicle development in mouse skin
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of EGF and KGF signaling in hair follicle induction. It shows that increased levels of EGF and KGF ligands inhibit hair follicle formation and promote interfollicular epidermal fate. The study proposes that downregulation of these pathways is required for hair follicle initiation.

title: Interactions between cancer stem cells and their niche govern metastatic colonization.
biological_context: Metastatic colonization in distant organs, specifically focusing on breast cancer metastasis to the lung.
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of cancer stem cells and their niche interactions in metastatic colonization. It identifies periostin (POSTN) as a crucial extracellular matrix component secreted by stromal fibroblasts that is induced by infiltrating tumor cells in the secondary site. POSTN is essential for cancer stem cell maintenance and promotes metastatic expansion by recruiting Wnt ligands and enhancing Wnt signaling.

title: Human Fetal-Derived Enterospheres Provide Insights on Intestinal Development and a Novel Model to Study Necrotizing Enterocolitis (NEC).
biological_context: Human intestinal development and necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC)
covered_analysis_steps: ['Clustering', 'Gene Ontology analysis', 'Gene pathway analysis', 'Dimensional reduction', 'Gene set enrichment']
main_goals: To use human fetal-derived enterospheres (FEnS) to gain insights into NEC pathogenesis and establish FEnS as a relevant preclinical model for NEC. The study compares gene expression patterns and cellular responses between fetal and adult enterospheres.

title: The Spatial Landscape of Progression and Immunoediting in Primary Melanoma at Single-Cell Resolution.
data_modalities_used: ['high-plex imaging', '3D high-resolution microscopy', 'spatially resolved microregion transcriptomics', 'multiplexed imaging', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Visualization']
main_goals: This paper integrates high-plex imaging, 3D microscopy, and spatially resolved transcriptomics to study immune evasion and immunoediting in primary melanoma. It reveals significant changes in cellular neighborhoods along a progression axis and identifies hallmarks of immunosuppression even in precursor regions. The study demonstrates that invasion and immunoediting can coexist within millimeters of each other, mediated by cytokine gradients and cell-cell contacts.

title: Brain structure. Cell types in the mouse cortex and hippocampus revealed by single-cell RNA-seq.
biological_context: Mouse brain structure and cell types in the somatosensory cortex and hippocampal CA1 region
main_goals: To classify cells in the mouse somatosensory cortex and hippocampal CA1 region using large-scale single-cell RNA sequencing. The study aimed to identify molecularly distinct subclasses, marker genes, and understand the regulatory code of transcription factors for cell type identity maintenance.

title: Topography of cancer-associated immune cells in human solid tumors.
main_goals: This study systematically measures the topography of multiple immune cell types in human solid tumors across a pan-cancer cohort. It defines inflamed ('hot'), non-inflamed ('cold'), and immune excluded patterns and investigates their differences between immune cell types and cancer types. The findings suggest that immune topographies can serve as biomarkers for patients with solid tumors, particularly when using a bivariate classification system.

title: Tumor-associated macrophages trigger MAIT cell dysfunction at the HCC invasive margin.
biological_context: Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and its invasive margin
main_goals: This study investigated the role and dysfunction of Mucosal-associated invariant T (MAIT) cells in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It identified tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) at the invasive margin as key regulators of MAIT cell dysfunction through spatial interactions. The findings suggest that targeting these interactions can reinvigorate MAIT cell anti-tumor immunity and have implications for immunotherapy.

title: A transcriptomic and epigenomic cell atlas of the mouse primary motor cortex.
main_goals: This paper presents a comprehensive transcriptomic and epigenomic cell atlas of the mouse primary motor cortex by generating data from over 500,000 cells. It developed methods to integrate multimodal data and validate cell-type reproducibility, resulting in a reference atlas of over 56 neuronal cell types. The atlas highlights complex molecular regulation and enables the design of reagents for targeting specific cell types.

title: Adult mouse cortical cell taxonomy revealed by single cell transcriptomics.
main_goals: This paper constructs a cellular taxonomy of the adult mouse primary visual cortex using single-cell RNA sequencing. It identifies 49 transcriptomic cell types and analyzes cell type-specific mRNA processing and genetic access. The study confirms that transcriptomic signatures can be associated with specific cellular properties.

title: Two subsets of human marginal zone B cells resolved by global analysis of lymphoid tissues and blood.
biological_context: Human lymphoid tissues and blood, specifically focusing on B cells and their subsets, including their role in lupus nephritis.
main_goals: To perform deep profiling of B cells in human lymphoid tissues and blood to define subgroups and identify two distinct subsets of marginal zone B (MZB) cells. The study also investigates the depletion of these subsets in lupus nephritis and highlights the importance of considering MZB cell heterogeneity in disease studies.

title: Mapping the temporal and spatial dynamics of the human endometrium in vivo and in vitro.
biological_context: Human endometrium and related diseases (endometrial cancers, endometriotic lesions)
main_goals: The study generated single-cell and spatial reference maps of the human uterus and endometrial organoids to dissect signaling pathways regulating epithelial cell fate. It benchmarks organoids against in vivo data and uses the cellular maps to deconvolute bulk data from endometrial cancers and endometriotic lesions, providing insights for future treatments.

title: Spatial multi-omic map of human myocardial infarction.
data_modalities_used: ['single-cell gene expression', 'chromatin accessibility', 'spatial transcriptomic profiling', 'histology images']
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Clustering', 'Integration with other omics']
main_goals: To generate an integrative high-resolution map of human cardiac remodelling after myocardial infarction using multi-omic spatial profiling. The study aims to understand changes in cell-type compositions, transcriptome, and epigenome, identifying disease-specific cell states in their spatial context.

title: An Immune Atlas of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma.
main_goals: This study performed in-depth immune profiling of clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC) samples using mass cytometry. It identified distinct immune cell phenotypes and compositions correlated with progression-free survival, aiming to reveal potential biomarkers and therapeutic targets for ccRCC immunotherapy.

title: A single-cell molecular map of mouse gastrulation and early organogenesis.
main_goals: To construct a molecular map of cellular differentiation from pluripotency towards all major embryonic lineages during mouse gastrulation and early organogenesis. The study explores the convergence of endoderm types and demonstrates how combining temporal and transcriptional information can illuminate gene function. It provides a baseline for understanding gene mutations and optimizing in vitro differentiation protocols.

title: Immunogenomic profiling determines responses to combined PARP and PD-1 inhibition in ovarian cancer.
main_goals: This study aimed to identify predictive biomarkers for combined PARP and PD-1 inhibition in ovarian cancer by performing immunogenomic profiling and multiplexed single-cell imaging. The researchers identified mutational signature 3 and an immune score as determinants of response and investigated the spatial interactions of immune cells and tumor cells mechanistically.

title: Single-Cell Mapping of Human Brain Cancer Reveals Tumor-Specific Instruction of Tissue-Invading Leukocytes.
main_goals: This paper maps the leukocyte landscape of human brain tumors using CyTOF. It distinguishes between gliomas and brain metastases based on their immune cell composition and investigates the origin and function of tumor-associated macrophages, revealing tumor-driven instruction of invading leukocytes.

title: Altered expression and distribution of cathepsins in neuronopathic forms of Gaucher disease and in other sphingolipidoses.
biological_context: Neuronopathic forms of Gaucher disease and other sphingolipidoses
data_modalities_used: ['Cathepsin mRNA expression', 'Cathepsin activity', 'Cathepsin protein levels', 'Histology images']
main_goals: This paper investigates the altered expression and distribution of cathepsins in neuronopathic forms of Gaucher disease (GD) and other sphingolipidoses using a mouse model. It shows that cathepsin mRNA, activity, and protein levels are elevated, with significant changes in cathepsin D distribution in affected brain regions, particularly in microglia and astrocytes. The findings suggest the involvement of cathepsins in the neuropathology of these diseases and highlight a crucial role for reactive microglia in neuronal degeneration.

title: Imaging mass cytometry and multiplatform genomics define the phenogenomic landscape of breast cancer.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Cell Segmentation', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis']
main_goals: This study aimed to investigate the relationships between genomic alterations and cell phenotypes and tumor ecosystem structure using imaging mass cytometry on breast cancer tumors. It revealed how distinct cell phenotypes and their interactions are associated with genomic subtypes and linked tumor ecosystem features to prognosis, highlighting their clinical relevance.

title: The spatial landscape of lung pathology during COVID-19 progression.
covered_analysis_steps: ['Spatial Domain Identification', 'Cell-Cell Interaction Analysis', 'Spatial Gene Expression Analysis', 'Cell Segmentation', 'Spatial Domain Identification']
main_goals: This study uses high-parameter imaging mass cytometry to investigate the cellular composition and spatial architecture of acute lung injury in humans, particularly in the context of SARS-CoV-2 infection. It aims to unravel the disordered structure of the infected and injured lung and the distribution of immune infiltration. The research also characterizes the pathophysiology of the human lung from macroscopic presentation to the single-cell level.

title: N-myc downstream regulated family member 1 (NDRG1) is enriched in myelinating oligodendrocytes and impacts myelin degradation in response to demyelination.
biological_context: Oligodendrocyte function and myelin degradation in the central nervous system, with implications for Multiple Sclerosis
main_goals: This paper investigates the role of NDRG1 in oligodendrocytes and its impact on myelin. It shows NDRG1 is enriched in myelinating oligodendrocytes and affects myelin degradation after demyelination. The findings suggest NDRG1 is important for adult myelinating oligodendrocytes and its decreased levels in MS brains may lead to increased myelin susceptibility to damage.

title: Transcriptional analysis of cystic fibrosis airways at single-cell resolution reveals altered epithelial cell states and composition.
main_goals: This study applied single-cell transcriptomics to the proximal airway of cystic fibrosis (CF) and healthy lung donors. The goal was to define disease-related changes in epithelial cell states and composition. The findings revealed an overabundance of transitioning ciliated and secretory cells and a decrease in cycling basal cells, aiming to provide insights for new CF therapies.

title: The single-cell transcriptional landscape of mammalian organogenesis.
main_goals: This paper investigates the transcriptional dynamics of mouse organogenesis at single-cell resolution using single-cell combinatorial indexing. It aims to create a global view of developmental processes during a critical window (9.5-13.5 days of gestation) and identify cell types and developmental trajectories.

title: A Structured Tumor-Immune Microenvironment in Triple Negative Breast Cancer Revealed by Multiplexed Ion Beam Imaging.
